jobTitle: Alignment Specialist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50654193.txt	§Alignment Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Alignment Specialist§§Advertiser: §ANZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§•    Support HR to translate strategies into day-to-day work§•    Drive strategic workforce planning and strategic capability initiatives for the HR function§•    Plan the investment allocation of transformation initiatives for HR§•    Work with the Leadership team to develop capability strategies§ §About The Role§Role location: 839 Collins street, Docklands VIC 3008§Role Type: 18 months fixed-term; Full-time § §As the Alignment Specialist, you will ensure clarity and alignment of priorities across the HR (Talent and Culture) function and the business. You will make sure that we are focusing on the things that will deliver the biggest benefits in terms of value, employee experience, and risk. In this role, you will drive significant future uplift in our HR function through multiple strategies.§ §Your key accountabilities will include: § §•    Lead Workforce Planning and Strategic capability build activities for Talent & Culture§•    Facilitation of function-wide portfolio management to deliver planning & prioritisation processes across T&C and ensuring that initiatives are described in sufficient detail to support decision-making§•    Driving investment planning and governance for slate for the function§•    Working with the leadership team and leveraging a broad network of partners in identifying interdependencies within the function and in ensuring alignment to strategy§•    Acting as the link between groups and ensuring that work across areas are aligned§•    Support communications plans for function.§•    Improving demand & capacity planning, leveraging a consistent and coherent communication plan, and communicating progress to stakeholders§•    Aligning demands, priorities, costs, and resources across the function - ensuring capacity to support key priorities§•    Driving insight on T&C’s performance by ensuring that work initiatives are tracked and measured and that objectives are achieved§ §About you§To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following: § §•    Experience in a HR consulting role from a large corporate or financial services industry §•    Proven ability to drive strategic initiatives and execute change and transformation programs§•    Strong analytical skills preferable experience in finance or business management roles§•    Ability to take a commercial and system-wide view to facilitate the prioritisation and sequencing of work§•    Demonstrated capability development, workforce planning and workforce strategy skills§•    Ability to develop, influence, and leverage relationships with stakeholders and business partners for best results§•    Ability to identify gaps between where we are and where we need to be§•    Highly developed business & commercial acumen coupled with Human Centered thinking§•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills § §About ANZ§ANZ is a great place to grow. We know our people look to their leaders to understand what is and isn’t valued.§ §Developing a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture. It means we actively encourage people to try new things so we can improve. With effort, we can all learn and grow.§ §We ask our leaders to practice daily leadership behaviours – things like connecting with empathy, empowering people, growing people selflessly, being curious and creating shared clarity. These are the leadership behaviours we need to transform ANZ. We support our leaders with tools, tips and online coaching.§ §ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.§ §We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.§ §To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers.  § § §#GD3.0§§§§

jobText: TXT/50656961.txt	§Policy Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy Officer§§Advertiser: §Medical Technology Association of Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Policy Officer §The Policy Officer reports to the Director, Policy. The role supports the Policy Director, the Medical Technology Association of Australia and relevant industry committees to develop policy positions which allow medical device companies to manufacture and supply safe, effective and cost-effective medical devices to the community. The focus of the role is particularly on industry and reimbursement policy development.§Key Duties & Responsibilities§Policy Development and Analysis:§Prepare background papers and briefs to inform decision making, and draft position statements to contribute to MTAA´s advocacy work as needed in relation to topics that affect the industry particularly funding of medical technology and industry support initiatives§Research and compile data and evidence to inform and support the industry’s policy positions§Engage and consult with members and external stakeholders including government as needed to inform policy positions§Committee work:§Provide secretariat support to industry committees and other forums as required, including drafting agenda papers, minute taking and meeting administration§Support industry committees to develop policy positions which impact on the development and sustainability of the industry and/or optimise reimbursement pathways for medical devices in the public and private markets.§As required, support other MTAA forums to develop policy or generate information to advance understanding of the industry and its policy positions§Industry Representation:§As required, on behalf of the Director, Policy, represent MTAA on committees or advisory groups that relate to the responsibilities of the Policy Business Unit§Other duties:§Contribute to the organisation of events for MTAA´s members pertaining to policy issues§Contribute to member surveys on industry specific issues to help identify areas for further policy work§Qualifications:§Required: undergraduate or postgraduate degree in health, economics, public policy or related field; alternatively a minimum of three years´ experience working in a public policy role, preferably related to healthcare or industry.§Skills and Experience:§Required:§Sound knowledge and understanding of government decision-making processes in Australia and/or Australia´s healthcare system§Excellent writing skills, with demonstrated ability to produce high quality policy documents, position papers and briefing material for different audiences§Ability to conduct desktop research and compile data on complex and varied policy topics, particularly relating to health or industry, draw conclusions and make recommendations§Ability to effectively engage and collaborate with stakeholders to develop shared positions§Well organised, self-motivated, a team player§Desirable:§Experience in policy analysis and development§Experience in any of: the medical device industry; a government department/agency; a healthcare service provider; health insurer; or member-based industry organisation§Experience in committee servicing including developing agendas, writing minutes and supporting committee activities§Suit a graduate with the right demonstrated abilities’§Strong capabilities in Excel§This position is only open to candidates that have full eligibility to live and work in Australia. If interested please click 'apply for this job' with your cover letter and CV.  Closing date for applications: 26 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a policy officer?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Join a dynamic and growing life sciences consultancy, based in Sydney or Melbourne.§  §Biointelect assists industry and research organisations to navigate the path to market for biopharmaceutical technologies and bring innovations to patients. Our core values are passion, teamwork, diversity, creativity, innovation, commitment, leadership and integrity​.§  §Biointelect’s team has expertise in health economics, reimbursement and health policy, commercialisation and corporate strategy, clinical project management and regulation. We work with both large and small companies, government and not-for-profits and our experience spans therapeutic areas including cell and gene therapy and vaccines. We work collaboratively with clients in Australia and internationally, to bring science to market.§  §We are seeking an experienced health economist/market access consultant to join our team, working with a diverse range of clients, innovative technologies and therapeutic areas. The successful applicant will research and author client reports, draft policy white papers, plan and conduct data analysis and manage junior staff on client projects. They will work closely with senior team members, who have many years of experience working in Australia and internationally and be exposed to a variety of challenging projects.§  §The successful applicant will be a self-starter, a strong communicator, a strategic thinker, and problem solver, able to work independently and passionate about healthcare and the successful commercialisation of research in the biopharmaceutical sector.§  §General Qualifications and Experience: § § §Minimum tertiary qualification (Masters or PhD desirable) in a health economics or life sciences-related discipline§ §Undergraduate or post-graduate studies in health economics desirable§ §3-5 years work experience in a consulting, industry (market access or health economics), public sector or similar role§ §Skills & Experience§ § §Strategic, customer-focused thinking, reliable and results driven§ §Advanced data analysis skills using Excel, STATA or similar packages§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills essential – experienced in writing reports (PowePoint/Word) and presentations targeted at diverse and senior-level audiences§ §Proven ability to deliver tasks on time with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail§ §High level of proficiency in researching and assimilating academic, clinical and market literature and data to develop a compelling story or case§ §Experience managing stakeholders (including internal stakeholders) to deliver a successful project/outcome§ §Experience working on PBAC/MSAC submissions desirable§ §Experience in immuno-oncology and cell and gene therapy desirable§ §Proactive, curious, keen to learn and with a can-do/positive attitude§ §Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel/Powerpoint/Word)§ §Please submit applications with a cover letter describing: your relevant experience and why you would be a good fit for this role; your long-term career goals; what you would hope to achieve in this position; and a full CV.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§§§

Roles available in this dynamic and growing Sydney or Melbourne-based life sciences consultancy.§Biointelect is a Sydney & Melbourne-based life sciences consultancy with an established reputation in both biotechnology early stage commercialisation and in late stage pharmaceutical product planning and market access. The leadership team have strong experience and networks, both in Australia and internationally. Due to our expanding list of clients and projects, Biointelect is seeking applications for a new role in our Sydney or Melbourne CBD offices.§Biointelect offers exciting and dynamic opportunities to work with a diverse range of clients on equally diverse challenges in commercialisation of medicines and biotherapeutics and associated policy issues. Biointelect is looking for someone to join our very experienced team and contribute to the growth of the company. The successful applicant will be required to work with a diverse range of innovative technologies and disease areas. § §Position Description§:§Associate for a range of projects in commercialisation of biotechnology: A full time role.§Applicants should have strong scientific qualifications (Masters or PhD) as the successful applicants will be required to work with a diverse range of innovative technologies and disease areas.§A good understanding of the pharmaceutical development, regulatory environment (international including FDA and EMA) and health technology assessment landscape as well as experience in structuring / solving strategic commercialisation challenges would be rated highly along with an interest in / exposure to international markets.§A high level of proficiency in researching clinical and economic literature and scientific writing is required, along with excellent Excel / PowerPoint skills and experience in contributing / project managing the delivery of high-quality consulting services to a diverse and senior level audience.§Must be a commercially aware, proactive with a can-do attitude and a strategic thinker who is customer focused, reliable and results driven.§Qualifications:§Applicants should have minimum tertiary qualification (Masters or PhD desirable) in a clinical or life sciences-related or health economics discipline. §Skills & Experience§A strategic thinker who is customer focused, reliable and results driven;§A high level of proficiency in researching and assimilating academic, clinical and commercial/market literature and data;§A skilled communicator both written and oral – a good story-teller who is able to bring strategy to life; Excellent written ability is essential – experienced in writing reports, creating powerpoint presentations and scientific writing;§Proven ability to deliver tasks on time with a high degree of accuracy, attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills§A team player with an ability to collect and assimilate data and information from multiple streams as well as good stakeholder management skills;§Skills and experience in contributing / project managing the delivery of high-quality consulting services to a diverse and senior level audience;§Must be a commercially aware, proactive with a can-do/positive attitude;§Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel/Powerpoint/Word);§ §All Applicants must have the right to live and work in Australia.§A written application including CV and covering letter should be sent to info@biointelect.com. The deadline for applications is §Sunday 31st October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.§KPMG's Management Consulting practice requires experienced procurement professionals to drive transformational change across client's procurement operations. Based in Adelaide, these opportunities will focus on all aspects of Strategic Supply Planning, Source to Contract, Supplier Relationship Management and Procure-to-Pay, all underpinned by core effectiveness enablers . Candidates will form part of the project delivery team working across a wide portfolio of client businesses including Government, Defence, Finance, Energy and Natural Resources.§ §Your Opportunity§We’re now looking for an experienced practitioner to join our team at §Consultant§, §Senior Consultant §or §Manager §Level in our §Perth §office. §§You will be a key team member assisting with developing client leads, winning business and delivering transformational procurement change within client organisations§Have a significant focus on the implementation and optimisation of end-to-end procurement processes within large organizations, with a view of enabling procurement to add value to the business§Ensure customer / stakeholder satisfaction enabling the development of business across a wide range of industries§Require you to develop and transfer knowledge/skills to staff to optimise talent offering and flexibility around delivery to a range of clients§Provide opportunities to learn and grow, developing skills across the full spectrum of Procurement§§Candidates must be team players able to work effectively as part of a wider KPMG and client team. They will also act as a spokesperson for KPMG, making a strong impact with their problem solving and business focus skills.§You are you Extraordinary§At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.§§Tertiary qualified, ideally in business, economics or engineering§A member of the Chartered Institute of Purchasing & Supply Australia (CIPSA) and / or Certificate IV in Government (Procurement and Contracting) accredited or willing to work towards accreditation§Experience within complex Procurement environments is required; exposure to Agile Transformation and Operating Models is welcome §Strong experience within one or more areas of Strategic Supply Planning / Category Management / Strategic Sourcing (Direct and Indirect) / Contract Management / Purchase-to-Pay is preferred §Experience with Data Analytics and Financial Cost Models is required; exposure to Big Data Analysis, Should Cost Modelling and Zero-Based Budgeting is welcome but not essential §Experience with new digital technologies such as Robotics (RPA), Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence - including Machine Learning & Cognitive - is welcome but not essential §§Due to the nature of consulting work, candidates must also be open to travel interstate. §The KPMG Difference§Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.§We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.§ §Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:§Flexibility empowers wellbeing § [link removed]§Flexibility enables contribution to the community§ [link removed]§Flexibility inspires technology§ [link removed]§ & innovation§§Flexibility§ [link removed]§ supports family§ §Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!§ § § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Investment Manager Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50714177.txt	§Investment Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Investment Manager§§Advertiser: §Discovery Holiday Parks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§About Us§ §G’day Group comprises three leading Australian tourism brands in Discovery Parks, G’day Parks and loyalty program G’day Rewards. Employing more than 1300 people Australia-wide, G’day Group has a truly national footprint of over 280 holiday parks, including 65 fully owned and operated parks. The largest park network in the country, we’re about authentic Australian holiday experiences and inviting all Aussies to say g’day to more of Australia.§ §We’re on a journey of growth and evolution to reshape the industry, offering the best customer experience underpinned by the best technology. With eyes on domestic and regional tourism like never before we are building a passionate, adaptable, high performance team to deliver holiday memories that put a smile in every g’day.§ §The Role§ §We are seeking an Investment Manager to join our talented Investment and Initiatives team. This is a newly created role due to growth in Acquisitions, Joint Ventures and Property Capital Works Projects. Reporting to the General Manager, Investment and partnering closely with the CFO and COO, this role will lead allocated projects relating to Mergers & acquisitions; Development projects and contract management related to transactions.§ §You will be responsible for (not limited to):§ § §Providing strategic input to merger, acquisition & divestment transactions§ §Assessing, monitoring and advising on commercial risks§ §Preparing Board and investment committee papers in relation to potential Capital Works Projects§ §Presenting to internal and external key stakeholders and decision makers regarding a strategic transaction ie winning a tender§ §Assisting Capital Works Project Managers with completion and submission of Statutory, Government and Industry requirements§ §Reviewing, scrutinizing, and developing potential construction and transaction contracts§ §Leading cost reduction through contract negotiations§ §Administration of contracts and contractual requirements§ §About You§ §You bring outstanding Corporate/M&A and transactions experience. You have a track record in effective engagement with senior business stakeholders and robust negotiation skills. You are able to synthesise complex information in a concise manner in a dynamic environment. Key personal attributes include enthusiasm, professionalism and integrity§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ § §5+ years’ PQE in an investment/M& A manager role with a large corporate firm§ §Tertiary qualification in business/financial/legal discipline§ §Proven experience in the execution of deals§ §Budgeting, cost containment and capital investment proposal/review§ §Expert negotiation skills§ §Advanced business writing skills§ §Outstanding project management expertise§ §Solid and innovative problem solving, decision making and analytical capabilities§ §Use of MS office suite of programs§ §Tourism and Hospitality industry experience is desirable but not essential§ §You will possess a high level of energy, self-motivation, autonomy, initiative and flexibility to be successful in meeting the business demands at Discovery Parks. Your naturally upbeat and open style will fit our cultural values. You will have a highly organised mindset with the ability to assess the urgency of work allocated to you by various stakeholders.§ §Discovery is a dynamic company with an energetic ‘market disrupter’ reputation. If you are passionate, adventurous, and ready to hit the ground running, we want to hear from you.§ §Discover more to life§ - APPLY NOW!§ §Prior to an offer of employment being made, candidates must provide authority for a Federal Police Clearance to disclose any criminal offences or charges.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50694747.txt	§Business Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Business Enterprise Centre NT§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Darwin§§Salary§§$85,000 - $99,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Corporate Development§§§§§§About the business§ § § §The Business Enterprise Centre NT has a future-focused culture, with a goals of helping NT business growth and reducing the number of businesses closing every year. We are the largest business advisory organisation in the NT and we are leading the NT with our up to date business knowledge. We pride ourselves in providing excellence in business education to businesses of all sizes. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is in our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. We offer ongoing training and mentoring so you can continue to improve and learn new skills with ongoing career development opportunities.§ §So, are you ready to shape new and early stage businesses?§ § § § §About the role§ § § §As the successful candidate, you will have owned your own business, whether you were successful or not you will have learnt from your experience. You understand the complexities of business strategy and the emotional rollercoaster business owners go through. You have a passion for business knowledge. You are highly organised with a proven ability to establish and build relationships. § §As part of the application process, you will need to provide a copy of your resume and a cover letter addressing the key selection criteria.§ §If you have any queries please contact Phillip Loader          §(08) 8923 6111§ §Applications close at midnight on 25 October 2020§ §Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Join the NT's leading business advisory organisation§ §$85,279 - $96,759§ (Plus Superannuation)§ §Permanent, full-time or flexible, § §Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)§ §Usual work location: Darwin§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §As a member of the Business Advisory team, you will work with business owners and key stakeholders to advise people starting a business and early stage businesses. This introductory role to business consultancy is a springboard to becoming a business mentor.§You will support the Business Advisory team to deliver the BECNT strategic plan, build connections in the business community and engage with key stakeholders.§ § § §Key Selection Criteria§:§ §Experience of starting or owning your own business.§An understanding of the principles of business development strategy.§A passion for learning more about business development with a view to progressing to business mentor level.§Facilitate the programs and projects as developed by BECNT in line with local and regional plans, state strategic policy and business community needs; manage, monitor, report and review the performance of business owners.§Provide regional business intelligence to help inform decision making as it relates to program design and policy development.§Must be able to empathise with all personalities.§Ability to communicate with clearly articulated messaging to a variety of audiences.§Presentation delivery experience.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Manager Governance and Strategy Job in Melbourne - SEEK
xenophobe: Moreland is a progressive council with 180,000 residents: one community, proudly diverse. The city is vibrant and energetic, known for its active community, array of fabulous festivals, cool pools, eclectic shops and community of artists and creative industries. As a Council, Moreland is supporting the community in difficult times, and its long-term vision has ambitious goals for environmental sustainability, community wellbeing, and creating great places.
jobText: TXT/50714827.txt	§Manager Governance and Strategy§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Governance and Strategy§§Advertiser: §Fisher Leadership§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Northern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Manager Governance and Strategy §        §          §            §Deliver contemporary governance and strategic planning§            §Impactful senior management role§            §Be part of an ambitious and progressive community agenda§          §          §Overview§          §A key leader within the Senior Management Team, this position oversees the effective governance structures that support the management of Council business with appropriate oversight, accountability and risk management. This position also oversees the critical development and delivery of Council’s key long-term planning inputs including the Community Vision and Council Plan to reflect community expectations and aspirations.§          §The Position§          §Reporting to the Director Business Transformation, this role is an integral member of Moreland City Council’s Senior Management Team. This role provides governance support services to Councillors and Council meetings, coordinating key Council planning documents, including the Community Vision and Council Plan, to promote good governance, community engagement and robust decision making. The role will also collaborate across the organisation to ensure effective governance and corporate strategic planning through business partnering to deliver high quality services. Success requires the drive for continuous improvement and a wholistic view of the organisation and the communities it serves.§          §The role will drive a contemporary and effective approach to risk and audit functions. It will enhance organisational performance through governance structures shaped by key Moreland City Council planning documents and legislation, regulation, standards, and community expectations. This is an exciting opportunity to foster a positive governance and strategic planning culture across the organisation and develop a high performing team to embed desired practices.§          §To be considered for this opportunity, you will have proven relevant leadership expertise within Local Government, or in the public or not-for-profit sector. A strong understanding of good governance, impactful corporate strategic planning, risk management and internal audit within the local government setting is required. You will bring a reputation of the highest integrity and ethics.§          §The Organisation§          §Moreland is a progressive council with 180,000 residents: one community, proudly diverse. The city is vibrant and energetic, known for its active community, array of fabulous festivals, cool pools, eclectic shops and community of artists and creative industries. As a Council, Moreland is supporting the community in difficult times, and its long-term vision has ambitious goals for environmental sustainability, community wellbeing, and creating great places.§          §Moreland Council strives to be a contemporary, innovative and collaborative organisation with a deep commitment to, and engagement with, the Moreland community. With the Civic Centre located in Coburg, just 8 kilometres north of Melbourne’s CBD, there are excellent public transport options and great food and cafés right at the doorstep. Moreland City Council is a great place to live, work and play.§          §COVID-19 has temporarily changed the way people engage with local spaces and services, but one of the exciting features of this role is the opportunity to support an organisation deeply committed to community relief and recovery.§          §Moreland City Council is proudly diverse and an equal opportunity employer. Applications are encouraged from the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander community, people with disability, and people from every culture, gender and sexuality identity, age and ethnic background. Moreland City Council is committed to being a Child Safe organisation and has zero tolerance for child abuse.§          §Unfortunately, due to pandemic restrictions we cannot consider anyone residing outside of Australia.§          §For a copy of the §Position Description§, please visit: §https://fisherleadership.com/opportunities/manager-governance-and-strategy/ §          §To apply§ - please go to fisherleadership.com and click on ‘APPLY ONLINE’ using reference §MORmgs1020§, addressing your cover letter, response to the Key Selection Criteria and CV to David Baber of Fisher Leadership, or call §1300 347 437§ for further information.§          §Applications close:§ Friday 23rd October.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§ §Deliver contemporary governance and strategic planning§ §Impactful senior management role§ §Be part of an ambitious and progressive community agenda§ §Overview§ §A key leader within the Senior Management Team, this position oversees the effective governance structures that support the management of Council business with appropriate oversight, accountability and risk management. This position also oversees the critical development and delivery of Council’s key long-term planning inputs including the Community Vision and Council Plan to reflect community expectations and aspirations.§ §The Position§ §Reporting to the Director Business Transformation, this role is an integral member of Moreland City Council’s Senior Management Team. This role provides governance support services to Councillors and Council meetings, coordinating key Council planning documents, including the Community Vision and Council Plan, to promote good governance, community engagement and robust decision making. The role will also collaborate across the organisation to ensure effective governance and corporate strategic planning through business partnering to deliver high quality services. Success requires the drive for continuous improvement and a wholistic view of the organisation and the communities it serves.§ §The role will drive a contemporary and effective approach to risk and audit functions. It will enhance organisational performance through governance structures shaped by key Moreland City Council planning documents and legislation, regulation, standards, and community expectations. This is an exciting opportunity to foster a positive governance and strategic planning culture across the organisation and develop a high performing team to embed desired practices.§ §To be considered for this opportunity, you will have proven relevant leadership expertise within Local Government, or in the public or not-for-profit sector. A strong understanding of good governance, impactful corporate strategic planning, risk management and internal audit within the local government setting is required. You will bring a reputation of the highest integrity and ethics.§ §The Organisation§ §Moreland is a progressive council with 180,000 residents: one community, proudly diverse. The city is vibrant and energetic, known for its active community, array of fabulous festivals, cool pools, eclectic shops and community of artists and creative industries. As a Council, Moreland is supporting the community in difficult times, and its long-term vision has ambitious goals for environmental sustainability, community wellbeing, and creating great places.§ §Moreland Council strives to be a contemporary, innovative and collaborative organisation with a deep commitment to, and engagement with, the Moreland community. With the Civic Centre located in Coburg, just 8 kilometres north of Melbourne’s CBD, there are excellent public transport options and great food and cafés right at the doorstep. Moreland City Council is a great place to live, work and play.§ §COVID-19 has temporarily changed the way people engage with local spaces and services, but one of the exciting features of this role is the opportunity to support an organisation deeply committed to community relief and recovery.§ §Moreland City Council is proudly diverse and an equal opportunity employer. Applications are encouraged from the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander community, people with disability, and people from every culture, gender and sexuality identity, age and ethnic background. Moreland City Council is committed to being a Child Safe organisation and has zero tolerance for child abuse.§ §Unfortunately, due to pandemic restrictions we cannot consider anyone residing outside of Australia.§ §For a copy of the §Position Description§, please visit: §https://fisherleadership.com/opportunities/manager-governance-and-strategy/ § §To apply§ - please go to fisherleadership.com and click on ‘APPLY ONLINE’ using reference §MORmgs1020§, addressing your cover letter, response to the Key Selection Criteria and CV to David Baber of Fisher Leadership, or call §1300 347 437§ for further information.§ §Applications close:§ Friday 23rd October.§§§§

We are on the lookout for someone with the initiative and the drive to continue building this function.§  §Your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Support the development of and maintain sub-plans for specific crisis scenarios (e.g. bushfire, storm, pandemic, prolonged ICT disruption)§ §Plan and implement ‘red team’ scenario planning and crisis simulation exercises to ensure preparedness§ §Assist with the establishment of effective Regional / Functional Crisis Support teams, as required to implement the Crisis Management plan and each sub-plan§ §Promote awareness of Crisis Management protocols across the organisation§ §Coordinate the implementation of Business Continuity / Resilience plans§ §Prepare reports, recommendations and other correspondence§ §Maintain knowledge in current best practice & brief senior management on industry developments, and opportunities to improve RSL LifeCare’s processes§ § §To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Have 3 years of experience in a similar role§ §Demonstrated experience participating in Crisis Management Team(s), during high impact crisis events§ §Current NSW drivers’ licence§ §Qualifications in crisis management, business resilience, or related fields (desirable)§ §We Offer:§ § §A genuine opportunity to make your mark and grow in your career whilst working in a supportive team  § §Competitive salary on offer§ §Excellent Not-For-Profit Salary packaging benefits with up to $15,900 of your salary tax free§ §The ability to make a real impact on the lives of senior citizens and their families§ §Please note:§ As part of the application process you will be required to undergo a National Criminal History Check and must hold valid Australian work rights/visa.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Policy Manager Job in Brisbane - SEEK
advertiser: Australian Academy of Health and Medical Sciences
jobText: TXT/50639228.txt	§Policy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy Manager§§Advertiser: §Australian Academy of Health and Medical Sciences§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$90,000 - $109,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Do you want to work at the forefront of health and medical science policy in Australia?§ §The Australian Academy of Health and Medical Sciences (AAHMS) is seeking a motivated and experienced Policy Manager to join our small, dynamic team. This is an exciting time to join AAHMS as we are currently in a period of growth. The Policy Manager will have the skills and experience to drive forward an ambitious policy agenda, working closely with the CEO.§ §This role is available at our offices based in either §SYDNEY or BRISBANE.§ §The Australian Academy of Health and Medical Sciences is the impartial, authoritative, cross-sector voice of health and medical science in Australia. Our purpose is to advance health and medical research in Australia and its translation into benefits for all, by fostering leadership within our sector, providing expert advice to decision makers, and engaging patients and the public. At the heart of our work are our Fellows – an independent, interdisciplinary body of Australia’s leading researchers, elected by their peers for outstanding achievements and exceptional contributions to health and medical science in Australia.§ §Reporting directly to the CEO, the Policy Manager will manage all aspects of the Academy’s high impact policy projects on key health and medical research issues, working with the Academy’s Fellows. As Australia’s newest learned Academy, AAHMS has grown in influence over the past few years, including providing briefings direct to government during the COVID-19 crisis. The Policy Manager position is a new role that will provide the successful candidate with the opportunity to shape the Academy’s policy work and our role in informing government policy over the coming months and years.§ §The successful candidate will have excellent interpersonal and organisation skills, with a demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities to meet short and long term deadlines. They will have good knowledge of the Australian health, research and innovation landscape, including the policy issues currently facing the sector. They will have experience of policy analysis and ideally of developing and managing policy projects on health and medical science issues. The successful candidate must be comfortable working closely with senior academics and health professionals, and will have experience of managing professional relationships with external stakeholders or collaborators.§ §Main duties/responsibilities§ § §Day-to-day management of the Academy’s policy projects.§ §Undertake research to identify the key issues and gather relevant evidence in relation to policy projects, using this to produce high quality analysis and to develop conclusions and recommendations.§ §Draft evidence-based policy outputs, including policy reports, meeting reports, consultation responses, correspondence and briefings.§ §Undertake scoping work on potential future projects.§ §Maintain an excellent understanding of the health and medical research landscape in Australia and monitor key policy issues.§ §Identify and work with relevant Fellows, stakeholders and other experts in relation to all aspects of Academy policy projects.§ §Deputise for the CEO as required.§ §Maintain an excellent network of contacts across relevant stakeholders and attend external events and meetings.§ §Support and coordinate meetings of the Academy’s policy committees, including the Reports Committee (one of the Academy’s standing committees) and other §ad hoc§ committees, such as our COVID-19 Expert Committee and project working groups.§ §How to apply§ §Applicants must provide the following:§ § §Up to date CV with contact details of at least two referees, one of which should be the current/most recent employer.§ §A cover letter of not more than three pages including a statement to explain how the candidate meets the key eligibility criteria. These are listed in full in the position description available on our website - please visit www.aahms.org/news/we-are-hiring-policy-manager/ § §For further information on this post, how to apply and a more detailed position description, including the key eligibility criteria, please visit www.aahms.org/news/we-are-hiring-policy-manager/§ §Applications must be received via email to §recruitment@aahms.org§ by 23.59 AEDT on Sunday 18 October 2020.§ §To discuss the role, please contact Catherine Luckin, CEO: §ceo@aahms.org§. §§§§

Oversight and understanding of an infrastructure project from ‘cradle to grave’ is therefore essential. This highly regarded consultancy covers the full spectrum of considerations over the entire infrastructure lifecycle. This includes financial and economic analysis and development of business cases through to involvement in complex procurement and project transaction phases.§ § § §Your key responsibilities§ § § §Reporting to the Senior Manager and Partner group, you'll be responsible for:§ § § §Independently leading project teams§ §Undertaking strategic, financial and commercial analysis for public and private clients in a variety of sectors§ §Assisting in the pursuit of business development opportunities and leading the development of proposals§ §Delivering complete engagements including billing, work-in-progress, fee negotiations and risk management.§ § § §Skills and attributes for success§ § § § §An aptitude for managing multiple projects and stakeholders§ §Strong commercial acumen and general commercial skills§ §Strong financial modelling skills§ §Excellent interpersonal and client management skills§ §Enthusiastic work ethic and willingness to learn new capabilities§ § § § §To qualify for the role you must have§ § § §Experience in project finance or corporate finance§ §Demonstrated ability in developing commercial framework, procurement and tender strategy, overseeing financial modelling and tender assessment§ §Demonstrated ability to lead and manage teams in the scoping and production of deliverables for clients§ §Experience in client facing roles, with excellent report writing, communication and presentation skills§ §Proven ability to develop, manage and leverage client relationships effectively§ §Management and coordination of junior staff across teams and experience of upward management§ §A keen interest in working on large scale public infrastructure transactions  § § § § §What they look for§ §They are interested in people who are driven, who can think critically and creatively and who are used to working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. They are seeking people with the ability to quickly anticipate and respond to the issues of a constantly changing global economy. If you have a strong desire to develop your career in business/consulting, then this is the role for you.§ § §Their continued success has propelled rapid growth in it's Infrastructure Advisory team. They have ambitious plans and are seeking high performing experienced professionals to expand it's Sydney and Melbourne practices. They offer a competitive compensation package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and recognised for the value you bring to the business. §Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development. They also offer:§ § §Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around§ §Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career§ §The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    § § If you would like further information on this or any other of our Advisory positions then please contact Marc Owen - §marc@cranfieldgroup.com.au§ | §0434 989 810§. For a confidential discussion§§§§

jobText: TXT/50636961.txt	§Customer Engagement and Business Development Role§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Engagement and Business Development Role§§Advertiser: §Carbon Neutral§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$80,000 - $90,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Carbon Neutral is a leading mission-driven carbon reduction consultancy.  As a long standing and respected carbon solutions consultancy and offsets provider, we support organisations in the low carbon economy. § §Carbon Neutral works primarily in the voluntary carbon credit market, and support organisations to measure, reduce and offset their greenhouse gas emissions. We work closely with organisations to ensure our services fit seamlessly with their corporate social responsibility and climate change solutions. Our services include carbon footprint and energy reduction strategies, carbon credit project development and retailing, revegetation programs and green marketing support. § §Carbon Neutral is also a leading biodiverse reforestation ‘carbon sink’ developer. To date we have planted 30+ million mixed native species in the award winning §Yarra Yarra Biodiversity Corridor§.§ §We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced business development and customer service specialist to join a leading environmental organisation to grow and support our client base in Australia and overseas.§ §Position Summary§ §We are seeking a specialist to join the team to further develop and support our expanding client base. With a minimum of three years business experience, preferably in B2B account management, candidates must have previous experience in a client facing role; possess an excellent phone manner, have strong computer literacy skills and attention to detail and a focus on meeting and exceeding customers’ expectations.§ §The ideal candidate must be passionate about climate change solutions and the environment, particularly regarding carbon credit markets as well as the role that reforestation plays as a climate solution.§ §Carbon Neutral office is within a 3 minute walk to the train station and Cottesloe village.§ §Main Tasks and Responsibilities§ §To actively seek and develop new clients for Carbon Neutral and manage existing clients. Grow strong referral sources, community links and new business partnerships as part of a team approach in assisting clients meet their environmental and sustainability goals.§ § §Proactively qualify and manage inbound leads§ §Drive growth in new business opportunities through networking and referral marketing§ §Assist with client renewals, proposals and contracts across a range of sectors and business size§ §Coordinate the smooth delivery of quality sales and administrative functions including CRM management§ §Essential Selection Criteria§ § §A commitment to and knowledge of positive environmental and climate change solutions with an enthusiasm and passion to influence high level B2B clients in their sustainability goals§ §Proven experience of minimum of three (3) years in Customer Service and /or Account Management§ §Strong competency in MS Office, particularly Excel to accompany your analytical abilities, and know-how of relevant sales/CRM software§ §Exceptional written communications skills§ §Strong organisational skills and meticulous attention to detail§ §A passionate and proactive approach to work§ §Apply now and submit a current version of your CV and a covering letter addressing the criteria.§ §Applications close Sunday 18th October 2020.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§

jobText: TXT/50646500.txt	§Manager Compliance & Delivery§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Compliance & Delivery§§Advertiser: §Department of Regional NSW§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tumut, Snowy & Monaro§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§Join a group of grants professionals who are committed to contemporary compliance practices.§§Work in partnership with internal and external stakeholders to set the direction for compliance improvements across NSW.§§Full time position available for two years in Queanbeyan (other regional locations may be considered)§§Salary from $128,089 pa plus super and annual leave loading§§We have a great opportunity for an experienced compliance and audit professional to lead the deployment of internal audit and compliance protocols across a large range of grants programs.§A proactive role that will be responsible for designing and implementing effective regional grants administration frameworks, policies and risk mitigation strategies to ensure transparent administration of regional grants.§About you:§As the Manager Compliance and Delivery, you will have a detailed understanding of building effective grants programs. You will have a number of key accountabilities within this role including:§§Lead a team in the administration of regional and community grants, providing expert advice with regard to the effective management and allocation of grants funding to applicants.§Develop and implement business policy, processes and systems to support transparent financial analysis and management reporting, budgeting and forecasting of funds under the administration of regional and community grants, ensuring compliance with relevant legal, professional and ethical standards.§Prepare and monitor budgets for the implementation of technology changes to streamline grants administration processes.§Establish and embed good governance and risk management practices within the grant management process.§§You will be a strong communicator with the ability to influence across all levels of a business unit. You will have a proven leadership capacity and a motivation to achieve strong results for the communities of Regional NSW.§About Regional Development§The Department of Regional NSW was formed in 2020 as a central agency for regional issues. The Department is responsible for building resilient regional economies and communities, strengthening primary industries, managing the use of regional land, overseeing the state’s mineral and mining resources and ensuring government investment in regional NSW is fair and delivers positive outcomes for local communities and businesses§§Leading promotion and effective delivery of  the government infrastructure programs aligned with the Regional Development Framework;§Identifying and activating economic potential;§Attracting business investment; and§Delivering a wide range of facilitation and assistance programs to help businesses establish, expand and create more jobs.§§To apply,§ please submit an updated CV and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role.§Learn more:§ Please contact §Adam Young, A/Director Grants Management, Evaluation & Reporting§ on §0436 823 281§ or §click here§ to review the role description.§Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020§A recruitment pool may be created from this recruitment action for ongoing and temporary roles of the same standard that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.§Why work for Department of Regional NSW?§§Exciting career pathways and opportunities§We offer vibrant and exciting career paths for people from a wide range of backgrounds and skills. Once you join the NSW Government, you’ll be supported to develop your skills and expertise through ongoing training, and opportunities to move easily from role to role, and agency to agency across the entire NSW government.§Our people:§Join DRNSW and you’ll be joining a team of more than 4,000 passionate people spread across a diverse range of disciplines and functions including – regional infrastructure, fisheries, agriculture and mining. If you’re motivated and passionate about making a difference to the people of NSW we invite you to become part of our story.§§Inclusion and Flexible Working§ §§We strive to reflect the community we serve and encourage our people to explore new ways of working across regional NSW. We are open to arrangements that help individuals balance their work and life commitments, including working part-time or working from different locations. We embrace difference and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. §§We understand that everyone is different and you may require adjustments to apply. Please don’t hesitate to contact us to discuss how we may be able to assist you. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§        § §        §  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ § § § § §Your path to many possible futures§ § § §Challenging and innovative projects§ §An opportunity to make a visible difference to a ~A$60b business, developing and executing the most critical strategic initiatives within divisions and across the portfolio§ §Join an experienced team with strong mentorship and development§ § § §The Opportunity§ § § §The team mandate is to develop high quality strategic plans and projects, either focused on business units or across the portfolio. We target areas that represent the most significant sources of profitable growth for the company, which are outside the ‘day job’ and which require additional resources to help think bigger, faster, sooner. This role will report to Senior Strategy Manager / General Manager and will be responsible for managing projects or key work streams in major projects, managing teams and providing strategic advice. You'll be responsible for;§ § § §Structuring problems and defining the plans of action to solve them§ §Extracting insights from complex analysis§ §Running client meetings§ §Coaching junior team members§ §Problem solve key business questions§ §Project manage a project or key work streams in major projects§ §Inject strategic and innovative thinking into the issues that the business faces§ §Influence key stakeholders to deliver impactful change§ § § §Who we’re looking for§ § § §We’re looking for someone who can establish strong relationships with senior managers with the ability to influence and engage. You will have the ability to manage and develop junior team members, drawing on your structured and rigorous approach. You are dedicated and results focused with a customer first mindset. § § § §Experience in a top tier strategy consultancy, investment bank or corporate strategy team§ §Outstanding academic record and social achievements§ §Demonstrated deep experience and knowledge of strategic problem solving and frameworks, project and change management§ §Superb written and oral communication with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to influence at all levels of the organisation§ §Analytics and quantitative modelling§ §Consumer market experience and retail experience is an advantage§ § § § § §Joining the Group§ § § §As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. § § § §We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion.§ §As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference. § § § §We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing. § § § §We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.§ § § §We’d love to hear from You§ § § §If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au. #LI #Work180§ § § §Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§ § § §  §§§§§

You are values driven and realise considerable satisfaction from delivering positive financial, social and environmental impact.§ §You can add immediate value across multiple industry sectors and bring the following:§ § §At least 5+ years industry and/or consulting experience within advisory disciplines, preferably strategy§ §Lateral thinking and analytical skills with direct C-level and Board experience§ §Very strong facilitation, stakeholder relationship management and project management skills§ §Full command over tools and frameworks of strategy, planning and analysis, financial modelling, business case and feasibility studies§ §Ability to initiate and/or design advisory projects, working with a high degree of ambiguity§ §A strong work ethic, positive attitude and high degree of self-motivation§ §A people-centric and impact-driven approach§ §Tertiary qualifications in relevant fields, advanced studies highly regarded§ §If you tick these boxes and are keen to join a §profit for purpose §strategy consultancy §delivering a unique brand of advisory - click "Apply" today.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in business administration?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50674718.txt	§Policy Officer - Sustainable Health Review§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy Officer - Sustainable Health Review§§Advertiser: §Aboriginal Health Council of Western Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$76950 - $84872 p.a. + super + salary sacrifice§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Location:§ Highgate§ §Employment Type:§ Full Time§ §Employment Category:§ Fixed Term to 30 June 2021§ §Remuneration:§ $76,950.73 - $84,872.13 per annum pro rata + superannuation + salary sacrifice§ § §About the Organisation§ § The Aboriginal Health Council of Western Australia (AHCWA) is the peak body for Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Services (ACCHSs) in Western Australia. We exist to support and act on behalf of our 23 Member ACCHSs throughout WA, actively responding to the individual and collective needs of our Members.§ § Governed by an Aboriginal Board of Directors who represent all regions in Western Australia, AHCWA aims to promote and strengthen the ACCHSs’ model of care; a model that is built around the delivery of comprehensive, holistic, and culturally secure primary health care services.§ § AHCWA is a community organisation that focusses on making a difference to the health and wellbeing of Aboriginal people. We work together as a team; to respect and understand the social and cultural needs; to network; to provide support; to advocate; to influence policy; to monitor performance; and to build work capacity to help improve and strengthen the social and emotional wellbeing of Aboriginal people and their communities.§ § AHCWA is centrally located on the bustling and vibrant Beaufort Street café strip, and offers a flexible and family friendly workplace with a wide range of benefits to suit prospective employees.§ § AHCWA is also home to a Registered Training Organisation (RTO) and provides access to a number of training programs and short courses to enhance the capacity of the ACCHS workforce.§ § To find out more about AHCWA, visit our website at www.ahcwa.org.au§ § §About the Opportunity§ § The Policy Officer - Sustainable Health Review directly reports to the Policy and Strategy Manager and is accountable to the Executive Manager - Policy and Public Health.§ § The occupant of this position is responsible for leading effective engagement with, and coordinating feedback from, AHCWA’s Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Services (ACCHS) to ensure the Sustainable Health Review (SHR) reform program accurately reflects the needs and interests of Aboriginal people and their communities. This position represents the ACCHS sector in the scoping, planning and implementation of the recommendations from the SHR to ensure the WA health system delivers more equitable health outcomes and access to health care for Aboriginal people in WA.§ § This position works collaboratively and in partnership with all AHCWA Work Units, AHCWA’s Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Services (ACCHS), Department of Health (DoH) and other key external stakeholders to facilitate positive health outcomes for Aboriginal people and their communities.§ § To view the full Position Description and Selection Criteria, click here [link removed] or visit www.ahcwa.org.au§ § §About You§ § To be considered for this position, you must have:§Tertiary qualification(s) in a relevant discipline (community development, social science, public health, public policy etc.) and/or equivalent knowledge and skills.§Considerable skills and practical experience in the formulation, development, analysis and evaluation of policy.§Excellent written communication skills, including the ability to prepare high-quality written materials including submissions, position papers, briefing notes, reports and correspondence.§Highly developed interpersonal skills including negotiation and consultation skills, and the ability to proactively establish and sustain effective stakeholder relationships.§Excellent time management skills, with the ability to manage competing priorities and meet strict deadlines.§High level of initiative with the ability to be proactive and work autonomously.§Strong computer skills with advanced Microsoft Office skills in Outlook, Work, Excel and PowerPoint.§Demonstrated ability to uphold the principles of cultural sensitivity including an ability to communicate effectively and sensitively with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.§Ideally§, in addition to be above, we are looking for someone who:§Identifies as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander and is acknowledged as such by their community.§Demonstrates a sound understanding of the Aboriginal Community Controlled Health sector and/or the SHR.§Can demonstrate their ability to communicate effectively and credibly with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to ensure that their views are incorporated into health service planning, development and implementation.§The position involves working with a multicultural organisation where the majority of staff, clients and stakeholders identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander. Candidates must be able to demonstrate an understanding of the issues affecting Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and their ability to communicate sensitively and effectively with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.§ § §Please note:§ In addition to the above skills and experience, the successful candidate will require an unrestricted WA “C” Class Driver’s Licence, and be required to submit a National Police Clearance (dated within 3 months) prior to appointment.§ § Applicants for this position must be legally entitled to work in Australia and will be required to provide evidence of this entitlement. Acceptable evidence includes an Australian or New Zealand passport, birth certificate, or foreign passport with relevant visa.§ § §About the Benefits§ § While you will face diverse new challenges in the role, you will also enjoy an attractive remuneration package including a base salary of $76,950.73 - $84,872.13 per annum pro rata plus superannuation. You'll also gain access to §generous salary packaging options,§ which will greatly increase your take home pay. In addition, you will have access to a number of fantastic benefits including:§Flexible work arrangements and a family friendly work environment§Support to further invest in your career through additional training§Up to 10 days’ Study Leave per year§17.5% Annual Leave loading§Bring Your Dog To Work Day§Employee Assistance Program§Up to 2 days’ Volunteer Leave per year§Health and wellbeing initiatives§Applications close 5pm, Sunday 11 October 2020§ § All submissions must be received by the nominated closing date. In fairness to all applicants, late applications cannot be considered unless prior consent has been received under restricted circumstances.§ § For further information about this position please call Kimberley Biggs, People and Culture Advisor on §08 9227 1631§.§ § §As per section 51 of the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 (WA) AHCWA actively seeks to increase the diversity of our workforce to better meet the differing needs of our clients and stakeholders and to improve equal opportunity outcomes for our employees§.§ § §Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50708659.txt	§Principal Sustainability Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Sustainability Officer§§Advertiser: §Moonee Valley City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Sustainability Officer §      §        §Principle Sustainability Officer §        §Reference number:§ 13369§        §Closing date:§  11:45pm, Friday 23 October 2020§        §          §Permanent Full Time§          §Classified as a Band 7§          §$98,614.12 to $111,769.73 per annum +9.5% Superannuation§          §Regular RDO available§        §        § §        §About Us§        §Moonee Valley City Council is a vibrant and diverse municipality. We are a local government within the north-west metropolitan area of Melbourne, providing a range of services to some 118,000 residents and over 10,000 businesses.§        § §        §The Opportunity §        §Moonee Valley City Council’s City Futures Unit is currently seeking a Principle Sustainability Officer to join a committed and passionate Sustainability Team. This role will be leading policy and projects that contribute towards creating a sustainable city, and Council’s commitment of achieving zero net carbon emissions for its operations by 2020 and the community by 2040, as outlined in Council’s long term strategy, MV2040.§        § §        §The Principle Sustainability Officer will play a role in leading the delivery of  environmental sustainability actions in MV2040, through the development of partnerships within other Council teams, government agencies, other councils, the environmental sector, business and industry.§        § §        §Responsibilities§        §          §Lead and manage environmental sustainability projects;;§          §Provide specialist advice and preparation of reports to Council on zero carbon opportunities measures for Council and the community;§          §Provide high level advice about climate change mitigation and adaptation related issues and opportunities, on energy efficiency, renewable energy and climate related risks both internally and externally;§          §Lead and coordinate the Environmental Upgrade Finance scheme within Council;§          §Coordinate the cross-Council delivery and evaluation of relevant MV2040 ‘Green’ theme actions and other environmental policies; and§          §Lead the coordination of Council’s operational and city of Moonee Valley community greenhouse gas inventories and meet reporting obligations, including the Australian Government’s Climate Active Carbon Neutral Standard.§        §        §About You§        §          §A tertiary qualification in Engineering, Environmental Management, Environmentally Sustainable Design, Environmental Science or related field, with several years’ relevant experience;§          §Extensive experience in environmental program development and delivery;§          §Demonstrated experience and/or knowledge of the broad range of issues associated with environmental sustainability for Local Government;§          §Demonstrated ability to design, lead and deliver environmental sustainability projects such as in the areas of climate change adaptation, carbon emissions reduction, energy management, from scoping through to implementation, ensuring delivery within agreed budget and timeframes;§          §Demonstrated ability to analyse energy, carbon and climate change issues and develop and inform policy and project responses; Highly-developed written and oral communication skills, and ability to articulate a complex message to inform and educate different audiences; and§          §Demonstrated effective interpersonal communication skills, including building and maintaining effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders and ability to participate in and facilitate successful cross-organisational projects.§        §        §Next Steps§Applications must be submitted through our online system §https://mooneevalley.mercury.com.au/§        §and should be in line with the Moonee Valley City Council Application Guide found at the bottom of the advertisement. Applications that do not meet these requirements may not be considered.§        § §        §For further information please view the Position Description or contact Sarah Wighley on §(03) 9243 1164§.§        § §        §Benefits§        §At Moonee Valley City Council, we provide a number of benefits to our valued employees including:§        §          §Flexible work opportunities§          §Local Government Employees Health Plan§          §Novated vehicle leasing§          §Employee assistance programs / phone or in person counselling services§        §        § §        §Our Culture of Inclusion§        §If you are interested in the role but feel you may not meet the full range of selection criteria, we encourage you to contact us to discuss your experience and application for this position.§        § §        §We don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our services and our community. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace work agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.§        § §        §Moonee Valley City Council is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer and we value diversity and encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, people of any age or gender, people identifying as lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and gender diverse, intersex and/or queer (LGBTIQA+) and people with disability.
