We are a local government within the north-west metropolitan area of Melbourne, providing a range of services to some 118,000 residents and over 10,000 businesses.§ §The Opportunity §Moonee Valley City Council’s City Futures Unit is currently seeking a Principle Sustainability Officer to join a committed and passionate Sustainability Team. This role will be leading policy and projects that contribute towards creating a sustainable city, and Council’s commitment of achieving zero net carbon emissions for its operations by 2020 and the community by 2040, as outlined in Council’s long term strategy, MV2040.§ §The Principle Sustainability Officer will play a role in leading the delivery of  environmental sustainability actions in MV2040, through the development of partnerships within other Council teams, government agencies, other councils, the environmental sector, business and industry.§ §Responsibilities§Lead and manage environmental sustainability projects;;§Provide specialist advice and preparation of reports to Council on zero carbon opportunities measures for Council and the community;§Provide high level advice about climate change mitigation and adaptation related issues and opportunities, on energy efficiency, renewable energy and climate related risks both internally and externally;§Lead and coordinate the Environmental Upgrade Finance scheme within Council;§Coordinate the cross-Council delivery and evaluation of relevant MV2040 ‘Green’ theme actions and other environmental policies; and§Lead the coordination of Council’s operational and city of Moonee Valley community greenhouse gas inventories and meet reporting obligations, including the Australian Government’s Climate Active Carbon Neutral Standard.§About You§A tertiary qualification in Engineering, Environmental Management, Environmentally Sustainable Design, Environmental Science or related field, with several years’ relevant experience;§Extensive experience in environmental program development and delivery;§Demonstrated experience and/or knowledge of the broad range of issues associated with environmental sustainability for Local Government;§Demonstrated ability to design, lead and deliver environmental sustainability projects such as in the areas of climate change adaptation, carbon emissions reduction, energy management, from scoping through to implementation, ensuring delivery within agreed budget and timeframes;§Demonstrated ability to analyse energy, carbon and climate change issues and develop and inform policy and project responses; Highly-developed written and oral communication skills, and ability to articulate a complex message to inform and educate different audiences; and§Demonstrated effective interpersonal communication skills, including building and maintaining effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders and ability to participate in and facilitate successful cross-organisational projects.§Next Steps§Applications must be submitted through our online system §https://mooneevalley.mercury.com.au/§and should be in line with the Moonee Valley City Council Application Guide found at the bottom of the advertisement. Applications that do not meet these requirements may not be considered.§ §For further information please view the Position Description or contact Sarah Wighley on §(03) 9243 1164§.§ §Benefits§At Moonee Valley City Council, we provide a number of benefits to our valued employees including:§Flexible work opportunities§Local Government Employees Health Plan§Novated vehicle leasing§Employee assistance programs / phone or in person counselling services§ §Our Culture of Inclusion§§If you are interested in the role but feel you may not meet the full range of selection criteria, we encourage you to contact us to discuss your experience and application for this position.§ §We don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our services and our community. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace work agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.§ §Moonee Valley City Council is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer and we value diversity and encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, people of any age or gender, people identifying as lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and gender diverse, intersex and/or queer (LGBTIQA+) and people with disability. If you have a reasonable adjustment, support or access requirement, we encourage you to let us know through your application or email §H2@mvcc.vic.gov.au§ or call §9243 1122§.§§Enquiries:§ Sarah Wigley§Ph:§ §(04) 0283 9007§Applications Close:§ 23/10/2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The team is composed of high calibre and passionate individuals from a range of backgrounds including management consulting, investment banking and corporate venture capital. §        § §        §The key responsibilities of the role and team include:§        § §        §          §Analysis of the operating environment and identification of the potential medium ti linger term issues and trends that are of strategic significance to the Group’s portfolio of businesses. §          §Evaluation of the implications of environmental change, development of strategic options and recommendations to achieve the Group’s vision and objectives over the medium to longer term. §          §Facilitating the annual strategy development processes with the Executive leadership team and the board. §          §Contributing to the development of the the corporate strategy, generating insights on the near and long term challenges and opportunities facing the group and broader industry. §          §Lead and execute projects end to end by working with the stakeholders across the group. This will include identifying framing and scoping problems, undertaking internal and external research, synthesizing complex information and project management responsibilities. §          §Support the Strategy team to build practice tools and IP, including frameworks, approaches and solutions to enhance the teams productivity. §        §        § §        §Your skills and experience§        § §        §          §3 - 5 years experience working in a top tier strategy consulting firm, in-house strategy function or Investment Banking§          §Exposure to Financial Services sector§          §Ability to take ownership of complex strategic cases, with demonstrated structured problem solving capability and hypothesis led thinking and analysis§          §Demonstrated ability to work effectively and efficiently in high performing teams§          §Exceptional communication skills and stakeholder engagement skills§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The overview§We are delighted to be working with one of Australia's most iconic and well known brands to find them a Senior Strategy Manager to join their in-house Group Strategy function. This will include identifying framing and scoping problems, undertaking internal and external research, synthesizing complex information and project management responsibilities. §Support the Strategy team to build practice tools and IP, including frameworks, approaches and solutions to enhance the teams productivity. § §Your skills and experience§ §3 - 5 years experience working in a top tier strategy consulting firm, in-house strategy function or Investment Banking§Exposure to Financial Services sector§Ability to take ownership of complex strategic cases, with demonstrated structured problem solving capability and hypothesis led thinking and analysis§Demonstrated ability to work effectively and efficiently in high performing teams§Exceptional communication skills and stakeholder engagement skills§§§§

jobTitle: Economic Development Lead Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50674575.txt	§Economic Development Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economic Development Lead§§Advertiser: §Penrith City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$100,282.00 - $116,080.00 p.a., plus 9.5% Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Are you looking for an exciting career in a place of limitless opportunity? The city of Penrith sits at the foot of the Blue Mountains, alongside the Nepean River, and is home to approximately 212,000 people and over 14,000 businesses. Located nearby the new Western Sydney Airport and Aerotropolis, Penrith is at the forefront of progress and possibility, perfectly placed to help forward-thinking businesses and investors achieve new levels of success.§At Penrith City Council, we’re passionate about people; in our community and in our workplace. We want you to be able to be your best self and we get that work is just one part of your life, so we’re here to support you in the moments that matter. As the winner of the 2020 Local Government Excellence in People and Culture Award and a finalist in the 2020 Australian HR Awards, you can be confident in joining a workplace that offers truly outstanding benefits, including:§§A range of flexible work arrangements§18 weeks paid maternity leave§Health and wellbeing leave§15 days personal leave§Significant financial and leave support for undertaking further education §Diverse salary packaging§And much, much more!§§The Economic Development Lead sits within the Council’s City Economy and Marketing Department. The role is responsible for the facilitation of economic development opportunities in alignment with Penrith’s Community Plan.§Key objectives of this role include:§§Implementing relevant aspects of Penrith’s Economic Development Strategy,§Promoting to those wanting to locate their business in Penrith our City’s economic advantages using our New West investment brand,§Creating, facilitating and implementing initiatives that create new economic opportunities for Penrith, §Proactively engaging with existing business and industry to help facilitate their growth and diversification.§§In addition, the Economic Development Lead will provide strategic advice about economic development activity in Penrith to Council and to other key stakeholders such as State and Federal Government and agencies, The Greater Sydney Commission, Western Sydney City Deal stakeholders along with other community and government organisations.§To fulfil the role, we require a highly organised professional with strategy development and implementation skills and demonstrated project and stakeholder management experience.§Our team is dynamic, outgoing, high-performing, energetic and friendly, and engaged in enhancing the future of Penrith and creating more opportunities for our community.§If you are looking for your next challenge, this is the role for you!§Essential Criteria§§A tertiary qualification in Urban Planning, Economic Development, Marketing, Business or related area§Demonstrated experience in economic development, tourism development or regional development§Demonstrated experience and demonstrable achievement in implementing economic and regional development projects and initiatives;§Highly developed interpersonal, negotiation and communication skills, with demonstrated experience in public speaking, and stakeholder and community engagement§Strong strategic, analytical and organisational skills, with a demonstrated ability to manage complex external and cross-organisational projects to deliver community outcomes§Experience in providing high-level advice to achieve strategic outcomes§Current Class C Driver Licence.§§Desirable Criteria§§ Experience in local government, the public sector or a large, diverse organisation.§§Commencing salary: §$100,282.00 - $116,080.00 per annum, plus 9.5% Superannuation§Applications close:§ Sunday, 18 October 2020§You may be required to undertake background checks, as relevant to the position for which you have applied.§Please visit careers.penrith.city to view the position description and select the "Apply" button to submit your application online.§For further information about the position, please contact Fiona Kulak on §(02) 4732 7496§. §In addition to a cover letter and resume, applicants are required to submit comprehensive responses to the selection criteria (listed above) as a part of their initial application. Applicants who do not meet the essential criteria will not be considered.§Completed applications must be received by 11.55pm on the closing date. Please allow 4 weeks from the closing date for the processing of your application.§Council practices EEO and WHS principles.§Penrith City Council is committed to ensuring the safety of our people and community during the COVID-19 pandemic. §§Many of our employees are currently working remotely or in a way that is different to normal, which may impact our recruitment processes including time to respond to applicants and conducting online interviews instead of in-person. Some roles may also require temporary remote working arrangements; if applicable, this will be discussed with you at the time of interview.  §§We thank you for your patience and understanding during this time.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Management Consultant: Change and Innovation Leader Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50652449.txt	§Senior Management Consultant: Change and Innovation Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Management Consultant: Change and Innovation Leader§§Advertiser: §Enzen Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§About ENZEN§  §Enzen Australia is an innovative & knowledge-based Consulting, Technology, Engineering and Operations organisation exclusively working in the Energy and Utility sectors. We provide outcome-based turnkey solutions, blending industry best practices and leading-edge ideas with a continuous focus on meeting our customers’ expectations. §  §Our purpose is to make energy & water accessible, affordable and sustainable to all!§  §About the ROLE§  §As the Change & Innovation Leader, you will play an integral role in leading our client’s digital transformation change journey. As a member of the senior program delivery team you will design and implement change and training programs across people, process and technology. §  §In addition, you will lead the development of the Change & Innovation practice within the Enzen Australia organisation. You will act as a visionary, and proactively strategize, formulate and implement the short and long-term strategy for the Change & Innovation practice. You will drive continuous improvement and assist in the development and execution of strategic initiatives in your area of responsibility. §  §You will have the opportunity to support leaders in successfully delivering new digital experience and exciting new transformation capabilities. You will be passionate about fostering a great culture and establishing a positive client experience with a focus on increasing value, benefit realisation and ROI.§ § §Build strong business partnerships internally and externally to enable game changing process improvements§ §Develop and continuously refine the Enzen Australia Change Management framework and associated tools. § §Conduct stakeholder and change readiness analysis, ensuring business and people related benefits and risks are well understood and managed§ §Define and spearhead the change & training strategy and framework for client project implementations§ §Develop a set of actionable and targeted change management plans – including communication plan, stakeholder management, training plan and resistance management plan. Oversee the delivery of the actions outlined in the plan, carefully assessing progress and if necessary revising the plan§ §Lead small project teams of technical training consultants, including overseeing the development and delivery of training materials§ §Support project teams in integrating change management activities into their project plans§ §Identifying issues, analyse problems, think laterally and provide tangible, practical and achievable business solutions.§ §About YOU§ § §Tertiary qualifications in Business coupled with Change Management Certification§ §Extensive Change Management experience in Utilities / energy verticals, ideally with a significant operational change supported by technology enablement experience§ §Experience leading change and innovation programs in complex, international organisations§ §Previous experience leading organisational design and communication programs§ § Strong analytical skills§ §An extensive background in roles delivering sustainable change programs relating to people, process and technology§ §Extensive experience in stakeholder management, at C+ Level and below§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills§ §Excellent planning and organisational skills§ §Agile change delivery skills and experience§ §Able to demonstrate current best practice change management operations including those adopted by other leading organisations§ §Have a genuine approach to stakeholder consultation to build relationships, understand challenges, and empower advocates§ §Be outcomes focused and thrive running multiple initiatives at any one § §How to APPLY§  §To apply, please submit a copy of your updated resume and cover letter addressing the requirements presented in selection criteria. Screening will be conducted as we receive applications and only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.§  §For more information or to have a confidential discussion, please contact our Talent Acquisition Specialist, §Shreya Pahwa§ on §shreya.pahwa@enzen.com§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§How many years' experience do you have with change management?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have prior experience in pre-sales activities as part of your overall leadership role where you have contributed to business growth?§How many years of change management experience do you hold in Utilities Industry?§§§

jobText: TXT/50672816.txt	§Specialist: Reward and Analytics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Specialist: Reward and Analytics§§Advertiser: §Sydney Catholic Schools§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Salary Packaging§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§We have a unique opportunity for a Specialist: Reward and Analytics within the People and Culture directorate to support our core values of empathy, curiosity, excellence, collaboration, and truth.§In 200 years of delivering excellence in education, Sydney Catholic Schools (SCS) has grown alongside the city’s dynamic, ever-changing and multicultural landscape with over 150 schools, more than 70,000 students and around 10,000 staff.§SCS continues to provide and support team environments, exceed expectations through collaboration, and deliver purposeful and value-driven work. Come join us as we embark on the next 200 years of excellence in teaching and learning.§ §The Role§We are looking for an exceptional subject matter expert to provide ongoing support in the development, management, and continuous improvement of People and Culture data insights, rewards and recognition.§Reporting to the Director: People and Culture, this is a unique opportunity to be a member of the People and Culture leadership team provides direction for all aspects of performance, reward and recognition. You will extensively partner with stakeholders relating to projects through research, analysis, data management, and reporting.§This role calls for a committed self-starter who appreciates the value of collaborating with various stakeholders within the business to explore and examine data to develop new reporting initiatives. You will be resilient, highly adaptable, and flexible in your approach as this role evolves to meet the needs of the organisation within a changing landscape.§ §Major Accountabilities§The major accountabilities for the role will include but are not limited to:§Partnering with senior leaders to define the most appropriate recognition and reward programs to support the organisation's strategic and operational plans.§Providing analytics and modeling to support the implementation of new initiatives and calendar events across the organisation.§Evaluation and review of superannuation, salary continuance, remuneration packages as well as recognition and reward programs to ensure they deliver on intended outcomes.§Developing benchmarks and key indicators of organisational culture and evaluate the effectiveness of employee engagement programs in shaping organisational culture.§Undertaking and analysing industry remuneration trends for staff who are not classified under an award or enterprise agreement; and provide advice to senior leaders as required.§Promote and implement the Sydney Catholic Schools mission and vision To know and love Christ through learning and Thriving Catholic communities through excellent teaching and learning.§Promote and abide by the Sydney Catholic Schools' values of empathy, curiosity, excellence, collaboration, and truth.§ § §Essential Criteria:§§Undergraduate degree in Human Resources Management, Business or Commerce; or other relevant fields with at least 10 years post-qualification experience.§Demonstrated dynamic ‘remuneration and benefits’ experience.§Expert-level analytical and project management skills with strong commercial acumen.§Experience in working with multiple and complex data sets and delivering end-to-end reporting solutions in a large organisation.§Strategic Planning - Proven experience in linking reward and engagement activities to business strategy.§Business Partnering and influencing - Demonstrated ability to build and maintain effective relationships by engaging, collaborating, and influencing key stakeholders across geographies.§Innovation Management - Proven track record in challenging the status quo and encouraging others to do the same.§Prior experience in salary benchmarking.§ §Application Process§To apply for this position via §https://cgprod.phris.org.au§ and follow the steps to complete your application.§If you have any questions, please contact the recruitment team via §hr.recruitment@syd.catholic.edu.au§ §Working with Children Check§This is a child-related position and a Working with Children Check is a prerequisite for anyone in child-related work. It involves a national criminal history check and a review of findings of workplace misconduct. Also, as a permanent position, you need to be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident.§§§§

The mission is to grow a community of leaders committed to equity for children and young people, by recruiting and developing exceptional people to teach and lead across Australian schools. Teach For Australia (TFA) are dedicated to ensuring that all children can achieve their potential, no matter what their postcode is.§        § §        § §        §About the role§        § §        §The newly created, and time-limited, Chief of Staff role will help guide the organisation, in particular the CEO and Executive Leadership Team, into a new phase of our organisational evolution and drive our new ways of working. This role, reporting directly to the CEO, will play a varied role that supports the coherence and integrity of TFA's new 2023 Strategy and sets TFA up for success to deliver on its vision and mission. They will partner with the CEO to develop the short-term and long-term strategic agenda and enabling the leadership team to deliver on expected results. The role will provide a flexible and strategic resource to the CEO, providing oversight and guidance to high impact projects and will some instances lead them from end to end.§        §This role helps the organisation into a new phase of our organisational evolution and drive our new ways of working. Please visit the Teach For Australia website (www.https://www.teachforaustralia.org/join-tfa/join-the-team), and follow the application instructions, for an opportunity to take your place in this life-changing organisation. §    §  §§§§About the business§ § § §Our vision is an Australia where education gives every child, regardless of background, greater choice for their future. The mission is to grow a community of leaders committed to equity for children and young people, by recruiting and developing exceptional people to teach and lead across Australian schools. Teach For Australia (TFA) are dedicated to ensuring that all children can achieve their potential, no matter what their postcode is.§ § § § § §About the role§ § § §The newly created, and time-limited, Chief of Staff role will help guide the organisation, in particular the CEO and Executive Leadership Team, into a new phase of our organisational evolution and drive our new ways of working. jobText: TXT/50624260.txt	§Industry Based Learning (IBL) Program 2021: Retail Of the Future Project§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Industry Based Learning (IBL) Program 2021: Retail Of the Future Project§§Advertiser: §Mercedes-Benz Cars§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §We're Recruiting:§Industry Based Learning (IBL) Program 2021: Retail Of the Future Project §      §        §Be the change. Join our team.§        §At Mercedes-Benz we like to do things differently. We’re a balance of passion, professionalism and approachability. Our Head Office based in Mulgrave, supporting a dynamic network across Australia and New Zealand, has an established culture of support and collaboration, ensuring our service is exceptional and our customers’ expectations are exceeded.§        §We believe our people make the difference. We proudly offer generous employee benefits, such as discounted car leasing purchase options, volunteer leave and much more! Our passion for our people also extends to Employee Recognition and Reward programs, as well as on-going investment and support in learning and development opportunities.§        §We’re proud to be recognised as a Workplace Gender Equality Employer of Choice and support a flexible and modern work culture. We empower, trust and respect our employees and support a diverse workplace with equal opportunities. §        §Our 2021 IBL Program:§        §• Full-time, 12 month paid role to kick-start your career with a prestigious global brand §        §• Commencing mid-January 2021, with potential opportunities to stay on with the company following the conclusion of the program§        §• Flexible working hours available to accommodate study commitments §        §• Enrichening professional work experience in a large corporate business Head Office, combined with development and training opportunities§        §• Real work experience that will give you a competitive advantage§        §• Work in a collaborative, supportive and agile work culture§        §• Join a tight knit community of other IBLs and form lasting professional relationships§        §• Opportunities to grow your network, be involved in exciting cross departmental meetings and projects and become part of a close-knit team§        §The Retail of the Future placement at a glance: §        §An exciting opportunity is available for a motivated and enthusiastic student to join the Retail of the Future team. Reporting to the Manager, Retail of the Future, your key responsibilities will include:§        §          §Helping to introduce the Retail of the Future direct sales (Agency) model in Australia§          §Assisting to develop strategies for ordering and stock management/transition in the lead up to go-live§          §Helping to build intelligent pricing systems in the lead up to go-live§          §Process mapping, documentation and system development§        §        §What we are looking for:  §        §Self-motivated and pro-active students who are passionate about gaining work experience. Effective communicators who can build rapport, enjoy collaborating with others and have the confidence to step up and drive change and ideas.§        §To be considered, students must be an undergraduate in their second year or have at least 1 year left of studies as of January 2021, in a Business, Marketing or Information Systems discipline.§        §If this sounds like the right opportunity for you to kick start your career at Mercedes-Benz Australia’s Head Office, please apply by Thursday, 8th October. Please ensure your application includes your resume, cover letter and recent academic transcript  (this can be unofficial).§      §    §    §      §        §        § Register your interest today§        § Go to www.mercedes-benz.com.au/careers§      §    §  §§§Be the change. Join our team.§ §At Mercedes-Benz we like to do things differently. We’re a balance of passion, professionalism and approachability. Our Head Office based in Mulgrave, supporting a dynamic network across Australia and New Zealand, has an established culture of support and collaboration, ensuring our service is exceptional and our customers’ expectations are exceeded.§ §We believe our people make the difference. We proudly offer generous employee benefits, such as discounted car leasing purchase options, volunteer leave and much more! Our passion for our people also extends to Employee Recognition and Reward programs, as well as on-going investment and support in learning and development opportunities.§ §We’re proud to be recognised as a Workplace Gender Equality Employer of Choice and support a flexible and modern work culture. We empower, trust and respect our employees and support a diverse workplace with equal opportunities. § §Our 2021 IBL Program:§ §• Full-time, 12 month paid role to kick-start your career with a prestigious global brand § §• Commencing mid-January 2021, with potential opportunities to stay on with the company following the conclusion of the program§ §• Flexible working hours available to accommodate study commitments § §• Enrichening professional work experience in a large corporate business Head Office, combined with development and training opportunities§ §• Real work experience that will give you a competitive advantage§ §• Work in a collaborative, supportive and agile work culture§ §• Join a tight knit community of other IBLs and form lasting professional relationships§ §• Opportunities to grow your network, be involved in exciting cross departmental meetings and projects and become part of a close-knit team§ §The Retail of the Future placement at a glance: § §An exciting opportunity is available for a motivated and enthusiastic student to join the Retail of the Future team. Reporting to the Manager, Retail of the Future, your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Helping to introduce the Retail of the Future direct sales (Agency) model in Australia§ §Assisting to develop strategies for ordering and stock management/transition in the lead up to go-live§ §Helping to build intelligent pricing systems in the lead up to go-live§ §Process mapping, documentation and system development§ §What we are looking for:  § §Self-motivated and pro-active students who are passionate about gaining work experience. Effective communicators who can build rapport, enjoy collaborating with others and have the confidence to step up and drive change and ideas.§ §To be considered, students must be an undergraduate in their second year or have at least 1 year left of studies as of January 2021, in a Business, Marketing or Information Systems discipline.§ §If this sounds like the right opportunity for you to kick start your career at Mercedes-Benz Australia’s Head Office, please apply by Thursday, 8th October. jobText: TXT/50678654.txt	§Executive Director Environmental Services Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Director Environmental Services Group§§Advertiser: §Department of Planning, Industry and Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§Salary starting from $284k incl Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §      §      §Executive Director Environmental Services Group §      §        §          §Key Leadership role responsible for the environmental management of sites owned and managed by the NSW Government.  §        §        §          §Housing and Property§ (HAP), within the §Department of Planning, Industry & Environment§ (DPIE), is looking for an executive to take on an exciting opportunity of leading and developing the Environmental Services Group.  §        §        §          §            §              §Opportunity to provide leadership, expert strategic advice and facilitate executive decision making across environmental and sustainability projects. §              §Fulltime, ongoing (permanent) opportunity. §              §Parramatta base – the Department is promoting flexible work arrangements and would be open to other locations.   §              §TRP starting from $284k including superannuation, commensurate with experience §            §          §        §        §          §About the role §        §        §          §The Executive Director of the Environmental Service Group leads a team responsible for the environmental management of sites (both property and places) owned and managed by the NSW Government. The Executive Director provides leadership, expert strategic advice and facilitates executive decision making in respect to significant environmental and sustainability projects across the State within §Property & Development NSW§ (PDNSW).  §        §        §          §The role leads a team who provide expert advice and project management expertise on remediation and sustainability projects; the management and rehabilitation of former landfill sites; and ensures compliance with and reports on building and environmental standards and performance in respect to select NSW Government owned sites. §        §        §          §Your challenge will be to provide expert advice to achieve stakeholder support within the PDNSW leadership team and senior external stakeholders including government officials in other agencies and clusters to ensure significant environmental and sustainability projects and initiatives are delivered within applicable time, cost and quality parameters. The role is responsible for leading a team of highly qualified and experienced technical experts and ensuring specialist knowledge and expertise is maintained so that best practice environmental and sustainability practices continue to be delivered by the business unit. §        §        §          §For more information about this rare opportunity, §click here to view the role description§. §        §        §          §About you § §        §        §          §You will be a high calibre Environmental Services / Sustainability executive who is seeking a new challenge in a highly visible and strategic role.  You will bring a balanced mix of environmental management and sustainability experience along with a focus on innovation which will be employed in one of NSW’s most inclusive workplace cultures. Your ability to work with and engage stakeholders across all levels of seniority, combined with experience in high profile environmental and sustainability projects will set you up for success in this role. Strong experience in people leadership will also be key to your success. §        §        §          §We’re passionate about our team and work. You’ll be joining a team which nurtures talent and works to overcome barriers in order to achieve exciting project outcomes for our state. You will also be expected to create and drive integrated project teams and government departments that bring together a diversity of skills and experience.  §        §        §          §To apply, §please submit an updated CV and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role.  §        §        §          §For further information,§ please contact Matthew Dwyer via email to §matthew.dwyer@dpie.nsw.gov.au§ § §        §        §          §Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020, at 11:55pm  §        §        §          § §        §        §          §About Housing & Property  §        §        §          §The Housing and Property Group, part of the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE), oversees the management of NSW Government assets, including the management of Crown land, the NSW Government’s social housing portfolio and oversight of strategic use and disposal of government owned land. The Group also includes the Aboriginal Housing Office, the Valuer General and the Land and Housing Corporation.   §        §        §          §The Group leverages public and private sector expertise to improve place-based outcomes, providing greater access and choice of housing through initiatives such as an end-to-end housing strategy, and improving outcomes for Aboriginal communities to maximise community benefit from government owned land and property.  §        §        §          §Who is the Department of Planning, Industry & Environment [link removed]?    §        §        §          §The Department of Planning, Industry and Environment brings together specialists in urban and regional planning, natural resources, industry, environment, Aboriginal and social housing and regional NSW.   §        §        §          §            §We share a common goal to maximise the long-term wellbeing of NSW.   §          §          §            §We do this by protecting and improving:   §          §          §            §              §prosperity   §              §environmental sustainability   §              §safety and security   §              §social inclusion and cohesion, and   §              §attractiveness as a place for recreation and relaxation   §            §          §        §        §          §            §We bring together the economy, environment, work and play, industry and recreation. This helps to ensure economic growth and job security considers the environment and character of our neighbourhoods and communities.   §          §          §            §Why work for Department of Planning, Industry and Environment?   §          §        §        §          §Exciting career pathways and opportunities   §        §        §          §We offer vibrant and exciting career paths for people from a wide range of backgrounds and skills. Once you join the NSW Government, you’ll be supported to develop your skills and expertise through ongoing training, and opportunities to move easily from role to role, and agency to agency across the entire NSW government.    §        §        §          §Our people:  §  §        §        §          §Join DPIE and you’ll be joining a team of more than 8,000 passionate people spread across a diverse range of disciplines and functions including - urban planning, parks and wildlife, fisheries, agriculture and water. If you’re motivated and passionate about making a difference to the people of NSW, we invite you to become part of our story.   §        §        §          §Wellbeing: §   §        §        §          §Providing a safe, supportive, ethical, diverse and inclusive workplace for our people is one of our priorities. We run a variety of programs and provide a range of supporting resources to ensure the wellbeing of all our people.   §        §        §          §  §        §        §          §A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary roles of the same role or role type that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.  §        §        §          § §        §      §    §  §§§Key Leadership role responsible for the environmental management of sites owned and managed by the NSW Government.  §§Housing and Property§ (HAP), within the §Department of Planning, Industry & Environment§ (DPIE), is looking for an executive to take on an exciting opportunity of leading and developing the Environmental Services Group.  §§§Opportunity to provide leadership, expert strategic advice and facilitate executive decision making across environmental and sustainability projects. §Fulltime, ongoing (permanent) opportunity. §Parramatta base – the Department is promoting flexible work arrangements and would be open to other locations.   §TRP starting from $284k including superannuation, commensurate with experience §§§About the role §§The Executive Director of the Environmental Service Group leads a team responsible for the environmental management of sites (both property and places) owned and managed by the NSW Government. The Executive Director provides leadership, expert strategic advice and facilitates executive decision making in respect to significant environmental and sustainability projects across the State within §Property & Development NSW§ (PDNSW).  §§The role leads a team who provide expert advice and project management expertise on remediation and sustainability projects; the management and rehabilitation of former landfill sites; and ensures compliance with and reports on building and environmental standards and performance in respect to select NSW Government owned sites. §§Your challenge will be to provide expert advice to achieve stakeholder support within the PDNSW leadership team and senior external stakeholders including government officials in other agencies and clusters to ensure significant environmental and sustainability projects and initiatives are delivered within applicable time, cost and quality parameters. The role is responsible for leading a team of highly qualified and experienced technical experts and ensuring specialist knowledge and expertise is maintained so that best practice environmental and sustainability practices continue to be delivered by the business unit. §§For more information about this rare opportunity, §click here to view the role description§. §§About you § §§You will be a high calibre Environmental Services / Sustainability executive who is seeking a new challenge in a highly visible and strategic role.  You will bring a balanced mix of environmental management and sustainability experience along with a focus on innovation which will be employed in one of NSW’s most inclusive workplace cultures. Your ability to work with and engage stakeholders across all levels of seniority, combined with experience in high profile environmental and sustainability projects will set you up for success in this role. Strong experience in people leadership will also be key to your success. §§We’re passionate about our team and work. You’ll be joining a team which nurtures talent and works to overcome barriers in order to achieve exciting project outcomes for our state. You will also be expected to create and drive integrated project teams and government departments that bring together a diversity of skills and experience.  §§To apply, §please submit an updated CV and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role.  §§For further information,§ please contact Matthew Dwyer via email to §matthew.dwyer@dpie.nsw.gov.au§ § §§§Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020, at 11:55pm  §§ §§About Housing & Property  §§The Housing and Property Group, part of the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE), oversees the management of NSW Government assets, including the management of Crown land, the NSW Government’s social housing portfolio and oversight of strategic use and disposal of government owned land. The Group also includes the Aboriginal Housing Office, the Valuer General and the Land and Housing Corporation.   §§The Group leverages public and private sector expertise to improve place-based outcomes, providing greater access and choice of housing through initiatives such as an end-to-end housing strategy, and improving outcomes for Aboriginal communities to maximise community benefit from government owned land and property.  §§Who is the Department of Planning, Industry & Environment [link removed]?    §§The Department of Planning, Industry and Environment brings together specialists in urban and regional planning, natural resources, industry, environment, Aboriginal and social housing and regional NSW.   §§§We share a common goal to maximise the long-term wellbeing of NSW.   §§We do this by protecting and improving:   §§§prosperity   §environmental sustainability   §safety and security   §social inclusion and cohesion, and   §attractiveness as a place for recreation and relaxation   §§§§We bring together the economy, environment, work and play, industry and recreation. This helps to ensure economic growth and job security considers the environment and character of our neighbourhoods and communities.   §§Why work for Department of Planning, Industry and Environment?   §§§Exciting career pathways and opportunities   §§We offer vibrant and exciting career paths for people from a wide range of backgrounds and skills. Once you join the NSW Government, you’ll be supported to develop your skills and expertise through ongoing training, and opportunities to move easily from role to role, and agency to agency across the entire NSW government.    §§Our people:  §  §§Join DPIE and you’ll be joining a team of more than 8,000 passionate people spread across a diverse range of disciplines and functions including - urban planning, parks and wildlife, fisheries, agriculture and water. If you’re motivated and passionate about making a difference to the people of NSW, we invite you to become part of our story.   §§Wellbeing: §   §§Providing a safe, supportive, ethical, diverse and inclusive workplace for our people is one of our priorities. jobTitle: Data Governance Specialist -6 month contract Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50710704.txt	§Data Governance Specialist -6 month contract§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Governance Specialist -6 month contract§§Advertiser: §Melbourne Water§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Data Governance Specialist -6 month contract §      §        §Our Organisation§        §We love water and love life. What we do makes a vital contribution to Melbourne’s famous lifestyle. We achieve this by supplying high quality drinking water, providing outstanding sewerage services, integrating drainage systems, building resilience to flooding and by enhancing our waterway and land for greater community use. It’s a pride we share in helping to make greater Melbourne a fantastic place to live.§        §Reporting to the Manager, Risk and Information Management you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference and add to our work environment, within a place where you can learn and perform to your fullest potential.§        §The Role§        §In this 6 months role as a Data Governance Specialist you will focus on developing and delivering a strong foundational enterprise data governance framework incorporating data principles, policies, standards and practices.  In this role you will help establish and maintain data governance structures, custodianship and enhanced capabilities that drive data ownership, accountability, decision making and deliver value. In this role you will:§        §          §Establish and lead the delivery of an enterprise data governance vision and strategic roadmap§          §Lead and roll out an enterprise data governance framework, including data policies, processes, standards, metrics, and related tools§          §Embed a data governance approach that ensures clear decision making and accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets§          §Lead effective strategies to enhance and improve information literacy and capabilities across the business§          §Be the key point of contact for data governance queries and concerns§        §        §Make an Impact§        §Become part of a talented and passionate team dedicated to enhancing life and liveability in Melbourne and beyond. Doing truly meaningful work in a supportive and inclusive culture that encourages you to make the most of your talents.§        §We provide a range of employee benefits that will make your experience working at Melbourne Water both professionally and personally rewarding.§        §Freedom§        §Melbourne Water is committed to flexible working. We offer a variety of flexible arrangements to suit our employees varied needs and the business, including purchased leave, varied start and finish times, working from alternative locations, part time work and 9-day fortnights. We understand that Melbourne Water and our customers benefit from enabling our employees to achieve balance in work and life.§        §People§        §Our people are passionate, welcoming and inclusive. We welcome applications from everyone, including people with disability, mature age and young job seekers, members of the LGBTI+ community, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. Melbourne Water welcomes and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.§        §Your Skills and Experience§        §          §Extensive practical experience with large scale data management deliverables§          §Established experience in the design, creation, implementation and management of data governance activities§          §Demonstrated ability to influence, negotiate with, and engage all levels of management from Board, Senior leaders, to data owners and stewards§          §Proven strategic thinker, with the ability to create, execute and deliver complex programs of work and change initiatives§          §Strong understanding of the range of information related compliance obligations for which Melbourne Water is required to comply§          §Sound understanding of data management trends and best practices§        §        § §        §Your ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders is required together with a qualification in Information/Data Management, Information Science, or a relevant Information Technology.§        §For more information, please see the attached §Position_Description§        §How to apply§        §Click on the "apply" button and complete the online application form.§        §Closing date: Thursday 11th OCTOBER 2020 at 11:55pm AEST§        §Please note a Police Check / Health Assessment is required for this position. §        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§Our Organisation§We love water and love life. What we do makes a vital contribution to Melbourne’s famous lifestyle. We achieve this by supplying high quality drinking water, providing outstanding sewerage services, integrating drainage systems, building resilience to flooding and by enhancing our waterway and land for greater community use. It’s a pride we share in helping to make greater Melbourne a fantastic place to live.§Reporting to the Manager, Risk and Information Management you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference and add to our work environment, within a place where you can learn and perform to your fullest potential.§The Role§In this 6 months role as a Data Governance Specialist you will focus on developing and delivering a strong foundational enterprise data governance framework incorporating data principles, policies, standards and practices.  In this role you will help establish and maintain data governance structures, custodianship and enhanced capabilities that drive data ownership, accountability, decision making and deliver value. In this role you will:§§Establish and lead the delivery of an enterprise data governance vision and strategic roadmap§Lead and roll out an enterprise data governance framework, including data policies, processes, standards, metrics, and related tools§Embed a data governance approach that ensures clear decision making and accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets§Lead effective strategies to enhance and improve information literacy and capabilities across the business§Be the key point of contact for data governance queries and concerns§§Make an Impact§Become part of a talented and passionate team dedicated to enhancing life and liveability in Melbourne and beyond. Doing truly meaningful work in a supportive and inclusive culture that encourages you to make the most of your talents.§We provide a range of employee benefits that will make your experience working at Melbourne Water both professionally and personally rewarding.§Freedom§Melbourne Water is committed to flexible working. We offer a variety of flexible arrangements to suit our employees varied needs and the business, including purchased leave, varied start and finish times, working from alternative locations, part time work and 9-day fortnights. We understand that Melbourne Water and our customers benefit from enabling our employees to achieve balance in work and life.§People§Our people are passionate, welcoming and inclusive. We welcome applications from everyone, including people with disability, mature age and young job seekers, members of the LGBTI+ community, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. Melbourne Water welcomes and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.§Your Skills and Experience§§Extensive practical experience with large scale data management deliverables§Established experience in the design, creation, implementation and management of data governance activities§Demonstrated ability to influence, negotiate with, and engage all levels of management from Board, Senior leaders, to data owners and stewards§Proven strategic thinker, with the ability to create, execute and deliver complex programs of work and change initiatives§Strong understanding of the range of information related compliance obligations for which Melbourne Water is required to comply§Sound understanding of data management trends and best practices§§ §Your ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders is required together with a qualification in Information/Data Management, Information Science, or a relevant Information Technology.§For more information, please see the attached §Position_Description§How to apply§Click on the "apply" button and complete the online application form.§Closing date: Thursday 11th OCTOBER 2020 at 11:55pm AEST§Please note a Police Check / Health Assessment is required for this position. § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50645544.txt	§Group HR Project Lead - Culture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group HR Project Lead - Culture§§Advertiser: §QBE§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Group HR Project Lead - Culture §      §        §Your part in a changing world§        §At QBE, we’re driven by our purpose – §to give§ §people the confidence to achieve their ambitions§.§        §We are an international insurer and reinsurer offering a diverse portfolio of commercial, personal and specialty products, as well as risk management solutions. Our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation. We employee a team of more than 11,800 people, in 27 countries around the world.§        §The opportunity§        §An exciting new opportunity of Group HR Project Lead, Culture, has become available within QBE’s dynamic, progressive and employee-centric Group HR team.§        §This role will see you leading and managing the end-to-end delivery of our Culture review and transformation roadmap, as well as contributing to developing delivery and change capability and discipline across the HR function and at a global reach.§        §In this unique and exciting role, you will:§        §          §Deliver primary support to HR executives/teams and internal/external partners to mobilise new initiatives, deliver critical outcomes and manage stakeholder expectations;§          §Manage the end-to-end delivery of our Culture review and transformation roadmap, establishing and controlling project constraints and scope;§          §Collaborate and engage with the HR Portfolio Office and Program leadership to give input around and support the strategic direction of the initiative as a whole;§          §Establish and manage appropriate working groups and steering committees aligned to program governance model and processes;§          §Participate as a member of the global HR transformation program and contribute to the development of planning, change and delivery mechanisms.§        §        §Your story so far§        §          §Previous experience in related program/project management and change disciplines, with strong foundations in human resources and culture jobTitle: Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Project Coordinator Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50635220.txt	§Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Project Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Project Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Mulgowie Farming Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Western Suburbs & Ipswich§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Mulgowie Farming Company is a large Australian owned and operated horticultural business, specialising in the growing, packing, marketing and distribution of fresh vegetables for domestic and export markets. Over the past 75 years, Mulgowie Farming Company has grown far and wide, with vegetable farms across Queensland, New South Wales and Victoria. Mulgowie farmers are passionate about tending to §Healthy Soil§, growing §Healthy Plants§ and consistently providing high quality, nutritious fresh vegetables for §Healthy People§.§ §The Role:§ §We are embarking on a significant change in the way we work at Mulgowie, adopting the Oliver White approach to Integrated Business Planning.  We are doing this to ensure that as we continue to grow, we are well positioned to continue our delivery of fresh healthy produce to consumers.  The IBP Project Coordinator will support the changes and inputs required to deliver Oliver Wight recognised “Class A” Status. The role provides direct support to the IBP Change Management Lead (IBP CML) and change management process associated with Integrated Business Planning (IBP), to ensure all departments maintain a fully integrated planning approach to business execution.  This is a 12 month fixed term contract.§ §Your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Deliver and embed the structured methodology used to lead change and implement management activities§ §Support Communication strategies to assist design, development, delivery and management of communications§ §Provide direct support to key implementation stakeholders throughout all phases of the project through to embedment and maturity§ §Assess the change impact, determine and deliver strategies and tactics to increase adoption, acceptance and minimize resistance§ §Support all training programs and the team in their efforts across training initiatives§ §Aid the IBP Change Management Lead by coordinating and managing administrative duties such as communications, minute taking, project documentation management, and meeting scheduling§ §To be successful in the position you will have:§ § §Strong project experience in operational change management and coordination§ §Experience working in fast moving industries, dealing with ambiguity§ §IBP exposure will be highly regarded§ §Project Management qualifications will be highly regarded§ §Professional written and verbal communication skills§ §Highly developed organisational skills§ § § §Why Join Us?§ §At Mulgowie; we value the Consumer in all of our decision making; value the safety of our people and product; respect all people and are united through team spirit; and value clear communication whilst welcoming all ideas for improvement.§ §This is an exciting role for candidates who pride themselves on providing a high level of customer satisfaction and have the drive to continue professional growth to support and strengthen our high calibre operations.§ §If you believe you possess the above criteria, please apply on seek providing a cover letter and current resume outlining your skills and experience.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a project coordinator?§How many years' experience do you have with project planning and scheduling?§§§

jobTitle: Rostering Specialist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50634308.txt	§Rostering Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Rostering Specialist§§Advertiser: §Scope (Aust) Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §      §      §Rostering Specialist §      §        §About Home@Scope§        §Our mission is to enable each person to live as an empowered and equal citizen. We support people with physical, intellectual and multiple disabilities and developmental delays to achieve their goals.§        §Home@Scope is a subsidiary of Scope, providing Supported Independent Living (SIL) and Short-Term Accommodation and Assistance (STAA) services previously provided by the Victorian Government. §        §About the Role§        §Looking for a new challenge? As Home@Scope enters a new phase, transitioning from direct Victorian Government funding and towards the Federal National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), there is an opportunity for someone to help pioneer the execution of activities to align new SIL funding to the individual needs of our Residents. As part of starting this transition, the Roster Business Partner will work closely with our Operations Managers, NDIS Transition Roster Project team and internal Home@Scope teams to develop rosters, support Operations Management, and be instrumental in this transition.§        §This 6 month contract role sits within the Home@Scope Business Performance and Operations team. Working closely with Customer Service Delivery Managers, Business Partners, General Managers and senior leadership to help with transformation. This is a hands-on role, suitable for someone passionate about delivering a great product and with the ability to work to deadlines, as well as building more strategic capability.§        §About You§        §You will have experience working in efficiently and effectively drafting rosters based on the input from Operations Staff, Operations Management advice and awards (DSEAV) constraints. You will have high level communication and interpersonal skills, and strong organisation, analytical and stakeholder management skills.§        §In addition, our ideal candidate will be expected to demonstrate:§        §          §Ability to ‘think on your feet’ to progress difficult/challenging discussions and inspire confidence§          §Cultivate and maintain collaborative working relationships.§          §Support operational teams in transitioning to NDIS Supported Independent Living (SIL) rosters across all H@S SIL Houses, drawing on previous experience in roster creation.§          §Ensure rosters adhere to industrial awards (DSEAV) rostering principles§          §Instrumental team member of the NDIS Transition Roster Project to help pioneer the process and help resolve escalations§          §Work closely with senior leadership across Home@Scope functions§          §Deliver reporting that demonstrates progress and highlights risks and trends as required to Roster Project Lead and project team§        §        § §        §Home@Scope as an Employer§        §Successful candidates will enjoy a range of staff benefits including flexibility to suit your work-life balance, continuous development and training, competitive remuneration, purchased annual leave scheme and a locally based, friendly team environment.  You will also get the unique chance to work for a highly respected organisation that is seeing the biggest change to the disability sector with the roll out of the NDIS.§        §Take your career on a journey with Home@Scope and work proactively with us to achieve our mission!§        § §        §All appointments are subject to a satisfactory police records check. This role is only available to Australian residents or to those who hold the right to work in Australia. Find out more about us at www.scopeaust.org.au§        § §      §      §      §      §All appointments are subject to a satisfactory police records check. This role is only available to Australian residents or to those who hold the right to work in Australia. Find out more about us at www.scopeaust.org.au§    §    §  §§§About Home@Scope§Our mission is to enable each person to live as an empowered and equal citizen. We support people with physical, intellectual and multiple disabilities and developmental delays to achieve their goals.§Home@Scope is a subsidiary of Scope, providing Supported Independent Living (SIL) and Short-Term Accommodation and Assistance (STAA) services previously provided by the Victorian Government. §About the Role§Looking for a new challenge? As Home@Scope enters a new phase, transitioning from direct Victorian Government funding and towards the Federal National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), there is an opportunity for someone to help pioneer the execution of activities to align new SIL funding to the individual needs of our Residents. As part of starting this transition, the Roster Business Partner will work closely with our Operations Managers, NDIS Transition Roster Project team and internal Home@Scope teams to develop rosters, support Operations Management, and be instrumental in this transition.§This 6 month contract role sits within the Home@Scope Business Performance and Operations team. Working closely with Customer Service Delivery Managers, Business Partners, General Managers and senior leadership to help with transformation. This is a hands-on role, suitable for someone passionate about delivering a great product and with the ability to work to deadlines, as well as building more strategic capability.§About You§You will have experience working in efficiently and effectively drafting rosters based on the input from Operations Staff, Operations Management advice and awards (DSEAV) constraints. This role is only available to Australian residents or to those who hold the right to work in Australia. Find out more about us at www.scopeaust.org.au§ §§§§

jobTitle: Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684848.txt	§Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority§§Advertiser: §Department of the Treasury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$88,084 - $131,799§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§The Financial Regulator Assessment Authority (FRAA) is a new statutory body that is being created in response to the recommendations of the Royal Commission into Misconduct in the Banking, Superannuation and Financial Services Industry.§Its role will be to conduct regular assessments of the effectiveness of the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) and the Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority (APRA), as well as capability reviews and reviews of matters related to the effectiveness of ASIC and APRA.§The FRAA will be made up of four members, including the Chair and the Secretary of the Treasury. The FRAA Secretariat will carry out the assessments under the guidance of the FRAA, as well as assisting the FRAA with the performance of its duties more generally.§Members of the Secretariat will be ongoing Treasury employees.§Successful applicants will have the opportunity to join the FRAA Secretariat on day one, and shape the organisation through its start-up phase. Staff will be required to apply fresh strategic thinking in order to develop frameworks for assessing the effectiveness of the financial regulators.§FRAA staff will engage directly with FRAA panel members and the Treasury Secretary, and with senior representatives from ASIC and APRA. The work of the FRAA will guide and influence the direction of financial regulation in Australia.§Between them, the staff of the FRAA Secretariat will have quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, financial literacy, knowledge of legal and regulatory frameworks in Australia, and understanding of corporate governance practices. In addition to the capabilities demonstrated by individual candidates, the selection process will consider the balance of skills available in the Secretariat as a whole.§The ability to work collaboratively and develop productive working relationships will be a key selection criteria.§Senior Analysts (Executive Level 1)§There are two EL1 Senior Analyst positions in the FRAA Secretariat. Each of these will focus on one of ASIC or APRA, and assist on projects in relation to the other.§Working in teams, and under the guidance of an EL2 Manager, Senior Analysts will:§• Conduct analysis required to support FRAA assessments;§• Develop advice to the FRAA and the leadership of the FRAA Secretariat;§• engage with external stakeholders to gather relevant information;§• Draft assessments and other written communications from the FRAA;§• Contribute to the development of the strategic direction of the FRAA;§• Plan and lead assessment projects under the guidance of an EL2 Manager; and§• Assist with and lead other tasks as required.§EL1s are expected to perform the above roles more independently and with limited supervision by the EL2 Manager of the Secretariat. EL1s may also take on a ‘Team Leader’ role, may have responsibility for staff development, and may lead individual projects under the supervision of an EL2 Manager. §Analysts (APS 6)§There are two Analyst positions in the FRAA Secretariat. Each of these will focus on one of ASIC or APRA, and assist on projects in relation to the other. Analysts will:§• Conduct analysis required to support FRAA assessments;§• Develop advice to the FRAA and the leadership of the FRAA Secretariat;§• Engage with external stakeholders to gather relevant information;§• Draft assessments and other written communications from the FRAA;§• Contribute to the development of the strategic direction of the FRAA; and§• Assist with other tasks as required.§APS 6 Analysts will be expected to work with a high degree of autonomy, but under the supervision and guidance of EL1 Senior Analysts and the EL2 Manager of the Secretariat.§§§§

and§          §Complying with program guidelines, work plans, budget, data and reporting requirements while working within relevant parameters and scope of practice.§        §        §About the Benefits§        §This is a multifaceted and strategic role where you will §truly make a difference§ to the continued success of the organisation and §experience real job satisfaction§ every day - don't miss out!§        §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with an §attractive remuneration circa $131,629 - $148,014 + super, §negotiable with skills and experience. In addition, you will have access to a range of great benefits including:§        §          §Salary packaging up to $15,899.94;§          §Subsidised furnished accommodation is available for candidates coming from outside of the Barkly region;§          §6 weeks annual leave giving you plenty of time to explore the beautiful Barkly region;§          §Remote Retention Allowance after 12 months of continual service;§          §$1,500 annual allowance for continued professional development;§          §Free general medical;§          §Free general dentistry (excluding laboratory work);§          §Free gym membership; and§          §Free personal medical prescriptions (conditions apply).§        §        §You will be joining a §friendly and professional team§, where you will also receive §personal and professional development opportunities.§        §About the Tennant Creek region§        §Year-round blue skies, stunning landscapes and vibrant, diverse and warm communities - that's life in the Northern Territory! and§ §Complying with program guidelines, work plans, budget, data and reporting requirements while working within relevant parameters and scope of practice.§ §About the Benefits§ §This is a multifaceted and strategic role where you will §truly make a difference§ to the continued success of the organisation and §experience real job satisfaction§ every day - don't miss out!§ §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with an §attractive remuneration circa $131,629 - $148,014 + super, §negotiable with skills and experience. In addition, you will have access to a range of great benefits including:§ § §Salary packaging up to $15,899.94;§ §Subsidised furnished accommodation is available for candidates coming from outside of the Barkly region;§ §6 weeks annual leave giving you plenty of time to explore the beautiful Barkly region;§ §Remote Retention Allowance after 12 months of continual service;§ §$1,500 annual allowance for continued professional development;§ §Free general medical;§ §Free general dentistry (excluding laboratory work);§ §Free gym membership; Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§About Us§RightShip is the world’s biggest third party maritime due diligence organisation, providing expertise in global safety, sustainability and social responsibility best practises.  §We bring together years of industry expertise with the output from analytics and large data sets to provide our safety and environmental scoring systems, recommendations and consultancy services.  §Using leading data and technology, we aim to set new benchmarks in environmental protection.  We support global initiatives and action influencing practical and impactful change, enabling “win-win” for business and the environment.  §To find out more visit RightShip.com. §The Role§The focus of the Strategic Planning and Partnerships Manager will include the development and translation of RightShip's strategic priorities into corporate planning and performance outcomes, and the alignment of business transformation and improvement initiatives to effect service improvement.  §Reporting to the CFO and partnering closely with the Executive Team, you will lead on key existing strategic initiatives while identifying, scoping and recommending what is next for the business.  You will liaise with functional leaders to execute on key projects while also fast tracking the overall strategic thinking of the group.  You will be responsible for:§Developing and applying analytic frameworks and principles to investigate business issues, identify solutions and manage the implementation of agreed actions§Creating situational awareness – strategic metrics, key results, competitive analysis, strategic intelligence§Facilitating and developing practical plans and outcomes§Develop and update key strategic documents including business and corporate plans§Monitor and report on strategy execution§Independently conduct research activities to explore strategic issues and keep abreast of market dynamics, and to use these insights to update dashboards and registers§Market analysis including market sizing exercises, competitor monitoring and external pricing§Develop and implement a Partnering policy and framework§Undertake a periodic partner review and work with stakeholders to deliver partnership outcomes§About You§You will have proven capability in effective communication, building business insights.  Your highly analytical and organised approach and your ability to execute work effectively and independently will help you succeed in this role.  You will have the:§Proven ability to influence and collaborate with senior leaders§Ability to adapt your communication style and approach to engage teams§Ability to work at pace, adapt to changing priorities with a strategic problem-solving approach§Ownership and drive - delivering outcomes with and through cross functional teams§Tertiary qualification in relevant field e.g. commerce, business, IT or project management§Experience in a strategy/management consulting firm or corporate strategy team will be highly regarded§Proven ability to break down and frame strategic problems§Maritime industry experience is desirable but not essential§What we offer§We offer a place where you know you are contributing to an organisation who are constantly working to ensure ships are safe as possible so that crew and cargo are protected.  We are passionate about maritime efficiency, safety and sustainability practices.  §We offer generous rewards.  Our base salary is competitive, we support employee wellbeing and provide our employees with a Healthy Living Allowance and our annual incentive scheme is awesome.  §We are committed to professional development to make sure that your career keeps growing while you’re working with us.  §We have some great talent who are happy to share their experience and skills to help you on your way and we are committed to professional development to make sure your career keeps growing while you’re working with us. §Click the Apply button or contact Kathryn Woolridge for more information at §kathryn.woolridge@rightship.com§.§RightShip is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values diversity, enables access and promotes inclusion in our workplace.
