jobText: TXT/50688520.txt	§Category Specialist – Indirect Procurement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Category Specialist – Indirect Procurement§§Advertiser: §Reserve Bank of Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Category Specialist – Indirect Procurement §      §        §Achieve procurement success through effective influencing and strategic partnership with the business. §        § §        §Do work that makes a difference §        §In this position you will play a key role in influencing the strategic direction of Procurement within and the Bank. You will work within the Corporate and Governance team to achieve the following:§        §          §Engage internal stakeholders with your influencing skills and ability to tactfully challenge internal leadership§          §Develop and implement Category Plans using your analytical skills and ability to leverage spend analytics (Microsoft Power BI) §          §Lead process reengineering and digitisation by reimagining internal tools and templates with your process thinking§          §Coach team members and business leaders using your technical expertise and interpersonal skills§          §Analyse business needs with your commercial acumen and develop approach to market (RFX/EOI) documentation with your expertise in procurement to see them delivered §          §Provide reliable, pragmatic advice on procurement policy and the Commonwealth Procurement Rules with your knowledge of best market practice§          §Lead strategic supplier management in partnership with the business by leveraging your market intelligence and customer focus§          §Negotiate and review contract documentation using your high attention to detail§        §        § §        §Your team§        §RBA Procurement is a centre of excellence for the organisation. The Corporate and Governance team is leading a significant change agenda to streamline and improve organisational practices. The team is leading a project to overhaul every aspect of procurement at the RBA – policies, tools, practices and analytics - in partnership with the business. The Corporate and Governance team is leading a significant change agenda to streamline and improve organisational practices. jobText: TXT/50651597.txt	§Management Consultant - Energy/Mining/Natural Resources Sector§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Management Consultant - Energy/Mining/Natural Resources Sector§§Advertiser: §Blenheim Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Blenheim Partners is an international Executive Search and Board Advisory Firm. As a professional services company we are specialist advisors to many of the world's leading corporations. As a result of company growth and market investment we have an opportunity for a motivated and experienced Management Consultant to join our Energy/Mining/Natural Resources Sector Practice.§ §Reporting to the Managing Partner, the potential candidate will have a track record as a Management Consultant delivering transformation programmes to leading Industrial organisations in Australia. This opportunity will appeal to those with a background as a Management Consultant in the Energy/Mining/Natural Resources Sector with a previous track record as an executive in the broader sector. As a business consultant you will be accustomed to delivering on-time and on-budget consulting projects and will have experience of developing strategy and implementing change agendas, creating value and maximising growth that delivers sustainable and tangible results in the complex sector of Energy/Mining and Natural Resources. § §It is anticipated the successful candidate will have over 5 years’ experience working in the Energy/Mining/ Natural Resources l Sector or as a management/business consultant covering the market with exposure and knowledge across the broad remit of the Energy/Mining/Natural Resources market that may include Upstream and Downstream, Renewables, Open Cut, Underground as well as Engineering Support. You will ideally have relevant international sector/consulting experience and a demonstrable track record of developing client relationships that have converted to sustainable revenue generation. § §The successful candidate will be results oriented, customer focused, delivering on-time and on-budget projects to deliver enhanced efficiencies to our clients and be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. You will be a problem solver, able to understand organisational structures with high intellect and ambiguity tolerance, possessing strategic and commercial acumen. You will have the ability to engage and partner with senior level decision makers and bring a commitment to excellence, belief in team values and esprit de corps. § §Responsibilities include:§Playing a representative role as a trusted advisor and partner within the Energy/Mining/Natural Resources sector;§Developing strong client relationships and ensuring presentation of business cases with strategic advice are of utmost quality and reassurance;  §Analysing and evaluating client objectives and Management structures to achieve optimal commercial outcomes; §Presenting alterative ideas to clients to stimulate review of current organisational decision making processes to enhance efficiency and transformational goals;§Developing project plans with key deliverables that aim to provide efficiencies and support to corporate and growth agendas of our clients;§Managing client deliverables and expectations, including drafting client proposals and overseeing the end to end execution of the engagement deliverables; and,§Preparing written reports relating to business development opportunities based on previous successful outcomes. § §It is anticipated you will possess an appropriate tertiary qualification with a degree in mining, engineering, science, business, or a related field. Postgraduate business qualification would be highly regarded.§ §For further information please email your enquiries to (§employment@blenheimpartners.com§ [link removed])§§§§

jobTitle: Economic & Social Advisory - Student Internship Program 2021 Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50610139.txt	§Economic & Social Advisory - Student Internship Program 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economic & Social Advisory - Student Internship Program 2021§§Advertiser: §Urbis Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§Kickstart your career in a multidisciplinary professional services firm§Collaborate with market leaders and industry experts§Casual opportunities offering 2-4 days per week, commencing in February 2021§Urbis is a market-leading firm that shapes the cities and communities of Australia for a better future. Drawing together a network of the brightest minds, Urbis consists of practice experts, working collaboratively to deliver fresh thinking and independent advice and guidance. Working across the areas of planning, design, policy, heritage, valuations, transactions, economics and research, the expert team at Urbis connect their clients in the public and private sectors to a better outcome, every time.§National Student Internship Program 2021§Our National Student Internship Program offers exclusive opportunities for the brightest students to gain invaluable experience and broad exposure to our business and related industries. As part of our program, you will learn from mentors, work with our clients, access our learning resources and have exposure to fantastic networking opportunities.§Our annual program will run from February to December 2021 and will enable you to graduate with the distinct advantage of industry experience over your peers. Our student roles offer flexibility in the form of 2-4 days per week, to complement your studies.§What about this opportunity?§Our Economics & Social Advisory team has an opening for a student in our Melbourne office on a paid casual basis. We are looking for a student with either a public policy research background or an economics background. You will have the opportunity to be involved in research, report generation and administration across both our public policy and economic advisory projects, utilising a range of relevant research tools, to assist in delivering consulting services to clients.§As a Research Assistant (Public Policy) or Assistant Research Analyst (Economics), you can expect to be involved in:§Supporting team members in research tasks, servicing client requirements, including data and report preparation.§Providing input into the compilation and presentation of evidence-based research to support economic & social impact assessment, cost-benefit analysis, and Input-Output modelling (only if Economics student)§Supporting the design, development and testing of surveys and research instruments (only if Public Policy student)§Undertaking straightforward analysis of qualitative and quantitative data.§About You§You will be an undergraduate or post-graduate student undertaking studies in a relevant public policy, social science or economics degree, who is passionate about city shaping, has great communication skills and an interest in working in a professional services / consulting environment. Successful candidates will have a strong academic record and possess a combination of the following technical skills and attributes:§Strong writing and conceptual capabilities, with the ability to develop well-reasoned and logical arguments;§Demonstrates developing skills in specific qualitative, quantitative, economic research and modelling techniques (Economic student only); and/or,§Demonstrates developing ability to undertake desktop research including literature reviews and to clearly analyse and synthesise findings (Public Policy student only); and,§Strong attention to detail and accuracy.§The Application Process§If you’re interest in joining our Student Internship Program, click on ‘Apply’ and submit your application. For your application to be considered, we require your CV, a copy of your most recent academic transcripts and a cover letter (one page maximum) addressing the following questions:§Why do you want to be a cityshaper at Urbis?§What has motivated you to pursue a career in your selected discipline?§Which Urbis project (past or present) would you like to be part of, and why?§ §Note: your chosen project should be relevant to the practice area/discipline you are applying for.§Our Economic & Social Advisory team are looking for candidates with either Public Policy or Economic skills, although also welcome applications from candidates with experience in both areas.§Applications close at 11:00pm on Sunday 11 October 2020. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted, with interviews expected to be in mid/late October 2020.§Urbis is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive, supports flexibility, and welcomes diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. To find out more about us visit our website at https://urbis.com.au/.§Eligibility§You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident and studying throughout the duration of the internship to be eligible for the program. Preference will be given to those in their final or second last year of their degree, but we encourage applications from those earlier in their degrees also.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Policy and Planning Officer Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50675881.txt	§Senior Policy and Planning Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Policy and Planning Officer§§Advertiser: §Wyndham City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Senior Policy and Planning Officer§ § § §Join a high performing team and deliver policies that have real impact on the community!§ §Two roles; Permanent full-time and temporary full-time until May 2021, Werribee/Virtual-based§ §Salary from $101,069.74 plus super and fortnightly RDO§  § §We are Wyndham§, one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities.§ §Our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared to welcome over 200,000 new residents by 2040.§ §Shape new possibilities. Be part of something more.§ § §A bit about the role§ §The Senior Policy and Planning Officer sits within a newly formed team, which will play a strategic leadership role within the City Life Directorate to support Wyndham’s recovery post Covid-19. You will ensure that outcome focused social policy responses are developed, delivered and evaluated to meet the emerging needs of the community, as we begin our journey towards recovery.§ §You will have skills and experience in research and writing for government on complex and high-profile policy and issues. Your versatile policy analysis and stakeholder management skills will make you a strong contributor to a range of issues and projects in a dynamic and agile environment.  Play a critical role in Council’s social policy development and make a real impact for the Wyndham community!§ § §What you’ll deliver§ § §High quality social policy responses, tackling a wide range of community priorities in Wyndham§ §Strategic methods to monitor and measure policy outcomes, ensuring optimal results are being delivered§ §Innovative and creative solutions to many conflicting priorities§ §Translating future-focused and data-informed policy into actionable strategies for our community§ §Establish strong working relationships with a network of key internal and external stakeholders, holding a collaborative approach to your work§  § §What you’ll bring§ § §Excellent policy development ability, with substantial experience (social policy experience is desirable)§ §Highly tuned stakeholder management skills, particularly within the tiers of government§ §Ability to translate complex policy into tangible, clear-cut action items§ §Strong analytical skills to complement policy development§ §Tertiary qualifications in public policy, social sciences, community development or related§ disciplines§ §A collaborative, flexible and dynamic mindset§  § §Be part of something more§ §Take a look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. § §Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. Ask us how this role can be worked.§ §So, are you ready to shape new possibilities?§ § §What’s next?§ §If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending us a cover letter and your resume. We do not require any selection criteria to be addressed.§ §To find out more about the role, please contact §Lucy Midolo, Acting Social & Service Planning Coordinator§ on §0400 185 823§ §Applications will be accepted until 11:59pm §Sunday 18 October 2020§.§ § §We are a proud equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all walks of life to apply for our job opportunities. Our commitment is to provide safe and inclusive environments where everyone can grow and succeed.§§§§

jobTitle: Monitoring, Evaluation, and Communications (MEC) Coordinator Job in Asia Pacific - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647288.txt	§Monitoring, Evaluation, and Communications (MEC) Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Monitoring, Evaluation, and Communications (MEC) Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Cardno§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Asia Pacific§, §PNG & Pacific Islands§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Solomon Islands Education Sector Support Program§  § §  §The Solomon Islands Education Sector Support Program (ESSP) provides the strategic direction and implementation arrangements for the New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade (MFAT) and the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) combined investment to support the Solomon Islands Government (SIG) to implement its Education Strategic Framework 2016–2030 (ESF), the National Education Action Plan §2016-2020§ (NEAP) and its successor.§  § §  §The Program adopts a modified version of a sector-wide approach, using mixed-modalities. It positions the Ministry of Education and Human Resources Development (MEHRD) as the central partner, adopts MEHRD’s ESF and NEAP as the guiding frameworks for all investment, promotes strengthened sector-wide donor coordination and provides the majority of Program funding through sector budget support. Funding is also available to support targeted capacity development and activities implemented by non-governmental organisations.§  § §  §ESSP is managed under Australia’s Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF) by Cardno.§  § §  §The role§  § §  §The Monitoring, Evaluation and Communications Coordinator will be a part of the Program Management Team (PMT) who are responsible for supporting the development and undertake the day-to-day management, implementation, coordination and administration of the Solomon Islands ESSP.§  § §  §Working under the guidance of the ESSP Team Leader, the MEC Coordinator will ensure the timely collection, collation and support the analysis of both quantitative and qualitative data and information; activity and program implementation are underpinned by lessons, research and evidence; and assisting the MEL Lead in developing the M&E Framework for the ESSP and support the implementation of the Monitoring, Evaluation, Research and Learning Plan (MERL).§  § §  §The adviser will also:§  § § § §Support the collection, management and communication of qualitative and quantitative data and information about implementation of activities for quality reporting;§ §Working with the MEL Lead, assist with the updating and analysing data into the MEL Framework and implementation of M&E activities;§ §Draft media releases and social media posts in consultation with the AHC, NZHC, and MEHRD.§ §In line with the Public Diplomacy Framework, ensure appropriate branding is included on all printed and digital content produced under this program including NGOs activities, as well as arranging appropriate signage for events supported by the Program;§ §Support the SIRF Strategic Communications Manager in offering MEHRD staff in their professional development, training to improve their communication skills as deemed appropriate by the ESSP Team Leader.§ §Create strategies to assist the team improve the Ministry’s M&E framework including internal business communications system§ §Working with the SIRF Strategic Communications Manager, to ensure MEL information is incorporated into communications material.§ §Work with the PMT to ensure key development issues such as gender equity, social inclusion, diversity and impacts are systematically captured and reported on;§ §Provide additional support to the PMT as required.§ § §  §For further information, please copy paste this link to access the Terms of Reference detailing responsibilities and selection criteria: https://bit.ly/3jcw3Ko§  § §  §About you§  § §  §Cardno encourages Solomon Islands nationals and nationals from other Pacific island countries to apply.§  § §  §You will be a motivated and proactive individual with the right combination of experience, talent, energy and a commitment to technical excellence. You will also have:§  § § § §Tertiary qualification in monitoring and evaluation with some communications/Media studies or a related Social Science discipline or equivalent experience§ §Up to 5 years relevant experience in monitoring and evaluation, communications/media or a related social science.§ §Demonstrated experience working in media and/or communications or on education or development programs.§ §Proven track record in report writing, proofreading and effective communications with an attention to detail.§ §Strong interpersonal and communication skills.§ §Ability to work effectively as part of a cross-cultural and multi-location team with a range of stakeholders;§ §Proficiency with MS Word, Excel, Outlook, Indesign and other software is desirable;§ §Ability to converse in Pidgin English would be an advantage§ § §  §Remuneration§  § §  §This position is classified under DFAT’s Aid Adviser Remuneration Framework (ARF) as Discipline C, Level 1 and will be offered at a level commensurate to the successful candidate’s experience relevant to the role.§  § §  §To access the ARF rates, please copy and paste the following link:https://www.dfat.gov.au/sites/default/files/adviser-remuneration-framework-2016.pdf§  § § §  §Location and travel requirements§  § §  §The position will be based in Honiara with regular provincial travel required.§  § §  §Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF)§  § §  §The Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF) is supported by the Australian Government and managed by Cardno. SIRF is an integrated facility that delivers both Technical Assistance (TA) and Deployee Support Services (DSS), in Solomon Islands.§  § §  §Why join Cardno?§  § §  §Cardno offers meaningful opportunities for each individual member of our team to grow, make an impact and leave a legacy for local communities, globally.§  § §  §By joining Cardno, you will be part of an environment where you can collaborate with leading experts from diverse backgrounds, access development programs to achieve your career goals, and be challenged to take a global outlook§  § §  §How to apply§  § §  §We welcome your interest in joining the Cardno team. Click the ‘apply’ button to submit your application online with the reference number CID/MN/SIRF/MEC by§ Sunday 25th October. §Your application §must§ include the following:§  § § § §Your CV; and§ §Completed application form in lieu of a cover letter. Please copy paste this link to access the application form: https://bit.ly/3j9aURt§ § §  §If you are having any technical issues with submitting your application online, please email them directly to the SIRF recruitment team §recruitment@sirf.com.sb§  § §  §About Cardno§  § §  §We are a global provider of integrated professional services which enrich the physical and social environment for the communities in which we live and work. Our team of multidisciplinary specialists has more than 70 years’ experience in designing, developing and delivering sustainable projects and community advancement programs.§  § §  §Cardno is an equal opportunity employer. Cardno encourages women and Solomon Islands nationals to apply. §  § §  §Cardno is committed to Safety and the Prevention of Sexual Abuse and Harassment (PSEAH), Child Protection and bribery prevention. We want to engage with the right people to deliver our client programs. As part of our approach you will be subjected to formal background screening, criminal record checks, employment verification, and periodic compliance checks. All Cardno staff receive safety, compliance and safeguards training and are responsible for contributing to a safer working culture.§§§§

jobTitle: Business Performance Analyst Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50554454.txt	§Business Performance Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Performance Analyst§§Advertiser: §Agricomm Trading Australia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$65,000 - $74,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Agricomm Trading Australia is an Australian family owned agricultural commodity trading company that has exhibited 25 years of constant and sustainable growth. Due to an expanding market share, business unit diversity and vertical integration opportunities within Australia and overseas, through a range of integrated Agricultural and distribution business, ACTA are currently seeking a strategic and driven Business Performance Analyst to join their Brisbane office.§ §The role of the Business process analyst is to support and partner with the leadership team in optimising the ongoing growth and profitability of the business.§ §This will be achieved through developing deep insight into the drivers and levers of business success and then translating these learnings into meaningful actions in collaboration with the senior management team and Directors.§ § § §Position Overview:§ § §Develop in-depth insight, analysis and effective communication of group product, customer and segment performance across the integrated supply chain, identifying internal and external factors that influence performance and how we can capitalise on them.§ §Develop in depth insight and analysis of targeted areas of operational performance across the group, identifying root cause of lost opportunity and how we can improve. Examples include lost sales from product not being available, asset under-utilisation, team productivity, and impact of external market / competitive actions.§ §Responsibilities & duties:§ § § §Strategic Business planning:§ § §Work with the CEO/CFO in creating and updating the overall business plans.§ §Assist the CEO/CFO in the effective presentation and communication of business strategy.§ §Assist in developing the business plan and strategy in our subsidiary businesses.§ §Data leadership and business intelligence: § § §Partner with Group IT and BI team on future dashboard and data warehouse development.§ §Provide leadership in automating analytics and training business units in their effective interpretation and use.§ §Financial Forecasting§:§ § §Partnering with the CFO in the development and operation of: § §Financial forecasts and scenario planning.§ §Farm and Livestock planning models§ §Forex risk exposure management.§ § § § § §Ideal Candidate Profile§:§ § §Motivation and tenacity to develop in-depth understanding of the real cause and effect of business performance.§ §Skilled at translating and communicating insights and data into effective learnings and actions to a wide range of stakeholders. Assisting in carrying these actions through to results.§ §Educational background in economics/statistics/analytics.§ §Have exposure to data warehouses, operational databases, BI & analytic tools§ §Demonstrated success in adding value to businesses in the 4 core role responsibilities of this position.§ §A collaborative mindset, demonstrating success in problem solving.§ §A strong desire to grow as part of a highly efficient and successful team§ § § §This role exemplifies a passionate, commercial and driven Business performance analyst with the ability to interpret, analyse and turn data into meaningful actions or outcomes and then assist with the real life and common sense application of outcomes. A result focussed professional with a hunger for continuous improvement.§ § § §If you possess the above background and skillset and are looking for a long term opportunity to join an expanding and well established business, please apply below.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: bp Customer & Products Internship (Commercial) Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639684.txt	§bp Customer & Products Internship (Commercial)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§bp Customer & Products Internship (Commercial)§§Advertiser: §BP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Salary§§Competitive Intern salary on offer§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§About the Opportunity§At bp, our Customer and Products business is divided between our Fuels / Retail business, Lubricants and Air bp. Our Retail business provides advantaged fuel, convenience and loyalty programmes to customers at over 17,000 service stations worldwide. Our market-leading lubricants business delivers Castrol and a range of high-quality BP branded products to over 100 countries - products that help cars, ships, aeroplanes, industrial plants, wind turbines and even computers run more efficiently.§For penultimate year students, our virtual paid 8-week internship program will commence 11th January 2021. As a bp Customer & Products Commercial Intern, you’ll gain insight into the real world of business. You’ll execute and deliver a multi-discipline project within a team environment which will ultimately contribute the achievement of bp’s reimagined strategy. Through this project you’ll benefit from a structured programme of work with real responsibility. You’ll experience on-the- job learning, along with development training to suit your role. Working across teams and functions, you’ll enjoy access to some of the most talented people in their fields.§No matter where you work at BP, you’ll be valued, included and respected. We’ll provide you with on-going support and we’ll reward you for the great work you do.§About You§We look for students with well-rounded life experiences. Your strong academic results will be supported by some work experience - everything from customer service to industry experience is great! You’ll have strong organisational skills, and the ability to deliver results in a collaborative environment. Your agility to learn and adapt will be key, along the energy and ownership to make the most of this fantastic opportunity. §Specifically, within our Customer & Products Commercial Internship space we’re looking for Interns with foundational knowledge in business analysis, modelling and strategy. As a Commercial Intern you will have an interest and/or skill in delivering economic value back to a business, identifying solutions and strategies resulting in cost savings and a natural negotiation style.§You must be comfortable making courageous and bold decision, digital fluency, a keen eye for analytics and the insights they provide. You’ll have career aspirations within a customer-centric and innovative convenience & retail business within a leading Integrated Energy Company.§To be eligible for our program you will:§Be an Australian citizenship or permanent resident§Have academic results of credit average (65) or above§be in your penultimate year of study in 2020§have career aspirations align with bp within our Customer & Products business (this may include currently studying a Commerce, Business, Marketing, Communications or similar degree)§Submit a cover letter with your application which answers the following question (in 200-500 words) - "What are you career and/or personal aspirations, and how do these aspirations align with bp's ambitions to reimagine energy by 2050 or sooner"§§About the benefits§BP offers you a collaborative work culture and a company that lives and breathes our values of Safety, Respect, Excellence, Courage and One Team. We have a commitment to developing your career and rewarding you with a competitive salary package for the duration of your internship. You’ll also have the opportunity to be considered for part-time work and our 2022 Graduate program at the completion of your time with BP.§BP is an equal opportunity employer supporting inclusion and diversity in our workforce. BP encourages women, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage and people of diverse backgrounds to apply.§ § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Energy Analyst Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50708172.txt	§Energy Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Energy Analyst§§Advertiser: §Opus Recruitment Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Salary§§Competitive§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Corporate Development§§§§§§ Energy Market Analyst§ §Work for a global Energy company specialising in analytics, consulting and training to businesses and stakeholders across the Australian and European Energy market. Our client are strong believers in creating a sustainable planet and to achieve this they provide insights on the energy market from wholesale, retail, regulatory and policy perspectives to our clients, facilitating informed business decisions.  §The Position§: § §Exciting opportunity for an Energy Analyst to work for a global company with a new presence within Australia, having a diverse and hardworking team. §The opportunity to gain experience in an international company§Working on exciting projects§Flexible working environment§Long-term career progression opportunities§Requirements:§Critical analysis of the impact of policy and legislation changes for our clients§1-2 years of experience in programming languages: macro excels, §Python, R, VBA, and SQL.§Responsible for authoring high quality and punctual content for external publication§Responsible for gathering information, inputting data and identifying key trends or relevant impacts to customers §Develop knowledge of the §National Electricity Market§ and wider energy industry through research, regular reporting, training courses, webinars, consulting papers and knowledge sharing meetings to keep the content fresh and up to date§Effectively communicate the key outputs of the research to the team and customers, focusing the information language to the audience§Take a proactive role in the team, contributing ideas and learnings to the business and our customers§Provide support to team members as required§Involvement in ad-hoc consulting projects as required§If this position seem like a good fit please click apply.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Manager - Finance & Performance Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50698586.txt	§Manager - Finance & Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Finance & Performance§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Manager - Finance & Performance§ §Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best§Opportunity to be a part of the best in class Finance Transformation team in ACT§People Leadership and Mentoring Opportunities§Lead our diverse and collaborative teams through our clients’ finance transformation journey. Build and grow Deloitte’s thought leadership to drive innovation and shape future trends!§ § §What will your typical day look like?§ As a Manager in our Finance & Performance team, you will -lead a team of Deloitte’s brightest minds to analyse clients’ needs and requirements for transforming their finance function; develop a roadmap strategy through redesign of finance structure, processes, enabling systems and effective business partnering; Design and embed end-to-end business process improvements to enhance customer experience, improve efficiency and productivity and/or reduce costs; Leverage your superb interpersonal skills and remarkable business sense to support the wider team in business development.§ § §About the team§ Industries are being disrupted at lightning speed and we’re responsible for helping CFOs stay ahead of the curve (and get that extra sleep at night!). Our high-performing and collaborative team offers CFOs advice to enable and optimise our clients’ finance strategies, ensuring that they are aligned with the organisation’s long-term goals. We primarily seek to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of organisations at all stages of the finance transformation journey from designing the change required, to delivering and managing that change and providing assurance around change initiatives.§ § You will be an integral part of a leading Finance Transformation practice in Australia and generate real insights to help deliver value to our clients.§ § §Enough about us, let’s talk about you.§ You are someone with:§ §7+ years’ experience working in Public Sector Corporate / Finance organisations with 4+ years’ in Professional Services or Consulting.§Experience in leading and/or implementing digitally enabled transformation projects and service delivery improvements§Knowledge of various digital finance systems and Business Analytic systems/processes across technology vendor(s)§Experience leading or mentoring small teams.§Ability to build consensus and foster change in ambiguous settings§NV1 Clearance is required§Why Deloitte?§ At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § § §Next Steps§ Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.§ § If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Daphne Gacsal from the Talent Acquisition t­­­­eam. We’d love to hear from you!§ § §This position is only open to Australian Citizens due to the nature of client engagements. For other positions we encourage Non-residents Non-citizens to view our Careers page and apply.§ § §By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients and candidates with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally§ § §The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50597186.txt	§Business Development Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Associate§§Advertiser: §Zenobe Energy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§JOB TITLE§  §Business Development Associate§  §SALARY §  §Competitive and based upon experience§  §LOCATION§  §Sydney preferred; other locations considered§  §OPPORTUNITY SUMMARY§  §Zenobē Energy was established to enable the transition to full zero carbon, non-polluting power, and transport systems through the intelligent use of energy storage. §  §The company has established itself as a market leader in battery storage, with 73MW of operational grid-scale battery capacity and is now is a leading firm in the financing and provision of turnkey solutions for electric vehicle fleets. The company has been consistently innovative since its founding in 2017, with major industry firsts in software development, market access, financing, and solution provision. It is backed by leading strategic energy storage investors and is uniquely positioned to meet customer demands with innovative solutions§  §We are offering an exciting opportunity for outstanding candidates with a passion for fighting climate change to apply their degree skills to the management of energy storage and electric vehicle projects. In our rapidly growing company, adaptable, highly motivated, and talented analysts will be given significant responsibility early-on, with the potential for equity participation. §  §We are looking for associates who will support our sector EV Fleet, Network Infrastructure and Commercial and Industrial Business Development teams. You will be a key member of these small teams primarily running data analytics, financial modelling, creating presentations and supporting our Business Development Directors and main Board Directors in the delivery of client proposals. Tasks will vary according to the sector and client but will include:§ § §Research into potential customers and understanding of their requirements§ §Analysis of client data to understand energy demand requirements§ §Building business cases and running financial scenarios to identify the impact for clients§ §Liaising with the Bidding and Analytics team to understand changes in the power markets§ §Liaising with the Procurement team to understand the change in capital and operational costs§ §Liaising with the Regulations team to understanding the impact of regulatory changes§ §Liaising with the Corporate Finance for the structuring of debt and equity components§ §Identifying ways to manage risk for Zenobē and our clients§ §Be proactive in thinking about new ways of delivering value for clients§ §Development of client presentation materials§ §Creation of presentations for Investment Committee meetings§ §APPLICANT PROFILE§  §A job with Zenobē Energy means a job with the market leader in one of the most dynamic and fastest growing sectors, gaining exposure to diverse roles and highly experienced partners. We are open to applicants from all academic areas, however the below skills and a strong interest in sustainability are essential.§  §Essential skills:§ § §Fluent in PowerPoint§ §Strong excel skills§ §Essential competencies:§ § §Bachelor’s degree from a renowned educational institution§ §A solid team player with a collaborative and consultative approach§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §Pragmatic, proactive and solution driven§ §Robust analytical skill set, an endless curiosity to think beyond conventional solutions§ §Able to thrive in a very fast-paced environment with large amounts of responsibility§ §Excellent organisational skills, able to multi-task, meet deadlines and juggle competing demands§ §Attention to detail and able to produce work of consistently high quality§ §Proven record of success§ §Ability to work in Australia and travel Australia wide and to a lesser extent internationally§ §Desirable but non-essential skills:§ § §Electrical engineering knowledge, particularly relating to grid-scale power electronics or battery technology and operation§ §Knowledge of the Australian energy or transport landscape§ §Previous experience in any client-facing role (especially consulting or large professional advisory firms)§ §Python skills§ §BENEFITS§ § §Performance related bonus and company share plan§ §Excellent opportunity for personal growth and responsibility.§ §DIVERSITY INITIATIVES§  §We are committed to the principles of equal opportunity for all and prohibit discrimination of every type. We will always ensure that all persons are treated fairly irrespective of their race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, political beliefs, trade union membership or non-membership, marital, physical or mental status or any other factors including pregnancy and maternity. We will endeavour to provide those who have physical or mental disabilities with specific assistance and arrangements to enable them to work for us wherever and whenever this is reasonably practical.§  §Our company is fully committed to the elimination of unlawful and unfair discrimination and values the differences that a diverse workforce brings to the organisation. We will not discriminate because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (which includes colour, nationality and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. We will not discriminate because of any other irrelevant factor and will build a culture that values meritocracy, openness, fairness, and transparency.§  §APPLY§  §To apply please submit your CV and a brief cover letter (1 page) detailing why you are well suited to the role and how you will contribute to the firm's success in this region. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following data analytics tools are you experienced with?§Have you worked in a role which requires experience with financial analysis and modelling?§How many years' experience do you have in a business analyst (BA) role?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50684897.txt	§Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority§§Advertiser: §Department of the Treasury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$88,084 - $131,799§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§The Financial Regulator Assessment Authority (FRAA) is a new statutory body that is being created in response to the recommendations of the Royal Commission into Misconduct in the Banking, Superannuation and Financial Services Industry.§Its role will be to conduct regular assessments of the effectiveness of the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) and the Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority (APRA), as well as capability reviews and reviews of matters related to the effectiveness of ASIC and APRA.§The FRAA will be made up of four members, including the Chair and the Secretary of the Treasury. The FRAA Secretariat will carry out the assessments under the guidance of the FRAA, as well as assisting the FRAA with the performance of its duties more generally.§Members of the Secretariat will be ongoing Treasury employees.§Successful applicants will have the opportunity to join the FRAA Secretariat on day one, and shape the organisation through its start-up phase. Staff will be required to apply fresh strategic thinking in order to develop frameworks for assessing the effectiveness of the financial regulators.§FRAA staff will engage directly with FRAA panel members and the Treasury Secretary, and with senior representatives from ASIC and APRA. The work of the FRAA will guide and influence the direction of financial regulation in Australia.§Between them, the staff of the FRAA Secretariat will have quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, financial literacy, knowledge of legal and regulatory frameworks in Australia, and understanding of corporate governance practices. In addition to the capabilities demonstrated by individual candidates, the selection process will consider the balance of skills available in the Secretariat as a whole.§The ability to work collaboratively and develop productive working relationships will be a key selection criteria.§Senior Analysts (Executive Level 1)§There are two EL1 Senior Analyst positions in the FRAA Secretariat. Each of these will focus on one of ASIC or APRA, and assist on projects in relation to the other.§Working in teams, and under the guidance of an EL2 Manager, Senior Analysts will:§• Conduct analysis required to support FRAA assessments;§• Develop advice to the FRAA and the leadership of the FRAA Secretariat;§• engage with external stakeholders to gather relevant information;§• Draft assessments and other written communications from the FRAA;§• Contribute to the development of the strategic direction of the FRAA;§• Plan and lead assessment projects under the guidance of an EL2 Manager; and§• Assist with and lead other tasks as required.§EL1s are expected to perform the above roles more independently and with limited supervision by the EL2 Manager of the Secretariat. EL1s may also take on a ‘Team Leader’ role, may have responsibility for staff development, and may lead individual projects under the supervision of an EL2 Manager. §Analysts (APS 6)§There are two Analyst positions in the FRAA Secretariat. Each of these will focus on one of ASIC or APRA, and assist on projects in relation to the other. Analysts will:§• Conduct analysis required to support FRAA assessments;§• Develop advice to the FRAA and the leadership of the FRAA Secretariat;§• Engage with external stakeholders to gather relevant information;§• Draft assessments and other written communications from the FRAA;§• Contribute to the development of the strategic direction of the FRAA; and§• Assist with other tasks as required.§APS 6 Analysts will be expected to work with a high degree of autonomy, but under the supervision and guidance of EL1 Senior Analysts and the EL2 Manager of the Secretariat.§§§§

jobTitle: Reporting Data and Security Lead Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697243.txt	§Reporting Data and Security Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reporting Data and Security Lead§§Advertiser: §APA Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§APA is one of Australia’s leading energy infrastructure businesses. We own and operate Australia’s largest gas network with over 1800 people across almost 70 sites throughout mainland, regional and remote Australia, APA also own or have interests in gas storage facilities, gas-fired power stations, gas processing plants, wind farms and solar farms.  We have a strong commitment to achieving the best outcome through an inclusive and collaborative culture.§With a strong growth agenda, APA is investing in its operating model, systems and processes and establishing a new “people.connect” support team that will provide integrated support management services across APA.  We now have an exciting opportunity available for a Reporting, Data and Security Lead to join our People Safety and Culture (PSC) team in our Melbourne, Southbank office on a full time, permanent basis.§Reporting to the PSC Transformation Program Manager, you will play a key role in providing end to end reporting solutions and governance of user security and master data for the people.connect project.  The role will span the ‘hire to retire’ life cycle and will drive a standardised, efficient and fit for purpose approach that supports delivery of an exceptional experience for the APA business community.§Leveraging your knowledge and experience of leading a practice, the role will drive continuous improvement aligned to the people.connect roadmap and evolution of APA’s People, Safety & Culture (PSC) function.§Key Responsibilities§         Reporting and Analytics§§Engage with stakeholders to build, deliver and enhance the supply of people reports and analytics in line with business requirements to support operational and strategic decision making.§Contribute to the definition of reporting performance metrics and targets and monitor and report on process performance.§Ensure quality, usability and operational risk expectations are met.§Provide Level 2 reporting support: triage, investigate and resolve escalated service requests and break/fix.§§          Security Governance§§Maintain user security across people.connect processes and reports in line with policy and data privacy principles, ensuring organisational compliance and controls.§Provide Level 2 reporting support: triage, investigate and resolve escalated security-related service requests and break/fixes.§Identify opportunities to streamline and standardise people.connect security profile catalogue.§Data Governance§§Scope, define and maintain master data in people.connect.§Provide expertise and Level 2 support on data integrity and reconciliation issues, partnering with PeopleAssist (Level 1 support) to triage, investigate and resolve escalated data-related service requests and break/fixes.§Perform bulk uploads & tactical initiatives, including  appropriate testing and reconciliation to deliver quality and integrity.§Maintain data documentation (data definitions, standards, reconciliation and control framework in line with APA standards and policies.§§About You§§In depth experience in report design, build and management for end to end HR, abreast with leading practice and trends in decision support, reporting standards and principle§Demonstrated capability in analysis, aggregation and synthesis of data into meaningful information that supports effective and efficient decision-making.§Experienced in data governance and security management in top tier, enterprise-wide planning systems.§Experienced in role-based security management in large-scale cloud-based systems.§Detailed understanding and experience working in HR functions and business processes across the ‘hire to retire’ lifecycle.§Well-developed consulting skills, preferably demonstrated in delivery of services to distributed client groups.§Well-developed analytical skills matched with an ability to articulate strategies and implement effective solutions to complex business problems.§High degree of presentation and communication skills and capability in preparation of regular reporting material.§Excellent documentation skills; organised with thorough attention to detail and demonstrated commitment to quality.§Experienced in delivery of change programs to HR function and enterprise-wide people leaders and employees§Proven ability to work effectively across multi-disciplinary teams in a fast-paced environment.§Experienced in design, implementation and user-level operation of contemporary HRIS (eg. Oracle, Workday, SAP/Success Factors) and Service Management applications (eg. ServiceNow)§Excellent stakeholder management skills and the ability to communicate effectively at all levels§§Sound like your kind of career?§ We’d love to hear from you.§APA is an equal opportunity employer. The safety and sustainability of our people, community and environment is our focus. We embrace diversity in our people to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we operate in.§When you join us on this journey to success, you will have access to targeted career development programs, competitive remuneration, employee benefits, work–life balance and wellbeing programs.§Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.§APA Group is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.§Role closes §Wednesday 21st October.§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50593600.txt	§Head of Change & Business Improvement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Change & Business Improvement§§Advertiser: §People's Choice Credit Union§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Head of Change & Business Improvement §      §Choose...People's Choice§        §People's Choice is one of Australia's largest and most successful credit unions and a leading provider of financial services. jobTitle: Senior Change Analyst Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703151.txt	§Senior Change Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Change Analyst§§Advertiser: §Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Change Analyst §      §        §About the Role§:§        §The Australian Energy landscape is rapidly changing and AEMO is on the forefront of this change. As part of this transformation AEMO has invested in a large-scale Digital Uplift that will benefit both AEMO, our Market Participants and external stakeholders.§        §As a Senior Change Analyst you will be pivotal in providing support to the Digital Change Team. This change will involve a change in the way we work, skills, capabilities, delegations, cost management, systems, you name it!§        §This opportunity is ideally to be based in Melbourne CBD for a 12 month fixed term contract (annual salary).§        § §        §Key accountabilities: §        §          §Support development of change management plans§          §Lead / support stakeholder and business engagement§          §Business impact assessments§          §Training needs assessments, design and (where applicable) training delivery§          §Development and input into change execution / activity plans§          §Tactical communication planning and delivery§          §Development and review of training collateral, work instructions and or support collateral§          §Identifying, tracking and profiling business change benefits§        §        § §        §Required skills and experience: §        §          §Experience supporting technology or digital initiatives requiring solid analytical, team collaboration and facilitation experience§          §Experience working through project ambiguity, clarifying and articulating people change impacts across the project life-cycle (Agile and Waterfall project experience a bonus)§          §Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools (accreditation in a relevant Change Management or Project Management methodology will be highly regarded)§          §Experience with developing training materials and facilitating training highly beneficial§          §Excellent written, oral and electronic communication skills §          §Solid experience working with MS Office / 0365 environments§        §        § §        §About the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO):§        §AEMO delivers secure, reliable energy to millions of Australians every day. Our work touches virtually all aspects of Australia’s industrial, business and domestic life. We ensure energy produced by electricity generators and gas suppliers reaches consumers nationwide.§        §We operate the national electricity grid and manage gas markets in all states except Northern Territory.  We also operate Victoria’s gas system. §        §AEMO provides expert guidance to government and the energy sector to inform policy, investment decisions and infrastructure management.  We play a crucial role in shaping Australia’s energy future. §        § §        §Your career with AEMO:§        §AEMO has some of Australia’s finest energy sector talent in its midst.  Our work is intellectually challenging, and our people gain enormous satisfaction from solving the complex problems constantly facing them. §        §The continuing interplay of shifts in energy generation, reliability, affordability, and a low emissions future will ensure we at AEMO continue to be challenged and driven for many years to come.§        §So, make your next career move one that really matters! §        § §        §Some of our employment benefits:§        §Here are some of the attractive employment benefits we offer:§        §          §Professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks and job rotation§          §Flexible working: work from home, part time and job share§          §Discount health insurance, gym membership and other concessions§          §Free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses *§        §        §* Subject to eligibility§        § §        §Apply now to join us and take your place alongside like-minded passionate, driven individuals in the Energy sector: one of the world’s most exciting and dynamic industries.§        §Click ‘apply’ to submit your CV and cover letter by §midnight Sunday 25th of October 2020.  §        §No agency applications will be accepted at this time.§        § §      §      §      §      §        §      §    §  §§§About the Role§:§ §The Australian Energy landscape is rapidly changing and AEMO is on the forefront of this change. As part of this transformation AEMO has invested in a large-scale Digital Uplift that will benefit both AEMO, our Market Participants and external stakeholders.§ §As a Senior Change Analyst you will be pivotal in providing support to the Digital Change Team. This change will involve a change in the way we work, skills, capabilities, delegations, cost management, systems, you name it!§ §This opportunity is ideally to be based in Melbourne CBD for a 12 month fixed term contract (annual salary).§ § § §Key accountabilities: § § §Support development of change management plans§ §Lead / support stakeholder and business engagement§ §Business impact assessments§ §Training needs assessments, design and (where applicable) training delivery§ §Development and input into change execution / activity plans§ §Tactical communication planning and delivery§ §Development and review of training collateral, work instructions and or support collateral§ §Identifying, tracking and profiling business change benefits§ § § §Required skills and experience: § § §Experience supporting technology or digital initiatives requiring solid analytical, team collaboration and facilitation experience§ §Experience working through project ambiguity, clarifying and articulating people change impacts across the project life-cycle (Agile and Waterfall project experience a bonus)§ §Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools (accreditation in a relevant Change Management or Project Management methodology will be highly regarded)§ §Experience with developing training materials and facilitating training highly beneficial§ §Excellent written, oral and electronic communication skills § §Solid experience working with MS Office / 0365 environments§ § § §About the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO):§ §AEMO delivers secure, reliable energy to millions of Australians every day. Our work touches virtually all aspects of Australia’s industrial, business and domestic life. We ensure energy produced by electricity generators and gas suppliers reaches consumers nationwide.§ §We operate the national electricity grid and manage gas markets in all states except Northern Territory.  We also operate Victoria’s gas system. § §AEMO provides expert guidance to government and the energy sector to inform policy, investment decisions and infrastructure management.  We play a crucial role in shaping Australia’s energy future. § § § §Your career with AEMO:§ §AEMO has some of Australia’s finest energy sector talent in its midst.  Our work is intellectually challenging, and our people gain enormous satisfaction from solving the complex problems constantly facing them. § §The continuing interplay of shifts in energy generation, reliability, affordability, and a low emissions future will ensure we at AEMO continue to be challenged and driven for many years to come.§ §So, make your next career move one that really matters! § § § §Some of our employment benefits:§ §Here are some of the attractive employment benefits we offer:§ § §Professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks and job rotation§ §Flexible working: work from home, part time and job share§ §Discount health insurance, gym membership and other concessions§ §Free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses *§ §* Subject to eligibility§ § § §Apply now to join us and take your place alongside like-minded passionate, driven individuals in the Energy sector: one of the world’s most exciting and dynamic industries.§ §Click ‘apply’ to submit your CV and cover letter by §midnight Sunday 25th of October 2020.  § §No agency applications will be accepted at this time.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Research Impact and Translation Manager Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50636479.txt	§Research Impact and Translation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Research Impact and Translation Manager§§Advertiser: §University of Western Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$130,120 - $135,189 p.a. + 17% super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Research Impact and Translation Manager §      §        §Cooperative Research Centre for Transformations in Mining Economies (CRC TiME)  §        §          §Flexible working environment to work the way that works for you§          §Full-time, three year fixed-term appointment§          §Salary range: Level 10, Grade 1: $130,120 - $135,189 p.a. + 17% superannuation§          §Position based in St. Georges Terrace (Perth CBD)§        §        §The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked amongst the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of Eight research-intensive universities.  With an enviable research track record, vibrant campus and working environments, supported by the freedom to ‘innovate and inspire’ there is no better time to join Western Australia’s top University.§        §About the team §        §The Cooperative Research Centre for Transformations in Mining Economies (CRC TiME) has been formed to drive transformational change that will enable regions and communities to transition to a prosperous and sustainable post-mine future. The goals of CRC TiME are to enable: §        §          §The delivery of sustained value to regional communities. §          §The creation of national and international opportunities to METS companies. §          §Support to governments and mining companies in achieving lease relinquishment.  §          §Building confidence for future resource sector investment §        §        §CRC TiME brings together a unique partnership of over 75 leading mining companies, mining equipment, technology and services (METS) companies, regional and community development organisations, governments and research partners. CRC-TiME will be co-hosted by the University of Western Australia and the University of Queensland with offices in Perth and Brisbane. CRC TiME will deliver projects nationally, with key ‘regional hubs’ where project activity undertaken by the CRC will be focussed.§        §About the opportunity §        §As the appointee, you will act as a key bridge between the CRC end users and research community.  This position is a key linking position within our organisation, providing a clear understanding of how information and knowledge is exchanged to best position it for impact and adoption. This means understanding how our core end user community best accesses or integrates new knowledge into their decision making.§        §You will be responsible for collaboratively developing the processes and systems for optimising research impact and adoption that will work with our ‘project delivery’ model. You will help build a coordinated approach to the delivery of knowledge exchange activities, creation and translation of outputs and design of monitoring and evaluation KPIs that can be integrated into CRC TiMEs projects to connect a large portfolio of projects to a clearly articulated path to impact model.§        §You will support engagement with key stakeholder groups and liaise directly with regional hubs to build meaningful local scale relationships that will enable two way knowledge exchange and connect with regional challenges and priorities.§        §To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate:§        §          §A relevant tertiary qualification, or demonstrated equivalent competency§          §Extensive management experience at an appropriate level§          §Demonstrated experience and understanding in the resource sector and the issues around mine closure§          §Extensive experience in the communication of and use of research by policy-makers, industry and the general public§          §Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to convey information and build rapport with all levels of staff within a diverse work environment§        §        §About you §        §We are seeking a Research Impact and Translation Manager that can work independently to develop and lead the impact and translation work of CRC TiME. You will possess excellent organisational and time-management skills, with a demonstrated ability to manage and respond to changing priorities and deadlines. §        §Previous experience in a similar role of working to get research adopted to a broader community is essential for this role.  Finally you must have excellent communication skills, as well as the ability to adapt to different audiences, including translating research outcomes to a wider audience§        §Full details of the position's responsibilities and the selection criteria are outlined in the position description. Please see the position description prior to applying:  §POSITION DESCRIPTION Research Impact and Translation Manager - Position Number 319097 - Level 10.pdf§        §The content of your CV should demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.§        §Closing date: Sunday 18th October 2020§        §This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia.§        §Application Details: Please apply online via the Apply Now button.§        §Our commitment to inclusion and diversity§        §UWA is committed to a diverse workforce. We celebrate inclusion and diversity and believe gender equity is fundamental to achieving our goal of being a top 50 university by 2050.§        §          §We have child friendly areas on campus, including childcare facilities. Flexible work arrangements, part-time hours and job sharing will all be considered.§          §UWA has been awarded Platinum Employer Status for being a Top Ten Employer for LGBTI Inclusion by the Australian Workplace Equity Index (AWEI -2019).§          §UWA has also been awarded Athena Swan Bronze Accreditation in 2020. §        §        §       §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Cooperative Research Centre for Transformations in Mining Economies (CRC TiME)  §§Flexible working environment to work the way that works for you§Full-time, three year fixed-term appointment§Salary range: Level 10, Grade 1: $130,120 - $135,189 p.a. + 17% superannuation§Position based in St. Georges Terrace (Perth CBD)§§The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked amongst the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of Eight research-intensive universities.  With an enviable research track record, vibrant campus and working environments, supported by the freedom to ‘innovate and inspire’ there is no better time to join Western Australia’s top University.§About the team §The Cooperative Research Centre for Transformations in Mining Economies (CRC TiME) has been formed to drive transformational change that will enable regions and communities to transition to a prosperous and sustainable post-mine future. The goals of CRC TiME are to enable: §§The delivery of sustained value to regional communities. §The creation of national and international opportunities to METS companies. §Support to governments and mining companies in achieving lease relinquishment.  §Building confidence for future resource sector investment §§CRC TiME brings together a unique partnership of over 75 leading mining companies, mining equipment, technology and services (METS) companies, regional and community development organisations, governments and research partners. CRC-TiME will be co-hosted by the University of Western Australia and the University of Queensland with offices in Perth and Brisbane. CRC TiME will deliver projects nationally, with key ‘regional hubs’ where project activity undertaken by the CRC will be focussed.§About the opportunity §As the appointee, you will act as a key bridge between the CRC end users and research community.  This position is a key linking position within our organisation, providing a clear understanding of how information and knowledge is exchanged to best position it for impact and adoption. This means understanding how our core end user community best accesses or integrates new knowledge into their decision making.§You will be responsible for collaboratively developing the processes and systems for optimising research impact and adoption that will work with our ‘project delivery’ model. You will help build a coordinated approach to the delivery of knowledge exchange activities, creation and translation of outputs and design of monitoring and evaluation KPIs that can be integrated into CRC TiMEs projects to connect a large portfolio of projects to a clearly articulated path to impact model.§You will support engagement with key stakeholder groups and liaise directly with regional hubs to build meaningful local scale relationships that will enable two way knowledge exchange and connect with regional challenges and priorities.§To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate:§§A relevant tertiary qualification, or demonstrated equivalent competency§Extensive management experience at an appropriate level§Demonstrated experience and understanding in the resource sector and the issues around mine closure§Extensive experience in the communication of and use of research by policy-makers, industry and the general public§Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to convey information and build rapport with all levels of staff within a diverse work environment§§About you §We are seeking a Research Impact and Translation Manager that can work independently to develop and lead the impact and translation work of CRC TiME. You will possess excellent organisational and time-management skills, with a demonstrated ability to manage and respond to changing priorities and deadlines. §Previous experience in a similar role of working to get research adopted to a broader community is essential for this role.  Finally you must have excellent communication skills, as well as the ability to adapt to different audiences, including translating research outcomes to a wider audience§Full details of the position's responsibilities and the selection criteria are outlined in the position description. Please see the position description prior to applying:  §POSITION DESCRIPTION Research Impact and Translation Manager - Position Number 319097 - Level 10.pdf§The content of your CV should demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.§Closing date: Sunday 18th October 2020§This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia.§Application Details: Please apply online via the Apply Now button.§Our commitment to inclusion and diversity§UWA is committed to a diverse workforce. We celebrate inclusion and diversity and believe gender equity is fundamental to achieving our goal of being a top 50 university by 2050.§§We have child friendly areas on campus, including childcare facilities. Flexible work arrangements, part-time hours and job sharing will all be considered.§UWA has been awarded Platinum Employer Status for being a Top Ten Employer for LGBTI Inclusion by the Australian Workplace Equity Index (AWEI -2019).§UWA has also been awarded Athena Swan Bronze Accreditation in 2020. §§       § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

experience developing analytical reports and the ability to liaise with and present information to diverse audiences.§          §Thorough working knowledge of Microsoft Office including Word, Excel and PowerPoint§          §Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to work with a broad range of people from a variety of backgrounds and experiences.§          §Ability to work
