jobTitle: Strategic Pricing Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50645644.txt	§Strategic Pricing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Pricing Manager§§Advertiser: §Imperial Brands Australasia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Strategic Pricing Manager §      §        §Despite COVID-19, we have a strong pipeline of job opportunities and we are still hiring. Many of our employees are now safely returning to work. We're operating with an increased focus on health and safety on-site. We're finding new ways of working in response to COVID-19 and our workforce is still delivering the best capability.§        §The purpose:§ Lead, influence and proactively drive pricing strategy to impact consumer behavior and respond to real time competitive pressures. Enable IBA to leverage competitive market edge via pricing to ensure company brands remain relevant in a price sensitive market across channels and accounts. The role is responsible for the strategic aspects of the pricing function which includes:§        §          §Driving the company’s pricing and excise Intelligence, insights across the competitive field§          §Assess and commercialise pricing and excise opportunities / risks. Develop pricing road map.  §          §Develop local pricing strategies and tactics in order to drive competitive position to meet commercial shareholder objectives.§        §        §The Role:§ Reports to the Revenue Growth Manager - Australasia, within Strategy, Brands & Insights team. The role will lead and support the implementation of strategic pricing, driving optimisation through headline and promotional price, and their link to the overall business and investment strategy; with a secondary element of the role to own certain aspects implement pricing execution. Having a good understanding of the market and category dynamics along with each brand’s customer, shopper, consumer, price, promotion and key marketing tools landscape will be the key to your success.§        §Responsibilities include:§        §Commercial insight on Pricing: §Providing the cluster with pricing expertise and commercial insights allowing for a development of relevant pricing and excise strategies, which maximise IMB competitive market advantage, across Channels & Brand formats. §        §Champion insights driven pricing strategies though incorporating relevant consumer insights research findings into the pricing thinking.§        §Analysing IBA’s competitive landscape:§ covering historical price performance learnings and real time pricing landscape. Provide comprehensive insights for company plans and relevant business review and activities.§        §Conducting strategic reviews §and “deep dive” analysis as agreed: post excise reviews. Assess impact and implications of key changes / events. Risk analysis (Price Driven) and recommend response to drive strategic growth agenda.§        §Evaluating overall price performance§ and specific activities intended to deliver and assist in development of successful excise strategies including scenario planning.§        §Developing and maintaining best practice: §processes and analysis including econometric and choice model scenario analysis. Performance indicator reporting, benchmarking and analysis.§        §Stakeholder engagement:§ Liasing with the relevant cluster I&I faction for potential impact of current and future pricing activities on volume, SOM and OP. §        §Skills & Experience§: As an ideal applicant will have:§        §          §Degree qualified in related fields: marketing, commerce, economy, mathematics.§          §Minimum of 5 years’ experience in pricing related field.§          §Experience in econometric analysis and foresights, consumer pricing studies i.e. choice models, reviewing and analysing business cases, accounting processes, budgeting, accruals, and reporting.§          §Experience interacting with business leaders functional managers.§          §Prior experience within the tobacco business will be an advantage§        §        §What’s in it for you§? A company culture that thrives on a positive team environment and the focus on every role contributing to sustainable success. The Senior Leadership Team values the opinion of its employees and takes measures to consistently ensure every voice is heard. This is a unique opportunity, perfect for a commercial individual who wants to demonstrate – and further cultivate – their  influencing and business partnering experience to become a highly regarded pricing professional§,§ committed to achievement of the overall pricing strategy.§        §Work with§: You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders from sales & marketing team and Senior Management and will be challenged, supported and guided as you continue to learn and develop during your career at IBA.§        §How do we make this happen for you§? For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of all employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. It also means providing a family friendly, flexible and supportive place to work. §        §What do we want?§ We are looking for an enthusiastic, commercially astute executive with an ability to translate reporting and analysis into actionable insights to support decision making. Well-developed communication skills, ability to draw insights from data and develop collaborative solutions and challenge the status quo. §        §The Brand:§ At Imperial Brands, we’re a truly international company driven by a strong challenger culture. We’re an inclusive, innovative and responsible FTSE30 FMCG business widely recognised on the global stage. We generate over £30bn revenue and employ over 30,000 like-minded achievers in markets worldwide. We’re driven by a common purpose: to create something better. Alongside maximising our respected brands, we’re increasingly focused on developing a leading portfolio of next generation products with lower health risks than regular tobacco products, all underpinned by leading edge science, high-quality innovation and high standards of governance. Our entrepreneurial spirit, ability to challenge the status quo and think on our feet and take ownership in an engaging and supportive environment are the keys to our success and that of the thousands of people who work here. Here You Can!§        §Next steps:§ Interested applicants should apply with their cover letter and CV highlighting their suitability for the role. Sponsorship is NOT available for this role.§        §We are an inclusive employer of choice and passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background. All successful candidates will need to undergo a pre-employment medical check and will be asked to present their working rights for Australia/ New Zealand.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Despite COVID-19, we have a strong pipeline of job opportunities and we are still hiring. Many of our employees are now safely returning to work. We're operating with an increased focus on health and safety on-site. We're finding new ways of working in response to COVID-19 and our workforce is still delivering the best capability.§ §The purpose:§ Lead, influence and proactively drive pricing strategy to impact consumer behavior and respond to real time competitive pressures. Enable IBA to leverage competitive market edge via pricing to ensure company brands remain relevant in a price sensitive market across channels and accounts. Develop pricing road map.  § §Develop local pricing strategies and tactics in order to drive competitive position to meet commercial shareholder objectives.§ §The Role:§ Reports to the Revenue Growth Manager - Australasia, within Strategy, Brands & Insights team. The role will lead and support the implementation of strategic pricing, driving optimisation through headline and promotional price, and their link to the overall business and investment strategy; with a secondary element of the role to own certain aspects implement pricing execution. Having a good understanding of the market and category dynamics along with each brand’s customer, shopper, consumer, price, promotion and key marketing tools landscape will be the key to your success.§ §Responsibilities include:§ §Commercial insight on Pricing: §Providing the cluster with pricing expertise and commercial insights allowing for a development of relevant pricing and excise strategies, which maximise IMB competitive market advantage, across Channels & Brand formats. § §Champion insights driven pricing strategies though incorporating relevant consumer insights research findings into the pricing thinking.§ §Analysing IBA’s competitive landscape:§ covering historical price performance learnings and real time pricing landscape. Provide comprehensive insights for company plans and relevant business review and activities.§ §Conducting strategic reviews §and “deep dive” analysis as agreed: post excise reviews. Assess impact and implications of key changes / events. Risk analysis (Price Driven) and recommend response to drive strategic growth agenda.§ §Evaluating overall price performance§ and specific activities intended to deliver and assist in development of successful excise strategies including scenario planning.§ §Developing and maintaining best practice: §processes and analysis including econometric and choice model scenario analysis. Performance indicator reporting, benchmarking and analysis.§ §Stakeholder engagement:§ Liasing with the relevant cluster I&I faction for potential impact of current and future pricing activities on volume, SOM and OP. § §Skills & Experience§: As an ideal applicant will have:§ § §Degree qualified in related fields: marketing, commerce, economy, mathematics.§ §Minimum of 5 years’ experience in pricing related field.§ §Experience in econometric analysis and foresights, consumer pricing studies i.e. choice models, reviewing and analysing business cases, accounting processes, budgeting, accruals, and reporting.§ §Experience interacting with business leaders functional managers.§ §Prior experience within the tobacco business will be an advantage§ §What’s in it for you§? A company culture that thrives on a positive team environment and the focus on every role contributing to sustainable success. The Senior Leadership Team values the opinion of its employees and takes measures to consistently ensure every voice is heard. This is a unique opportunity, perfect for a commercial individual who wants to demonstrate – and further cultivate – their  influencing and business partnering experience to become a highly regarded pricing professional§,§ committed to achievement of the overall pricing strategy.§ §Work with§: You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders from sales & marketing team and Senior Management and will be challenged, supported and guided as you continue to learn and develop during your career at IBA.§ §How do we make this happen for you§? For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of all employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. It also means providing a family friendly, flexible and supportive place to work. § §What do we want?§ We are looking for an enthusiastic, commercially astute executive with an ability to translate reporting and analysis into actionable insights to support decision making. Well-developed communication skills, ability to draw insights from data and develop collaborative solutions and challenge the status quo. § §The Brand:§ At Imperial Brands, we’re a truly international company driven by a strong challenger culture. jobText: TXT/50637007.txt	§Social Impact Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Impact Manager§§Advertiser: §Modibodi§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§Do you have experience leading a social impact agenda, striving to achieve a positive impact across environmental, sustainability and humanitarian issues? Read on – this is a role you will love!§ § §Australian-owned, market-leading brand, with social impact values at its core§ §Newly created role with social impact ownership and budget§ §Create a difference with passion, integrity and corporate support§ §The Company:§  §Built on world-first innovation, Modibodi is a leader in the development of functional apparel. Innovation, quality and customer service are at the heart of what we do, whilst also delivering on a strong social impact agenda across environmental, sustainability and humanitarian issues. This is your chance to work with a company that is genuinely focused on social impact – create a difference in the world we live in - be better, do better!§  § §  §The Job:§  §This is a newly created role, specifically designed and purposed with leading Modibodi's social impact programs. You will engage with all areas of product development, production, and marketing internally, as well as cultivate key relationships with external stakeholders such as BCorp, charities/NGOs, government agencies/regulators, PR consultants etc, ultimately building a social impact program and ensuring the company meets our social impact goals.§ § §Make our products in a more sustainable and responsible way§ §Make a positive impact b helping women and girls§ §Identify and pursue short and long term social impact opportunities§ §Reporting and analysis on impact to the Senior Leadership Team§ §Work with marketing to communicate our impact and progress both internally and to external customers§ §This role requires a forward thinker who is both strategic and tactical, and who is excited by the opportunity to work in a fast paced, high growth business that has social ethics and impact at its core.§  §Your skills:§  §To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:§ § §Significant experience working within or leading a NFP or corporate Social Responsibility Program and/or managing their sustainability program§ §Experience in a manufacturing environment would be highly regarded but is not essential. Those working in the Not For Profit, community services, government, NGO, charitable foundations, and corporate responsibility areas in other industries are actively encouraged to apply.§ §Strong communication skills, budget management and negotiation skills§ §Be able to connect, influence and engage at all levels, internally and externally§ §Be creative, resourceful, organized and able to work in fast-paced environment§ §You will thrive on setting and achieving humanitarian and sustainability objectives and love leading others through a journey for the greater good§ §You will be passionate about the company purpose and social impact agenda, and be excited by the opportunity to grow with the company!§ § §  §The Benefits:§ § §Australian-owned, innovative, market-leading company§ §Highly recognised brand with success and footprint in APAC, UK and US!§ §Newly created role with social impact ownership and budget§ §Create a difference with passion, integrity and corporate support§ §Creative, fun, and passionate environment§ §Flexible work arrangements § §Convenient Inner West location, with easy public transport and parking nearby§ §To Apply:§  §Please click APPLY NOW to submit your full CV. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobTitle: Responsible Gambling Project Lead Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50624112.txt	§Responsible Gambling Project Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Responsible Gambling Project Lead§§Advertiser: §sportsbet.com.au§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§The Company§Sportsbet's purpose is to bring excitement to life for its customers and we do this by overdelivering on excitement through serious fun, disrupting the status quo and living our values. From the moment you walk in the door you'll see that fun is at the heart of the way we work.  We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer with over 7000 cool, clever and curious people around the world. We’re a global player, but in Melbourne, Sydney and Darwin we’re tight knit, with 800 of us bringing excitement to life every day.§Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools we offer that go over and above industry requirements. We care about our team members and customers and everyone at Sportsbet has a role to play in bringing our commitment to Responsible Gambling to life. Check out the tools and information we provide our customers to help manage their gambling on our dedicated site at §https://responsiblegambling.sportsbet.com.au/hc/en-us§ §The Team§Our customers mean everything to us here at Sportsbet, and to meet their expectations, we need to ensure our customer experiences are bringing excitement to life!§Reporting directly to our Head of Responsible Gambling (Consists of Customer Service, Phone Betting, Customer Enablement, Payments, Security & Responsible Gambling) you will lead a team in the delivery of industry leading customer care in Responsible Gambling through early prediction and meaningful intervention.§The role§Sportsbet takes Responsible Gambling very seriously. As the Responsible Gambling Project Lead you will be responsible for the effective delivery of industry leading Responsible Gambling Initiatives across Sportsbet§Duties and Responsibilities include;§§Identify challenges to implementation and find solutions to meet project timelines§Lead the development of new evidence-based Responsible Gambling Initiatives§Work collaboratively with internal and external research teams to identify latest innovation in the prevention and early intervention of gambling harm§Work collaboratively with the Product Team within Sportsbet to develop innovative Responsible Gambling initiatives, such as provision of Responsible Gambling Tools and safe product design§Work closely with relevant teams across Sportsbet to align Responsible Gambling Initiatives and ensure cross-business expertise is capitalised on§§You§You will have a minimum undergraduate degree with experience in innovation framework and project management;§§Ability to develop and work to timelines and project plans§Pro-active problem solver attitude with flexibility to work across different units§Strong work ethic complemented by a positive, can-do attitude§Experience working collaboratively with different stakeholders§Design and strategic Thinking§Able to work in a fast-paced environment§§The Perks§We don’t expect you to do this for free, so along with your salary we will also provide you with:§§Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers §Tailored career development programs, and opportunities§25 days annual leave§Discounted Myki & gym memberships, free breakfast and loads of event, conference tickets and many more§§What’s next?§To make sure you are the best person for Sportsbet and Sportsbet is the best for you our interview process includes, online assessments, videos, behavioural and technical interviews. This ensures all types of experiences can be considered for all roles and provides you with ample time to ask any questions.§We encourage you to apply immediately as we will begin shortlisting within 1-2 weeks of advertising.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Engagement and Communications Officer Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50668246.txt	§Engagement and Communications Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Engagement and Communications Officer§§Advertiser: §National Aboriginal Community Controlled§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Company Profile§The National Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Organisation (NACCHO) is the national peak body representing 143 Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Services (ACCHOs). ACCHOs deliver comprehensive primary health care to more than half of the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples nationally. As an act of self-determination, these ACCHOs attend to all matters affecting health and wellbeing spanning transformative community empowerment through to individual health treatments and continuity of care.§NACCHO’s work is focused on supporting the work of ACCHOs and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people overall through negotiating and advocating with Governments on health care policies and programs and systems reform.  These issues range in variety from chronic disease management, preventative health strategies, telehealth, listing of Medical Benefits Scheme (MBS) to the social determinants of health. §NACCHO partners with organisations including: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RACGP), Royal College of Physicians, the Pharmacy Guild of Australia and the Pharmaceutical Society of Australia greatly contributes to significantly to enhancing health care for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.§It is a very interesting and transformative time across the health sector currently not the least being the COVID-19 pandemic.  NACCHO co-chairs the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Advisory Committee on COVID-19 with the Commonwealth Department of Health and is also a member of the Committee developing a 10-year Primary Health Care Plan.§NACCHO is also host to the Coalition of Peaks Secretariat.    The Coalition of Peaks is a representative body of around 50 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander community controlled peak organisations and members. The Coalition of Peaks came together as an act of self-determination to be formal partners with Australian governments on Closing the Gap.  The Secretariat supports the work of the Coalition of Peaks; and has been established through a grant by the Commonwealth Government.§ §About the role§This role will help to build the capacity of our member ACCHOs to understand and navigate the disability policy and service delivery environment.    §The Engagement and Communications Officer will be responsible for the development of a NDIS Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Communications Initiative (National Strategy) and will investigate, develop, coordinate, and implement national engagement and communication strategies.§The National Strategy will include the development of culturally appropriate NDIS materials for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in collaboration with NACCHOs sector support organisations, also known affiliates. These materials will be for both potential NDIS providers and potential NDIS participants to promote greater understanding of the NDIS and supports available in a culturally appropriate way.§ §Type of person NACCHO is seeking§It isn’t essential the person has experience in the health or disability sector, but they will have the skills to quickly gain the knowledge and the agility to work across issues in short time frame. If not having worked with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people they will have an understanding and awareness of their history, culture and health and other issues affecting them.§We are seeking a motivated individual with:§demonstrated experience in stakeholder engagement, including ability to build strong relationships §demonstrated ability in problem solving in a complex and evolving environment. §excellent communication and writing skills including the ability to present complex and technical information in a simple and concise manner, and tailor written material to different audiences. §demonstrated ability to prioritise work and meet deadlines while producing high quality work. §demonstrated ability to work in a diverse team environment and achieve positive results §demonstrated ability to work and priortise in an ever- changing environment§understanding of the NDIS (desirable capability). § §Qualifications: §hold tertiary qualifications in policy or related field.§ §Experience: §demonstrated experience in policy development, communications and/or program implementation (NDIS specific would be a bonus).§ §Clearances§The successful applicant will be required to undergo a Police Check and Working with Vulnerable People Clearance.§ §Enquiries§Enquires regarding this position are to be submitted via email to §Jess.Styles@naccho.org.au§ [link removed]§ §How to apply§Applicants are required to submit a resume and a detailed cover letter demonstrating their suitability to the position.   Applications are to be submitted using the “Apply” function. § §Closing date§Friday 16 October 2020, 9.00am.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50622282.txt	§Social Responsibility Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Responsibility Manager§§Advertiser: §Forever New Clothing§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Social Responsibility Manager §      §        § §        §Forever Evolving§        §Forever New is Australia's fastest growing fashion clothing and accessories brand. With more than 300 stores and a vast online presence across the globe, we have developed a strong community of fashion-lovers, designers, innovators, experts and creatives who have taken us from Melbourne to the world.§        §The Opportunity§        §As the Social Responsibility Manager, you will be responsible for implementing Forever New’s sustainability strategy and agenda. You will develop and implement activities to drive corporate and operational sustainability compliance across the business, meet relevant regulatory obligations, while managing key reporting and data requirements that monitor companywide performance. You will also drive and deliver sustainable initiatives, manage external partnerships and internal engagement, communication programs and initiatives the promote the sustainability agenda.§        §Key Responsibilities§        §          §Manage the sustainability performance by reducing resource use, promoting behavioral change and executing strategy priorities.§          §Working with key stakeholders to ensure the continued integration and accountability of sustainability§          §Conduct on going reviews and analysis with suppliers and ensure social compliance§          §Research and propose on going efficiencies across greenhouse gas emissions energy, water waste, gas, fuel and paper to reduce environmental impacts and maximise economic efficiencies§          §Productively execute sustainability education and behavioral change initiatives targeted at internal and external stakeholders§          §Undertake auditing, lifecycle analysis and environmental reporting requirements§          §Identify and manage business actions that address industry environmental and sustainability threats and opportunities§          §Develop robust governance framework and reporting indicators that measure compliance§          §Facilitate training and engagement activities to achieve widespread understanding and increase capability to deliver positive environmental outcomes§        §        §Key Experience§        §          §Tertiary qualifications in an Environment/Sustainability discipline§          §3+ years’ experience in leading, promoting, developing and implementing sustainability strategies§          §Knowledge of current sustainability trends within the Retail industry§          §Well-developed influencing and organisational skills§          §Demonstrated leadership, collaboration and creative thinking skills§          §Excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills§        §        §Company Culture & Benefits§        §Here at Forever New, our people are at the heart of everything we do. Forever New HQ is a fast-paced retail environment rapidly expanding across the globe. By the same token, we're all about a healthy, flexible work-life balance. That's why, as part of the Forever New family, you'll enjoy plenty of exciting rewards and benefits.§        §The perks:§        §          §Generous 40% employee discount and periodic family and friends’ discounts  §          §Loyalty and birthday leave§          §Monthly afternoon tea with an early finish Friday§          §Wellbeing and environmental incentives§          §Learning and development programs§          §Recognition program and service awards§          §Subsidized car parking§          §Thriving head office located in Richmond§          §Exposure to a global business based across 5 continents§          §Recruitment referral incentives§        §        §Whether we’re designing our latest fashion collection, expanding into a new international market, or providing expert styling advice to our loyal customers, these are a few of the rules we live by:§        §          §Think Customer§          §Respect for all§          §Keep it Simple§          §Take Responsibility§          §Act with Pace§        §        §Apply now to join our talented team.§        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§ §Forever Evolving§ §Forever New is Australia's fastest growing fashion clothing and accessories brand. With more than 300 stores and a vast online presence across the globe, we have developed a strong community of fashion-lovers, designers, innovators, experts and creatives who have taken us from Melbourne to the world.§ §The Opportunity§ §As the Social Responsibility Manager, you will be responsible for implementing Forever New’s sustainability strategy and agenda. You will develop and implement activities to drive corporate and operational sustainability compliance across the business, meet relevant regulatory obligations, while managing key reporting and data requirements that monitor companywide performance. You will also drive and deliver sustainable initiatives, manage external partnerships and internal engagement, communication programs and initiatives the promote the sustainability agenda.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Manage the sustainability performance by reducing resource use, promoting behavioral change and executing strategy priorities.§ §Working with key stakeholders to ensure the continued integration and accountability of sustainability§ §Conduct on going reviews and analysis with suppliers and ensure social compliance§ §Research and propose on going efficiencies across greenhouse gas emissions energy, water waste, gas, fuel and paper to reduce environmental impacts and maximise economic efficiencies§ §Productively execute sustainability education and behavioral change initiatives targeted at internal and external stakeholders§ §Undertake auditing, lifecycle analysis and environmental reporting requirements§ §Identify and manage business actions that address industry environmental and sustainability threats and opportunities§ §Develop robust governance framework and reporting indicators that measure compliance§ §Facilitate training and engagement activities to achieve widespread understanding and increase capability to deliver positive environmental outcomes§ §Key Experience§ § §Tertiary qualifications in an Environment/Sustainability discipline§ §3+ years’ experience in leading, promoting, developing and implementing sustainability strategies§ §Knowledge of current sustainability trends within the Retail industry§ §Well-developed influencing and organisational skills§ §Demonstrated leadership, collaboration and creative thinking skills§ §Excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills§ §Company Culture & Benefits§ §Here at Forever New, our people are at the heart of everything we do. Forever New HQ is a fast-paced retail environment rapidly expanding across the globe. By the same token, we're all about a healthy, flexible work-life balance. jobTitle: Management Consultant - Property/Construction/Infrastructure Sector Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50657318.txt	§Management Consultant - Property/Construction/Infrastructure Sector§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Management Consultant - Property/Construction/Infrastructure Sector§§Advertiser: §Blenheim Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Blenheim Partners is an international Executive Search and Board Advisory Firm. As a professional services company we are specialist advisors to many of the world's leading corporations. As a result of company growth and market investment we have an opportunity for a motivated and experienced Management Consultant to join our Property/Construction/Infrastructure Sector Practice.§ §Reporting to the Managing Partner, the potential candidate will have a track record as a Management Consultant delivering transformation programmes to leading Property/Construction/Infrastructure organisations in Australia. This opportunity will appeal to those with a background as a Management Consultant in the Property/Construction/Infrastructure Sector with a previous track record as an executive in the broader sector. As a business consultant you will be accustomed to delivering on-time and on-budget consulting projects and will have experience of developing strategy and implementing change agendas, creating value and maximising growth that delivers sustainable and tangible results in the complex sectors. § §It is anticipated the successful candidate will have over 5 years’ experience working in the Property/Construction/ Infrastructure Sector or as a management/business consultant covering the market with exposure and knowledge across the broad remit of the Property/Construction/Infrastructure market that may include Property, Real estate, Infrastructure, Construction, Engineering and Support Services. You will ideally have relevant international sector/consulting experience and a demonstrable track record of developing client relationships that have converted to sustainable revenue generation. § §The successful candidate will be results oriented, customer focused, delivering on-time and on-budget projects to deliver enhanced efficiencies to our clients and be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. You will be a problem solver, able to understand organisational structures with high intellect and ambiguity tolerance, possessing strategic and commercial acumen. You will have the ability to engage and partner with senior level decision makers and bring a commitment to excellence, belief in team values and esprit de corps. § §Responsibilities include:§Playing a representative role as a trusted advisor and partner within the Property/Construction/Infrastructure sector;§Developing strong client relationships and ensuring presentation of business cases with strategic advice are of utmost quality and reassurance;  §Analysing and evaluating client objectives and Management structures to achieve optimal commercial outcomes; §Presenting alterative ideas to clients to stimulate review of current organisational decision making processes to enhance efficiency and transformational goals;§Developing project plans with key deliverables that aim to provide efficiencies and support to corporate and growth agendas of our clients;§Managing client deliverables and expectations, including drafting client proposals and overseeing the end to end execution of the engagement deliverables; and,§Preparing written reports relating to business development opportunities based on previous successful outcomes. § §It is anticipated you will possess an appropriate tertiary qualification with a degree in business, economics, engineering, science, construction or a related field. Postgraduate business qualification would be highly regarded.§ §For further information please email your enquiries to (§employment@blenheimpartners.com§ [link removed])§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657132.txt	§GHD Digital - Robotic Process Automation Solutions Lead - Perth§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§GHD Digital - Robotic Process Automation Solutions Lead - Perth§§Advertiser: §GHD Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §GHD Digital - Robotic Process Automation Solutions Lead - Perth §      §        § § §GHD Digital is rapidly growing and we are looking for a talented solution lead who can drive analysis, solutioning and product development in, and around our fast growing Intelligent Automation (IA) practice, whilst also growing the business in Western Australia. We are looking for experienced consultants with strong communication skills and drive; who will thrive in a supportive, agile and a consultative environment.§        §As an RPA Solutions Lead, you will work on multiple client engagements and with different internal and external stakeholders. Working within GHD Digital's Intelligent Automation practice, you shall liaise closely with GHD Digital's clients, internal project team(s), local and offshore development teams, Robotic Process Automation tool providers, and any third-part tool providers to help deliver robust Intelligent Automation solutions.§        §In order to be successful in this role, you must be experienced in implementing, operating or maintaining robots, writing algorithms or programming code, identifying and designing appropriate automation workflows, scoping and managing Robotic Process Automation (RPA) projects. You should have implemented the full life cycle of RPA / IA projects and have had demonstrated experience of managing associated risks and realising benefits. §        §Responsibilities Include:§        §          §Acting as the Western Australia lead, grow the Intelligent Automation business within the region§          §Perform detailed business process assessments for Automation suitability, and prepare business cases for senior management approval (including cost-benefit analysis, ROI calculations, and associated documentation)§          §Coordinate global project teams for execution of projects, whilst ensuring all projects get delivered on-time, within scope and budget§          §Understand business and technical requirements to effectively coordinate process definition, detailed documentation, solution design, user acceptance testing (UAT), and deployment activities§          §Design, document, develop and execute test automation plans from business requirements. Develop solution documentation to support solution transition for application maintenance§          §Develop / Manage Intelligent Automation Products or Service lines, through combining strong Business Process Analysis skills with the advanced AI technology skills available in the organisation§          §Develop content and facilitate training workshops on process automation. Serve as a subject matter expert to others seeking to utilise RPA technologies to automate and streamline existing manual business processes§        §        §What you will bring to the team:§        §          §Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline (MBA preferred)§          §Process Mapping Standards Certification for e.g. BPMN 2.0 (or deep practical experience in Automation process mapping) §          §3+ years’ consulting experience §          §Strong project management experience (preferably for Automation projects)§          §Strong understanding of RPA technologies, solutions and underlying IT services§        §        §Highly regarded:§        §          §Strong client / business consulting and strategic review skills §          §Problem-solving and strategic planning ability§          §Experience of working in the asset intensive sectors§          §Strong communication and stakeholder management skills §          §Team player along with leadership skills §          §Self-driven and results orientated §        §        §Our commitment to you§        §Fostering gender balance, diversity and acceptance of flexible working is central to the way GHD digital does business. We offer a professional, friendly and inclusive culture based on our core values of Safety, Teamwork, Respect and Integrity. §        § In addition to a competitive salary, GHD digital provides attractive career options including professional development via our GHD Business School, additional leave, and family-friendly flexible work arrangements. §        §Why GHD digital? § Why waste a single day doing work that isn’t an investment in your future? At GHD digital, you will join a team of passionate individuals, many of them leaders in their field, who are also the owners of our business. This ownership is what sets us apart. §        § It means our people enjoy an unrivalled amount of autonomy in their roles. It is also what drives our commitment and accountability in how we serve our clients, deliver projects, and pursue new opportunities. §        § If this is the kind of investment you would like to make with your talent, join us, and take control of your career and your future. §        §About GHD digital §GHD digital builds on the GHD network of more than 10,000 people, to help companies across the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation unlock the potential of digital technologies to generate value for their businesses. §        § Addressing the challenges of the fourth industrial revolution, GHD digital delivers a suite of professional services including digital strategy and transformation, smart technology solutions, digital innovation, cybersecurity and digital risk, and data and analytics. Our strong purpose, positive environment, CEO and Executive leadership team lead our commitment to supporting our membership, staff and values of Equity, Respect, Integrity, and Collaboration.§        §The Position§        §As a Policy Officer, your work in advocacy and policy development will make a real difference to health system reform, with a core purpose of addressing systematic challenges within Emergency Medicine and influencing healthcare outcomes for vulnerable and diverse populations within Australia and New Zealand.§        §Working closely with passionate Doctors and the Policy team, your contribution will ensure that our Fellows and Trainees have the resources to practice safe and high-quality care whilst improving patient outcomes. Some key focuses of the department involve implementing and coordinating advocacy campaigns or policy relating to wait times in emergency departments, mental health and addiction, public health and disaster medicine, and Indigenous health.§        §Please note this is a §full-time§ and §permanent§ §position§.§        §Our ideal candidate will have:§        §          §Tertiary qualifications in public health, public policy, international development or a related discipline§          §Strong conceptual and analytical skills to identify problems and solutions in a range of policy and advocacy environments§          §Knowledge of policy, legislative or political processes as they relate to the health sector§          §Well-developed engagement and consultation skills including the ability to identify and liaise with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders§        §        §ACEM is an Equal Opportunity Employer who promotes, embraces and values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. For further information on the position please contact Georgie O'Connor (HR Officer) on phone §(03) 8679 8811§.§        §You must have the right to work in Australia to apply for this role.§        §To apply, please submit a cover letter (addressing 4-5 points from the key skills, qualifications and attributes selection criteria) and a resume to be considered.§        §Recruitment agencies, we appreciate your interest, but plan to fill this role ourselves.§        §Applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality and will be reviewed upon receipt.§      §      §      §    §    §    §acem.org.au§  §§§The Australasian College for Emergency Medicine (ACEM) is the not-for-profit peak body responsible for advancing the professional standards and quality of care in Emergency Medicine within Australia and New Zealand.§ §We are a specialist medical College of over 100 employees. Our strong purpose, positive environment, CEO and Executive leadership team lead our commitment to supporting our membership, staff and values of Equity, Respect, Integrity, and Collaboration.§ §The Position§ §As a Policy Officer, your work in advocacy and policy development will make a real difference to health system reform, with a core purpose of addressing systematic challenges within Emergency Medicine and influencing healthcare outcomes for vulnerable and diverse populations within Australia and New Zealand.§ §Working closely with passionate Doctors and the Policy team, your contribution will ensure that our Fellows and Trainees have the resources to practice safe and high-quality care whilst improving patient outcomes. Some key focuses of the department involve implementing and coordinating advocacy campaigns or policy relating to wait times in emergency departments, mental health and addiction, public health and disaster medicine, and Indigenous health.§ §Please note this is a §full-time§ and §permanent§ §position§.§ §Our ideal candidate will have:§ § §Tertiary qualifications in public health, public policy, international development or a related discipline§ §Strong conceptual and analytical skills to identify problems and solutions in a range of policy and advocacy environments§ §Knowledge of policy, legislative or political processes as they relate to the health sector§ §Well-developed engagement and consultation skills including the ability to identify and liaise with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders§ §ACEM is an Equal Opportunity Employer who promotes, embraces and values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and Māori are encouraged to apply.§ §The Benefits§ §ACEM offers excellent staff benefits including:§ § §Additional paid leave at Christmas§ §Flexible work arrangements including options of RDOs and purchased leave§ §Regular social activities and casual Fridays§ §Health and wellbeing initiatives§ §Ongoing Staff development and training§ §To Apply§ §For a full Position Description, please visit our website www.acem.org.au --> Work with us -- > Opportunities at ACEM. For further information on the position please contact Georgie O'Connor (HR Officer) on phone §(03) 8679 8811§.§ §You must have the right to work in Australia to apply for this role.§ §To apply, please submit a cover letter (addressing 4-5 points from the key skills, qualifications and attributes selection criteria) and a resume to be considered.§ §Recruitment agencies, we appreciate your interest, but plan to fill this role ourselves.§ §Applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality and will be reviewed upon receipt.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684698.txt	§Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Analysts and Analysts - Financial Regulator Assessment Authority§§Advertiser: §Department of the Treasury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$88,084 - $131,799§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§The Financial Regulator Assessment Authority (FRAA) is a new statutory body that is being created in response to the recommendations of the Royal Commission into Misconduct in the Banking, Superannuation and Financial Services Industry.§Its role will be to conduct regular assessments of the effectiveness of the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) and the Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority (APRA), as well as capability reviews and reviews of matters related to the effectiveness of ASIC and APRA.§The FRAA will be made up of four members, including the Chair and the Secretary of the Treasury. The FRAA Secretariat will carry out the assessments under the guidance of the FRAA, as well as assisting the FRAA with the performance of its duties more generally.§Members of the Secretariat will be ongoing Treasury employees.§Successful applicants will have the opportunity to join the FRAA Secretariat on day one, and shape the organisation through its start-up phase. Staff will be required to apply fresh strategic thinking in order to develop frameworks for assessing the effectiveness of the financial regulators.§FRAA staff will engage directly with FRAA panel members and the Treasury Secretary, and with senior representatives from ASIC and APRA. The work of the FRAA will guide and influence the direction of financial regulation in Australia.§Between them, the staff of the FRAA Secretariat will have quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, financial literacy, knowledge of legal and regulatory frameworks in Australia, and understanding of corporate governance practices. In addition to the capabilities demonstrated by individual candidates, the selection process will consider the balance of skills available in the Secretariat as a whole.§The ability to work collaboratively and develop productive working relationships will be a key selection criteria.§Senior Analysts (Executive Level 1)§There are two EL1 Senior Analyst positions in the FRAA Secretariat. Each of these will focus on one of ASIC or APRA, and assist on projects in relation to the other.§Working in teams, and under the guidance of an EL2 Manager, Senior Analysts will:§ § §Conduct analysis required to support FRAA assessments;§ §Develop advice to the FRAA and the leadership of the FRAA Secretariat;§ §Engage with external stakeholders to gather relevant information;§ §Draft assessments and other written communications from the FRAA;§ §Contribute to the development of the strategic direction of the FRAA;§ §Plan and lead assessment projects under the guidance of an EL2 Manager; and§ §Assist with and lead other tasks as required.§ §EL1s are expected to perform the above roles more independently and with limited supervision by the EL2 Manager of the Secretariat. EL1s may also take on a ‘Team Leader’ role, may have responsibility for staff development, and may lead individual projects under the supervision of an EL2 Manager. §Analysts (APS 6)§There are two Analyst positions in the FRAA Secretariat. Each of these will focus on one of ASIC or APRA, and assist on projects in relation to the other. Analysts will:§• Conduct analysis required to support FRAA assessments;§• Develop advice to the FRAA and the leadership of the FRAA Secretariat;§• Engage with external stakeholders to gather relevant information;§• Draft assessments and other written communications from the FRAA;§• Contribute to the development of the strategic direction of the FRAA; and§• Assist with other tasks as required.§APS 6 Analysts will be expected to work with a high degree of autonomy, but under the supervision and guidance of EL1 Senior Analysts and the EL2 Manager of the Secretariat.§§§§

jobTitle: Property Economics & Research - Student Internship Program 2021 Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50610205.txt	§Property Economics & Research - Student Internship Program 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Economics & Research - Student Internship Program 2021§§Advertiser: §Urbis Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§Kickstart your career in a multidisciplinary professional services firm§Collaborate with market leaders and industry experts§Casual opportunities offering 2-4 days per week, commencing in February 2021§Urbis is a market-leading firm that shapes the cities and communities of Australia for a better future. Drawing together a network of the brightest minds, Urbis consists of practice experts, working collaboratively to deliver fresh thinking and independent advice and guidance. Working across the areas of planning, design, policy, heritage, valuations, transactions, economics and research, the expert team at Urbis connect their clients in the public and private sectors to a better outcome, every time.§National Student Internship Program 2021§Our National Student Internship Program offers exclusive opportunities for the brightest students to gain invaluable experience and broad exposure to our business and related industries. As part of our program, you will learn from mentors, work with our clients, access our learning resources and have exposure to fantastic networking opportunities.§Our annual program will run from February to December 2021 and will enable you to graduate with the distinct advantage of industry experience over your peers. Our student roles offer flexibility in the form of 2-4 days per week, to complement your studies.§What about this opportunity?§Our Property Economics & Research team has an opening for a student in the Melbourne office, on a paid casual basis. Our PER team work across the spectrum of property sectors with a long history in retail, residential, mixed-use and commercial property advice. Our advice is sought out in every stage of a project from acquisition, master planning, development and expansion right through to marketing and ongoing performance management and disposal. §As an Assistant Research Analyst you can expect to be involved in:§Responding to internal and external client requests and escalating to senior staff where necessary;§Research, modelling, analysis and database creation and maintenance§Undertaking audits, site visits and interviews/surveys§Presenting research findings and industry trends/issues internally§Developing an in-depth knowledge of sites and projects§About You§You will be an undergraduate or post-graduate student undertaking studies in a relevant field, who is passionate about city shaping, has great communication skills and an interest in working in a professional services / consulting environment. Successful candidates will have a strong academic record and possess a combination of the following technical skills and attributes:§Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritise§Strong analytical skills to interpret research data §Ability to adopt a logical approach to problem solving and make objective and informed recommendations to assist the team§Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and through written communication §The Application Process§If you’re interest in joining our Student Internship Program, click on ‘Apply’ and submit your application. For your application to be considered, we require your CV, a copy of your most recent academic transcripts and a cover letter (one page maximum) addressing the following questions:§Why do you want to be a cityshaper at Urbis?§What has motivated you to pursue a career in your selected discipline?§Which Urbis project (past or present) would you like to be part of, and why? §Note: your chosen project should be relevant to the practice area/discipline you are applying for.§Applicants for our National Design team (Landscape Architecture and Urban Design based roles) are also required to submit a portfolio with their application. For other roles, this is optional.§Applications close at 11:00pm on Sunday 11 October 2020. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted, with interviews expected to be in mid/late October 2020.§Urbis is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive, supports flexibility, and welcomes diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. To find out more about us visit our website at https://urbis.com.au/.§Eligibility§You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident and studying throughout the duration of the internship to be eligible for the program. Preference will be given to those in their final or second last year of their degree, but we encourage applications from those earlier in their degrees also.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50676539.txt	§Senior Advisor, Cabinet§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor, Cabinet§§Advertiser: §Department of Premier And Cabinet§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Salary Range: $110,745 - $122,038§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Advisor, Cabinet §      §        §          §Do you have strong knowledge and understanding of the Westminster system of government, Cabinet systems and machinery of government§          §            §Are you interested in a fast paced and dynamic role at the centre of Government?§          §          §            §A temporary roles available until 30 June 2021 with the possibility of extension or ongoing conversion§          §        §        § §About the role§§        §We are currently inviting applications for a temporary Senior Advisor, Cabinet (Clerk Grade 9/10) role within the Cabinet & Governance Branch at the NSW Department of Premier & Cabinet.§ §        §The §Senior Advisor, Cabinet§, leads assigned areas of Cabinet and Committee operations, policy and project work and provides support to the Associate Director, Cabinet, and the broader work team. The Senior Advisor, Cabinet, ensures high-quality support and sound advice is provided to internal and external stakeholders, and effective coordination of consultation and management of stakeholders across the department, cluster and government sector. §        § Want to know more? Please refer to the §Role Description.§        §We are looking for an individual who has:§        §        §          §            §Well-developed organisation skills and a demonstrated ability to work in a high pressure, high volume environment with tight deadlines.§          §          §            §Strong understanding of NSW Government, Cabinet Systems and machinery of government processes. §          §          §            §Superior customer service skills working with a diverse set of senior stakeholders§          §          §            §Experience as a senior team member, working in a diverse and dynamic team §          §          §            §Appropriate tertiary qualifications or equivalent, relevant professional experience and training.§          §        §        §        §About the team §§        §The Cabinet team delivers policy coordination and support services for the Premier and Cabinet Ministers in relation to Cabinet and its committees. The Team:§        §        §          §            §coordinates policy advice across the department and cluster in relation to Cabinet submissions, §          §          §            §advises on Cabinet practice, including on strategic and operational matters relating to Cabinet and its committees,§          §          §            §provides technical, secretariat and logistical services to support the Cabinet and Committees system, §          §          §            §manages access to, distribution and storage of Official Cabinet records, including maintaining custodianship of records of both current and previous governments.§          §        §        §  §Interested in applying? §        §Applicants are required to submit an online application. This must include:§        §        §          §            §an up-to-date resume which clearly details your relevant skills and experience (maximum 5 pages) §          §          §Answers to the targeted questions: §        §        §        §Please note you will be required to respond to the targeted question as part of the application process once you click §Apply Online.§ §        §        §        §          §            §In 200 words or less, describe what appeals to you most about working for the Cabinet team within the Department of Premier and Cabinet?  §          §          §            §In 200 words or less, provide an example of where you have led a stream of work such as a program or project involving a complex set of stakeholders and met critical deadlines?§          §          §            §2020 has brought many challenges, in 200 words or less, what professional practices have you adopted or implemented in your past roles in response to these challenges?§          §          §            §In 250 words or less, why is upholding Cabinet Conventions important?§          §        §        §  §        §Please note: To be eligible to apply for this role, applicants must have existing Australian work rights.  §        §        §The selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role. The successful applicant will be required to undertake pre-employment checks.§        §        §The successful applicant will be required to undertake pre-employment checks. Successful applicants may also be required to obtain and maintain a §National Security Clearance§.§        §        §A recruitment pool may be created from this recruitment action for ongoing and temporary roles for this role or similar roles that may become available over the next 18 months.§  §Closing date: Wednesday 14 October 2020 (11:59PM)§§        §Salary:§ Clerk Grade 9/10. Package includes base salary ($110,745 - $122,038) plus superannuation and leave loading.§  §Further Information§        §For enquiries regarding this role, please contact the DPC Cabinet team on §(02) 9228 4667§ and leave a message requesting a call back in relation to this position.§        §        §For information on applying for a role in the NSW Public Service, §visit this link.§        §If you run into any technical difficulties with your online application, contact I Work for NSW Support at §support@iworkfor.nsw.gov.au§ or §1800 562 679§.§  §About the Department of Premier and Cabinet (DPC) §        §To learn more, please visit our website: §http://www.dpc.nsw.gov.au/about/about_the_department§ §  §Why work for DPC?§        §DPC believes all roles flex – working flexibly on an “if not, why not” basis. We are committed to fostering a culture of inclusion, providing employees challenging and rewarding work, opportunities for career progression, and learning and development. We offer our employee discount gym membership, study assistance, salary packaging, and are conveniently located near Martin Place station.  §  §Our Commitment §        §We welcome and encourage applications from diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTI+, people with disability, people with caring responsibilities, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, veterans and women. §        §        §Candidates can request a reasonable adjustment throughout each step of the recruitment process. If you require a reasonable adjustment to the recruitment process, please note this in your application. §        §        §We endeavour to make all our roles flexible. jobText: TXT/50596201.txt	§Tender & Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tender & Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §Clinton Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Leading Salary Package. Ongoing training.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Tender & Business Analyst§    §    §      §        §Due to an internal promotion a career opening has arisen for a Tender and Business Analyst to join an Australian wide service-based organisation in Sydney where you will report to a National Commercial Manager. §        §The rewards are plentiful with this organisation but be warned the environment is extremely challenging.  The first two years will be like a crash course in intense business management, you will be learning on the job, continually absorbing information while developing and perfecting new skills. The aim initially is to hone your abilities to a point where you can manage your own portfolio of work. Those who excel and want to be continually challenged can expect to move from the tender and business analyst team in a couple of years to a leadership role elsewhere in the business. §        §To be successful in this organisation you need to be driven, energetic, analytical, and able to operate in a fast-paced environment. You must have an extremely high degree of numerical ability, be able to evaluate tender requirements, complete tender submissions and have a sharp memory that can absorb rates, awards and production / productivity rates for use in tender and pricing responses. The focus is not just on pricing and being competitive it is about business strategy, thinking creatively about how to add value and truly work in partnership with clients. §        §In addition to being organised, able to work at a considerable pace while paying special attention to detail you must also be confident to liaise directly with clients, contractors, and suppliers. You need to have an entrepreneurial sharpness allowing you to nurture effective client relationships with internal and external stakeholders across Asset Ownership and Management organisations while  finding a commercial edge in your negotiations. §        §Following an intensive six-twelve-month introductory period, a new team member would be expected to confidently lead a sales pitch and demonstrate a sound knowledge of tender requirements and tender submissions. §        §Previous experience of managing commercial tenders is advantageous but not essential. Applicants who have worked in the construction industry as a Contract Administrator, Estimator or Tender / Submission Coordinator are encouraged to apply. Perhaps you commenced a career in an accounting or finance related industry and have a sharp commercial acumen but are seeking an alternative working environment. This role is best suited to someone who has had at least one- or two-years full time work experience post-graduation in the business world.  §        §To apply for this unique opportunity please submit your resume and a concise introduction letter that explains why you believe this role is the right career move for you. §        §Please forward your resume and cover letter to §        §E: §louise@clintonrecruitment.com.au§        §M: §0412 322 424§        §Clinton Recruitment is the preferred recruitment agency for the Master Builders Association of New South Wales.§ §Clinton Recruitment – constructing relationships that last! § §      §      §For more information about this career role please contact§ Louise Clinton § T: §02 9664 8653§ W: www.clintonrecruitment.com.au§ Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below. §    §    §  §§§Due to an internal promotion a career opening has arisen for a Tender and Business Analyst to join an Australian wide service-based organisation in Sydney where you will report to a National Commercial Manager. § §The rewards are plentiful with this organisation but be warned the environment is extremely challenging.  The first two years will be like a crash course in intense business management, you will be learning on the job, continually absorbing information while developing and perfecting new skills. The aim initially is to hone your abilities to a point where you can manage your own portfolio of work. Those who excel and want to be continually challenged can expect to move from the tender and business analyst team in a couple of years to a leadership role elsewhere in the business. § §To be successful in this organisation you need to be driven, energetic, analytical, and able to operate in a fast-paced environment. You must have an extremely high degree of numerical ability, be able to evaluate tender requirements, complete tender submissions and have a sharp memory that can absorb rates, awards and production / productivity rates for use in tender and pricing responses. The focus is not just on pricing and being competitive it is about business strategy, thinking creatively about how to add value and truly work in partnership with clients. § §In addition to being organised, able to work at a considerable pace while paying special attention to detail you must also be confident to liaise directly with clients, contractors, and suppliers. You need to have an entrepreneurial sharpness allowing you to nurture effective client relationships with internal and external stakeholders across Asset Ownership and Management organisations while  finding a commercial edge in your negotiations. § §Following an intensive six-twelve-month introductory period, a new team member would be expected to confidently lead a sales pitch and demonstrate a sound knowledge of tender requirements and tender submissions. § §Previous experience of managing commercial tenders is advantageous but not essential. Applicants who have worked in the construction industry as a Contract Administrator, Estimator or Tender / Submission Coordinator are encouraged to apply. Perhaps you commenced a career in an accounting or finance related industry and have a sharp commercial acumen but are seeking an alternative working environment. This role is best suited to someone who has had at least one- or two-years full time work experience post-graduation in the business world.  § §To apply for this unique opportunity please submit your resume and a concise introduction letter that explains why you believe this role is the right career move for you. § §Please forward your resume and cover letter to § §E: §louise@clintonrecruitment.com.au§ §M: §0412 322 424§ §Clinton Recruitment is the preferred recruitment agency for the Master Builders Association of New South Wales.§ §Clinton Recruitment – constructing relationships that last! § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50576119.txt	§Change Management Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Management Consultant§§Advertiser: §ITbility§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§ §Change Management Consultant § §Canberra§ §12 Months contract § § § §My Client is looking for a §Change Management Consultant §to join their team in §Canberra§. If you're interested and looking for your next role please email your resume to §anil.more@itbility.com.au§ § § §Required Skills:§ § § § §Stakeholder management§ Identifying and manage all stakeholder critical to the implementation success including:• Conducting stakeholder analysis;• Preparing stakeholder impact analysis§ §Change and transition management Design§ and develop a fit for purpose change management and communications strategy to: • Support affected stakeholders to adopt the new arrangements and;• Engage with new capabilities§ §Training and education §• Assist in the design and development of training materials; and • Assist in the delivery of training to stakeholders§ §Communications §• Assist in the design and development of communication events and promotional materials to support effective sector engagement and change management§ §Other§- In addition, the Services will include:• attending meetings and being available for consultation as required;• following the department’s program protocols for communication with stakeholders, format of documents, clearance processes, consultation, timeframes and security arrangements;• engagement with the relevant Senior Executive such as Deputy Secretaries, First Assistant Secretaries and Assistant Secretaries, teams and external stakeholders as required; • working with other contractors and consultants employed by the department;
