jobTitle: Principal and Senior Consultants Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50611459.txt	§Principal and Senior Consultants§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal and Senior Consultants§§Advertiser: §Callida Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$110,000 - $149,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Principal and Senior Consultants §        §          §Business Process Improvement & Automation §          §Principal Consultant & Senior Consultant positions available now§          § §          §Callida is a values-based consulting firm located in Canberra, that provides high quality professional services to public sector clients. Our focus is to provide professional, pragmatic, and practical consulting services.§          §We are looking for experienced, authentic and outcome focussed consultants to join our high performing team. We pride ourselves on a culture of genuine, talented, motivated and passionate professionals. Our people are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel supported and comfortable to be themselves.§From day one at our firm, you’ll be considered part of the team and our framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every way possible. At Callida, we recognise the importance of balance and embrace flexibility, understanding that this means different things to every one of our employees.§          §We have achieved significant growth over recent years and secured a large range of new and exciting technology and business transformation projects. This has created opportunities within our Business Process Improvement & Automation team at the Principal Consultant and Senior Consultant levels. Working as part of a team, you will be leading, learning, sharing professional experience and advice to deliver the needs of our clients as a cohesive unit. §About the role§          §            §Work directly with high profile public sector clients to find practical and cost effective solutions to their most important and challenging business issues.§            §Day to day management of stakeholder relationships.§            §Lead role in the overall scoping, requirement gathering, delivery and deployment on a variety of projects.§            §Responsibility for project outcomes and the ability to meet project timelines.§            §Analysis of policy, process, technology and data to formulate evidence-based recommendations and strategic advice.§            §Required to communicate complex and technical concepts in clear and concise ways.§          §          §About you§          §The ideal candidate will have the following:§          §            §Business Analyst skills.§            §Project management skills.§            §Experience in broad range of technology and applications, including SAP, Microsoft Dynamics and Technology One.§            §Experience with Python and R open source programming languages an advantage.§            §Sound understanding of cloud computing, data analytics and visualisation methods.§            §Sound understanding of automation technologies, including robotic process automation and machine learning concepts.§            §Experience working with government departments across a range of agencies.§            §Ability to communicate with influence to a variety of audiences.§            §Ability to manage multiple deliverables simultaneously, and able to handle ambiguity.§            §Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.§            §Strong interpersonal and communication skills.§            §Ability to work effectively within a diverse team environment.§            §Time management skills - prioritisation of work without supervision.§            §Minimum of baseline security clearance is highly desirable.§          §          §Next Steps§          §Joining us means that you will be part of an agile and flexible working environment that offers personal development and promotion opportunities. You will have access to a range of market leading employee benefits, while being part of a growing business that celebrates success like no other.§          §If this sounds like you, and you feel working at Callida aligns with your values, experience and career goals, we want to hear from you.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Business Process Improvement & Automation §  §Principal Consultant & Senior Consultant positions available now§  § §  §Callida is a values-based consulting firm located in Canberra, that provides high quality professional services to public sector clients. Our focus is to provide professional, pragmatic, and practical consulting services.§  §We are looking for experienced, authentic and outcome focussed consultants to join our high performing team. We pride ourselves on a culture of genuine, talented, motivated and passionate professionals. Our people are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel supported and comfortable to be themselves.§From day one at our firm, you’ll be considered part of the team and our framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every way possible. At Callida, we recognise the importance of balance and embrace flexibility, understanding that this means different things to every one of our employees.§  §We have achieved significant growth over recent years and secured a large range of new and exciting technology and business transformation projects. This has created opportunities within our Business Process Improvement & Automation team at the Principal Consultant and Senior Consultant levels. Working as part of a team, you will be leading, learning, sharing professional experience and advice to deliver the needs of our clients as a cohesive unit. §About the role§ § §Work directly with high profile public sector clients to find practical and cost effective solutions to their most important and challenging business issues.§ §Day to day management of stakeholder relationships.§ §Lead role in the overall scoping, requirement gathering, delivery and deployment on a variety of projects.§ §Responsibility for project outcomes and the ability to meet project timelines.§ §Analysis of policy, process, technology and data to formulate evidence-based recommendations and strategic advice.§ §Required to communicate complex and technical concepts in clear and concise ways.§ §About you§  §The ideal candidate will have the following:§ § §Business Analyst skills.§ §Project management skills.§ §Experience in broad range of technology and applications, including SAP, Microsoft Dynamics and Technology One.§ §Experience with Python and R open source programming languages an advantage.§ §Sound understanding of cloud computing, data analytics and visualisation methods.§ §Sound understanding of automation technologies, including robotic process automation and machine learning concepts.§ §Experience working with government departments across a range of agencies.§ §Ability to communicate with influence to a variety of audiences.§ §Ability to manage multiple deliverables simultaneously, and able to handle ambiguity.§ §Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.§ §Strong interpersonal and communication skills.§ §Ability to work effectively within a diverse team environment.§ §Time management skills - prioritisation of work without supervision.§ §Minimum of baseline security clearance is highly desirable.§ §Next Steps§  §Joining us means that you will be part of an agile and flexible working environment that offers personal development and promotion opportunities. You will have access to a range of market leading employee benefits, while being part of a growing business that celebrates success like no other.§  §If this sounds like you, and you feel working at Callida aligns with your values, experience and career goals, we want to hear from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

border-style: solid; }§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§.job-template__wrapper [bordercolor="#000000"] { border-color: #000000; }§§  §    §      §        §          §            §              §                §                  §                    §                      §                        § §                      §                      §                        §                        §                          §                            § §                            §Senior Consultant - Procurement Specialist§                            § §                            §                          §                        §                      §                    §                  §                  §                    §                      §                        §Looking for your next challenge? §                      §                    §                    §                      §                        §10+ years’ experience in providing procurement advice to the public sector?  §                      §                      §                        §Keen to be part of a dynamic, fast-paced, flexible organisation committed to making a difference? §                      §                    §                    §About us  §                    §Morrison Low are an Australasian management consulting firm. We have offices in Sydney, Wellington and Auckland.  For over twenty years we have consulted to the public sector and achieved some exceptional results.  §                    §Our clients come to us for trusted advice on a wide range of issues and we are seen as sector experts in providing strategic infrastructure, service delivery and procurement advice. We are looking for a senior level procurement consultant to work on a broad range of activities including procurement strategy, contract management and project delivery with our team of senior consulting staff. §                    §We are a values-driven business with a supportive team who thrive on delivering exceptional results across all facets of our client’s businesses. §                    §Our people are flexible, hardworking, and committed. We invest in our people. We take pride in the fact that we are a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility, and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity, and overall employee well-being. §                    §You can find out more about us at www.morrisonlow.com§                    §The opportunity §                    §Our Senior Procurement Specialist will have experience in consulting to the state or local government sectors and have excellent relationship, communication and networking skills. You will also have a track record of problem solving and formulating high quality advice from your expertise in the procurement area. This will cover a range of service areas including infrastructure and term service contracts, with involvement from pre-planning, the planning stages, developing requirements, contract development, tendering and then contract review. §                    §To be successful in this role you will: §                    §                      §                        §be degree qualified in a jobTitle: Demand and Supply Planner / Analyst Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50675439.txt	§Demand and Supply Planner / Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Demand and Supply Planner / Analyst§§Advertiser: §Bellroy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§IN A NUTSHELL§  §Bellroy is growing more than 30% year-on-year and you will be joining our Operations team at an exciting time when we are redesigning and optimising our Demand and Supply Planning function to have us ready for even faster growth. Previous supply chain experience is not essential. What we’re really searching for is an analytical thinker who will maximise our inventory availability while minimising stock-holding, analyse our historical sales trends to generate sales forecasts and create supply plans to match supplier capacity. §  §You’ll be joining a team used to thinking carefully about possibilities, used to building models, then using them to directly improve processes. You might have a few years of inventory planning under your belt and found yourself limited by rigid processes and systems. Or, you might have worked in analytics roles, serving up data and insights to decision-makers but wishing you could experience the tangible effects of your analysis. Either way, you’ll need to get a kick out of working with large datasets and keen to use data to question, tweak and create processes to help drive us towards achieving our goals. We’ve recently started implementing a new demand planning software, and you’ll be key to helping us design and optimise it to make sure we keep pace during this time of rapid development. §  §If you get excited by the idea of working in a fast-paced environment working alongside a team of smart people with good intentions who get sh*t done, you should probably read on…§  § §  §YOU’D MAKE A GREAT SUPPLY AND DEMAND PLANNER  IF YOU …§ § §Have 3-5 years experience working in a data rich environment, with some experience sourcing data from different systems and making sure it’s clean (or cleaning it if necessary)§ §Want to have a deep understanding of how things work and what is going on under the hood§ §Desire to work with data to draw practical insights from it and use it to improve our inventory health§ §Can pinpoint when and where a process is flawed and are able to question when something doesn’t make sense § §Have a desire to work autonomously to build systems that work and update processes as improvements reveal themselves to you§ §Are hard-working, meticulous and highly organised§ §You can plan with precision and great attention to detail noticing when we’re getting off-track and proactively putting corrective actions in place§ §Have been exposed to using tools such as Netsuite (ERP), StockIQ (Demand Planning) and Looker (BI Tool)§ § §  §IF YOU WERE HERE LAST WEEK, HERE ARE SOME OF THE THINGS YOU MIGHT HAVE DONE§ § §Collaborated with our projects team on the implementation of our new Demand Planning software§ §Updated the 12-month rolling forecast for our bags product range, combining historical sales demand with growth insights from the sales team § §Created Transfer Orders in NetSuite  for the weekly replenishment of Amazon’s FBA warehouses§ §Reviewed the inventory levels of our 5 parent warehouses and created transfer orders to balance inventory relative to demand at each location§ §Worked with our Digital Sales team to allocate inventory to our Black Friday campaign§ §Noticed the oversized demand of a recently released product, requested updated projections from the sales team, updated the sales forecast and prepared an expedited purchase order§ §Prepared a summary of our aged stock and presented your insights and recommendations to our Sales team§ §Reviewed our Inventory KPIs with the Operations Manager§ §Noticed a manual process that could be delegated to your Virtual Assistant, created an SOP and freed up an hour of your time each week§ § §  §LOCATION AND HOURS§  §This role is a full-time role based in our Fitzroy office (or it will be, and it’s remote until we get back there).§  § §  §IF YOU'RE READY TO APPLY: §  §Click the apply button and make sure to include your resume and a cover letter telling us why you'd love to work at Bellroy in this role. We will then send some application questions to successful candidates. §§§§

jobTitle: Senior Associate - Waste Advisory Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700781.txt	§Senior Associate - Waste Advisory§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Associate - Waste Advisory§§Advertiser: §Ricardo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$160,000 - $190,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Ricardo is a global sustainability consultancy and our ambition is to create a world fit for the future. We help our clients solve some of the world’s most complex environmental challenges and provide governments, public agencies and businesses with leading analysis, advice and data.§Operating across the world, we work in partnership with our customers to help transform the way they work, empowering business leaders with award winning consultancy advice. With unrivalled sector insight and a reputation for producing innovative solutions, we offer a stimulating and rewarding environment in which to work.§ §The opportunity§We have an opportunity for a highly experienced Senior Associate to lead and direct a wide range of exciting and innovative Waste Advisory projects. This is an opportunity for you be at the forefront of establishing an international brand in the Australian market, whilst leveraging an internationally respected business. Drawing upon Ricardo’s focus on innovation you will be involved with a broad range of projects focused on Circular Economy and Zero Waste Strategy development, Business Case and Project Feasibility, Service and Contract Reviews, Waste to Energy, Environmental Infrastructure, Infrastructure Sustainability, and Renewable Energy working across both the public and private sector.§You will work closely with an established management team in Australia and therefore, you will have a lot of support with systems and a depth of expertise from the international business and will be rewarded for bringing your network of clients and local experience. You will utilise your strong commercial and business development skills to further grow and enhance the team.§On a day-to-day basis you will often be acting as the technical lead on complex consultancy projects and proposals and will need to have the necessary skills, experience and aptitude to lead from the front and collaborate with a wide range of experts across the company and in partner organisations. §We are looking for an individual who has strong capabilities and proven experience in operational development, technical expertise and business development in the Waste Advisory sector. You will have a proven track record, strong market credentials and great customer and commercial skills. You will also have experience of leading teams and will be passionate about developing and mentoring junior team members.§ §Skills and experience§You should have the following skills and experience:§Extensive consultancy experience in Waste Advisory projects.§Strong commercial and business development skills, coupled with a track record of identifying and securing new consultancy work, as well as supporting and leading complex proposals and consultancy projects.§Strong communication skills, and experience of collaborating with diverse stakeholders/audiences and facilitating agreement between conflicting parties.§Possess a good network of contacts across New South Wales / Queensland at a management and/or operational level and ideally be recognized as an industry leader within your chosen technical area.§You will have an established client base of national clients, with a specific focus on New South Wales and Queensland§An interest in supporting international projects.§An ability to build relationships both internally and externally.§Be an effective and proactive business leader, capable of supporting and developing peers.§Flexible approach, including a willingness and ability to work on a wide range of topics.§We operate in an interesting and innovative environment, offering you the opportunity to make your mark in an expanding international company. You will have support from the wider business in developing a personal development plan for your career to develop into a wide range of future opportunities. We have excellent training and development opportunities and you will have the opportunity to work in new and emerging markets.   §In return for your commitment, drive and enthusiasm, we offer an attractive benefits package, an informal company culture, flexible working hours and the opportunity to make a difference in a challenging and rewarding field.  Ricardo Energy, Environment & Planning is an equal opportunities employer and champions inclusion and diversity.§Once you have submitted your application a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch. Please be aware that the timing can vary dependent on the volume of applications that we receive for each role and in some cases, we may start to review applications prior to the closing date.§ §§§§

You will have experience leading change in highly-regulated environments and the ability to perform within tight timeframes. You will be adaptable, and not beholden to a methodology and thrive on bringing structure to chaos especially when this adds to the customer experience.§ If this sounds like you, please don’t delay in applying. Applications for this opportunity will close on Monday 12th at 12pm.§   § §Please forward your application to Jamie Edmundson directly by using the 'apply now' link below.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

We respect and take care of each other, our community and the environment. jobTitle: Senior Evaluation Advisor Job in Tumut, Snowy & Monaro - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673260.txt	§Senior Evaluation Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Evaluation Advisor§§Advertiser: §Department of Regional NSW§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tumut, Snowy & Monaro§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Temporary role with possibility of extension§Queanbeyan Location§Salary from $110,745 plus super and leave loading§§The Regional Programs Unit within the Department of Regional NSW (DRNSW) has a current vacancy for an experienced and motivated evaluation professional.§This role will be charged with the coordination and evaluation of a broad range of projects and funding programs administered within the Regional Programs Unit (RPU).  Critical to the success of this role is your ability to develop evaluation frameworks, engage with service providers and ensure quality and accurate reports to the management and executive teams to facilitate accurate decision making.§This role will also be responsible for the review and implementation of continual improvement practices aimed at improving programs, services and other initiatives within RPU.§About you§You are an experienced evaluation professional with an in-depth understanding of grants programs including, probity and governance standards and social and economic outcomes of different programs.§You are a proven team player with strong communication skills both verbally and written. Your communications skills will help you develop and maintain effective working relationships across a range of internal and external stakeholders§If you have the capability to achieve success in this role and are interested in creating a more prosperous NSW, we would love to hear from you!§About The Department of Regional NSW§The Department of Regional NSW was formed in 2020 as a central agency for regional issues. The Department is responsible for building resilient regional economies and communities, strengthening primary industries, managing the use of regional land, overseeing the state’s mineral and mining resources and ensuring government investment in regional NSW is fair and delivers positive outcomes for local communities and businesses§To apply,§ please submit an updated CV and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role.§Learn more:§ Please contact §Adam Young, Manager Grants Administration Office§ on §0436 823 281§ or §click here§ to review the role description.§Applications close on Wednesday 14 October 2020§A recruitment pool may be created from this recruitment action for ongoing and temporary roles of the same standard that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.§Why work for Department of Regional NSW?§§Exciting career pathways and opportunities§We offer vibrant and exciting career paths for people from a wide range of backgrounds and skills. Once you join the NSW Government, you’ll be supported to develop your skills and expertise through ongoing training, and opportunities to move easily from role to role, and agency to agency across the entire NSW government.§Our people:§Join DRNSW and you’ll be joining a team of more than 4,000 passionate people spread across a diverse range of disciplines and functions including – regional infrastructure, fisheries, agriculture and mining. If you’re motivated and passionate about making a difference to the people of NSW we invite you to become part of our story.§§Inclusion and Flexible Working§ §§We strive to reflect the community we serve and encourage our people to explore new ways of working across regional NSW. We are open to arrangements that help individuals balance their work and life commitments, including working part-time or working from different locations. We embrace difference and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. §§We understand that everyone is different and you may require adjustments to apply. Please don’t hesitate to contact us to discuss how we may be able to assist you. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Manager - Customer Experience Insights Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50674301.txt	§Senior Manager - Customer Experience Insights§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager - Customer Experience Insights§§Advertiser: §IVE Data Driven Communications§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Senior Manager - Customer Experience Insights §        §          §IVE is Australia’s leading holistic marketing company. With an unmatched breadth and depth of offering, we guide our clients from idea to execution. Our landscape is constantly shifting and evolving. As marketing natives, so are we. We are forever seeking new ways to navigate the marketing maze and connect our clients with customers. Specialising in data-driven communications, we bring together the capabilities, specialists and technology needed to make customer connection seamless.§          § §          §What do we do?§ We provide data and marketing technology solutions for businesses invested in providing better customer experiences.§          §Why do we do it?§ In a world of perpetual change, our clients seek specialist data and marketing technology support to create and maintain their competitive advantage.§          §How do we do it?§ Our people are marketing and technology experts that deliver specialist data, technical and communications solutions.§          § §          §About the Role:§          §As the Senior Manager - Customer Experience Insights, you will enable our mix of commercial and not-for-profit clients to leverage their data to gain competitive advantage and provide industry-leading analytics reporting.§          §Reporting to the Director of Platform ROI & Innovation, you will join the CX team of marketing strategists and data analysts working on projects for Australia’s largest and most trusted organisations. Our clients rely on our CX Analytics Team to help them gain insights from their data to identify behavioural trends, use their owned data source to take predictive action to anticipate customer needs, and identify campaign opportunities across CX programs. §          §You will work with best-of-breed platforms to craft data-driven solutions to solve our clients CX program delivery challenges.  These solutions may include: building advanced propensity models, forecasting models, multi-variant predictive models, campaign segmentation, statistical analysis and testing, data cleansing and enrichment, industry benchmarking, and ETL services. §          §On a daily basis you are very hands on, managing campaign and data analysis projects across various channels (both online and offline). Using insights and analysis, you will complete end-to-end campaign analysis and provide next-step recommendations. Your expertise in data analysis will guide internal and external stakeholders to shape their thinking and help them refine their Customer Experience strategies. §          §Our successful Candidate§          §            §              §Hands-on experience working with data science and analytics tools / languages (such as R, H2O, QL Server and / or Python).§            §            §              §Apply your knowledge and up-to-date understanding of Data Analysis and Data Science techniques, capabilities, constraints and technical implementation to build conceptual models and analyses to drive client business decisions.§            §            §              §5+ years of working in or supporting digital marketing experience teams.§            §            §              §Hands-on experience in business intelligence and reporting platforms ( Tableau / Klipfolio / Google Data Studio). Power-BI is essential§            §            §              §Build, deploy and report on multi-channel campaigns - i.e. email, SMS, social and direct mail. §            §            §              §Build and refine data visualisation solutions which provide clients with the insights they need to inform decision-making.§            §            §              §Experience providing CX insights and  campaign optimisations / recommendations.§            §            §              §Support clients to develop test and learn programs to optimise their CX strategies. §            §            §              §Experience in team management of data professionals in establishing best practice governance and technical procedures to create operational efficiencies.§            §            §              §You are an eager learner, and actively research new tools to solve challenges relating to data.§            §          §          §            §              §Ability to provide support for the  improvement of IVE DDC’s Campaign Analysis & Optimisation services and processes§            §            §              §Ability to manage multiple projects under time pressure while maintaining strict attention to detail.§            §            §              §Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.§            §          §          § §          §No Recruiters§          §Applicants must have the right to live and work in Australia§          § §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§IVE is Australia’s leading holistic marketing company. With an unmatched breadth and depth of offering, we guide our clients from idea to execution. Our landscape is constantly shifting and evolving. As marketing natives, so are we. We are forever seeking new ways to navigate the marketing maze and connect our clients with customers. Specialising in data-driven communications, we bring together the capabilities, specialists and technology needed to make customer connection seamless.§ § § §What do we do?§ We provide data and marketing technology solutions for businesses invested in providing better customer experiences.§ §Why do we do it?§ In a world of perpetual change, our clients seek specialist data and marketing technology support to create and maintain their competitive advantage.§ §How do we do it?§ Our people are marketing and technology experts that deliver specialist data, technical and communications solutions.§ § § §About the Role:§ §As the Senior Manager - Customer Experience Insights, you will enable our mix of commercial and not-for-profit clients to leverage their data to gain competitive advantage and provide industry-leading analytics reporting.§ §Reporting to the Director of Platform ROI & Innovation, you will join the CX team of marketing strategists and data analysts working on projects for Australia’s largest and most trusted organisations. Our clients rely on our CX Analytics Team to help them gain insights from their data to identify behavioural trends, use their owned data source to take predictive action to anticipate customer needs, and identify campaign opportunities across CX programs. § §You will work with best-of-breed platforms to craft data-driven solutions to solve our clients CX program delivery challenges.  These solutions may include: building advanced propensity models, forecasting models, multi-variant predictive models, campaign segmentation, statistical analysis and testing, data cleansing and enrichment, industry benchmarking, and ETL services. § §On a daily basis you are very hands on, managing campaign and data analysis projects across various channels (both online and offline). Using insights and analysis, you will complete end-to-end campaign analysis and provide next-step recommendations. Your expertise in data analysis will guide internal and external stakeholders to shape their thinking and help them refine their Customer Experience strategies. § §Our successful Candidate§ § § §Hands-on experience working with data science and analytics tools / languages (such as R, H2O, QL Server and / or Python).§ § § §Apply your knowledge and up-to-date understanding of Data Analysis and Data Science techniques, capabilities, constraints and technical implementation to build conceptual models and analyses to drive client business decisions.§ § § §5+ years of working in or supporting digital marketing experience teams.§ § § §Hands-on experience in business intelligence and reporting platforms ( Tableau / Klipfolio / Google Data Studio). Power-BI is essential§ § § §Build, deploy and report on multi-channel campaigns - i.e. email, SMS, social and direct mail. § § § §Build and refine data visualisation solutions which provide clients with the insights they need to inform decision-making.§ § § §Experience providing CX insights and  campaign optimisations / recommendations.§ § § §Support clients to develop test and learn programs to optimise their CX strategies. § § § §Experience in team management of data professionals in establishing best practice governance and technical procedures to create operational efficiencies.§ § § §You are an eager learner, and actively research new tools to solve challenges relating to data.§ § § §Ability to provide support for the  improvement of IVE DDC’s Campaign Analysis & Optimisation services and processes§ § § §Ability to manage multiple projects under time pressure while maintaining strict attention to detail.§ § § §Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.§ § § § §No Recruiters§ §Applicants must have the right to live and work in Australia§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Which of the following web analytics tools are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Continuous Improvement/Project Manager Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50593428.txt	§Continuous Improvement/Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Continuous Improvement/Project Manager§§Advertiser: §Aurizon§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Salary§§Attractive salary package plus bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Location:  §Sarina (near Mackay)§Remuneration/Benefit: §Attractive salary package plus generous bonus opportunity§ §About the role:§The Central Queensland Coal Network is entering a critical change phase with the implementation of multiple technology and transformation initiatives. As a result, we are seeking the expertise of §a§ Continuous Improvement/Project Manager §to coordinate and deliver cost benefits to the business§.  §Reporting to the Business Performance Leader you will work with a team of transformational specialists to ensure projects are successfully implemented. § § The role will be accountable for; §§Assist with the identification, prioritisation and implementation of improvement activities.§Lead the analysis of project and operational requirements, investigate innovative solutions and provide guidance to managers and employees.§Lead and coordinate the review and reporting of initiative progress to senior management and/or stakeholders and ensure ongoing alignment with strategic objectives.§Drive effective working relationships with customers, internal and external clients at a middle management level to ensure improvement initiatives are in keeping with wider business objectives§Drive collaboration across functions and regions to ensure consistent application of improvement activities across the enterprise and standardise§§About you:§ §§Ideally you will have applied process improvement methodologies (e.g. lean / six sigma)§Project management experience including PM qualifications would be well regarded§You possess excellent data analytical capability§You are an experienced influencer, able to connect and implement change with a range of stakeholders and environments.§You have experience with identifying and managing risks to mitigate impact to program delivery.§You are values driven and results focused, with the ability to coordinate resources to meet deadlines.§High Level of interpersonal skills to communicate cross functionally. §Effective business acumen, strategic thinking and analytical skills.§Ability to work as an effective member of a team and build relationships for results.§§ §What we can offer you:§At Aurizon, we support the development and growth of our employees to reach their full potential.  With a National portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with long term and exciting career opportunities.  Some of our benefits include:§§Development and growth opportunities§Discounts on selected health insurance funds, personal travel, gyms, vehicles and retail brands§Parental Leave Program and Super Booster§As an endorsed WORK180 employer, you can view our policies and benefits §here§§At Aurizon we believe in connection§It is our ability to connect that strengthens communities, industries and builds economies. It helps to embrace diversity in our workplace and that is the experience we want for everyone. We are building a culture where everyone is seen, heard and valued, because of their diversity. We value inclusion throughout the whole company and encourage you to apply.§About Aurizon§Aurizon is Australia’s largest rail freight operator and a top 50 ASX company.  Each year, we transport more than 250 million tonnes of Australian commodities, connecting miners, primary producers, and industry with international and domestic markets.§We strive for a diverse, collaborative, creative and a high-performance culture that celebrates the contribution of every employee and provide opportunities for career development in a dynamic work environment.§To learn about us and our company values visit §www.aurizon.com.au/careers§§Should you have any questions about this position  (reference 85966), please contact Christine on §07 4943 4341§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50675234.txt	§Business Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Coach§§Advertiser: §Practice Max§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§WE WANT YOU!§Savvy Dentist is a boutique coaching business assisting dentists nationally and internationally to grow their dental practice. Specifically, we work with dentists who want to create a practice §and§ a life they love.§ §We set ourselves apart form the competition by combining proven business growth strategies with innovative, cutting edge resources. If you're sick of the ‘same old’ coaching, you’ll love us!§ §At Savvy Dentist we are forward focused and driven to help our clients succeed. We believe that great coaching involves building strong professional relationships with clients.  All of our team members are §high performers §who are effective, efficient and emotionally intelligent.§We are looking for a Head Coach to coach our clients and to lead our team of coaches. This is a new role and is an opportunity to shape the future direction of the business.§About the role§In addition to providing coaching services to our clients, you will lead our team of expert business coaches.§ §The role includes monitoring the results of our clients and their engagement with the coaching program. These results will be used to provide advice to management as well as providing coaching and guidance to the other coaches on the team.§ § § §Responsibilities include:§ § §Coaching clients in the Practice Max Mastermind§ §Coaching clients in the Savvy Dentist Academy§ §Drive engagement in our Facebook group§ §Deliver training from time to time§ §Lead the coaching team which includes reporting on client outcomes and engagement and then using that data to coach and mentor the other coaches§ § § §You will be the right fit if:§ § §You are coachable and willing to take feedback on board§ §You have a track record of coaching to drive client results (as compared to a friendly chit chat)§ §You can follow a process consistently§ §You can build strong professional relationships§ §You are an excellent communicator and emotionally intelligent§ §You can lead and manage others§ §You can hit targets and interpret metrics§ §You have flexibility with appointment scheduling (we have clients in different time zones)§ §You are prepared to attend workshops§ §You are driven and motivated to help clients succeed§ §You are driven and motivated to help Savvy Dentist be regarded as the premier coaching program for dentists§ § § §So, what’s in it for you?§ § §Be part of a warm and dynamic team committed to excellence.§ §Develop skills and knowledge to fulfill your potential§ §Attractive remuneration for the right candidate§ §Work remotely or in house (If working remotely, attendance at periodic meetings at the office is required)§ §How to Apply§Send your CV and your cover letter outlining why you think you are a good fit for the role.§ § § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Service Planning Manger  Job in Lismore & Far North Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673618.txt	§Service Planning Manger §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Service Planning Manger §§Advertiser: §Eden Ritchie Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Lismore & Far North Coast§§Salary§§Great Packaging Options§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Location negotiable: Port Macquarie, Coffs Harbour, Ballina, Lismore or Tweed §Attractive salary including excellent salary packaging benefits§Healthy North Coast (Limited) is a not for profit organisation whose principal activity is to provide better health for NSW North Coast communities. They are currently seeking a highly experienced and qualified person for the position of Service Planning Manager, within their Commissioning Directorate. Service Planning within Healthy North Coast incorporates supporting both clinical service planning, which informs the commissioning of health services and also supporting the organisation with the development of operational planning in line with the annual planning cycle.§The Service Planning Manager will be responsible for shaping and driving the organisation’s planning processes using quality evidence and information gathered by North Coast Primary Health Network and will develop and optimise planning processes to meet service and timeliness objectives. This role is the organisation’s primary resource for establishing reporting frameworks, providing guidance to internal and external stakeholders for the Health Needs Assessment, activity work planning and strategic and program planning.§Incorporating an interface with all Directorates, you will ensure planning and performance systems are embedded across the organisation. You will act as an internal consultant, analysing and coordinating the internal reporting framework, balance scorecard and operational planning, with a focus on leading the organisations Health Needs Assessment.§To be considered for this exciting community focussed opportunity, you will ideally have relevant post graduate qualifications and have worked within a similar service delivery focussed role. You will have high level drive, be agile, resilient and possess strong attention to detail with the ability to manage often conflicting priorities in calm and precise manner. You will be an analytical thinker with solid mathematical and data integrity skills and have a natural ability to think on your feet, with sound problem solving capabilities.§If this sounds like a role that would interest you, or you would like further information and a copy of the PD, please contact Jane Harvey on §0407 132 157§ or email your CV and a short covering letter to §jane@edenritchie.com.au§Applications close 5pm Friday 23rd October 2020.§Please note - all third party or direct applications will be forwarded to Eden Ritchie Recruitment.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Internal Audit and Risk Manager - Australia Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50711324.txt	§Internal Audit and Risk Manager - Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Internal Audit and Risk Manager - Australia§§Advertiser: §SeaLink Corporate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Join an award winning tourism and transport company§ § §SeaLink§ is looking for a bright and energetic individual with a strong work ethic and an enthusiastic attitude to join their team!§  §Are you an experienced Internal Audit and Risk Manager?§Hold a tertiary qualification and have significant financial and operational internal audit experience?§Looking for an exciting new work environment?§§We encourage you to apply!§ §About Us§SeaLink Travel Group is a publicly listed multi-modal transport and tourism operator, delivering world-class customer services and brilliant Australian holiday experiences. In January 2020, SeaLink completed the acquisition of the Transit Systems Group, Australia's leading metropolitan public transport operator.§Carrying more than 359 million passengers a year in different locations around the world, our Group has over 8,700 employees operating more than 3,300 buses and 79 ferries across Australia, London and Singapore. § §About The Role§ §The Internal Audit and Risk Manager (Australia) is a new and exciting opportunity reporting to the International Compliance Director. § §The role will support and improve SeaLink's Corporate Governance framework through the delivery of the Group's Internal Audit plan and support our key stakeholders in the management of risk in line with the Group's Risk Management Policy. § §This role will focus on audit/risk management across our Australian operations and will require collaboration with audit and risk colleagues in the UK and Singapore.§ §This position will be based in Adelaide.§ §About You§ §The successful candidate will possess excellent internal audit skills inclusive of understanding and applying auditing standards, with an emphasis on internal audit activities, exercising professional judgement and consideration of quality, risk and commercial aspects. You will be a strong, proactive and resilient leader with a successful track record in building and managing relationships, motivating and developing teams, encouraging creative thinking and influencing and managing through others to deliver positive results.§ §You will also demonstrate experience and skills in the following areas:§Strong accounting and reporting knowledge §Risk management experience in the development and application of enterprise risk management frameworks across a global/multi-national/diverse organisation§Ability to critically evaluate, interpret complex business process, structures and systems§Make informed recommendations on appropriate governance, risk and audit strategies§Understanding of corporate governance and risk management including the strategic role of Internal Audit in an ASX listed company§Experience in building the profile of risk management and internal audit with stakeholders at all levels of the business§Exceptional written and verbal communication skills §If you think this position is for you, please submit your resume and a covering letter.  In your covering letter, please outline why you have applied for this position and the skills and experience you have that make you the best person for this position.§ §Please fill in as much information as you can in track record section of the application and pay close attention to the questions. § §Applications close by 5pm on Wednesday 28 October 2020. § §SeaLink Travel Group is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.§Adelaide 5000 SA§§§§

jobText: TXT/50627117.txt	§Risk Management Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk Management Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Department of Justice and Community Safety§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§South West Coast VIC§§Salary§§$84,937 - $91,783§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Risk Management Coordinator §      §        §          §12-month, part-time (0.5 FTE) opportunity offering great flexibility in the Victorian Public Service§ §at CoG3 ($84,937 - $91,783 plus superannuation). §          §Make the next step in your career with the opportunity to develop your risk management skills in the Security and Intelligence division§          §Bring your strong risk management background to work in a high-profile environment, taking part in large prison expansion projects.§        §        §About Us§        §Corrections Victoria is responsible for the direction, management and operation of Victoria's adult correctional system. Its standards, policies, strategies and programs hold prisoners and offenders to account, contribute to public trust in the criminal justice system, and make a difference to the lives of prisoners and offenders to reduce recidivism and strengthen community safety.§        §The Security and Intelligence Division is responsible for the acquittal of several key strategic functions within Corrections Victoria including Security Risk Management, Electronic Monitoring, Correctional Emergency Response, and Emergency Management including exercising plans and contingencies, and Intelligence.§        §The Security Standards Unit is responsible for several of these strategic functions focused on Security Risk Management, Physical Security, Annual Procedural Security Reviews, Schematic Plans, and State-Wide Locksmith Services and maintaining a range of policy documents. The Security Standards Unit is responsible for monitoring the minimum-security requirements for all prisons and secure locations on an annual basis, as well as ensuring that the standards are reviewed regularly. The unit provides assistance, advice and support to Corrections Victoria relating to Security, Security Risk Management, Fire Response and Emerging Technology.§        §About the role§        §The Risk Management Coordinator is a specialist position that works across the correctional system performing security and risk reviews. This role provides advice on emerging risks and issues, performs research activities, and supports Corrections Victoria and other departmental business units in developing risk assessments and mitigation strategies. The coordinator will ensure that locations have the appropriate mitigation strategies in place to reduce foreseeable risks. The Risk Management Coordinator will undertake project work and perform other duties within the broader team of the Security Standards Unit.§        §Key accountabilities:§        §          §Assist with the development and implementation of a comprehensive risk assessment process.§          §Assist all prisons locations to ensure appropriate mitigation strategies are in place to reduce foreseeable risks.§          §Provide feedback on prison assessments against the Risk Assessment Tool as well as the Minimum-Security requirements for all Prison and other Custodial Security Classifications.§          §Research and monitor innovative technologies and their impact in the correctional environment: Drug detection technology, mobile phones, electronic security, fire safety, drone technology, etc.§        §        §This role is based in SSU Offices - Barwon Prison; however, the work location is negotiable.§        §About you§        §To be successful you will have:§        §          §A good understanding of risk management standards (e.g. ISO 31000)§          §Strong abilities in planning and organising concurrent work activities and time management.§          §Abilities to manage projects and effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders.§          §Experience and knowledge of correctional practices and research §(Desirable however not necessary).§        §        §A formal qualification in risk or project management is desirable.§        §How to apply§        §Please click the Apply button on this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and covering letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.§        §The successful candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include national police checks and misconduct screening.§        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§§12-month, part-time (0.5 FTE) opportunity offering great flexibility in the Victorian Public Service§ §at CoG3 ($84,937 - $91,783 plus superannuation). §§Make the next step in your career with the opportunity to develop your risk management skills in the Security and Intelligence division§§Bring your strong risk management background to work in a high-profile environment, taking part in large prison expansion projects.§§About Us§Corrections Victoria is responsible for the direction, management and operation of Victoria's adult correctional system. Its standards, policies, strategies and programs hold prisoners and offenders to account, contribute to public trust in the criminal justice system, and make a difference to the lives of prisoners and offenders to reduce recidivism and strengthen community safety.§The Security and Intelligence Division is responsible for the acquittal of several key strategic functions within Corrections Victoria including Security Risk Management, Electronic Monitoring, Correctional Emergency Response, and Emergency Management including exercising plans and contingencies, and Intelligence.§The Security Standards Unit is responsible for several of these strategic functions focused on Security Risk Management, Physical Security, Annual Procedural Security Reviews, Schematic Plans, and State-Wide Locksmith Services and maintaining a range of policy documents. The Security Standards Unit is responsible for monitoring the minimum-security requirements for all prisons and secure locations on an annual basis, as well as ensuring that the standards are reviewed regularly. The unit provides assistance, advice and support to Corrections Victoria relating to Security, Security Risk Management, Fire Response and Emerging Technology.§About the role§The Risk Management Coordinator is a specialist position that works across the correctional system performing security and risk reviews. This role provides advice on emerging risks and issues, performs research activities, and supports Corrections Victoria and other departmental business units in developing risk assessments and mitigation strategies. The coordinator will ensure that locations have the appropriate mitigation strategies in place to reduce foreseeable risks. The Risk Management Coordinator will undertake project work and perform other duties within the broader team of the Security Standards Unit.§Key accountabilities:§§Assist with the development and implementation of a comprehensive risk assessment process.§Assist all prisons locations to ensure appropriate mitigation strategies are in place to reduce foreseeable risks.§Provide feedback on prison assessments against the Risk Assessment Tool as well as the Minimum-Security requirements for all Prison and other Custodial Security Classifications.§Research and monitor innovative technologies and their impact in the correctional environment: Drug detection technology, mobile phones, electronic security, fire safety, drone technology, etc.§§This role is based in SSU Offices - Barwon Prison; however, the work location is negotiable.§About you§To be successful you will have:§§A good understanding of risk management standards (e.g. ISO 31000)§Strong abilities in planning and organising concurrent work activities and time management.§Abilities to manage projects and effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders.§Experience and knowledge of correctional practices and research §(Desirable however not necessary).§§A formal qualification in risk or project management is desirable.§How to apply§Please click the Apply button on this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and covering letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.§The successful candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include national police checks and misconduct screening.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50633905.txt	§Workforce Optimisation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Workforce Optimisation Manager§§Advertiser: §G8 Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§G8 Education is an ASX 200 organisation and leading provider of quality early education and care services. Owning over 500 Centres across Australia and Singapore and with over 11,000 team members, we are continually expanding and looking to grow and strengthen our network. G8 Education is committed to delivering employee incentives and professional development programs to achieve a rewarding culture that will ensure an engaged and driven workforce.§ §§About the role:§Reporting to the General Manager Operations, the Workforce Optimisation Manager will be responsible for the Operational Workforce Labour Strategy,  providing leadership, oversight, reporting and continual improvement of Centre based workforce rostering, productivity and wage management. This role has the flexibility to be based at either Support Office in Varsity Lakes or Brisbane CBD.§Key responsibilities include:§§Develop labour design, rostering and effective labour management strategies to deliver on company objectives.§Identify opportunities to improve processes and ways of working to improve efficiency while delivering the G8 quality offer and ensuring regulatory compliance requirements are met.§Responsible for the management, system and field support of the Roster module within the Workforce Management (WFM) suite.§Ownership of Wage budgets and forecasts and accountable for Wage cost outcomes.§Develop and implement labour standards and rostering principles to ensure productivity and Quality measures are delivered.§Daily oversight and management of labour metrics and performance against budget and optimal forecasts.§Establish target contract hours for each centre to maximise efficiency coupled with the required flexibility to react to variations in demand§§Ideally, you will have:§§Proven experience in a similar role across a mid-large, geographically dispersed organisation.§Experience with enterprise rostering solutions such as Kronos, Ceridian Dayforce, Tanda etc.§Excellent analytical, written and verbal communication skills.§Project management experience.§Strong commercial acumen that can identify and act on opportunities.§Customer & people experience orientation in identifying and implementing continuous improvement and process reviews.§Qualifications in Process Engineering or a related field preferred but not essential.§§Benefits Include:§§Attractive salary package including performance incentive scheme§Generous discount on childcare fees for either yourself or a member of your extended family§Exclusive access to our employee benefits program covering a wide range of discounts and promotions§Dedicated focus on professional growth and development§§This is a rare opportunity; if you want a diverse, challenging and personally fulfilling role, apply now!§G8 Education is a committed advocate for child protection, safety and wellbeing. As an organisation, we have a zero tolerance to any form of child abuse or harm. The safety and well-being of children will always be our priority and we have an expectation that all of our team members embrace this shared commitment.§Please note the advertising closing date is indicative only.  G8 Education reserves the right to close the advertisement before this date is reached. Therefore, it is encouraged that you submit your application as soon as possible.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50623930.txt	§Investment Analyst, Financial Modelling§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Investment Analyst, Financial Modelling§§Advertiser: §West Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§c. $120 - 140k + super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§The Employer§A defined market leader, this multi-billion dollar business is currently undertaking a strategic change in direction which will include acquisitions and high value growth projects. This business is at the forefront of a competitive industry and has built a highly respected brand and market reputation. With growth of this magnitude comes opportunity, and now is an opportune time to join the team.§ §The Opportunity§A newly created role within the Corporate finance team, the Corporate Investment Analyst, Modelling will have direct interaction with the CFO, Pillar leaders and other Exec level stakeholders. The core function of this role is to manage the manage the group corporate model for the entire business. The successful applicant will partner with Stakeholders who have input into the model to ensure accuracy and integrity with the data to then provide analysis and insights for presentation at board level.§Other key tasks aligned to this role will include:§ § §Develop other financial models for investment valuation, cashflow and debt structures including scenario based and ‘what if’ based modelling and sensitivity analysis§ §Assist with the Annual Budgeting program for the group including preparation of Forecasts§ §Provide decision support through insightful analysis and commentary.§ § §The Successful Applicant§ § §Will hold a professional qualification, (CFA, Chartered Accountant, CPA or MBA)§ §Has extensive financial Modelling experience including building and / or maintaining complex working models.§ §Can demonstrate experience and knowledge with investment analysis, Mergers / Acquisitions, Valuations, Treasury / debt finance & Cashflow§ §Will have a background in the Professional services firm (Big 4/ or Mid tier), Private Equity, Investment banking or Corporate finance sectors.§ §Interpersonally, you are inquisitive by nature with a strong attention to detail. You have a track record of effectively supporting Executive level stakeholders in a fast paced environment.§ § §To apply use the Apply Now button or for further information and a confidential discussion please contact Courtney on §0415 401 493§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50618872.txt	§Consulting Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting Manager§§Advertiser: §Pharmaceutical Society of Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Consulting Manager §      §        §The Company§        §The Pharmaceutical Society of Australia (PSA) is the national peak body representing Australia's 31,000 pharmacists working in all sectors and across all locations in Australia.§        §PSA believes the expertise of pharmacists can be better utilised to address the healthcare needs of all Australians by optimising the role of pharmacists as healthcare professionals and as medicines experts to provide high-quality healthcare for all Australians.§        §PSA leads and supports innovative and evidence-based healthcare service delivery by pharmacists and works to unlock opportunities for pharmacists to practise to their full potential.§        §The Position§        §The PSA is currently looking for an experienced consulting manager cover a Parental leave contract. We know we perform at our best when we are empowered to be ourselves, and that this, in turn, enables our future success as an organisation§  §PSA reserves the right to pull the advert before the end date if the suitable applicant is found before the close date.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Change Manager - Procurement Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629198.txt	§Change Manager - Procurement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Manager - Procurement§§Advertiser: §UnitingCare Qld§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Change Manager - Procurement §      §        §UnitingCare provides health and community services to thousands of people every day of the year through its services in Health, Aged Care and Community Services, Family and Disability Services, Retirement Living and Retail. These services encompass 8 major brands including UnitingCare, Blue Care, The Wesley Hospital, St Andrews, Buderim Private and St Stephens Hospitals, Lifeline and ARRCS (Australian Regional and Remote Community Services). For more than 65 years Blue Care has been committed to empowering individuals to live life their way.§        §Today, our people make more than three million visits to Queenslanders each year, providing the same holistic care, service and companionship that’s been our hallmark since the very beginning.§        §Your role§        §A unique opportunity has been created within our Procurement Team for an experienced §Change Manager for a 12 month contract§. Reporting to the Category Manager, Policy and Purchasing, this role will support the implementation of a Procure-to-Pay solution across our Aged Care and Community Services and Family and Disability Services business units, as well as our Corporate functions.§        §As a Change/Project Manager you will be accountable for the successful co-ordination and delivery of project related change across these business areas.  Equally important will be the embedding of new ways of working into these business areas.§        §This role requires the unique strengths and experience to manage a project and the related change with confidence.  It requires the right person who can see the big picture, has an easy but effective communication and engagement style and who can work with the Executive and Senior Leadership Team members to judiciously and successfully deliver business change to deliver sustainable strategic benefits.§        §In addition to the above, your responsibilities will include:§        §          §Develop, maintain and deliver an effective change management and project management approach to deliver project related system, process and people related changes;§          §Coordinate with managers and employees to develop and lead effective change management plans;§          §Identify, document and manage change management risks;§          §Provide strategic and operational change management advice and support;§          §Monitor and report on how change is being implemented, the effectiveness of the implementation, identify areas of weakness or failure and implement appropriate remedial actions to ensure success;§          §Facilitate the internal and external development of change management packages required to meet organisational needs;§          §Provide input into the development of change management projects, policy, process and systems.§        §        §We are seeking a pro-active team-player, with strong communication and interpersonal skills in addition to an ability to build positive and collaborative working relationships with stakeholders at all levels. We are looking for the right person that can bring their special blend of Project and Change Management skills along with the ability to think and see the bigger picture while maintaining a tactical focus§        § §Your skills and experience§        §Underpinning the above you will have the following technical competencies and skills:§        §          §Significant experience and understanding of end to end change management;§          §Demonstrated experience in managing diverse projects (including people, process and system impact);§          §Strong track record in a dual role – project and change management;§          §Proven stakeholder engagement and management skills at up to an executive level with the ability to lead / influence a diverse group of people across a complex organisation;§          §Strong track record in applying change and project management principles, protocols and methods, and have demonstrated successful application of these within a large, decentralised organisation.§        §        §While not essential, previous experience or sound understanding of working within the Health, Human Services or Not-For-Profit industries would be beneficial in this role.  Experience of managing change relating to finance, procurement or procure-to-pay system implementations is desirable.§        §We’ll look after you too§        §As the largest not-for-profit provider of Hospital, Family, Aged and Community Services in Queensland, UnitingCare delivers services in over 400 locations - offering the opportunity to advance your career from Coomera to Katherine and almost everywhere in between.§        §We offer:§        §          §Not for profit salary packaging to pay benefits and living expenses from pre-income tax§          §Flexible work arrangements, where we emphasise a work-life balance§          §Access to financial, retail and lifestyle discounts and benefits§          §Learning and development to support you in your role§        §        §With our family including The Wesley Hospital, Lifeline and Blue Care, we’re an organisation committed to service, offering our people a values-based culture and benefits.§        §We work hard to make our services welcoming and safe for every person. We are united in keeping children, young people and the elderly safe from harm, within our services, workplaces and the communities we support. We are committed to speaking up loudly for their safety.§        §We are proud of our team’s diversity and highly encourage applications from people who identify as a part of the Australian Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Community.§        §Closing date 12th October 2020§        § §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§UnitingCare provides health and community services to thousands of people every day of the year through its services in Health, Aged Care and Community Services, Family and Disability Services, Retirement Living and Retail. These services encompass 8 major brands including UnitingCare, Blue Care, The Wesley Hospital, St Andrews, Buderim Private and St Stephens Hospitals, Lifeline and ARRCS (Australian Regional and Remote Community Services). For more than 65 years Blue Care has been committed to empowering individuals to live life their way.§ §Today, our people make more than three million visits to Queenslanders each year, providing the same holistic care, service and companionship that’s been our hallmark since the very beginning.§ §Your role§ §A unique opportunity has been created within our Procurement Team for an experienced §Change Manager for a 12 month contract§. Reporting to the Category Manager, Policy and Purchasing, this role will support the implementation of a Procure-to-Pay solution across our Aged Care and Community Services and Family and Disability Services business units, as well as our Corporate functions.§ §As a Change/Project Manager you will be accountable for the successful co-ordination and delivery of project related change across these business areas.  Equally important will be the embedding of new ways of working into these business areas.§ §This role requires the unique strengths and experience to manage a project and the related change with confidence.  It requires the right person who can see the big picture, has an easy but effective communication and engagement style and who can work with the Executive and Senior Leadership Team members to judiciously and successfully deliver business change to deliver sustainable strategic benefits.§ §In addition to the above, your responsibilities will include:§ § §Develop, maintain and deliver an effective change management and project management approach to deliver project related system, process and people related changes;§ §Coordinate with managers and employees to develop and lead effective change management plans;§ §Identify, document and manage change management risks;§ §Provide strategic and operational change management advice and support;§ §Monitor and report on how change is being implemented, the effectiveness of the implementation, identify areas of weakness or failure and implement appropriate remedial actions to ensure success;§ §Facilitate the internal and external development of change management packages required to meet organisational needs;§ §Provide input into the development of change management projects, policy, process and systems.§ §We are seeking a pro-active team-player, with strong communication and interpersonal skills in addition to an ability to build positive and collaborative working relationships with stakeholders at all levels. We are looking for the right person that can bring their special blend of Project and Change Management skills along with the ability to think and see the bigger picture while maintaining a tactical focus§ § §Your skills and experience§ §Underpinning the above you will have the following technical competencies and skills:§ § §Significant experience and understanding of end to end change management;§ §Demonstrated experience in managing diverse projects (including people, process and system impact);§ §Strong track record in a dual role – project and change management;§ §Proven stakeholder engagement and management skills at up to an executive level with the ability to lead / influence a diverse group of people across a complex organisation;§ §Strong track record in applying change and project management principles, protocols and methods, and have demonstrated successful application of these within a large, decentralised organisation.§ §While not essential, previous experience or sound understanding of working within the Health, Human Services or Not-For-Profit industries would be beneficial in this role.  Experience of managing change relating to finance, procurement or procure-to-pay system implementations is desirable.§ §We’ll look after you too§ §As the largest not-for-profit provider of Hospital, Family, Aged and Community Services in Queensland, UnitingCare delivers services in over 400 locations - offering the opportunity to advance your career from Coomera to Katherine and almost everywhere in between.§ §We offer:§ § §Not for profit salary packaging to pay benefits and living expenses from pre-income tax§ §Flexible work arrangements, where we emphasise a work-life balance§ §Access to financial, retail and lifestyle discounts and benefits§ §Learning and development to support you in your role§ §With our family including The Wesley Hospital, Lifeline and Blue Care, we’re an organisation committed to service, offering our people a values-based culture and benefits.§ §We work hard to make our services welcoming and safe for every person. We are united in keeping children, young people and the elderly safe from harm, within our services, workplaces and the communities we support. We are committed to speaking up loudly for their safety.§ §We are proud of our team’s diversity and highly encourage applications from people who identify as a part of the Australian Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Community.§ §Closing date 12th October 2020§ § § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have with change management?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
