location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50657336.txt	§Robot Process Analyst - Pipeline Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Robot Process Analyst - Pipeline Development§§Advertiser: §Westpac Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§How will I help?§ §  §You will be a key thought leader and will be responsible for a high cadence of mining opportunities and drive of opportunity discovery through to funding release.  You will be required to show a business perspective of process improvement through to future state re-imagination.  Lean six sigma methods are desired to assist definition of the problem and a deep understanding of how automation enables rapid solution transformation. You will support and shape requirements, design, and change for the delivery team and drive its wider culture and brand  §  §What?s in it for me? §  §Joining Westpac has many benefits besides building a long and stable career. You?ll be able to purchase leave to facilitate your dreams or obligations and you?ll be encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments. You?ll also be entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us. §  §What do I need?§ §  §You will have a proven track record in working on Robotics Automation programs specifically working with RPA and RDA technologies consulting on robotics requirements, preparing business cases, process design and analysis; both change and run. You will be a strong and effective communicator with executive, middle management, SME?s and business stakeholders. You will have a background in working in a large and complex organisation, preferably in financial services. Certifications of working experience in Lean Six Sigma strongly desired. §  §What?s it like to work there?  §  §We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world?s great service companies. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we?re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs. §  §The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We?ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they?re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.§ §§§§

jobTitle: Senior Town Planner Job in Cairns & Far North - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50599510.txt	§Senior Town Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Town Planner§§Advertiser: §Urban Sync Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Cairns & Far North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Urban Sync Pty Ltd are a Town Planning and Land Development consultancy practice servicing Cairns, Tablelands, Cape York and everywhere in-between.  Our business is committed to delivering ‘high’ quality statutory planning and development advice to the private sector and government organisations dealing with project feasibility, design and co-ordination, approvals management, infrastructure negotiations and post approval activities.§ §An exciting opportunity now exists for a motivated and experienced individual looking to develop his or her career participating and managing a diverse workload involving several challenging projects. You will preferably have experience in a consulting environment or state/local government and a network of contacts throughout the planning development industry would be advantageous.§ §To be suitable for this role, you will need:§ § §A degree or relevant tertiary qualification in Town/Urban  Planning or other related discipline (associated with the development or property industry);§ §Demonstrated and recent experience dealing with the development industry. An understanding of regulatory frameworks and protocols of development in Queensland would be of benefit (ie. Planning Act 2016 and other related legislation);§ §Excellent written communication and verbal skills.  This includes the ability to participate in negotiations, problem solving and conflict resolution to advocate on behalf of client and in dealings with assessing authorities.§ §Given the nature of the position, we are encouraging an ‘expression of interest’ from individuals with around 5+ years’ experience in the development industry and who are committed and dedicated to achieving the aims of the business and the aspirations of our clients. Flexible working arrangements are on offer for the suitable applicant.§ §In return, an attractive salary package will be presented to the right applicant, with additional incentives after a qualifying period with the opportunity be part of a vibrant and motivated team. § §To apply for this role, please forward your CV to §§admin@urbansync.com.au§§ on or before 5pm, Friday 16th October 2020. §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a town planner?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Business Analyst Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50594536.txt	§Senior Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §Scalene Group Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§About us§ §Scalene Group is a fast-growing, specialist retail advisory and analytics business.We provide strategy, process design and analytics services to help retailers optimise their performance and leverage data in day-to-day decision-making. We deliver tailored solutions for our clients that turn complex data into high value, easy to implement solutions. We operate from our offices in Melbourne, Sydney and London to support a growing number of leading retailers in Australia, Asia and Europe. We have an ambitious growth agenda and are keen to expand our team with highly skilled and passionate individuals to help us deliver this.§ §Qualifications & experience§ § § §3-5 years experience in a commercial / business analyst or strategy role, ideally with a Retailer or Fast Moving Consumer Goods business§Strategic management consulting experience is a plus§Client focused mindset is a must§Exceptional analytical and insight skills, comfortable in dealing with large datasets§Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills§Knowledge of business information (BI) tools, basic SQL and R desirable§Strong verbal and written communication skills§Flexible and adaptable approach applied to all activities§Australian citizenship or permanent residency§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ § § §Capture and document client requirements, and then translate these into actions§Analyse datasets and generate insights to help bring clients along the "project journey"§Convert data and analysis outputs into effective, clear communication documents§Support project management through on time delivery of requirements and by proactively identifying critical activities§Engage client teams, ensuring trust and rapport is built to help create long term client relationships§Build user-friendly tools and analytics products§Help identify opportunities with potential to drive value both for our clients and Scalene going forward§Propose, develop and lead streams of work to support Scalene's internal development agenda§ § § §Benefits§ § § §Flexible working options including work from home§Strong focus on team training and development§Generous annual leave§Opportunity to shape and drive the development of an innovative fast-growing business§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a business analyst (BA) role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50634604.txt	§GHD Advisory - Managing Consultant - Pedestrian Modelling & Crowd Dynamics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§GHD Advisory - Managing Consultant - Pedestrian Modelling & Crowd Dynamics§§Advertiser: §GHD Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §GHD Advisory - Managing Consultant - Pedestrian Modelling & Crowd Dynamics §      §        §   §Do you enjoy consultancy and leading a team? Does the opportunity to be part of our team responsible for growing the business globally sound like the move you are looking for?§        §Movement Strategies joined GHD earlier this year, and we are now looking to expand our team in this exciting phase.§        §About Movement Strategies§        §People movement is not simply a theoretical exercise. It changes the way individuals experience spaces, which not only improves their visit, but makes the space safer, more efficient and more profitable.§        §We work with many high-profile clients and on projects across the globe: from the development of the London 2012 Olympic Park, to Tottenham Hotspur’s new stadium, Sydney’s New Year’s Eve, to the Tower of London and the Eiffel Tower, we understand how to make better buildings, places and cities. Our understanding of people movement has also allowed us to support our clients with their response to COVID-19.   As part of GHD there will also be many opportunities to be working on major infrastructure projects such as Sydney Metro where GHD is delivering fundamental services as a trusted client advisor delivery partner.§        §The Position§        §As a Managing Consultant, you will lead project teams and take ownership for the delivery of projects. Your focus will be on ensuring quality acting as a technical lead and providing project narratives. You will support our senior leadership in the day to day operations of the business. As your knowledge of our business and consultancy skills increase, your role will develop. Initially you will: §        §          § Lead delivery of scoping at both proposal and project stages, ensuring junior team members follow standards, methods and techniques§          §As Project Manager, design project workstreams and lead full life cycle of projects; including regular reporting on project progress, revenue forecasting, client management and marketing collateral.§          §Perform quality control checks on technical analysis and interpretation of results by the junior team. Lead of advice changes prior to final sign off.§          §Build capability within the team by providing training and knowledge sharing in technical area based on company strategic targets.§          §Be aware of business pipeline ensuring resourcing is sufficient and leading operational changes for success.§          §Conducting business development activities to build awareness of MSL capability in AU / NZ, network connections and by participating in marketing activities.§          §Responsible for talent acquisition, growing the team and developing and coaching junior team members.§        §A successful candidate:§        §          §Demonstrable experience in the application of pedestrian, crowd or evacuation modelling tools and concepts as a technical lead or a strong consulting background in a related field or sector§          §A standards and quality driven management style with the ability to mentor, motivate and guide a team.§          §Evidence of new business development and securing repeat business across a range of industry sectors.§          §Experience within some of the following packages: Legion, Pathfinder, Mass Motion, GIS, Viswalk.§          §Excellent numerical and analytical skills with a strong standard of written and spoken English.§        §        §About GHD Advisory §        §GHD Advisory is an integrated part of GHD’s connected network of 11,000 people, which has a track record of delivering insightful advice and robust outcomes for our clients for more than 90 years. GHD Advisory addresses the need for business outcomes that challenge the status quo in our rapidly changing environment, offering services relating to infrastructure investment and economics, asset management, risk, assurance & regulation. §        §We actively seek and nurture the very best people in their respective fields to join our team. In return, we offer remarkable career shaping opportunities to extend your skills and gain global experience.§ If this is the kind of investment you would like to make with your talent, join us and take control of your career and your future.§        §Why GHD Advisory?§        §Why waste a single day doing work that isn’t an investment in your future? At GHD Advisory, you will join a team of passionate individuals, many of them leaders in their field, who are also the owners of our business. This ownership is what sets us apart. It means our people enjoy an unrivalled amount of autonomy in their roles. It is also what drives our commitment and accountability in how we serve our clients, deliver projects, and pursue new opportunities. §        §GHD is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities and invites applications from people of all nationalities, genders, and cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders. §        §Interested? Please click on the link below to lodge your CV and cover letter.§ Contact Davin Grikis§E§ §davin.grikis@ghd.com§ §        §#LI-DG1§        §        §        §        §        §      §      §      §    §    §www.ghd.com/advisory§  §§§   §Do you enjoy consultancy and leading a team? Does the opportunity to be part of our team responsible for growing the business globally sound like the move you are looking for?§ §Movement Strategies joined GHD earlier this year, and we are now looking to expand our team in this exciting phase.§ §About Movement Strategies§ §People movement is not simply a theoretical exercise. jobTitle: Corporate Services Section Manager Job in Katherine & Northern Australia - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50642864.txt	§Corporate Services Section Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Services Section Manager§§Advertiser: §Employment Office§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Katherine & Northern Australia§§Salary§§$134,920 - $151,715 + super, accommodation & more!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Corporate Services Section Manager §      §        §          §Integral senior management opportunity within an Aboriginal community-controlled primary health care service in remote NT§          §Attractive remuneration circa $134,920 - $151,715 + super, negotiable with skills and experience§          §Amazing further benefits including 6 weeks annual leave, salary sacrificing, free gym membership, free general dentistry, and an annual professional development allowance!§        §        §About the Organisation§        §Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation§ (AHAC) is a multi-disciplinary organisation which provides primary health care services to the Aboriginal people of Tennant Creek and the surrounding Barkly region.§Anyinginyi §consists of five different sections (Health Centre, Corporate Services, Public Health Unit, Sports and Recreation, and Piliyintinji-Ki Stronger Families) which allow them to have a holistic approach to health ensuring that clients' physical and emotional health and wellbeing is given the utmost priority.§        §Anyinginyi§'s vision is Aboriginal people in the Barkly region enjoy equity in health status with that of other Australian citizens. Anyinginyi's purpose is to be a provider of high quality holistic primary health care services focusing on the Aboriginal communities of the Barkly region in a culturally responsive way. §        §About the Opportunity §        §Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation§ §has an exciting opportunity for a full-time §Corporate Services Section Manager§ to join their team based in Tennant Creek, on a full-time, permanent basis.§        §In partnership with the Executive Management Team and reporting to the General Manager, this position will see you responsible for §driving systems improvement, performance and strategy across key performance domains including Finance, ICT, Fleet, Facilities, Infrastructure, WHS, Risk and Business Development§.§        §Some of your key duties will include, but will not be limited to:§        §          §Providing scheduled reports to the Executive Management Team, project working groups, Audit & Risk Management Committee and the Board;§          §Working closely with the Executive Management Team to achieve sustainable outcomes for the Strategic Plan, as well as on projects and ongoing operations;§          §Mentoring, supervising and effectively resourcing reports, ensuring structure, roles and functions reflect organisational priorities;§          §Further developing the financial management framework, policies and procedures;§          §Overseeing and providing an ongoing review of the implementation of the Risk Management Framework; and§          §Complying with program guidelines, work plans, budget, data and reporting requirements while working within relevant parameters and scope of practice.§        §        §About the Benefits§        §This is a multifaceted and strategic role where you will §truly make a difference§ to the continued success of the organisation and §experience real job satisfaction§ every day - don't miss out!§        §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with an §attractive remuneration circa $131,629 - $148,014 + super, §negotiable with skills and experience. In addition, you will have access to a range of great benefits including:§        §          §Salary packaging up to $15,899.94;§          §Subsidised furnished accommodation is available for candidates coming from outside of the Barkly region;§          §6 weeks annual leave giving you plenty of time to explore the beautiful Barkly region;§          §Remote Retention Allowance after 12 months of continual service;§          §$1,500 annual allowance for continued professional development;§          §Free general medical;§          §Free general dentistry (excluding laboratory work);§          §Free gym membership; and§          §Free personal medical prescriptions (conditions apply).§        §        §You will be joining a §friendly and professional team§, where you will also receive §personal and professional development opportunities.§        §About the Tennant Creek region§        §Year-round blue skies, stunning landscapes and vibrant, diverse and warm communities - that's life in the Northern Territory! Only a short flight from most Australian cities, Tennant Creek is not just a must-see destination renowned for its individual identity and rich cultural heritage, but is a remarkable community to set up home in!§        §500km north of Alice Springs, Tennant Creek was once a rough and tumble droving town, but is now a modern town and one of the Territory's most populated areas. It is home to a major regional hospital, a CDU campus, schools, shops and a supermarket, accommodation, bars, clubs and restaurants, banking facilities, sporting clubs and an airport - everything you need to set up a relaxing new lifestyle! People from all walks of life find themselves calling Tennant Creek home.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Integral senior management opportunity within an Aboriginal community-controlled primary health care service in remote NT§ §Attractive remuneration circa $134,920 - $151,715 + super, negotiable with skills and experience§ §Amazing further benefits including 6 weeks annual leave, salary sacrificing, free gym membership, free general dentistry, and an annual professional development allowance!§ §About the Organisation§ §Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation§ (AHAC) is a multi-disciplinary organisation which provides primary health care services to the Aboriginal people of Tennant Creek and the surrounding Barkly region.§Anyinginyi §consists of five different sections (Health Centre, Corporate Services, Public Health Unit, Sports and Recreation, and Piliyintinji-Ki Stronger Families) which allow them to have a holistic approach to health ensuring that clients' physical and emotional health and wellbeing is given the utmost priority.§ §Anyinginyi§'s vision is Aboriginal people in the Barkly region enjoy equity in health status with that of other Australian citizens. Anyinginyi's purpose is to be a provider of high quality holistic primary health care services focusing on the Aboriginal communities of the Barkly region in a culturally responsive way. § §About the Opportunity § §Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation§ §has an exciting opportunity for a full-time §Corporate Services Section Manager§ to join their team based in Tennant Creek, on a full-time, permanent basis.§ §In partnership with the Executive Management Team and reporting to the General Manager, this position will see you responsible for §driving systems improvement, performance and strategy across key performance domains including Finance, ICT, Fleet, Facilities, Infrastructure, WHS, Risk and Business Development§.§ §Some of your key duties will include, but will not be limited to:§ § §Providing scheduled reports to the Executive Management Team, project working groups, Audit & Risk Management Committee and the Board;§ §Working closely with the Executive Management Team to achieve sustainable outcomes for the Strategic Plan, as well as on projects and ongoing operations;§ §Mentoring, supervising and effectively resourcing reports, ensuring structure, roles and functions reflect organisational priorities;§ §Further developing the financial management framework, policies and procedures;§ §Overseeing and providing an ongoing review of the implementation of the Risk Management Framework; and§ §Complying with program guidelines, work plans, budget, data and reporting requirements while working within relevant parameters and scope of practice.§ §About the Benefits§ §This is a multifaceted and strategic role where you will §truly make a difference§ to the continued success of the organisation and §experience real job satisfaction§ every day - don't miss out!§ §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with an §attractive remuneration circa $131,629 - $148,014 + super, §negotiable with skills and experience. In addition, you will have access to a range of great benefits including:§ § §Salary packaging up to $15,899.94;§ §Subsidised furnished accommodation is available for candidates coming from outside of the Barkly region;§ §6 weeks annual leave giving you plenty of time to explore the beautiful Barkly region;§ §Remote Retention Allowance after 12 months of continual service;§ §$1,500 annual allowance for continued professional development;§ §Free general medical;§ §Free general dentistry (excluding laboratory work);§ §Free gym membership; and§ §Free personal medical prescriptions (conditions apply).§ §You will be joining a §friendly and professional team§, where you will also receive §personal and professional development opportunities.§ §About the Tennant Creek region§ §Year-round blue skies, stunning landscapes and vibrant, diverse and warm communities - that's life in the Northern Territory! Only a short flight from most Australian cities, Tennant Creek is not just a must-see destination renowned for its individual identity and rich cultural heritage, but is a remarkable community to set up home in!§ §500km north of Alice Springs, Tennant Creek was once a rough and tumble droving town, but is now a modern town and one of the Territory's most populated areas. It is home to a major regional hospital, a CDU campus, schools, shops and a supermarket, accommodation, bars, clubs and restaurants, banking facilities, sporting clubs and an airport - everything you need to set up a relaxing new lifestyle! People from all walks of life find themselves calling Tennant Creek home.§§§§

jobTitle: Market Insights Analyst Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50601425.txt	§Market Insights Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Market Insights Analyst§§Advertiser: §Penguin Random House§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§As a global book publisher, Penguin Random House has a proud and successful record publishing a diverse range of local and international authors across many genres and platforms. § §We now have an exciting opportunity for a Market Insights Analyst to join our Commercial team. In this role, you will analyse and research available data to help us enact our opportunity-led strategy aimed at accelerating our market growth. Along with strong analytical skills, you will demonstrate the ability to translate data into commercially viable insights.  You will work closely with stakeholders across sales, marketing and publicity to ensure we are reacting with speed to consumer signals, tracking campaign outcomes and gathering and refining learnings for continuous improvement.§ §Key responsibilities will include:§ § §Collect, analyse and synthesize data to generate actionable insights and promote fast paced decision making and experimentation.§ §Proactively contribute insights and ideas to key stakeholders that will inform tactical campaign activities.§ §Define KPIs and a performance measurement framework§ §Set campaign goals and processes for tracking, testing and best practice measurements§ §Assist in reporting on key data e.g. POS data, website, social media and email§ §You will have:§ § §Experience in a Marketing and/or Insights Analyst or similar role§ §Knowledge of Google Analytics, SEM campaign strategies and SEO practices§ §Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel§ §Experience using data visualisation and BI tools - Tableau and Business Objects experience is desirable§ §Strong analytical abilities§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Strong stakeholder management skills§ §Ability to react quickly and deliver to deadlines§ §To register your interest, please apply with your cover letter and resume. If you have any questions please email jobs@penguinrandomhouse.com.au§ §Penguin Random House is committed to providing a workplace and culture that values diversity and inclusion across all levels of the business. We recognise and acknowledge the contribution of people with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. This includes, however is not limited to, differences in gender, age, disability, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, family status and disability.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Business Development Manager Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50592845.txt	§Business Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Manager§§Advertiser: §National Landcare Network§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$120,000 - $129,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§The NLN:§The National Landcare Network (NLN) is the peak representative body for Landcare groups across Australia and works to provide a voice for community Landcare at the national level. The NLN is made up of the peak Landcare bodies in each State and Territory, who come together to represent, support and foster the community Landcare movement.§The NLN advocates for the community Landcare movement to enable it to continue its essential work building resilient and productive landscapes and protecting our natural environment.§‘Landcare’ is a community-based approach to managing and protecting our natural resources- creating more productive and sustainable farms, conserving our environment, and building more cohesive and resilient communities for the future. §The Role:§The National Landcare Network Ltd (NLN) is seeking a Business Development Manager to assist the NLN to represent, support and foster the community Landcare movement by identifying and developing partnership, marketing and funding opportunities.§The successful applicant will have a good understanding of the grant-making and philanthropic sectors, a knowledge of government and parliamentary processes, strong relevant networks, and familiarity with the Landcare movement and/or Natural Resource Management policy settings in Australia. The role requires considerable initiative and and the ability to work remotely from home as part of a small team.§Functions:§In support of the CEO, identify and explore new opportunities for the NLN to engage with stakeholders.§Seek out new partnership and funding opportunities.§Negotiate, write and present program and partnership proposals.§Develop funding, sponsorship and philanthropic submissions on behalf of the NLN.§Develop Landcare promotional material to advocate the value of Landcare and partnership opportunities for the NLN.§Support delivery of the Federal Parliamentary Friends of Landcare including developing communication materials and events.§Work collaboratively with state and territory peak Landcare bodies in delivering these functions.§Further details:§This is a remote/work from home role.§The location for this role is negotiable.§12-month part-time contract (up to 18.75 hrs per week).§Renumeration: Services agreement by negotiation.§To apply:§Please provide your current CV with two referees.§Please provide a Cover Letter detailing your experience against the functions of the role.§For more information please email §contact@nln.org.au§. If you wish to discuss this role further, please advise so in your email.§§§§

assurance, transactions, economics, finance and digital § §Working across all GHD market sectors including Property and Buildings, Transport and Infrastructure. § §What you will bring to the team:§ management  § §A background in asset management life cycle would be desirable § §Commercial acumen  § §Proven ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships  § §Exceptional written and verbal communication skills§ §Our commitment to you§ § §Fostering gender balance, diversity and acceptance of flexible working is central to the way GHD Advisory does business. We offer a professional, friendly and inclusive culture based on our core values of Safety, Teamwork, Respect and Integrity.§ In addition to a competitive salary, GHD Advisory provides attractive career options including professional development via our GHD Business School, additional leave, and family-friendly flexible work arrangements.§Why GHD Advisory?§ Why waste a single day doing work that isn’t an investment in your future? In return, we offer remarkable career shaping opportunities to extend your skills and gain global experience.§ If this is the kind of investment you would like to make with your talent, join us and take control of your career and your future.§§Interested? §Please click the apply now button to apply. The ad closes on Friday 2 October.§ §GHD is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities and invites applications from people of all nationalities, genders, and cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders.§Contact Davin Grikis – Talent Acquisition Business Partner§E§: §Davin.grikis@ghd.com§ §#LI-DG1§§§§

jobText: TXT/50582889.txt	§Manager - Management Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Management Consulting§§Advertiser: §Paxton Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§ § §Specialist health and human services consultancy § § § §Make an impact in our growing evaluation practice § § § §Collegiate team and flexible work environment § § § § §The Opportunity § §An opportunity exists to join our specialist health and human services management consultancy firm and support an expanding suite of interesting and impactful evaluation and performance management work. § §We are looking for engaging, self-motivated, team-oriented professionals with proven problem solving and communication skills who have a passion for translating data and evidence into meaningful insights. The role is suitable for either experienced consultants or public policy professionals looking to transition to management consulting. § §Working alongside the directors, this role will require you to actively contribute to building the firm’s client and business relationships, drive project design and concept development, lead project teams of experienced consultants and actively participate in delivering a diverse range of client engagements. Some interstate travel required. § § § §To be successful in this role you will: § §The Position: § § § §Be able to critically appraise, generate, analyse, collate and distil disparate data and evidence (both quantitative and qualitative) into concise and compelling messages that influence change § § § §Have demonstrated experience in designing and applying a range of contemporary evaluation, research, and analytical methods § § § §Have outstanding written and verbal communication and presentation skills § § § §Have sound knowledge of the health and human services sectors in Australia § § § §Have proven experience working across multiple projects simultaneously § § § §Be comfortable with delivering work within tight timeframes and to high quality § § § §Be comfortable working in a team environment as well as autonomously § § § §Have tertiary qualifications in a relevant field or health related discipline and/or equivalent experience. § § § § §Project Delivery: § § § §Project manage multiple client engagements and project teams, ensuring project timelines and budgets are achieved § § § §Lead strategic approaches to analysis and problem solving § § § §Apply a disciplined and systematic approach to managing quality of team outputs § § § §Strategically manage communication and relationships with clients, internal and external stakeholders  § § § §Prepare high quality, tailored client reports in a range of formats to communicate problems and solutions in plain language § § § §Lead innovative approaches to methodology development § § § §Possess strong skills in the Microsoft product suite (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint). § § § § §Business Development: § § § §Develop competitive tender proposals § § § §Develop new direct business opportunities with clients through brand and service development, and strategies to identify new client opportunities § § § §Work closely with the Directors to develop ongoing innovative approaches and methodologies to deliver service offerings in line with contemporary industry developments. § § § § §Other:  § § § §Undertake continuous personal development to ensure currency of skills and expertise § § § §Develop a personal profile of expertise and leadership in the industry or technical aspects of the solutions offered by the firm § § § §Contribute to development of the team through leadership, coaching and mentoring team members. § § § § §Advantageous Skills and Experience: § § § §Track record of success in a business advisory or management consulting role § § § §Experience in economic/cost-benefit and quantitative analysis is advantageous § § § §Demonstrated experience in managing direct client relationships § § § §Demonstrated experience in team leadership. § § § § §About the team § §Established for over 20 years, Paxton Partners has a strong reputation for providing management consulting, corporate advisory and project management services to funders, state and federal departments, private, public and not for profit healthcare providers and investors across the Australian health and human services sector.  § §We believe a great job is more than just using your skills – it's also important to enjoy the work you do and the people you work with. Our company values the health, happiness and career development of every team member and we actively implement ways we can stay engaged and connected even when we aren’t in the same physical space.  We like to take a friendly approach to our internal catchups, enjoy a relaxed social chat at the end of the week and regularly host social activities. Additionally, we invite all team members to participate in the direction and growth of the firm with company-wide planning days.  § § § §Diversity & Inclusion § §Paxton Partners demonstrates a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion. We encourage all interested applicants to apply regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or other differences.  § §If you are successful in this role, we are open to discussing flexible working arrangements to make this work for everyone. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

You will §finish each day knowing that you have made a genuine, positive difference§ to the communities supported by the program.§  §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with an§ attractive salary circa $70,000 - $80,000,§ §commensurate with your skills and experience, §plus super and salary packaging up to $15,999.§  §As a growing organisation,§ BWAHS§ offers great§ job security§, and is committed to investing in their staff, with §ongoing training and professional development§ opportunities.§  §Finally, you'll also benefit from a§ fantastic work/life balance§, with the potential for §flexible work §arrangements.§  §This is a rare opportunity to join an organisation that's doing real, meaningful work to support vulnerable members of Melbourne's Aboriginal communities - Apply Now!§§§§

jobTitle: Policy Governance Specialist Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630473.txt	§Policy Governance Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy Governance Specialist§§Advertiser: §Uniting NSW & ACT§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§Excellent Salary Packaging Benefits available§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Policy Governance Specialist   North Parramatta location§§About us §At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. We work to inspire people, enliven communities, and confront injustice.§Our services are in the areas of aged care and disability, community services, and chaplaincy and we get involved in social justice and advocacy issues that impact the people we serve.  We commit to respecting children and take action to keep them safe.§As an organisation, we celebrate our diversity and welcome all people regardless of lifestyle choices, ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, and gender identity.§We are§ bold, imaginative, respectful, §and §compassionate §§About the role§This role is within the Governance, Risk, and Quality Directorate reporting to the head of Quality and Service Improvement.§This fantastic, full-time permanent role is located at our beautiful North Parramatta Campus, there is plenty of off-street parking available. We are a welcoming and dedicated team, we offer on-going learning and development opportunities, generous salary packaging, and a wide range of benefits.§You will play a key role as a member of the Quality and Service Improvement team in developing a stronger and more unified Uniting. Defining the priorities and appropriate outcomes for the Quality and Service Improvement team and your specific areas of accountability, working with your colleagues to translate service stream strategies into relevant plans and support the priorities and focus areas.§As Policy Governance Specialist, your role specifically will:§§Provide support and guidance to staff on the policy development process and alignment of policies and related documents to the policy framework.§Manage, maintain and seek improvements to the organisational SharePoint policy document system§Monitor policy registers to ensure document review timeframes are met.§Provide consultation and feedback to policy developers to ensure they are consistent and meet best practice from a document effectiveness aspect.§Coordinate the Uniting policy panel as part of the consultation process for organisational policies and procedures.§Streamline systems and processes to support greater efficiencies in the management of policy and procedure approvals, implementation, and evaluation.§§Qualifications & Experience§§Bachelor qualification in a relevant field with equivalent experience§§Typically this role will require 5 or more years' experience in your field of expertise.§§Prior experience administering and supporting policy governance frameworks across corporate, government and/or industry regulatory bodies.§Effective forward planning, coordination, prioritisation, and management of tasks to stakeholder expectations and timeframes.§Experience in the development, review, and implementation of policy§Good data/trend analysis, research and reporting skills§High level of analytical ability and sound judgment§Excellent interpersonal skills (perceptive, diplomatic, cheerful, 'can do' attitude) and the ability to develop and maintain professional relationships.§Advanced proficiency in SharePoint and MS office suite§§Even better§§Sound experience/understanding of the human services sector§Understanding of or experience in compliance and audit methodology§Understanding of the human services legislative and regulatory environment§§PD - Policy Governance Specialist.pdf§For all enquiries, please email Louise Massie §lmassie@uniting.org§ or call §0468 341 590§ for a confidential discussion.§Uniting is proud to be an EEO employer. Uniting supports an inclusive approach in the workplace. §Employment with Uniting is subject to satisfactory background checks which may include a national police check, reference checks, and working with children checks.§Please apply asap as applications will be assessed once received.§Closing date for all applications October 12, 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Sustainability Officer Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50708661.txt	§Senior Sustainability Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Sustainability Officer§§Advertiser: §Moonee Valley City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Sustainability Officer §      §        §Senior Sustainability Officer §        §Reference number:§ 13382§        §Closing date:§  11:45pm, Friday 23 October 2020§        §          §Permanent Part Time§          §23.5 hours per week§          §Classified as a Band 6§          §$44.45 to $49.41 per hour +9.5% Superannuation     §        §        § §        §About Us§        §Moonee Valley City Council is a vibrant and diverse municipality. We are a local government within the north-west metropolitan area of Melbourne, providing a range of services to some 118,000 residents and over 10,000 businesses.§        § §        §The Opportunity §        §Moonee Valley City Council’s City Futures Unit is currently seeking a Senior Sustainability Officer to join a committed and passionate Sustainability Team. It is a great opportunity to develop and deliver community sustainability and staff engagement programs, and contribute to a range of environmental sustainability programs including climate change adaptation and resilience within the community.§        § §        §The Senior Sustainability Officer will be responsible for policy and projects that contribute towards creating a sustainable city and Council’s commitment to achieving zero net emissions community by 2040, and a city that achieves climate resilience through supporting the community to adapt to a changing climate.§        §Responsibilities§        §          §Develop and deliver Council’s community sustainability and staff engagement programs to create a city that achieves climate resilience through supporting the community to adapt to a changing climate;§          §Engage with a range of internal and external stakeholders and partner organisations to develop partnerships and deliver projects and programs; and§          §Coordinate the design and delivery of community sustainability initiatives including events, campaigns, residential programs and other engagement activities. Acting with autonomy, build relationships with community members and groups, provide advice and support community led initiatives.§        §        § §About You§        §          §Relevant tertiary qualification in Environmental Science, Environmental Management, Environmental Engineering or a related field.§          §Practical experience in designing and delivering community sustainability projects to reduce carbon emissions, and address climate change adaptation measures;§          §Demonstrated experience and/or knowledge of the broad range of issues associated with environmental sustainability for Local Government;§          §Relevant experience in delivering programs from scoping through to implementation, ensuring delivery within agreed budget and timeframes; Highly developed analytical and written communication skills, including reports and communications materials; and§          §Demonstrated effective interpersonal communication skills, including building and maintaining effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders and ability to participate in successful cross-organisational projects.§        §        § §        §Next Steps§Applications must be submitted through our online system §https://mooneevalley.mercury.com.au/§        §and should be in line with the Moonee Valley City Council Application Guide found at the bottom of the advertisement. Applications that do not meet these requirements may not be considered.§        §For further information please view the Position Description or contact Sarah Wighley on §(03) 9243 1164§.§        § §        §Benefits§        §At Moonee Valley City Council, we provide a number of benefits to our valued employees including:§        §          §Flexible work opportunities§          §Local Government Employees Health Plan§          §Novated vehicle leasing§          §Employee assistance  programs / phone or in person counselling services§        §        § §        §Our Culture of Inclusion§        §If you are interested in the role but feel you may not meet the full range of selection criteria, we encourage you to contact us to discuss your experience and application for this position.§        § §        §We don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our services and our community. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace work agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.§        § §        §Moonee Valley City Council is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer and we value diversity and encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, people of any age or gender, people identifying as lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and gender diverse, intersex and/or queer (LGBTIQA+) and people with disability. If you have a reasonable adjustment, support or access requirement, we encourage you to let us know through your application or email §H2@mvcc.vic.gov.au§ or call §9243 1122§.§§Enquiries:§ Sarah Wigley§Ph:§ §(04) 0208 3900§Applications Close:§ 23/10/2020§      §      §Sarah Wigley§(04) 0208 3900§swigley@mvcc.vic.gov.au§ §    §    §  §§§Senior Sustainability Officer §Reference number:§ 13382§Closing date:§  11:45pm, Friday 23 October 2020§Permanent Part Time§23.5 hours per week§Classified as a Band 6§$44.45 to $49.41 per hour +9.5% Superannuation     § §About Us§Moonee Valley City Council is a vibrant and diverse municipality. We are a local government within the north-west metropolitan area of Melbourne, providing a range of services to some 118,000 residents and over 10,000 businesses.§ §The Opportunity §Moonee Valley City Council’s City Futures Unit is currently seeking a Senior Sustainability Officer to join a committed and passionate Sustainability Team. It is a great opportunity to develop and deliver community sustainability and staff engagement programs, and contribute to a range of environmental sustainability programs including climate change adaptation and resilience within the community.§ §The Senior Sustainability Officer will be responsible for policy and projects that contribute towards creating a sustainable city and Council’s commitment to achieving zero net emissions community by 2040, and a city that achieves climate resilience through supporting the community to adapt to a changing climate.§Responsibilities§Develop and deliver Council’s community sustainability and staff engagement programs to create a city that achieves climate resilience through supporting the community to adapt to a changing climate;§Engage with a range of internal and external stakeholders and partner organisations to develop partnerships and deliver projects and programs; and§Coordinate the design and delivery of community sustainability initiatives including events, campaigns, residential programs and other engagement activities. Acting with autonomy, build relationships with community members and groups, provide advice and support community led initiatives.§ §About You§Relevant tertiary qualification in Environmental Science, Environmental Management, Environmental Engineering or a related field.§Practical experience in designing and delivering community sustainability projects to reduce carbon emissions, and address climate change adaptation measures;§Demonstrated experience and/or knowledge of the broad range of issues associated with environmental sustainability for Local Government;§Relevant experience in delivering programs from scoping through to implementation, ensuring delivery within agreed budget and timeframes; Highly developed analytical and written communication skills, including reports and communications materials; and§Demonstrated effective interpersonal communication skills, including building and maintaining effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders and ability to participate in successful cross-organisational projects.§ §Next Steps§Applications must be submitted through our online system §https://mooneevalley.mercury.com.au/§and should be in line with the Moonee Valley City Council Application Guide found at the bottom of the advertisement. Applications that do not meet these requirements may not be considered.§For further information please view the Position Description or contact Sarah Wighley on §(03) 9243 1164§.§ §Benefits§At Moonee Valley City Council, we provide a number of benefits to our valued employees including:§Flexible work opportunities§Local Government Employees Health Plan§Novated vehicle leasing§Employee assistance  programs / phone or in person counselling services§ §Our Culture of Inclusion§§If you are interested in the role but feel you may not meet the full range of selection criteria, we encourage you to contact us to discuss your experience and application for this position.§ §We don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our services and our community. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace work agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.§ §Moonee Valley City Council is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer and we value diversity and encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, people of any age or gender, people identifying as lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and gender diverse, intersex and/or queer (LGBTIQA+) and people with disability. If you have a reasonable adjustment, support or access requirement, we encourage you to let us know through your application or email §H2@mvcc.vic.gov.au§ or call §9243 1122§.§§Enquiries:§ Sarah Wigley§Ph:§ §(04) 0208 3900§Applications Close:§ 23/10/2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Commercial Planning Analyst Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50699715.txt	§Senior Commercial Planning Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Commercial Planning Analyst§§Advertiser: §FRANKiE4 Footwear§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Senior Commercial Planning Analyst§– FRANKiE4 footwear§ §Indooroopilly - Brisbane§ §FRANKiE4 footwear is leading the way in healthy, comfortable and fashionable footwear for women in Australia. Our rapidly growing, award-winning label is looking for a skilled Senior Commercial Planning Analyst with a focus on continuing to grow the business with sound decision making.§ §FRANKiE4 footwear is searching for someone who has experience in developing & leading our growth and inventory strategies. This role is key in coordinating back-of-house operations through efficient use of systems and process, utilising trends and data analysis to forecast supply and demand requirements, while ensuring our supply-chain and inventory processes are streamlined.  You will be working closely with our Senior Management team, reporting to the CFO.§ §As we enter an exciting new phase with domestic and international expansion, this role is critical in ensuring we can successfully implement and execute our short, medium and long-term strategies.§ §The Commercial Planning Analyst will be responsible for:§ § §Efficient use of current and future technology to support sound, balanced decisions around ongoing supply and demand requirements.§ §Build and develop clear communications with marketing, design, and wholesale teams to gather insight for future planning§ §Budget and forecast modelling§ §Strategic Commercial & Business analysis§ §Utilise data, historical trends, and design content for informed decision-making§ §Partner with the business to implement inventory strategies§ §Refine and update forecasting and planning models in line with business developments§ § Foresee technical needs to meet demand and develop successful strategies§ § Generating critical insights to be utilised by senior management in strategy development§ §Supply Chain & Inventory Management§ § § Partner with the CFO and other business teams to streamline the end-to-end processes§ §Consistently seek improvements and increased efficiencies through systems and process§ §Ensure inventory and supply chain capabilities match demand forecasts§ §Coordinate stock ordering with various distribution and sales centres to achieve operational efficiencies while minimising costs§ §Monitor inventory and stock levels, collaborating across the business for positive outcomes§ §We supply any training and support you might need; however, our ideal candidate will hit the ground running, their experience and knowledge backing them in taking our Demand and Supply management to the next level!§ §What we will provide:§ § § All equipment and programs needed;§ §Great staff rates and benefits;§ §Weekly pay;§ §Beautiful, modern, dog friendly office; and§ §A supportive, experienced team.§ § § §Experience Desired§ § §5+ years’ experience as a business analyst in a fast paced, growing company§ §Experience using Shopify and CIN7 desired§ § Demonstrated knowledge of planning systems and process§ §Knowledge of Power BI and data modelling§ §Confidence in drawing data and historical trends to create forecast models§ §Experience in co-ordinating across global markets§ §Understanding wider business operations, with a focus on streamlined efficiency§ §Are you highly organised, fantastic at verbal and written communication skills, and ready to help take FRANKiE4 footwear to the next level?§ §If so, we want to hear from you!§ § § §Learn more about us at www.frankie4.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have with forecasting for businesses?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Corporate Modelling Analyst Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50616130.txt	§Corporate Modelling Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Modelling Analyst§§Advertiser: §West Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§c. $120 - 140k + super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§The Employer§A defined market leader, this multi-billion dollar business is currently undertaking a strategic change in direction which will include acquisitions and high value growth projects. This business is at the forefront of a competitive industry and has built a highly respected brand and market reputation. With growth of this magnitude comes opportunity, and now is an opportune time to join the team.§ §The Opportunity§A newly created role within the Corporate finance team, the Corporate Modelling Analyst will have direct interaction with the CFO, Pillar leaders and other Exec level stakeholders. The core function of this role is to manage the manage the group corporate model for the entire business. The successful applicant will partner with Stakeholders who have input into the model to ensure accuracy and integrity with the data to then provide analysis and insights for presentation at board level.§Other key tasks aligned to this role will include:§ § §Develop other financial models for investment valuation, cashflow and debt structures including scenario based and ‘what if’ based modelling and sensitivity analysis§ §Assist with the Annual Budgeting program for the group including preparation of Forecasts§ §Provide decision support through insightful analysis and commentary.§ § §The Successful Applicant§ § §Will hold a professional qualification, (CFA, Chartered Accountant, CPA or MBA)§ §Has extensive financial Modelling experience including building and / or maintaining complex working models.§ §Can demonstrate experience and knowledge with investment analysis, Mergers / Acquisitions, Valuations, Treasury / debt finance & Cashflow§ §Will have a background in the Professional services firm (Big 4/ or Mid tier), Private Equity, Investment banking or Corporate finance sectors.§ §Interpersonally, you are inquisitive by nature with a strong attention to detail. You have a track record of effectively supporting Executive level stakeholders in a fast paced environment.§ § §To apply use the Apply Now button or for further information and a confidential discussion please contact Courtney on §0415 401 493§.§§§§

VIC. 3168§ §Reports to: General Manager – Training & Operations (GM)§ §Civil Contractors Federation Victoria§ §CCF Victoria is the leading membership body for the civil construction industry in Victoria and exists to support its civil contractor members grow successful businesses.  Its mission is to build capacity and capability within the Civil Construction Industry.§ §As a key member of the Leadership team within this department / function, the role is responsible for the efficient management and delivery and reporting of CCF Victoria’s portfolio of existing grant funding agreements. Also accountable for actively researching and pursuing grant funding opportunities at both state and federal government level as well as ensuring continuity of existing funding by preparing funding §Demonstrated experience in a grants management role including co-ordinating competitive grant funding rounds, or demonstrated experience in coordinating applications to competitive grant funding rounds§ §Prior experience in successfully managing a diverse grants portfolio;§ §Demonstrated leadership skills building high performing teams§ §Proven ability to deal with competing deadlines and to jobTitle: Creative Agri Business Analyst Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50572381.txt	§Creative Agri Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Creative Agri Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §Greenleaf Enterprises§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Are you ready to equip some of Australia’s largest food, agriculture and meat companies and their supply chains with the right decision-making tools to help them grow all the way to the top? We need you to make the difference!§  §Based in Brisbane, Greenleaf Enterprises is a small but diverse consulting company helping develop and implement business strategies with data science to promote growth and increased profitability for our clients, some of the largest global companies in the food and manufacturing industries.§  §An exciting opportunity exists for a passionate, experienced and highly motivated creative thinker to join our team, as we grow with our clients. We are a close-knit team that values the diversity of skills and capabilities in our people to find the best solutions for our clients and our business. Work-life balance is important in supporting families. This position gives:§  §1. The ability to choose their own working hours during the day§2. Extra time off for additional hours worked§3. The ability to work from home§  §What your team will require of you:§  §You will be key supporter of close effective teams, able to demonstrate the following:§ § §See the other person, their perspective, and their skills with appreciation (even though very different to yours) with care for them as a person§ §Challenge others to achieve team vision in greater ways while encouraging everyone to grow professionally and personally§ §Passionate in seeing things differently to create more valuable solutions for our clients§ §Humble and hungry – to deliver high value to clients as a team player§ §Maturity to adapt and “shoulder-in” to rise to the occasion in high pressure situations and to encourage others§ §Key responsibilities:§  §You will be responsible for managing projects against milestones and budgets including proposals, analysis, recommendations and implementation.§  §The situations we are presented can be unique as are the solutions we provide which requires creativity and complex problem solving capabilities. If you are uncomfortable with change, or rely on predefined processes, procedures or solutions this job is not for you.§  §Detailed activities may include:§ § §Constructing economic modelling of business processes and to analyse, interpret, and report findings as written recommendations.§ §Conduct research and analysis of industry information, market dynamics and trends, and strategic drivers in order to provide recommendations and advice.§ §Supporting or leading supply chain improvement and network optimisation projects within the agriculture, manufacturing and resources industries.§ §Summarise findings from complex problems into succinct recommendations and value propositions for clients using highly developed written skills and face to face presentations.§ §Develop and document business cases, business process improvements, business requirements, functional requirements and system requirements to deliver targeted client solutions.§ §About You:§  §This role is best suited to an enthusiastic self-starter who has capacity to adapt and quickly develop new capabilities and enjoys a challenge. You will:§ § §Have a creative and questioning mind that loves to solve business problems§ §Understand new concepts quickly§ §Possess the initiative and analytical capability to work through complex problems, data sets, and situations effectively and triangulate missing data through risk managed processes§ §Have the ability to identify the key solutions to achieve strategic objectives§ §Have the ability to see data and reports in terms of their organisational and business value, displaying key findings to the executive level that supports your effective communication skills§ §Demonstrate highly developed business report writing, presentation and communication skills§ §Ability to gather your audience to quickly appreciate the key message§ §Your skills and experience:§  §You will be degree qualified and able to demonstrate the following:§ § §Operate effectively in a team but are equally adept at working autonomously.§ §Handle multiple priorities and work to tight deadlines under pressure§ §Employ initiative to identify opportunities and find effective and innovative new solutions with a "CAN DO" attitude;§ §Demonstrate high level proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, including ADVANCED Excel, Word and PowerPoint.§ §Enjoy writing to clearly communicate and facilitate knowledge transfer.§ §If you think this sounds like you we look forward to hearing from you.§Note: All applications must include a response to the following questions:§  §1. What are the biggest challenges in a collaborative multi-discipline team on complex consulting project?§  §2. What would you do to support team-work that delivers value beyond client expectations?§  §3. In your experience, what is the best way to see things differently in problem solving?§  §Please attach your cover letter, resume and question responses online as part of the application process.§Applications close 16th October 2020§  §Apply at §careers@greenleaf.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Data Analyst - Road Safety Job in South West Coast VIC - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50698465.txt	§Senior Data Analyst - Road Safety§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Data Analyst - Road Safety§§Advertiser: §TAC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§South West Coast VIC§§Salary§§Salary $109, 801 base, plus superannuation§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Senior Data Analyst§§Full time, fixed term role for 6 months§Geelong location (working from home currently)§Salary $109, 801 base, plus superannuation§§At the TAC our mission is to be the world’s leading social insurer, and to keep all Victorians safe on our roads.  We're passionate about our purpose, and supporting the careers and wellbeing of our people.§Culture and Benefits§We foster an engaged and inclusive culture; our 2019 survey results show 95% of our employees feel proud to work for the TAC.  Our people enjoy a range of rewarding benefits, including:§§Competitive remuneration, annual bonus and salary packaging options§Genuine work-life balance with attractive leave options and work flexibility§A comprehensive wellbeing calendar of events and initiatives§Extensive professional development opportunities§§Read more here: §http://www.tac.vic.gov.au/about-the-tac/careers§§Diversity and Inclusion§The TAC promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome and value unique contributions of all people, and is committed to diversity and social inclusion in our employment practices. We strongly encourage people with disability and diverse backgrounds to apply for our roles.§If we can assist you with any reasonable adjustments in order to submit your application for this role, please contact the TAC People & Culture Team on §(03) 5225 7500§ or via email at §People_Culture@tac.vic.gov.au§ noting your preferred method of communication and contact details and a member of the team will be in touch.§About the Role§Work with some of the best road safety data in the world, to ultimately assist the Victorian community to reduce the frequency and severity of transport accidents. In this role you will conduct advanced statistical analysis using a variety of quantitative data sources including insurance claims data, crash data and other data required for monitoring road trauma trends and the promotion of road safety, including market and social research survey data (road safety attitudes and behaviour). §Day to day tasks will include:§§Conduct analysis and reporting of road safety data to provide insight into fatality and serious injury statistics§Provide detailed analysis, statistical information and evidence-based advice§Simplify and translate complex research findings to address practical road safety challenges§Represent the TAC on internal and external committees§Keep abreast of the relevant road safety and injury prevention academic literature§§About You§To be successful in this role, you’ll ideally possess the following skills and attributes:§§Tertiary qualification in mathematics / statistics / psychology or other relevant discipline§Strong problem solving, statistical and conceptual skills§Proven ability to simplify data and translate results to provide actionable insights and meaningful recommendations§An understanding of quantitative research methods with the ability to plan and conduct evaluations§Knowledge of road safety research, principles and practice§Strong communication and stakeholder management skills§§How to Apply§Click §APPLY§ or contact Paulette Ziekemijjer by emailing §Paulette_Ziekemijjer@tac.vic.gov.au§ for further information.  Applications for this role will be accepted up until 11:55pm on Sunday 18th October 2020. §  §§ §Senior Data Analyst - PD.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Property Research and Advisory Consultant Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50652963.txt	§Senior Property Research and Advisory Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Property Research and Advisory Consultant§§Advertiser: §One Fell Swoop§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$110,000 - $119,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§A rare opportunity to play a leading role in the evolution of retirement living and aged care through the provision of innovative property and demographic research, market assessments, financial modelling, and leading-edge advice.§ §About the business§ §One Fell Swoop is the leading provider of Advisory, Marketing and Sales services for the retirement living and aged care sectors. Our innovative, practical advice is carefully and efficiently implemented. It begins with sound research, consumer understanding and extensive experience. Bold thinking, creatively applied, expertly delivered.§ §Our clients include some of the largest players in the industry including not-for-profit organisations and those seeking to expand their operations in this vital and growing sector. We serve the needs of clients nationally from offices in Sydney and Melbourne. This role is Sydney based but will involve some interstate travel.§ §About the role§ §The primary focus of the role is to provide clear and accurate research and insights for our clients’ development projects and operations. You will do this by leading a small, integrated team of analysts researching residential property, retirement communities and aged care and providing detailed market assessments and other types of customised reports that help our clients make key business decisions.§ §The responsibilities of the role include management of multiple projects while driving innovative thinking that supports delivery of well-reasoned, leading-edge reports and advice. Exceptional research capabilities and communication skills are essential to meet the requirements of this role. Sector understanding would be viewed very favourably.§ §Key accountabilities of the role are:§ § §Scoping projects, and preparing well written proposals for client approval that include clear objectives, timings and accurate costings§ §Oversee data collection, research and analysis and financial modelling that are integral to our clients’ decision making processes.§ §Preparation of concise and well written reports that display a high standard of written English§ §Articulate the outcomes of research both internally and to clients§ §Help build and strengthen client relationships in order to grow our business§ §Skills and experience§ §The successful candidate will have completed as a minimum a Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. Economics, Econometrics, Finance, Accounting and/or Statistics) and have a minimum of five years' experience in a similar role within a busy consultancy or research agency.§ §Please note that relevant experience in a property economics consultancy, large provider of retirement living and/or aged care, valuation agency or relevant government department will be highly regarded.  § §You will have had some exposure to the management of professional staff, and must be proactive, well organised and detail focused to succeed in this role.§ §Please apply online and submit your current resume and a covering letter specifically outlining why you are the right person for this role.§ §Applications close Monday October 12, 2020; however, applicants of outstanding quality will be considered ahead of the closing date, so those intending to apply are encouraged to do so promptly.§ §Located in Surry Hills, NSW, the role is a full-time position; however, possible flexible work arrangements will be considered for the right candidate. Only those eligible to work in Australia need apply. One Fell Swoop respects and encourages diversity in our workplace, and we welcome applications from all people who match the criteria outlined above.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§
