jobTitle: Risk, Privacy and Security Advisor Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681592.txt	§Risk, Privacy and Security Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk, Privacy and Security Advisor§§Advertiser: §Cambridge Boxhill Language Assessment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§About CBLA§ §Heading into the new decade, Cambridge Boxhill Language Assessment (CBLA) is excited to lead the way in English language testing for the healthcare sector. Our vision is to connect the world to better healthcare. We are a young and fast-growing global organisation and we set the benchmark for international healthcare communication skills, through industry-wide collaboration, so that internationally trained healthcare professionals can be wherever they are needed.§ §CBLA owns and manages the Occupational English Test (OET). OET is used by healthcare boards, councils, and other healthcare organisations in over 10 countries. The test is available in over 160 locations across 46 countries. We are in the midst of an exciting transformation program that includes converting OET to a digital-first organisation with the launch of new products and services.§ §Our office is situated in Melbourne CBD overlooking the Yarra, making it ideal for commuting from all parts of the city and is an environment that reflects OET's fresh and inviting approach to business.§ §The Role§ §The role of the Risk, Privacy and Security Advisor reports to the Risk and Compliance Manager. This is a key role that is responsible for providing advice and solutions for controlling and reducing privacy and security risks across Cambridge Boxhill Language Assessment (CBLA) and its third-party network. The role will also coordinate CBLA’s auditor network who provides independent and objective assurance validating venues operating effectiveness ensuring they work in an effective, efficient, and ethical manner and in the best interests of CBLA. § §Key Responsibilities§ §The role will encompass a variety of duties across Audit, Security Management, and Privacy Management. You will work with the business to develop, document, and continuously review processes in relation to privacy and security risk. You will also be a key pillar in supporting the investigations of incidents and breaches in cooperation with internal and external stakeholders, providing analytical insights and preventative recommendations.§ §Audit§ § § Coordinate venue audits§ § Review and support Test Delivery Partners (TDP) and venues in accordance with CBLA policies§ § Support the coordination of Auditor Forums and key communication tools across CBLA’s venue auditor network§ §Produce regular progress and trend reports§ §Security Management§ § § Assist in the identification, assessment, and implementation of strategies aimed at reducing identified cybersecurity risks across CBLA’s information platforms§ § Provide guidance and assistance in developing a risk-based audit strategy with a key focus on cybersecurity§ § Identify any and potential security weaknesses and obstacles within CBLA’s programs and systems  § § Ensure compliance is in place for relevant security policies and procedures, including regulatory and legal requirements§ §Privacy Management§ § § Complete compliance and risk assessments and support the implementation of strategies aimed at reducing privacy risks across CBLA’s global portfolio§ § Provide regular reporting on privacy trends§ § Ensure compliance is in place for relevant privacy policies and procedures, including regulatory and legal requirements§ §About You§ §To be considered for this role you will be an emotionally intelligent and adaptable Audit, Risk, and Security specialist with the ability to work in an ever-changing fast-paced environment. You will have an analytical mindset with the ability to form insights and ideas from data and information. You will have a thorough understanding of regulatory, legislative, and contractual requirements and be able to formulate well-constructed recommendations and advice with the view to influence stakeholders. You will have prior experience enhancing and driving risk culture along with demonstrated experience investigating and mitigating fraud and privacy breaches.§ §Experience § § § A minimum of 3+ years in audit, risk, and compliance management experience§ § A minimum of 2+ years in security and privacy management experience§ §Experience working with high stakes assessment and testing would be highly beneficial § §Benefits§ §This role offers a rare chance to partner with the business in an all-encompassing role, whilst being part of a high performing team. You will join a dynamic, growing, and forward-thinking business that you can contribute to in a variety of aspects. OET offers a remarkable work culture, a modern plant-filled workplace overlooking the Yarra, and an opportunity to make your mark.§ §Let your passion thrive in a challenging and expansive role that contributes to creating a better world for our healthcare professionals.§ § If this sounds like an interesting opportunity and you would like to learn more about the opportunity, please click 'Apply for this job'. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50667667.txt	§Park Management Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Park Management Planner§§Advertiser: §Parks Victoria§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§West Gippsland & Latrobe Valley§§Salary§§$98,977 - $106,303§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§Provide analysis and direction on Park Planning§Collaborate with project partners and stakeholders§Ongoing, Full Time role located in Morwell§§About the branch§The position sits in the Park Management Planning Branch within the Park Planning and Policy Directorate which provides park planning and programming advice aligned with the strategic directions of Parks Victoria.§The Park Management Planning Branch manages the statewide framework for multi-park management planning. It prepares management plans for each of Parks Victoria's 16 landscape regions to meet the legislative requirements for National Parks Act 1975 scheduled areas, and the management requirements of other areas of land and water. The Branch integrates environment and conservation, visitor and tourism, cultural heritage, fire and emergency services, and community engagement matters into management plans and master plans, liaises with the government departments on planning and policy implementation issues and ensures that the planning processes are informed by thorough engagement and consultation.§About the role and your responsibilities:  §As the Park Management Planner, you will be responsible for providing analysis and direction for Parks Victoria on priorities and emerging risks and opportunities in managing the Victorian parks system and support the development and delivery of the management plan and master plan program and schedule.§You will also work collaboratively with project partners, external and internal stakeholders and community groups. Projects will be time bound and requires clear focus on delivery timeframes and successful project management. In this role you must have thorough understanding of strategic planning, park management, project management and community engagement to prioritise and track the project.§To be successful for this role you will need: §§A tertiary qualification relating to Planning, Natural Resource Management or Environmental Science and/or equivalent experience in a similar field is desirable.§Demonstrated high level judgement experience in analytical problem solving and decision making.§Demonstrated experience in provision of expert and technical planning advice and support.§Demonstrated track record of leadership in dealing with external stakeholders, at a senior level, on a range of park management issues.§A current Employee Working with Children Check is required.§§ §Your application must include:§§Your current Resume§A cover letter addressing the Key Selection Criteria (KSC) as outlined in the position description§§Join our innovative organisation and enjoy what you do, §apply today!§§Application Closing date: §Sunday 18 October 2020§This position is based at the government services hub in the Latrobe Valley from January 2021.§Only people with Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency may apply for this position.§Parks Victoria requires all prospective employees to undergo a National Police Record Check prior to commencing employment.§§Parks Victoria is committed to child safety and has zero tolerance for child abuse and all forms of harm to children, in accordance with the Victorian Child Safe Standards. All Parks Victoria staff are expected to support this commitment.§§§§

Through advocacy, targeted programs and scholarships we work to remove the barriers to women's progression and ensure equal opportunity for prosperity. We have a vision of women and men having equal economic and social choices, and responsibilities.§ §We are a not for profit organisation. For more information, visit cew.org.au.§ §Qualified candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply for this role and support our strategy for greater inclusion and diversity in Australia. Candidates working remotely are welcome.§ §The Manager, Policy Advocacy and Research role is offered as a 6 month full time contract (immediate start), with the potential for permanent. Four days/flexible hours will be considered for the right applicant.  CEW is located in Sydney's CBD and operates nationally. § § § §PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:§ §This role helps shape, facilitate and implement CEW’s policy, advocacy and thought leadership initiatives in fulfilment of CEW’s mission: women leaders enabling women leaders.  It supports delivery of CEW’s strategy, working with the Director, Policy Advocacy and Research, CEW’s Business Engagement Committee and Members to undertake the following:§ § §Government and Public Advocacy§: support formulation and implementation of CEW’s strategy to advocate for conditions that lead to increased representation of female leadership, including the removal of barriers to progression and equal opportunities for prosperity.§ §Business Engagement:§ help identify, target and influence the conditions that support greater female representation at the most senior levels of corporates, by assisting in the design, implementation and management of campaigns.§ §Evidence based thought leadership§: Together with the Director, develop policy initiatives designed on the basis of CEW (and others) research. Work with CEW’s pro bono partners to design and deliver research in support of CEW’s mission.§ §Partnerships and collaboration:§ Coordinate, plan and support strengthening and development of partnerships with key collaborators including CEW sponsors and supporters, and third sector organisations§ § § §This role requires high levels of collaboration with team members to implement impactful, integrated activity that creates action toward CEW’s strategic outcomes.  It requires demonstrated ability in policy, advocacy, research, thought leadership, and communications, and well-developed project management skills.§ § § §KEY SKILLS/RESPONSIBILITIES:§ § §Policy, Advocacy and Research: §Work with the Director to identify key opportunities for CEW to influence policy through advocacy, based on CEW’s unique capabilities, and CEW and partners research projects.  Includes: § §Supporting a sophisticated policy and advocacy approach, in consultation with the Director, Business Engagement Committee, CEW President and Board, the CEW team and CEO, § §Coordinating the Business Engagement Committee, supporting identification of key areas of potential impact and developing the approach§ §Liaise with partners in research, facilitating launch and associated campaigns, working with the CEW team to deliver high impact activities including events§ §Researching and supporting implementation of policy and advocacy recommendations to support thought leadership leveraging CEW’s pre-eminent member base and potential influence§ §Drafting government submissions, stand alone thought leadership, case studies, summaries and talking points, media briefings and copy for internal and external consumption.§ § § §Strengthen and Manage Partnerships§: § §help manage CEW member input, in particular Business Engagement Committee and Board input and sensitively integrate it into active campaigns§ §Build relationships with key partners to help support delivery of timely, cost effective and creative thought leadership initiatives which support CEW’s mission§ §Coordinate members, partners (existing and prospects), sponsors, and supporters including peak bodies and social sector partners as required for consultation on key issues§ §Help develop robust and productive working relationships with CEW team and CEO, including sharing knowledge and expertise about policy and advocacy activities.§ §INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:§ § §Work with the Director to deliver CEW’s Policy, Advocacy and Research annual Business Plan§ §Support Government, Corporate and Public Advocacy strategy development and implementation – working closely with the CEW team to ensure alignment of CEW messages in all communications and identify media opportunities to advance CEW’s strategy.§ §Research and draft CEW’s policy position in key areas of CEW interest, together with the Director, Business Engagement Committee, CEW senior staff§ §Research and prepare position papers, and other collateral to for the Director to brief CEW members on CEW policy, advocacy and thought leadership activities, so that members are supported to act to advance CEW’s initiatives§ §Draft submissions to government, co-ordinate CEW’s participation in Federal and State roundtables and other government engagement opportunities§ §Coordinate meetings for key CEW personnel (e.g. President, Chair Business Engagement Committee, CEO) to engage with government to influence policy outcomes§ §Proactive market monitoring for research and initiatives relevant to CEW’s mission and responding to issues in the public domain, distilling key points for sharing knowledge§ §Coordinate partner research thought leadership initiatives § §Other research activities as required§ §PERSON CHARACTERISTICS§ § §Natural collaborator and relationship builder§ §Experienced policy, advocacy and thought leadership practitioner§ §Ability to contribute strategically and implement tactically with a solutions orientation§ §Hands on, energetic team player, equally comfortable taking personal responsibility for work and/or working independently. Able to work with a small team.§ §Exceptional plain English communicator with the capacity to create compelling content§ §Candidates are required to respond to these criteria in their application to be considered.§ §Demonstrate your ability to understand the brief and your exemplary communication skills in a one page cover letter and two page CV and include your salary expectations§.§ §Applications should be forwarded to §cew@cew.org.au§ and will be considered as received (so apply now!). Shortlisted applicants only will be contacted.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

We see the world is changing so we are changing too. Our people and their jobs are as diverse as the communities we serve.§ § §About the role§ § As a Change Specialist or Manager with experience in capability, process and transformation initiatives, you will help us innovate to meet the challenges of our growing cities.§ § Sydney Water is implementing an SAP ERP system called the “BxP Program”. Go live is planned for June/July 2021. This program has now entered its ‘Realise’ phase. The purpose of this is to complete the build, undertake testing, get the business ready for the solution, prepare staff for training etc.§ § You will work closely with Senior Change Leads, SMEs, communications and training practitioners, technical /functional team and key business stakeholders in Finance and Supply Chain /Procurement functions to provide support and execute the BxP Change Management Plan. Key accountabilities include:§ §        §          §Applying Sydney Water’s Change Management Framework and BxP change tools /approaches to create and implement actionable change management deliverables§          §Refresh change impacts assessments and communicate changes§          §Complete stakeholder analysis§          §Support the identification, planning, execution and tracking of business readiness activities /plans§          §Develop /refine communications and engagement plans to support readiness and address impacts, issues and concerns§          §Provide input to the learning journeys, and other training and system access requirements§          §Development of tailored stakeholder communications material§          §Support the completion of monthly readiness assessments, dashboards and reports§          §Business stakeholder engagement, including coaching and support managers as they direct their staff through this transition§          §Support the development of embed/ sustain plans.§          §Act as a link between the SME’s, change team, and stakeholders in the Finance and Procurement work streams to ensure the delivery of a coordinated change program of work§          §Assist in following up overdue actions and outstanding decisions to ensure work is completed on a timely basis§          §Assist in completing key OCM tasks and milestones§          §Be an ambassador for the changes that are being implemented through the BxP project.§        §        §About you§ § As a change specialist and manager you will demonstrate your ability and experience in transformative change programs through your 1-2+ years’ experience for medium to large change initiatives, where you have developed and executed change plans within projects and/or program environments, this will also include:§ §        §          §SAP change delivery experience, ideally with some finance exposure§          §Experience in end to end change management programs§          §Excellent stakeholder management skills - have managed diverse stakeholders at all levels within the organisation§          §Knowledge and solid practical experience of change management methodology and approaches§          §Takes initiative, self-starter, strong problem-solving skills, analytical and ability to work in a fast-paced environment across numerous tasks§          §Excellent written, verbal communication and computing skills§        §        §Closing date: 11§th§ §October 2020§ § You must be an §Australian Citizen§ or §Permanent Resident§ at the time of submitting your application to be considered for this role. For more information, you can contact § § We want your perspective and ideas to help us find better ways to delight our customers, so we encourage you to apply no matter your age, sex or culture. You can be part of a committed, highly skilled team who’ll appreciate what you bring to the table. You’ll set and achieve real goals and make decisions that matter, as together we help shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney.§ § As part of the application process, Sydney Water will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role. We will also use your personal information to establish a LiveHire talent profile in our Talent Community. We look at our Talent Community first when new opportunities come up when you apply for a role. jobText: TXT/50632839.txt	§Integrated Water Planning Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Integrated Water Planning Lead§§Advertiser: §City of Gold Coast§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Integrated Water Planning Lead §      §If you are passionate, enjoy a challenge and want to work for one of the fastest developing cities in Australia, if excellent working conditions are something you find attractive then we have an opportunity for you.§      § We are working hard to build a vibrant city, maintain our enviable Gold Coast lifestyle and ensure our city will be thriving, sustainable and attractive into the future.§      § The lifestyle opportunities, weather, career development and growth are some reasons why working for City of Gold Coast may be the best decision you've made.§      §We're making our mark on South-East Queensland... come and make your mark with us.§      §Reference No:  29673 §      §Salary Range:  $97867.43 to $110290.02 §      §        §§        §To our valued community; As the novel coronavirus §COVID§-§19§ continues to impact our community and daily lives, we want to assure you that we are monitoring developments very closely and taking all appropriate action. Keeping this in mind, please be aware that our recruitment process, while going ahead, may take longer than average and we ask that you remain patient during these prolonged periods.§        §The Gold Coast is an outstanding global city proudly looking towards its future. We are inspired by lifestyle and driven by opportunity.§        §Here at City of Gold Coast, our commitment to a shared set of values shapes our decisions, actions and behaviours towards achieving the City Vision and our many city priorities.§        §          §We aim high –§ we are passionate about delivering the best for our city§          §We add value –§ we are innovative and make the most of every opportunity§          §We work as a team –§ our people are great individually, but unstoppable together§          §We take responsibility –§ we are committed to working safely, being trustworthy and owning our actions§        §        §About the Position§        §Located in the Service Sustainability Branch of the Water and Waste Directorate, the §Integrated Water Planning Lead§ is responsible for integrated network and natural and urban catchment planning to deliver short, medium and long term planning outcomes to service growth and innovation requirements for the Gold Coast. §        §This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a new team driving City Shaping planning opportunities and projects, including supporting some of the major implementation projects of the City’s Water Strategy such as the Recycled Water Network Expansion and the investigation of future servicing strategies for Water, Sewerage and Recycled Water through a newly developed Adaptive Planning Framework.§        §You will support the Branch leadership team with the development of City Strategies, Plans and Projects, whilst delivering multiple planning projects through our consultancy partners PSP. This role will have multiple direct reports with a requirement for performance management to support their professional development.§        §About You§        §To be successful in this position, you will:§        §          §Have a Bachelor Degree in Engineering or Science and/or water industry experience (or other similar utility) in Network and Strategic Planning with knowledge and/or experience of Integrated network and natural/urban catchment planning§          §Be a ‘can do’ person who has great satisfaction in identifying improvement opportunities and thrives on innovatively solving problems in a complex environment§          §Like change, are an enthusiastic self-starter and dedicated team player with a continuous improvement and growth mindset§          §Have highly developed interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written and can prepare insightful strategy documents, business cases and other professional documents§          §Have advanced MS Office skills§          §Have excellent analytical skills including performance data analysis§          §Have excellent organisational skills, including the ability to manage a range of diverse tasks, establish work priorities and meet deadlines, in a high pressure environment§        §        §What can the City of Gold Coast offer you?§        §Working for the City of Gold Coast is both challenging and rewarding. You will enjoy:§        §          §working within a culture that promotes a healthy work life balance with 9 day fortnights and flexible working arrangements;§          §a friendly and supportive team where you will be recognised and rewarded;§          §opportunities for professional development training and study assistance to enhance your career progression;§          §a competitive remuneration plus up to 12% employer superannuation contribution and options to salary sacrifice;§        §        §See what other benefits the City can offer you here: §https://www.goldcoast.qld.gov.au/council/council-jobs-222.html§        §The Selection Process§        §As part of our selection process, you may be required to undertake a one way video interview via §SparkHire§, and a face to face interview or virtual interview via Mircrosoft Teams or Skype. You may also be required to undertake police checks, employment history checks, qualification checks and drug and alcohol testing in accordance with Australian Standards and Council's procedures.§        §Please note applications for all of our vacancies close at 10.30pm on the listed closing date.§Enquiries:§ Kevin Page§Ph:§ 07 §0414181620§Applications Close:§ 18/10/2020§      §      §Council is an EEO employer and welcomes diversity in the workplace.§    §    §  §§§§To our valued community; As the novel coronavirus §COVID§-§19§ continues to impact our community and daily lives, we want to assure you that we are monitoring developments very closely and taking all appropriate action. Keeping this in mind, please be aware that our recruitment process, while going ahead, may take longer than average and we ask that you remain patient during these prolonged periods.§The Gold Coast is an outstanding global city proudly looking towards its future. jobTitle: Senior Customer Experience and Activation Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50609145.txt	§Senior Customer Experience and Activation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Customer Experience and Activation Manager§§Advertiser: §Woolworths Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Customer Experience and Activation Manager §      §        §        § §        § §        §          §Passion for Customer Experience§          §Drive customacy advocacy and identify root causes of customer pain points§          §Work closely with central customer team and deep dive on customer opportunities§        §        § §        §About the Role§        §We have an amazing opportunity for someone to join us as a Senior Customer Experience and Activation Manager. In this role you will drive customer advocacy and customer-centric decision making for the Woolworths Supermarkets business.  You will work closely with the central customer team to tailor insights to the supermarkets strategy and to deep dive on customer opportunities. Identifying root causes of customer pain points and working with various functions (operations, buying, marketing etc) to develop clear and actionable plans.§        § §        §Working with all teams across Food Group to continuously evolve customer experience across all touchpoints (supermarkets, metro stores, calls into stores/Customer Hub, store callbacks, online delivery, pick up), and deliver consistently on our service goals. You will provide best practice expertise to develop customer value propositions/customer promises for our retail brands.§  §Responsibilities:§        §          §Actively work to remove customer pain points throughout our customers experience in store§          §Work directly with the central insights team to ensure that customer trends, data and insights are tailored to supermarkets strategy§          §Champion customer perspective in supermarkets and support weekly customer tracking§          §Support business performance reviews, quarterly reviews and the annual strategy planning process of the Strategy team in Supermarkets §          §Create partnerships with other teams and other data-sources including central insights team, WooliesX, FoodCo, Rewards, third party sources, quantium checkout etc.§          §Proactively identify emerging customer trends and opportunities §        §        § §  §About You§ You are a motivated and pragmatic problem solver who is passionate about improving the customer experience.  You bring with proven experience in being able to interrogate and synthesise complex data sets, build partnerships with a number of teams and stakeholders in order to develop and execute plans to address. §  § In addition, you will ideally have the following attributes:§        §          §Minimum of 5 years experience in Customer facing industries driving customer experience strategies based on customer insight§          §Experience in embedding Customer Experience programs, not essential but advantageous §          §Customer-centric mentality§          §Highly collaborative §          §Strong prioritisation skills §          §Analytical & comfortable with numbers§          §Can-do attitude and result-orientation§        §        § §  §  §        § §        §Joining the Group§        § §        §As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. §        § §        §We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI inclusion.§        §As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference. §        § §        §We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing. §        § §        §We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.§        § §        §We’d love to hear from You§        § §        §If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au. #LI #Work180§        § §        §Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. jobTitle: Contaminated Land Consultant Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50643155.txt	§Contaminated Land Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contaminated Land Consultant§§Advertiser: §CDM Smith§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Contaminated Land Consultants – Looking for a Change?§  §Exciting opportunity exists for an early career environmental consultant with CDM Smith based in our Melbourne office.§  §Being part of a global privately owned organisation that values Technical Excellence you can be part of our highly skilled team in Australia tackling regional and national environmental challenges.  Being privately owned we have the autonomy to both provide studies and solutions to our clients.§  §Our team sizes are small, but our projects are large and so this role will allow the successful person opportunities to learn and grow in a dynamic environment, whilst making valuable contributions to the organisation, supporting projects, fieldwork and research.§  §We are specifically looking for the following person:§ § §2-3 years’ experience general contaminated land management with a focus and passion for soil/groundwater remediation programs§ §We are looking for people with not only a passion for their environmental science/engineering, but also people wanting to make a difference and help our clients make better decisions through smarter ways of presenting and communicating our work.§  §Our work environment is dynamic, focused on solutions through teamwork and we are open to flexible working arrangements.§  §Success in this role will be based on the following criteria:§ § §An undergraduate degree in environmental science or environmental engineering, with a major in the earth sciences, soil, geology, hydrogeology or similar:§ §A sound understanding of field sampling techniques and a minimum of 1 year as a contaminated land practitioner or environmental scientist, preferably in the consulting industry;§ §A sound understanding of relevant Australian Standards for environmental assessments, relevant VIC EPA guidelines, the NEMP (2018) and NEPM (2013), at a minimum; Excellent data processing skills and a working knowledge of esdat, equis, gint etc highly desirable;§ §Good written and verbal communication and proven reporting skills;§ §Fast learning abilities and a good attention to detail;§ §Ability to work independently and with teams;§ §Willingness to undertake fieldwork, both in metropolitan and remote areas across Australia.  Some field works will be for extended periods;§ §Right to work in Australia; and§ §Valid Driver Licence.§ §CDM Smith is a professional services firm consulting in the environmental and engineering spaces and take great pride in putting our clients first and providing sustainable, fit for purpose and cost-effective solutions for complex and challenging industry problems, both nationally and internationally. We are committed to delivering high-quality outcomes by bringing together specific technical expertise, intuitive on-ground know-how and a passion for what we do.§  §We provide our employees with the opportunity to work on key projects in Australia and potentially overseas.§  §Please submit your Cover Letter, CV, and academic details by 5pm Friday 16th October to the following email address:    §Au-recruit@cdmsmith.com§ §  §Please call Darren Watt on §0414 724 947§ or contact him on LinkedIn if you have any questions in relation to the positions.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Consultant - Organisational Development & Change Management  Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50568196.txt	§Senior Consultant - Organisational Development & Change Management §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant - Organisational Development & Change Management §§Advertiser: §KPMG Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Value Diversity? It’s what sets us apart§§Change management and delivering large scale business transformation§§Fast growing business offering exceptional career opportunities§§KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, and drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.§In Adelaide, we are a close-knit, team based practice and this extends to our clients with whom we work and collaborate, in solving complex problems. Together, we design, innovate and implement, providing enduring advice that support our clients and the services they deliver. Our clients vary in size and come from a diverse range of sectors – all sharing in a common goal: to embrace change and deliver services that make Australia a better place.  We are looking for talented individuals who would like to join us on the journey.§Your opportunity§Our experienced team of People & Change Advisors work with organisations to provide solutions and advice that hit the core of any organisation – People. We provide support and guidance on Business Transformation, Change Management, Organisational Design, Workforce Planning, Cultural Transformation, Corporate Affairs, Stakeholder Engagement, Leadership Capability Development, HR Optimisation and Workplace Relations.§We are currently seeking a Senior Consultant to join our People & Change team in Adelaide. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to work across a number of different opportunities and projects; utilising your knowledge and experience to provide strategic advice and support.§Future opportunities are likely to see you focus on:§§Supporting the delivery of change management, cultural and organisational development initiatives by applying a structured approach/methodology with the view to minimise change impacts and drive business benefits/outcomes§Educating, mentoring and coaching our clients in the concepts of organisational change and undertake change management activities in support of strategy delivery§Supporting the development of implementation plans aimed at sustaining change and uplifting change capability§Developing organisational change related proposals§Establishing and sustaining working relationships within client organisations through the delivery of timely, high quality people related services, delivering high levels of customer satisfaction§Have a strong desire to contribute to the success of a growing team    §§How are you extraordinary?§We believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. §To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include: §§Experience servicing external or internal clients §Working with large-scale business transformation projects§A solid track record working on project-based organisational change initiatives and the ability to demonstrate your experience driving change from concept and strategy through to implementation§Skills and experience supporting successful organisational projects and associated analysis activities§Exceptional communication, stakeholder management and relationship management capability§Demonstrated attention to detail and excellent problem solving ability§§The KPMG Difference§KPMG is one of the world’s leading professional services networks. It comprises over 162,000 people in member firms in more than 155 countries. We bring our clients the best minds and the deepest industry experiences from across the KPMG network of firms. We provide a culture of learning and support in which professionals can flourish and discover their true potential.§Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.§We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.§Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:§Flexibility empowers wellbeing  [link removed]§§Flexibility enables contribution to the community [link removed]§§Flexibility inspires technology [link removed]§ & innovation§§Flexibility [link removed]§ supports family§ §§§§

Allianz is undergoing a significant level of change across the business driven by the evolving regulatory environment, customer expectations and technological advances. As such, there is a growing need for strong enterprise change management capability to enable the effective execution and embedment of our strategic portfolio of initiatives.§        §You'll be responsible for:§        §          §Conduct the change analysis (stakeholder analysis, change impact and gap analysis, training needs analysis) to drive a set of tailored change activities§ jobText: TXT/50591146.txt	§Project Manager | Business Enablement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Manager | Business Enablement§§Advertiser: §Woolworths Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Salary§§A great place to grow. §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Manager | Business Enablement §      §        §        § §        § §        §Business Enablement Project Manager §        §          §2 postions available - 6 month contract and Full Time Permanent§          §Based in Bella Vista§        §        § §        §About the role§        § §        §As Project Manager, you will lead and deliver critical business projects, working end to end for the Woolworths Group.  You will join the Customer Transformation team, living the purpose and role modelling the values of the Food Group. There will be plenty of opportunity to work across different teams and divisions as part of this team and function, providing invaluable experience working in a cross functional and matrix environment. You are required to navigate and work across complex work environment and teams to deliver outcomes and provide input into Delivery Office governance forums and project/program updates.§        § §        §This is a Business focused Project Management role, not traditional IT.§        §   §        §What You'll Do:§        § §        §          §            §Deliver high quality outcomes, within managed budget and agreed milestones.§          §          §            §Embed project deliverables into BAU, and ensure sustainability§          §          §            §Identify key areas of risk and develop continuous improvement initiatives and influence critical paths as required§          §          §            §Follow project methodology and governance as per agreed approach§          §          §            §Develop project, budgets and forecasting, managing project costs§          §          §            §Manage business resources or project resources as required§          §          §            §Able to navigate complex work environment and teams to deliver outcomes§          §        §        § §        §What You'll Need to Succeed:§        § §        §You need at least 2+ years experience in a Project Management role and must have successfully delivered multiple streams. You must have strong stakeholder and change management skills, as well as financial management skills.§        § §        §          §            §Experience in retail desirable§          §          §            §Sound business acumen and strategic focus§          §          §            §Excellent communication ability§          §          §            §Excellent financial management skills§          §          §            §Experience working in an Agile and Waterfall environment §          §        §        § §        §Joining the Group§        § §        §As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. §        § §        §We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI inclusion.§        §As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference. §        § §        §We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing. §        § §        §We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.§        § §        §We’d love to hear from You§        § §        §If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au. #LI #Work180§        § §        §Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§        § §        §  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ § § § § §Business Enablement Project Manager § §2 postions available - 6 month contract and Full Time Permanent§ §Based in Bella Vista§ § § §About the role§ § § §As Project Manager, you will lead and deliver critical business projects, working end to end for the Woolworths Group.  You will join the Customer Transformation team, living the purpose and role modelling the values of the Food Group. jobTitle: Project Botanist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50589585.txt	§Project Botanist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Botanist§§Advertiser: §Biosis Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Biosis is looking to appoint a motivated Project Botanist to join our team in Melbourne. This is an excellent opportunity to join a leading consultancy which provides ecological, heritage and environmental approval services throughout south-eastern Australia.  §This is a full time 12 month contract position, with the opportunity to extend for the right candidate. §Working closely with our multi-disciplinary team of professionals, you will become an integral member of the ecology team in VIC, a key contributor to existing and future projects throughout VIC, and a driver for the development of our ecological capabilities in the region.§Biosis employs a highly experienced multi-disciplinary team of aquatic ecologists, archaeologists, botanists, zoologists, environmental planners and GIS operators.  We have offices in Albury, Ballarat, Melbourne, Newcastle, Sydney, Wangaratta, Western Sydney and Wollongong.§Our Melbourne office is located in Port Melbourne, close to the CBD and easily accessible by public transport. We are a very short walk from the North Port tram stop. This central location provides access to all the services of Melbourne without the hassle of traffic and parking.§Selection criteria§Biosis is seeking a Project Botanist with experience in field botany, and the capability of providing environmental advice and guidance to our clients.  Your responsibilities will include participating in, conducting and managing projects, and the production of technical reports.  Additional duties will include; survey design and implementation, proposal writing, sales and establishing a profile in the professional community as a botanist.§To apply, please address the below selection criteria within your cover letter: §Appropriate tertiary qualifications in ecology and or botany§A minimum of three years’ botanical experience, preferably in consultancy or the public sector§Broad plant identification skills, preferably with experience in Victoria§Strong report writing and proposal writing skills§Knowledge of Commonwealth and state legislation with regard to ecology§Experience with field survey design and implementation§Basic experience in sales, client relationship management and business development including proposal preparation, client liaison and consultation§Competency with computer programs and software such as MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and/or similar software packages§A current manual driver's licence§Experience with project management, including budgets§Australian citizenship/residency, or a valid work permit. §Biosis offers the security of an established firm with support services in WHS, HR and accounts, and a supportive and vibrant work culture. We provide you with a competitive salary package consisting of base salary plus super. Our ecology team works collaboratively across the company and you will have the opportunity to be mentored by a range of industry experts within Biosis. §As a Biosis employee, you will also be rewarded with many of our added employee benefits. Some of these benefits include:§Professional development program, including a professional development allowance§Employee reward and recognition program§Flexible work arrangements§Mentorship and development program§Study assistance§Employee assistance program§Social activities§Internal job opportunities throughout Australia.§For more information, contact Louise Reardon on §03 8686 4884§. §To apply, forward a copy of your CV and a covering letter addressing the selection criteria, to: §applications@biosis.com.au§Position Description§A position description is available on our website at §www.biosis.com.au/jobs§Applications will close at 5pm on Monday 5 October 2020§Please note: Australian residents / work permits only.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Business Development Officer Job in Bundaberg & Wide Bay Burnett - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50693725.txt	§Business Development Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Officer§§Advertiser: §Gidarjil Development Corporation Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bundaberg & Wide Bay Burnett§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Corporate Development§§§§§§This position is for a three month contract for a Business Development Officer that will provide leadership and support to a range of projects and is responsible for executing strategies to improve the performance of our Indigenous Organisation specifically in developing a business package for marine environmental activities. The officer will be responsible for developing standard business package proposals and for the development of a Marine Workplace Health and Safety policy including a management plan and Marine Specific JSA procedures.§Duties and Responsibilities§Maintain a thorough knowledge of the business, as well as an understanding of how that impacts other entities of contact§Develop a package outlining the Organisations differentiating values, standard proposal templates, standard methodology and fee estimating.§Develop professional project profiles and case studies including standard CV’s for key staff and short bios for key staff.§Develop and implement Job Specific Health and Safety Policies and Management Plans.§Train staff in adoption of the Quality Management System and ensure best practice is achieved at all times.§Develop fee estimating procedures with a view to standardising a competitive price structure for fee for service works.§Proactively solve conflicts and address issues that could occur between the business and other entities§Promptly respond to incidents and other events as necessary§Act as a positive representation of the business to all stakeholders§Business Development Officer Requirements and Qualifications§Relevant experience in business and economic development including the ability to identify complex problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions§High level organisational and time management skills§Ability to consider the relative costs and benefits of potential actions and to choose the most appropriate one§Ability to give full attention to what other people are saying and to use logic and reason to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions§Excellent verbal and written communication skills including cross-cultural communication skills and attention to detail§Ability to establish and nurture beneficial business relationships§Self-motivated with a strong willingness to take initiative and solve complex problems§Capability to negotiate with and influence others§Business acumen with an analytical and mathematical mind to analyse data and create necessary reports§Cooperation — The role requires being pleasant with others and displaying a good-natured, cooperative attitude.§Dependability — Job requires being reliable, responsible, and jobTitle: Customer Strategy & Experience Manager Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50651019.txt	§Customer Strategy & Experience Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Strategy & Experience Manager§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Great benefits + flexible working arrangements§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§Reporting to the Head of Customer Strategy, Experience & Insights, the Customer Strategy & Experience Manager champions a Customer focus in the way things are done across AIA. This role supports and helps drive the Enterprise Customer Centric Design (CCD) Center of Excellence to ensure Customer Strategy initiatives are underpinned by CCD methodology, as well as ensuring that endorsed Customer initiatives are executed with our Business Partners - to drive impact, continuously improve customer interactions, ensure a customer focused culture and achieve strategic goals and metrics. §This role is responsible for embedding the methodology for the design and delivery of our target end-to-end customer experience throughout all interactions in the customer lifecycle, ensuring they are validated and aligned to customer needs, insights, needs/wants and behaviors - to drive greater customer value outcomes, deliver on our CVP and Brand proposition, enhance the Company’s competitive position, deliver financial and Strategic goals, and deliver consistent and exceptional customer experiences – which positively impact on our CSAT and CES metrics and support Customer Retention initiatives.§§Key responsibilities in this role include:§Partner with various Business Units to drive customer centricity at AIA, championing a customer-led approach to design and develop compelling Customer Propositions underpinned by validated Customer, Operational and Market Insights.  These will support the identification of customer pain points which will allow improvement opportunities and continuous improvements across the entire customer lifecycle.§Support the Head of Customer Strategy to drive the development and articulation of the Customer vision, strategy and execution plans across the Enterprise to create exceptional customer experiences through delivery of customer journey maps and customer experience designs§Contribute to the Enterprise CCD Center of Excellence to ensure Customer Strategy initiatives are underpinned by CCD methodology that balances human insight with commercial drivers to design optimal, validated, profitable experiences that support our brand and Customer Experience promise§Lead current and future state end-to-end customer journey maps and service execution models, validated by customer insights across the Learn, Buy, Service, Claim episodes in the Life, Health and Vitality business channels§Collaboratively work across the business, to build service blueprints that identify business friction points and customer breakpoints in key moments that matter and deliver strategic recommendations to enhance and remediate the customer service experience§Co-create a Customer Experience Artefacts Library including customer journey maps, service blueprints, contextual enquiry and ethnographic interview guides, empathy maps and persona templates§Partner with the business to inform, initiate and deliver prioritised partnerships, projects and initiatives through customer experience consulting and delivery of experience design solutions and artefacts – with measurable benefits and metrics§§Experience and skills required to be successful:§Strong and demonstrated experience in Customer design and execution, or customer/digital delivery§Experience in leading without authority in highly matrix organization, virtual cross functional Customer Champion teams§Proven success in defining and operationalising customer strategy, customer value propositions, CCD methodology, customer journey mapping, and driving the execution and implementation of customer initiatives - with a proven track record for driving change that has delivered step change customer growth outcomes§Strong influencing and negotiation skills required to manage key stakeholders at all levels of the organisation to sell in insights and actions into the business§Ability to synthesize information and present, ensuring business relevance and organisational impact§Superior verbal communication skills with the ability to listen and consult with stakeholders across all levels§Degree qualification in relevant discipline§Financial services and insurance experience desired§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

Our trust in each other gives us confidence to make an impact in our roles and to our customers.§        §Our team members are encouraged to lead their own way. Our teams are empowered and encouraged to be accountable for making an impact, no matter how big or small.§        §In our support offices, we may not quite resemble our iconic green sheds, but working behind the scenes are a team of people that make our stores come to life.§        §        §About the role and the team:§        §The Bunnings Innovation Lab is a multi-disciplinary team that is part of the Digital team at Bunnings. Our purpose is to solve our customers’ unmet needs and enable Bunnings to capture new value from digital experiences. We work on developing and delivering customer-centric apps and innovation projects for Bunnings commercial and retail customers, suppliers and team members.  §        §This year we launched the first customer-facing app for Bunnings, the Product Finder app, to help our customers plan ahead and find products in store. The focus of this last quarter was continuing the process of keeping customers and team members safe in store through cashless solutions and services whilst also setting the Business up for the future.  §        §The §Innovation Lead§ is tasked with solving customers' unmet needs and enabling Bunnings to capture new value from digital experiences. This is brought to life through working with the Innovation Manager in creating, delivering, and iterating new and existing Bunnings applications, determining the unmet needs of the customer and the business, and embedding innovation practices into Bunnings.§        §Our ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a passion for growth strategy, have strong business acumen and experience working on complex strategic projects, be sharp with numbers, a creative thinker, and be a collaborative and team oriented individual.§        §        §As the Innovation Lead, you can expect to:§ customer experience priorities§          §Map core capabilities with emerging innovations/ technologies§          §Identify key gaps within the business to execute on innovation with a plan to solve§          §Support the innovation process with senior leader involvement via Innovation Committee§          §Help identify opportunity statements, identify solutions and pitch proposed implementation approach§          §Understand retail industry landscape and business in the context of local, global, economic, technology and social trends§          §Stay informed of applicable technology, retail landscapes and key competitors§          §Analyse trends and market disruptions, as well as search for emerging opportunities§          §Assist in reporting Innovation Lab progress to agreed governance entities and stakeholders§          §Help to create a culture of innovation and experimentation, focused on continuous improvement by questioning and challenging the status quo§        § §Strong customer focus and business acumen, with experience working on complex strategy projects§          §Demonstrated experience in strategic thinking§          §Strong problem-solving ability - structural reasoning, sharp with numbers and creative thinking§          §Strong research and analytical skills to quickly extract insights§          §Strong financial and Excel skills§        §        §        §What's in it for you:§        §          §Competitive salary package§          §Team member and partner discount§          §12 weeks paid parental leave for eligible team members§          §The opportunity to participate in Wesfarmers Share Plan§          §Access to discounted offers from corporate partners§          §Ongoing career development and training§          §Work in a fun and informal team§          §Offers flexibility in an inclusive work environment§          §Chances to create a real difference in your community and environment§        §        §        §Retaining an inclusive, family feel while growing into one of Australia and New Zealand largest and most widely recognised brands has come naturally to us and we'd love to welcome you to the family.§ jobTitle: Urban Planning - Student Internship Program 2021 Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50609319.txt	§Urban Planning - Student Internship Program 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Urban Planning - Student Internship Program 2021§§Advertiser: §Urbis Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§Urbis is a market-leading firm that shapes the cities and communities of Australia for a better future. Drawing together a network of the brightest minds, Urbis consists of practice experts, working collaboratively to deliver fresh thinking and independent advice and guidance. Working across the areas of planning, design, policy, heritage, valuations, transactions, economics and research, the expert team at Urbis connect their clients in the public and private sectors to a better outcome, every time.§National Student Internship Program 2021§Our National Student Internship Program offers exclusive opportunities for the brightest students to gain invaluable experience and broad exposure to our business and related industries. As part of our program, you will learn from mentors, work with our clients, access our learning resources and have exposure to fantastic networking opportunities.§Our annual program will run from February to December 2021 and will enable you to graduate with the distinct advantage of industry experience over your peers. Our student roles offer flexibility in the form of 2-4 days per week, to complement your studies.§What about this opportunity?§Our Planning team has openings for  a student in our Brisbane office, on a paid casual basis. Our program will help you will develop a solid understanding of statutory and strategic urban planning. You will have the opportunity to provide input and advice relating to land use, development capability, due diligence assessment, masterplans, the approval process, and management.§As an Assistant Planner you can expect to be involved in:§Work alongside other professionals on a range of multi-disciplinary projects, working to specification, to deadlines and within budget.§Provide input into draft proposals, tenders and submission for potential projects.§Provide assistance in managing internal and external clients.§Carrying out research and conducting site visits.§About You§You will be an undergraduate or post-graduate student undertaking studies in a relevant field, who is passionate about city shaping, has great communication skills and an interest in working in a professional services / consulting environment. Successful candidates will have a strong academic record and possess a combination of the following technical skills and attributes:§An understanding of statutory planning frameworks, controls and processes.§Ability to adopt a logical approach to problem solving and make objective and informed recommendations.§Ability to synthesise and interpret data from a range of sources.§Flexibility and adaptability to changing work demands.§The Application Process§If you’re interest in joining our Student Internship Program, click on ‘Apply’ and submit your application. For your application to be considered, we require your CV, a copy of your most recent academic transcripts and a cover letter (one page maximum) addressing the following questions:§Why do you want to be a cityshaper at Urbis?§What has motivated you to pursue a career in your selected discipline?§Which Urbis project (past or present) would you like to be part of, and why?§ §Note: your chosen project should be relevant to the practice area/discipline you are applying for.§Applicants for our National Design team (Landscape Architecture and Urban Design based roles) are also required to submit a portfolio with their application. For other roles, this is optional.§Applications close at 11:00pm on Sunday 11 October 2020. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted, with interviews expected to be in mid/late October 2020.§Urbis is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive, supports flexibility, and welcomes diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. To find out more about us visit our website at https://urbis.com.au/.§Eligibility§You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident and studying throughout the duration of the internship to be eligible for the program. Preference will be given to those in their final or second last year of their degree, but we encourage applications from those earlier in their degrees also.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Consultant & Manager - Operational Advisory Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50659138.txt	§Senior Consultant & Manager - Operational Advisory§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant & Manager - Operational Advisory§§Advertiser: §KPMG Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§ §§Business Improvement, Strategy & Innovation, Operational Transformation, Operating Model Design, Operational Improvement§§Collaborate and link across borders and globally with sector and technical experts§§Career advancement opportunities§§ §KPMG is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.§ §Our Operations Advisory team is growing, assisting leading companies across all industries driving sustainable operational improvement. We assist our clients to identify opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of its operations and to successfully execute against these objectives. The team draws on a combination of professional talented people, powerful KPMG methodologies and global resources.§ §Your Opportunity § §Members of our operations team often have backgrounds in engineering, finance, consulting, law, computer science, or have worked in operational improvement environments in industry - if you think your background brings something to the table, we want to hear from you!§ §You will engage with our clients in the mining, oil and gas, utilities and public sectors among others.§ §Senior Consultant opportunities § §As a Senior Consultant you’ll be looking to build on your management consulting and / or industry experience and gain exposure to new and more complex challenges. Your role will see you take ownership of your own activity streams within projects. You’ll apply your strategic problem solving, data analysis, stakeholder engagement and project management skills to help solve complex client problems. You’ll hone your client relationship skills, harnessing your truly customer centric approach and passion for achieving great results for your client. This role would suit someone with 2-5 years of relevant consulting and / or experience. § §Manager opportunities§ §As a Manager, with 5-8 years of relevant experience, you’ll already have a successful track record in Management Consulting or working in improvement-oriented roles in industry. You’re now looking to join a high growth team to work with a prestigious range of clients and play a key role in developing the practice. You’ll bring a passion for growing high calibre teams and managing multiple streams that will see you building on your experience in reviewing business performance, go-to-market strategies and putting together the end-to-end service delivery of engagements.§ §How are you Extraordinary?§ §At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.§ §Experience in Management Consulting or driving operational improvement, strategy or innovation within industry is highly desirable.  We are also looking for:§ §§Demonstrated ability to apply structured thinking and analysis techniques to complex and ambiguous problems§Experience or exposure to the practical application of continuous improvement (eg Lean, Six Sigma), innovation (eg Design Thinking) and strategy methodologies and frameworks §Proven ability to translate business and customer needs into best practice process and operation design requirements, with experience in implementing the designs within core and enabling processes§Highly developed written and verbal communication skills§Experience in structured problem solving and advanced analytical skills§Strong stakeholder engagement, team work and project management capabilities§Experience in evaluation, design and the implementation of technology to solve operational problems is highly desirable§Experience within the mining industry is highly desirable §A supporting tertiary qualification is highly advantageous§§ §**Please note you must be an Australian Citizen or permanent resident. § §The KPMG Difference§ §Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.§ §We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.§ § §Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:§ §Flexibility empowers wellbeing § [link removed]§ §Flexibility enables contribution to the community§ [link removed]§ §Flexibility inspires technology§ [link removed]§ & innovation§ §Flexibility§ [link removed]§ supports family§ §Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!§ § § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50644801.txt	§Management Consultant - Consumer Sector§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Management Consultant - Consumer Sector§§Advertiser: §Blenheim Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Blenheim Partners is an international Executive Search and Board Advisory Firm. As a professional services company we are specialist advisors to many of the world's leading corporations. As a result of company growth and market investment we have an opportunity for a motivated and experienced Management Consultant to join our Consumer Sector Practice.§ §Reporting to the Managing Partner, the potential candidate will have a track record as a Management Consultant delivering transformation programmes to leading Consumer organisations in Australia. This opportunity will appeal to those with a background as a Management Consultant in financial services with a previous track record as an executive in the Consumer sector. As a business consultant you will be accustomed to delivering on-time and on-budget consulting projects and will have experience of developing strategy and implementing change agendas, creating value and maximising growth that delivers sustainable and tangible results in the complex Consumer sector.§ §It is anticipated the successful candidate will have over 5 years’ experience working in the Consumer Sector or as a management/business consultant covering the Consumer Industry with exposure and knowledge across the broad remit of the Consumer market that may include FMCG, Retail, Media, Travel, Leisure, Entertainment and Arts & Culture. You will ideally have international Consumer Sector/consulting experience and a demonstrable track record of developing client relationships that have converted to sustainable revenue generation.  § §The successful candidate will be results oriented, customer focused, delivering on-time and on-budget projects to deliver enhanced efficiencies to our clients and be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. You will be a problem solver, able to understand organisational structures with high intellect and ambiguity tolerance, possessing strategic and commercial acumen. You will have the ability to engage and partner with senior level decision makers and bring a commitment to excellence, belief in team values and esprit de corps. § §Responsibilities include:§Playing a representative role as a trusted advisor and partner within the Consumer sector;§Developing strong client relationships and ensuring presentation of business cases with strategic advice are of utmost quality and reassurance;  §Analysing and evaluating client objectives and Management structures to achieve optimal commercial outcomes; §Presenting alterative ideas to clients to stimulate review of current organisational decision making processes to enhance efficiency and transformational goals;§Developing project plans with key deliverables that aim to provide efficiencies and support to corporate and growth agendas of our clients;§Managing client deliverables and expectations, including drafting client proposals and overseeing the end to end execution of the engagement deliverables; and,§Preparing written reports relating to business development opportunities based on previous successful outcomes. § §It is anticipated you will possess an appropriate tertiary qualification with a degree in business, economics, engineering, science or a related field. Postgraduate business qualification would be highly regarded.§ §For further information please email your enquiries to (§employment@blenheimpartners.com§ [link removed])§§§§

jobTitle: Policy Officer Asia Pacific Group (APG) Job in Sydney - SEEK
