jobText: TXT/50709557.txt	§Policy Officer Asia Pacific Group (APG)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy Officer Asia Pacific Group (APG)§§Advertiser: §AUSTRALIAN FEDERAL POLICE§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$88,661 - $96,049 per annum, plus 15.4% super§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§The strategic objective of the APG is to reduce serious crime in the Asia/Pacific region by ensuring member jurisdictions combat money laundering and terrorist financing through: § § §Effective participation in the Financial Action Task Force’s (FATF’s) standard setting process, and § §Full and effective implementation of those standards in APG members.§ §To achieve these goals, the APG works collaboratively with the FATF and other organisations (both domestic and international) to formulate policy responses to emerging money laundering and terrorist financing risks. Together with similar regional bodies, the APG forms part of a global network to address the threats posed by money laundering and terrorist financing to the international financial system. Core APG functions include a mutual peer review system; technical assistance and training coordination; and education, research and analysis of money laundering and financing of terrorism environments, and the effectiveness of domestic and global AML/CFT efforts.  § §The APG Secretariat is located in Sydney, Australia and has 21 staff members (including the Policy Officer).  The primary role of the Secretariat is to provide secretariat services to the APG Co-Chairs and membership and in doing so serves as a focal point for APG activities.§ §The Policy Officer for Research & Implementation, reports to the Director, Research and Implementation to ensure that the APG actively supports its members under review by the FATF International Cooperative Review Group (ICRG). § § § §The Policy Officer duties include:§ § §Provides support to the Research & Implementation team in work associated with the APG’s participation in the Asia Pacific Joint Group of the ICRG.§ §Assists the Director, Research & Implementation with long term projects aimed at supporting APG members, in particular those under ICRG review, through research and analysis.§ §Assists with the team’s Typologies workload as required.§ § § §Essential requirements, skills or experience:§ § §Research and/or policy experience, preferably in AML/CFT (or related areas such as proceeds of crime or international cooperation) or in technical assistance and training/capacity building. § §A degree relevant to the field of international politics and development or related to aspects of AML/CFT, such as law, finance/commerce/economics, or law enforcement, would be an advantage.  Relevant experience may be accepted in lieu of a degree.§ § § §Desirable requirements, skills or experience:§ § §Advanced written communication skills. § §Ability to quickly acquire, analyse and apply knowledge.§ §Ability to present technical material to targeted audiences in writing, presentations and small group or one-on-one discussions.§ §Professionalism demonstrated through adaptability, respect and a result-oriented outlook. § §An understanding of stakeholders in the context of national and international policy implementation.§ §Experience in working with a wide range of computer-based applications, MS Office and document management systems.§ §Experience in communicating effectively with individuals and groups, including in situations which can be culturally and politically sensitive in an international context.§ § § §Eligibility:§ § §To be eligible you must be an Australian Citizen.§ § § §Additional Information:§ § §This position is located in Sydney, NSW. Successful applicants must be willing to relocate to Sydney.§ § § §What do we offer?§ §We provide our people with many benefits appropriate to the level of the position including, but not limited to:§ § §An attractive remuneration package as per our § Enterprise Agreement§ §Four mandatory rest days per year§ §Six weeks annual leave§ §Flexible working arrangements§ §Flex time§ §15.4% Superannuation§ §External and internal training opportunities§ § § §How to apply:§ § §To apply visit the AFP’s Career Page at: § https://www.afp.gov.au/careers/vacancies§ §Refer to the ‘Required Application Documents’ section on the job ad on the AFP Careers Page§ §If you have a disability/medical condition and require a copy of this advertisement and attached documentation in an accessible format or would like to discuss an access requirements/reasonable adjustment for the recruitment process, please contact §AFPRecruitment@afp.gov.au§ § § §To obtain more information about the position please contact Mitali Tyagi on §02 5126 9110§ or §mitali.tyagi@apgml.org§ § § §Applications close:  11.59pm (AEDST) on Thursday 22nd October 2020.§ § § §As an inclusive organisation, the AFP provides opportunity for all Australians to fairly gain employment in the AFP.  We appreciate that everyone is unique and acknowledge that diversity in thought leads to greater transparency and improved consideration in our decision making.  § § §§§§

jobTitle: Asset Management Consultants Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696449.txt	§Asset Management Consultants§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Asset Management Consultants§§Advertiser: §Assetic§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§About Assetic:§ §Assetic is a Melbourne-based professional services business specialising in the strategic management of infrastructure assets. Assetic is on a journey to integrate deep asset management science with leading edge software.§  §With a cloud-based suite of asset management software solutions and now backed by Dude Solutions International, Assetic is a world leader in Strategic Asset Management. We support our clients in strategically managing some $100 billion in assets for over 150 organisations. Our market-leading services and solutions have been utilised across government (federal, state, local), utilities (water, power), facilities (education, housing) and transport (rail, airports, ports) sectors in Australia, New Zealand, USA, Canada and the UK.§  §Assetic is a collaborative, supportive and busy workplace where you can really make a difference. We pride ourselves on our fun, innovative and friendly culture, where creativity and individual perspectives are valued.§  §What we are looking for:§ §As we are growing our consulting team, we are seeking §Expressions of Interest§ from Asset Management industry professionals who share our passion and commitment to deliver high quality strategic asset management consulting services. §  §Ideally you will be an Asset Management professional who has experience in delivery of infrastructure asset life-cycle modelling consulting services, developing asset management plans, long-term financial plans, asset valuations and capital works programs.§  §You will also be confident and comfortable delivering client-facing workshops and asset management services engagements and assignments, taking responsibility for client engagements. Ideally you will have a quality asset management consulting service track record.  §  §Positions will be based in our Melbourne CBD office but we are open to Remote employees from all over Australia. The role will require regular interstate and regional travel and can be offered to suit flexible working arrangements (permanent full-time or contract basis).§  §Minimum requirements of this opportunity:§ § §Qualification in Engineering, Asset Management, Science or a related discipline.§ §Experience and knowledge of infrastructure asset management, particularly in relation to lifecycle modelling (desirable).§ §Domain Knowledge in a selection of the following areas: § §Local Government and/or other Asset Intensive Industry Experience (e.g. Transport, Rail, Facilities, Power, Water) will be highly regarded.§ § § §Experience in leading and managing the planning and delivery of asset management services and the capability to apply best practice asset management, with an ability to transfer information, impart knowledge and educate clients.§ §Technical competence relating to assets and infrastructure management as defined by the ISO55000:2014 suite and the International Infrastructure Management Manual.§ §Successful applicants will possess the above minimum requirements and have a passion for Asset Management consulting and building client relationships. We are looking for team players with highly-developed interpersonal, report writing and presentation skills coupled with sound judgement. Previous experience in consulting and/or asset management roles will be highly advantageous.§  §Our Offer:§ §This role gives you the opportunity to work alongside and learn from inspiring leaders in the field of Asset Management.§ §Gain in-depth knowledge and experience working across a diverse range of infrastructure assets.§ §Work with and contribute to the enhancements of leading industry software ensuring they remain at the forefront of Asset Management.§ §Salary commensurate with experience§ §Assetic is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. If you’re interested in taking the next step in your career and have 4+ years’ experience in Strategic Asset Management, we would love to hear from you.§  §How to apply:§ § §To register your expression of interest, please submit a resume. A cover letter is also preferred (no longer than two pages).§  §All applicants will be carefully considered, however we will only be able to personally contact you if short-listed for an interview.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§How many years of asset management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Join our team with modern offices in Melbourne’s CBD, excellent office facilities, flexible work hours, team lunches, company retreats, a pet-friendly environment and the odd surf trip down the coast.§ § §DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: § § § §Learn about the client's business challenges and technologies to understand their business needs.§ § § §Review and monitor internal client company data.§ § § §Identify problems.§ § § §Outline the scope of the work and identify and map out schedules, milestones, and required resources to meet the project objectives.§ § § §Determine and communicate the work product or results that will be delivered to the client upon project completion.§ § § §Develop and carry out communications to the company's senior stakeholders, company staff, and internal and jobText: TXT/50648639.txt	§Management Consultant - Industrial Sector§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Management Consultant - Industrial Sector§§Advertiser: §Blenheim Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Blenheim Partners is an international Executive Search and Board Advisory Firm. As a professional services company we are specialist advisors to many of the world's leading corporations. As a result of company growth and market investment we have an opportunity for a motivated and experienced Management Consultant to join our Industrial Sector Practice.§ §Reporting to the Managing Partner, the potential candidate will have a track record as a Management Consultant delivering transformation programmes to leading Industrial organisations in Australia. This opportunity will appeal to those with a background as a Management Consultant in the Industrial Sector with a previous track record as an executive in the Industrial sector. As a business consultant you will be accustomed to delivering on-time and on-budget consulting projects and will have experience of developing strategy and implementing change agendas, creating value and maximising growth that delivers sustainable and tangible results in the complex Industrial sector. § §It is anticipated the successful candidate will have over 5 years’ experience working in the Industrial Sector or as a management/business consultant covering the Industrial Industry with exposure and knowledge across the broad remit of the Industrial market that may include Industrial Goods, Industrial Services, Transport, Manufacturing, Automotive and Mobility as well as Engineering. You will ideally have international Industrial Sector/consulting experience and a demonstrable track record of developing client relationships that have converted to sustainable revenue generation.  § §The successful candidate will be results oriented, customer focused, delivering on-time and on-budget projects to deliver enhanced efficiencies to our clients and be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. You will be a problem solver, able to understand organisational structures with high intellect and ambiguity tolerance, possessing strategic and commercial acumen. You will have the ability to engage and partner with senior level decision makers and bring a commitment to excellence, belief in team values and esprit de corps. § §Responsibilities include:§Playing a representative role as a trusted advisor and partner within the Industrial sector;§Developing strong client relationships and ensuring presentation of business cases with strategic advice are of utmost quality and reassurance;  §Analysing and evaluating client objectives and Management structures to achieve optimal commercial outcomes; §Presenting alterative ideas to clients to stimulate review of current organisational decision making processes to enhance efficiency and transformational goals;§Developing project plans with key deliverables that aim to provide efficiencies and support to corporate and growth agendas of our clients;§Managing client deliverables and expectations, including drafting client proposals and overseeing the end to end execution of the engagement deliverables; and,§Preparing written reports relating to business development opportunities based on previous successful outcomes. § §It is anticipated you will possess an appropriate tertiary qualification with a degree in business, economics, engineering, science or a related field. Postgraduate business qualification would be highly regarded.§ §For further information please email your enquiries to (§employment@blenheimpartners.com§ [link removed])§§§§

jobText: TXT/50609252.txt	§Property Economics & Research - Student Internship Program 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Economics & Research - Student Internship Program 2021§§Advertiser: §Urbis Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§Urbis is a market-leading firm that shapes the cities and communities of Australia for a better future. Drawing together a network of the brightest minds, Urbis consists of practice experts, working collaboratively to deliver fresh thinking and independent advice and guidance. Working across the areas of planning, design, policy, heritage, valuations, transactions, economics and research, the expert team at Urbis connect their clients in the public and private sectors to a better outcome, every time.§National Student Internship Program 2021§Our National Student Internship Program offers exclusive opportunities for the brightest students to gain invaluable experience and broad exposure to our business and related industries. As part of our program, you will learn from mentors, work with our clients, access our learning resources and have exposure to fantastic networking opportunities.§Our annual program will run from February to December 2021 and will enable you to graduate with the distinct advantage of industry experience over your peers. Our student roles offer flexibility in the form of 2-4 days per week, to complement your studies.§What about this opportunity?§Our Property Economics & Research team has openings for a student in our Brisbane office, on a paid casual basis. Our PER team work across the spectrum of property sectors with a long history in retail, residential, mixed-use and commercial property advice. Our advice is sought out in every stage of a project from acquisition, master planning, development and expansion right through to marketing and ongoing performance management and disposal. §As an Assistant Research Analyst you can expect to be involved in:§Responding to internal and external client requests and escalating to senior staff where necessary;§Research, modelling, analysis and database creation and maintenance§Undertaking audits, site visits and interviews/surveys§Presenting research findings and industry trends/issues internally§Developing an in-depth knowledge of sites and projects§About You§You will be an undergraduate or post-graduate student undertaking studies in a relevant field, who is passionate about city shaping, has great communication skills and an interest in working in a professional services / consulting environment. Successful candidates will have a strong academic record and possess a combination of the following technical skills and attributes:§Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritise§Strong analytical skills to interpret research data §Ability to adopt a logical approach to problem solving and make objective and informed recommendations to assist the team; §Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and through written communication §The Application Process§If you’re interest in joining our Student Internship Program, click on ‘Apply’ and submit your application. For your application to be considered, we require your CV, a copy of your most recent academic transcripts and a cover letter (one page maximum) addressing the following questions:§Why do you want to be a cityshaper at Urbis?§What has motivated you to pursue a career in your selected discipline?§Which Urbis project (past or present) would you like to be part of, and why?§ §Note: your chosen project should be relevant to the practice area/discipline you are applying for.§Applicants for our National Design team (Landscape Architecture and Urban Design based roles) are also required to submit a portfolio with their application. For other roles, this is optional.§Applications close at 11:00pm on Sunday 11 October 2020. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted, with interviews expected to be in mid/late October 2020.§Urbis is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive, supports flexibility, and welcomes diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. To find out more about us visit our website at https://urbis.com.au/.§Eligibility§You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident and studying throughout the duration of the internship to be eligible for the program. Preference will be given to those in their final or second last year of their degree, but we encourage applications from those earlier in their degrees also.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50578729.txt	§Pricing Lead, ANZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pricing Lead, ANZ§§Advertiser: §Cimpress§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Core to Vistaprint’s continued growth in recent years, is having a highly skilled and specialist pricing team that facilitates informed business and marketing decisions.  You will be part of a world-class international team that operates in real partnership with the business, working on major strategic questions and analysis that underpins the success of our organization as well as developing cutting edge models to support pricing recommendations.§ §Vistaprint has started its transformation towards a data-product centric organization with the initiative of “Next Gen Pricing&Promo” since April 2019. We have successfully piloted the introduction of more differentiated, data-driven list price and discount settings.§ §As a Senior Pricing Specialist, you will be driving the team forward by executing our new pricing strategies in Australia, New Zealand and Singapore.  Overall, you will collaborate with lines of business leads (product category or market based) and marketing team members to ensure the correct execution of our pricing strategy.  Once the transformation is executed, you will be developing and testing your pricing hypotheses from ideation to execution, in conjunction with both the lines of business leads and the central pricing team.§ §Your role will involve:§ § §Developing a deep understanding of our pricing methodologies and supporting models to determine the optimal list prices and promotions for an the ANZ line of business§ §Extensive collaboration with both core stakeholders across the business as well as with the central pricing team§ §Creating the overall roadmap for pricing optimization and testing strategy for ANZ§ §Creating, curating, and executing promotional offers in collaboration with business leads and marketing teams§ §Responsible for providing the input needed by the model to generate price recommendations§ §Defining and implementing pricing strategies for a broad range of products.  This includes identifying an opportunity, creating a hypothesis, building impact assessments, getting buy-in on the pricing recommendation and implementing the changes on the site§ §Tracking and measuring the success of the hypotheses§ §Communicating hypotheses and results of price changes/tests to a varied audience§ §Understanding competition and price elasticity of products and modeling scenarios to understand profitability impact of pricing changes§ §Mentoring others in the team§ §In return, you will bring:§ §- 5+ years’ experience working in an analytical role, ideally within a pricing or marketing team§ §- A Bachelor or master’s degree in Mathematics, Economics/Business/Finance, Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Business or other related technical discipline.§ §- Strong numerical, problem solving and analytical aptitude and be able to make data-based decisions§ §- Work experience within an ecommerce environment § §- Ability to learn quickly and to apply new tools and techniques§ §- Expert knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint§ §- SQL experience a plus, but you will have the opportunity to learn it§ §- Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple business partners§ §- Enthusiasm, entrepreneurial spirit, resilience and a collaborative mindset§ §- Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy§ §- Ability to work independently, take the initiative and have high level of ownership§ §- Inter-personal and communication skills including strong spoken, written, and visual storytelling abilities§ § § §This is a fantastic opportunity for you within this highly dynamic, rewarding environment! So if you are up for challenge in a fast-paced, energetic, and constantly changing environment apply now!§ § § §Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50597966.txt	§Manager - Supply Chain, Transformation and Operations§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Supply Chain, Transformation and Operations§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§Attractive annual salary package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Manager - Supply Chain, Transformation and Operations §      §        §In Operations, we focus on addressing the issues and questions that keep COOs awake at night. We start right at the top, helping our clients articulate and implement their strategic direction and touch every layer of an organisation from improving the customer experience business and financial performance and right down to the shop floor, optimising day to day operations and supply chain efficiency. The services we offer are aligned into three operating units across six industries; Technology, Media & Telecommunications, Energy & Resources, Social Impact, Financial Services, Consumer & Industrial Products and Public Sector & Healthcare.§ § The Deloitte Consulting Operations team work with leading executives both in Australia and internationally who are faced with the requirement to transform operations increase productivity restructure lower costs and get the most out of the workforce and assets to remain competitive. Our Operational Transformation practice specialises in turning strategies into measurable and sustained results.§ § We are seeking talented Supply Chain/Logistics Managers to join our successful Canberra supply chain practice to serve our Defence and Federal Government clients.§ § What will your typical day look like?§ §        §          §Help contribute to our Supply Chain/Logistics practice§          §Define client Supply Chain/Logistics problems, hypothesise and structure solutions, plan analysis, collect data, synthesise findings, develop and implement recommendations§          §Prepare for and lead client facing workshops§          §Understand the best-practice scope and be able to talk to clients in adopting these§          §Provide training to users and fellow consultants§        §        §About the Team§ § Our Transformation and Operations Supply Chain practice helps clients solve complex business issues by combining process and industry knowledge with expertise in enabling technologies and this team is expanding rapidly. We pride ourselves on our team of diverse high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented supportive inclusive and social and who are at the heart of our success. jobText: TXT/50689305.txt	§Senior Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Planner§§Advertiser: §Penrith City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$92,366.00 - $106,917.00 p.a., plus 9.5% super§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§About Us §At Penrith City Council, we’re passionate about people; in our community and in our workplace. We want you to be able to be your best self and we get that work is just one part of your life, so we’re here to support you in the moments that matter. As the winner of the 2020 Local Government Excellence in People and Culture Award and a finalist in the 2020 Australian HR Awards, you can be confident in joining a workplace that offers truly outstanding benefits, including:§§A range of flexible work arrangements §18 weeks paid maternity leave§Health and wellbeing leave§15 days personal leave§Significant financial and leave support for undertaking further education §Diverse salary packaging§And much, much more!§§Penrith City Council's City Planning Department is responsible for coordinating the long term planning for the City. In this role, we deliver a range of programs and services including the development of long term land use planning strategies and policies, city planning, regional planning and place-based planning projects. We work with people in our communities and staff from across the organisation as well as state and federal agencies, businesses, and interest groups.§About the role§It is an exciting future for Penrith and we want you to be part of it!§We are looking for two enthusiastic and motivated team players with relevant planning qualifications to take up the position of Senior Planner within the City Planning Department for a period of two years.  The positions will contribute to the amendment of Council’s Development Control Plan. Council is currently undertaking a comprehensive review of its Development Control Plan over the next year, with further review being undertaken at the completion of important strategic work for our Centres the year after.§This work will lead to amazing opportunities for our City as well as accepting the challenge as of balancing the growth, resilience and livability of our City. You will be part of a planning team that value free exchange of ideas and knowledge, collaboration, quality output and raising each other up and together we are seeking to develop a best practice planning framework for the Penrith community.§Essential Criteria§§Tertiary qualification in urban/town planning or related discipline§Demonstrated experience in the formulation and implementation of land-use planning policy, specifically development control plans§Proven ability to establish, coordinate and/or operate with multi-disciplinary teams§Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills§Demonstrated experience with stakeholder and community engagement§Strong analytical, project management and organisational skills§Demonstrated ability to prioritise and manage competing tasks, meet deadlines and achieve targets§A Current Class C Driver Licence §§Desirable Criteria§§Experience working in a local government environment§Experience in rapid growth area planning/management§Demonstrated experience in projects requiring a high level of urban design outcomes§§Salary §$92,366.00 - $106,917.00 per annum, plus 9.5% superannuation§Benefits§A Leaseback Vehicle is available with this position, however it is not a condition of employment.§A competitive salary will be negotiated commensurate with the skills, qualifications and experience of the preferred applicant.§To submit your application, please apply online using the link below. §Intending applicants are required to submit a cover letter and resume before the closing date, §Tuesday, 27 October 2020§ at §11:55pm§.. §In addition, applicants are required to provide comprehensive responses to the §Essential§ and §Desirable§ selection criteria. Applicants who do not meet the essential criteria will not be considered. §For further information about the position please contact §Abdul Cheema§ on §4732 8120§. §Please allow 4 weeks from the closing date for the processing of your application. §Council practices EEO and WHS principles.§§Penrith City Council is committed to ensuring the safety of our people and community during the COVID-19 pandemic. §§Many of our employees are currently working remotely or in a way that is different to normal, which may impact our recruitment processes including time to respond to applicants and conducting online interviews instead of in-person. Some roles may also require temporary remote working arrangements, if applicable this will be discussed with you at the time of interview.  §§We thank you for your patience and understanding during this time. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50564592.txt	§Sustainability Performance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sustainability Performance Manager§§Advertiser: §QBE§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sustainability Performance Manager §      §        §Your part in a changing world§        §At QBE, we’re driven by our purpose – §to give§ §people the confidence to achieve their ambitions§.§        §We are an international insurer and reinsurer offering a diverse portfolio of commercial, personal and specialty products, as well as risk management solutions. Our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation. We employee a team of more than 11,800 people, in 27 countries around the world.§        §The opportunity§        §An exciting, new opportunity for an experienced Sustainability professional has become available, joining the Group Corporate Affairs and Sustainability division in Sydney.§        §This is an amazing opportunity to contribute to the development of sustainability frameworks, strategy, policy and performance metrics, as well as manage the data collection and reporting of our sustainability performance across the QBE Group.§        §Reporting to the Group Head of Sustainability, you will:§        §          §Lead our annual sustainability materiality assessment process including desktop research and external stakeholder engagement;§          §Contribute to the ongoing review of our Group Sustainability strategy in line with materiality results and agreed sustainability priorities along with QBE’s purpose, vision, strategy and desired culture;§          §Project manage the development of key sustainability targets and associated metrics, including the annual update of our external Sustainability Scorecard;§          §Develop / maintain easy to use data collection and reporting templates;§          §Lead the development of our annual Sustainability Report, including managing internal data collection and verification, the external assurance process and service provider relationships (editors, designers, assurance);§          §Work with key people across the business to collect the information required to complete external analyst surveys (e.g. DJSI, FTSE4Good, ISS, MSCI) and other internal / external reporting requirements;§          §Assess QBE’s current management of sustainability in line with best practice sustainability frameworks, stakeholder expectations, competitor performance and benchmarking results and help to identify strengths, gaps and associated opportunities and risks. Engage with issue owners to discuss improvement opportunities and prepare periodic updates to management with supporting analysis and insight;§          §Support the development and maintenance of overarching sustainability frameworks, policies and procedures and work with Risk on sustainability elements of the Risk & Control Self-Assessment (RCSA); §Monitor alignment with voluntary standards and/or membership of industry sustainability initiatives (e.g. Principles of Sustainable Insurance) and prepare communications of progress where relevant;§          §          §Contribute to the Sustainability Team’s ability to provide strategic counsel on a range of sustainability trends and issues.§        §        §Your story so far§        §          §Previous experience in a similar role; within Insurance or Financial Services industries being advantageous;§          §Strong experience in data analysis, sustainability benchmarking and reporting frameworks (e.g. CDP, DJSI, GRI);§          §Solid understanding of/experience with external assurance processes;§          §Working knowledge of the regulatory and compliance requirements within the Insurance/Financial Services industries;§          §Highly-developed verbal and written communication, and proficiency in developing executive-level reports and presentations that are both commercial and compelling;§          §Strong project management skills;§          §Highly-developed commercial acumen and ability to articulate the business drivers for sustainability;§          §Superior stakeholder management skills, including the ability to gain influence and present across all organisational levels.§        §        §We are here to support you§        §We are proud to have been Voted #5 in the 2019 Top 20 Australian Workplaces for New Dads - HBF Direct Advice for Dads and we achieved Gold employer status in the 2019 & 2020 Australian LGBTI Inclusion Awards. We are also a finalist in the 2020 Australian HR Awards, shortlisted for Best Workplace Diversity & Inclusion Program and Best Health & Wellbeing Program.§        §We also offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstance.§        §As a QBE employee, we will offer you:§        §          §Flex@QBE leave to enhance your work/life integration;§          §Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, which includes a free 12-month subscription to Headspace;§          §Access to ‘Share the Care’ – 12 weeks’ flexible leave for new parents inclusive of paid superannuation;§          §The ability to maximise retirement savings through voluntary super contributions and company matching;§          §Income protection insurance and reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums;§          §Access to REACH My Best - free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, financial and legal advice and confidential counselling;§          §Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services;§          §Benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners such as free and discounted tickets.§        §        §Join us.§        §Click §APPLY §to submit your application. jobText: TXT/50684799.txt	§Senior RPA Developer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior RPA Developer§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§NA§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior RPA Developer §      §        §Are you naturally curious about emerging technologies and how they can deliver value to the enterprise? Do you like logical problem solving and are you meticulous, pragmatic and driven? We are now recruiting for an experienced RPA Senior Consultant to become a valuable member of our Robotics and Process Automate team that have carved out a niche for themselves by deploying multiple Robotic Transformation Projects across Australia.§ § Our Automate practice within Deloitte Consulting is leveraging established and emerging automation technologies to maximise our clients’ productivity and freedom to innovate. As a RPA consultant and developer, you will be empowered to identify automation opportunities that develop impactful solutions for some of Australia’s largest enterprises across different industries. Whether our clients are just beginning their automation journey or looking to scale, you will be there to collaboratively deliver meaningful change.§ § §About the Role§ §        §          §Drive process assessments for robotics process automation opportunities, including preparing documentation of solutions and coding.§          §Analyse, understand and document the business processes in detail where required and communicate effectively with business counterparts and stakeholders.§          §Design RPA process solutions in accordance with standard RPA vendor specific design principles and standards.§          §Configure new RPA processes and objects using core work-flow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand.§          §Support existing processes and implement change requirements as part of a structured change control process.§          §Problem solving issues that arise in day-to-day running of RPA processes and providing timely responses and solutions as required.§          §Communicating with RPA software vendor support team for technical issues and participating with other users in the RPA community.§          §Working within project planning constraints, communicating any identified project risks and issues to the delivery/project manager accordingly and providing inputs to the change control process.§          §Guiding and supporting junior team members as required§          §Perform all technical aspects of RPA development using best in class RPA tools.§        §        §Knowledge and Experience Required§ §        §          §Tertiary Qualification§          §A current baseline security clearance or NV1 will be required.§          §Exposure working with Australian government clients will be highly regarded.§          §Atleast 3 years of working experience within the Automation space§          §Experience in RPA projects within a consulting environment across diverse domains.§          §Process automation using VBA, .NET, JAVA, C++ or equivalent.§          §Development experience using Blue Prism, Ui Path or similar tools.§          §Blue Prism developer accreditation will be preferred.§          §Experience of software development projects, particularly automation projects is preferred.§          §Strong analytical and organisational skills and the ability to handle multiple high-priority projects that meet schedules on time§.§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ § At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § §Next Steps§ § Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now!§ § If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Vishal Wadhwani from the Talent Acquisition team. We’d love to hear from you.This position is only open to Australian Citizens due to the nature of client engagements. For other positions, we encourage Non-residents, Non-citizens to view our Careers page and apply.§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Are you naturally curious about emerging technologies and how they can deliver value to the enterprise? Do you like logical problem solving and are you meticulous, pragmatic and driven? We are now recruiting for an experienced RPA Senior Consultant to become a valuable member of our Robotics and Process Automate team that have carved out a niche for themselves by deploying multiple Robotic Transformation Projects across Australia.§ § Our Automate practice within Deloitte Consulting is leveraging established and emerging automation technologies to maximise our clients’ productivity and freedom to innovate. As a RPA consultant and developer, you will be empowered to identify automation opportunities that develop impactful solutions for some of Australia’s largest enterprises across different industries. Whether our clients are just beginning their automation journey or looking to scale, you will be there to collaboratively deliver meaningful change.§ § §About the Role§ §Drive process assessments for robotics process automation opportunities, including preparing documentation of solutions and coding.§Analyse, understand and document the business processes in detail where required and communicate effectively with business counterparts and stakeholders.§Design RPA process solutions in accordance with standard RPA vendor specific design principles and standards.§Configure new RPA processes and objects using core work-flow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand.§Support existing processes and implement change requirements as part of a structured change control process.§Problem solving issues that arise in day-to-day running of RPA processes and providing timely responses and solutions as required.§Communicating with RPA software vendor support team for technical issues and participating with other users in the RPA community.§Working within project planning constraints, communicating any identified project risks and issues to the delivery/project manager accordingly and providing inputs to the change control process.§Guiding and supporting junior team members as required§Perform all technical aspects of RPA development using best in class RPA tools.§Knowledge and Experience Required§ §Tertiary Qualification§A current baseline security clearance or NV1 will be required.§Exposure working with Australian government clients will be highly regarded.§Atleast 3 years of working experience within the Automation space§Experience in RPA projects within a consulting environment across diverse domains.§Process automation using VBA, .NET, JAVA, C++ or equivalent.§Development experience using Blue Prism, Ui Path or similar tools.§Blue Prism developer accreditation will be preferred.§Experience of software development projects, particularly automation projects is preferred.§Strong analytical and organisational skills and the ability to handle multiple high-priority projects that meet schedules on time§.§§Why Deloitte?§ § At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § §Next Steps§ § Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now!§ § If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Vishal Wadhwani from the Talent Acquisition team. We’d love to hear from you.This position is only open to Australian Citizens due to the nature of client engagements. For other positions, we encourage Non-residents, Non-citizens to view our Careers page and apply.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Manager - Cloud Engineering Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703662.txt	§Senior Manager - Cloud Engineering§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager - Cloud Engineering§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Manager - Cloud Engineering §      §        §§        §Senior Manager - Cloud Engineering§ § §Why Deloitte?§ § From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word!§ § At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life. You could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We pride ourselves on recognising the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every single one of our employees.§ § §About the team§ We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Deloitte's Cloud Engineering is at the forefront of technology. In a world of accelerating change and technology innovation, we help clients identify areas that will make an impact on their business in order to drive focus on practical solutions that support the key business strategies. We then use cloud technologies to implement world-leading innovative solutions that drive exceptional business value.§ § §About the Role§ §        §          §Work hand in hand with client's project and program counterparts to implement Cloud/DevOps transformation and/or migrate enterprise workloads to the AWS cloud platform.§          §Assess the customer Cloud environment maturity, identify gaps and suggest improvements.§          §Create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, automation, security, implementation and operations.§          §Day-to-day lead the customer through the technical and organisational challenges of Cloud and DevOps transformation.§          §Responsible and accountable for Cloud migration and DevOps transformation projects success, adherence to timeline and budget.§          §Drive quality and productivity of local and regional delivery teams.§          §Address risk and issues through concrete action plans by working with the Deloitte and client engagement teams§        §        §Enough about us, let’s talk about you§ § You are strategic, resilient, engaging with people and a natural self-starter. You have a passion for solving complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join the Deloitte Cloud Engineering team.§ § Are you an industry visionary and technologist at heart with a passion for leading complex Cloud transformation programs? Are you able to guide and advise customers and teams on the technical and organizational challenges of Cloud journeys? Do you have strong soft skills with solid stakeholder and program management experience? Do you want to transform businesses, so they can benefit from next-generation IT automation and are able to operate and grow successfully in the cloud-first IT world?§ § Then you have an opportunity to join as a Cloud Engineering Manager/Senior Manager to work with highly skilled and engaged teams across the globe on Cloud transformation and AWS enablement strategies and migration opportunities. You will be working on a range of programs connecting program management, architecture, and delivery.§ § Some of the best opportunities with us are the opportunity to work on leading-edge technologies and platforms with likeminded and passionate engineering teams, knowledge-sharing and collaboration with colleagues from Deloitte's global technical communities, opportunities for continuous professional growth, competitive compensation depending on experience and skills, regular performance feedback and salary reviews.§ § § § §Required Industry Skills/Experience§ §        §          §Regarded as an expert in the Cloud Services space, where clients approach you directly for advice.§          §Regarded as an authoritative expert in one or more Cloud Services concepts & you can provide strategic consulting advice across two or more Cloud Services.§          §Sets the direction for all planned deliverables and communicates to client management.§          §Provides oversight and leadership in the design and development of a Cloud services architecture. Provides oversight in the development of a suitable enterprise architecture or overall solution architecture.§          §Provides team direction on system integration and leads configuration design decisions and best practise compliance controls: eg: §AWS CloudTrail, AWS Config, VPC Flow Logs, Centralised AWS IAM Authentication.§          §Provides direction and leadership in the development of design specifications to ensure quality deliverables.§          §Leads and provides direction in the management of infrastructure build and implementation activities.§          §Reviews overall engagement technical documentation for completeness and ensures it meets high quality standards.§          §Reviews application of tools and quality of the tool output to ensure client requirements are met.§          §Identifies, plans, and manages the use and application of complex system testing techniques.§          §Works with client to develop system acceptance criteria and plan; Manages all aspects of the testing process.§          §Integrates test results into work plan and ensures testing success.§          §Ensures cutover plan is achievable and supportable.§          §Provides team direction and leadership on Process Optimization through the use and implementation of Automation and orchestration§          §Provides team direction and leadership on cost savings initiatives, orchestration, automation and process enhancements§          §Demonstrates significant experience in and expert knowledge of prevailing Cloud services, frameworks, and technologies.§          §Demonstrates in-depth knowledge of complex Cloud service transformation.§          §Formal education or certification in Cloud Services §(AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner, AWS Certified SysOps Administrator - Associate, AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional, AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional) and/or an Architecture framework; Awareness of emerging technology and standards. Formal education in ITIL Fundamentals, service management and service operations. Technical training on prevailing Cloud services, frameworks, and technology;§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ § At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § §Next Steps§ § Sound like the sort of role for you? jobTitle: Head of Risk and Compliance Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50634848.txt	§Head of Risk and Compliance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Risk and Compliance§§Advertiser: §Australian Red Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Salary§§Generous salary packaging options available§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Head of Risk and Compliance §      §        §          §Ongoing role§          §Full time hours§          §North Melbourne location§        §        §About us§        §Australian Red Cross is part of the world’s largest humanitarian organisation. Our vision is human dignity, peace, safety and well-being for all. Our purpose is supporting and empowering people and communicates in times of vulnerability, preventing and alleviating suffering across Australia and internationally through mobilising the power of humanity.§        §About the role§        §As the Head of Risk and Compliance you will manage an Australian Red Cross enterprise wide system of risk management and corporate quality assurance. You will be responsible for enterprise risk identification, analysis, evaluation, prioritisation and mitigation. You will also lead the enterprise frameworks across compliance management for all programs, services and functions of Australian Red Cross.§        §What you will bring§        §          §Significant experience managing risk and compliance obligations in a complex and diverse organisation§          §Strong strategic focus, understanding of strategic risks including principles and practices of Risk Management and the ISO31000§          §Solid understanding of fraud risk management and fraud controls§          §Demonstrated understanding of legislation and ability to provide advice on the suitability of contracts in relation to risk§          §High level communication and interpersonal skills, negotiation and consultation skills with the ability to maintain effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders§          §Masters Degree in Risk Management, Insurance or Business Administration§        §        §Why work with us?§        §Work for purpose, know that the work you do enables Red Cross to support and empower people and communities in times of vulnerability.§        §You can access flexible working arrangements and generous salary packaging options that can increase your take home pay by paying certain expenses using pre-tax dollars up to $15,900 a year.§        §Further Information§        §To find out more about this opportunity, please refer to the position description below or contact Jane Windsor on §0402 461 618§.§        § §PD - Head of Risk and Compliance.pdf§        §We are recruiting directly for this role and will not be accepting candidates from recruitment agencies§        § §        § §        § §      §    §    §  §§§Ongoing role§Full time hours§North Melbourne location§§About us§Australian Red Cross is part of the world’s largest humanitarian organisation. Our vision is human dignity, peace, safety and well-being for all. Our purpose is supporting and empowering people and communicates in times of vulnerability, preventing and alleviating suffering across Australia and internationally through mobilising the power of humanity.§About the role§As the Head of Risk and Compliance you will manage an Australian Red Cross enterprise wide system of risk management and corporate quality assurance. You will be responsible for enterprise risk identification, analysis, evaluation, prioritisation and mitigation. You will also lead the enterprise frameworks across compliance management for all programs, services and functions of Australian Red Cross.§What you will bring§§Significant experience managing risk and compliance obligations in a complex and diverse organisation§Strong strategic focus, understanding of strategic risks including principles and practices of Risk Management and the ISO31000§Solid understanding of fraud risk management and fraud controls§Demonstrated understanding of legislation and ability to provide advice on the suitability of contracts in relation to risk§High level communication and interpersonal skills, negotiation and consultation skills with the ability to maintain effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders§Masters Degree in Risk Management, Insurance or Business Administration§§Why work with us?§Work for purpose, know that the work you do enables Red Cross to support and empower people and communities in times of vulnerability.§You can access flexible working arrangements and generous salary packaging options that can increase your take home pay by paying certain expenses using pre-tax dollars up to $15,900 a year.§Further Information§To find out more about this opportunity, please refer to the position description below or contact Jane Windsor on §0402 461 618§.§ §PD - Head of Risk and Compliance.pdf§§We are recruiting directly for this role and will not be accepting candidates from recruitment agencies§§ § § §§§§

jobTitle: Strategic Enterprise Business Analyst Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50537578.txt	§Strategic Enterprise Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Enterprise Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §RAC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Strategic Enterprise Business Analyst §      §        §RAC is progressing through an exciting transformation journey and we are building a program delivery team to guide RAC towards becoming a truly member centred organisation, with a coordinated roadmap of initiatives to transform our organisation and deliver even greater value to our members.§        §The program delivery team will be the core dedicated resources that will be accountable for driving the outcomes of the Transformation plan and will work across the organisation and with our members, to implement approved initiatives defined in the transformation plan.§        §We have an exciting Strategic Enterprise Business Analyst opportunity to join the program team, and we are looking for passionate, committed individuals with a growth mindset who want to contribute to shaping RAC’s future. One that fully leverages the competitive advantages of a truly member centred organisation to ensure we remain relevant, valued and successful well into the future.§        §What’s the role?§        §Reporting to the Program Manager, you will perform feasibility studies and developing business cases, scoping and mobilising delivery projects and supporting the realisation of benefits across the program, as well as reviewing program risks. This is a three year maximum term contract with the potential for an extension.§        §You will contribute as a key member of the program team by:§        §          §Engaging with senior business leaders to ensure alignment, integration and leveraging the benefits between the program initiatives and the strategic initiatives within Business Units§          §Developing and maintaining of program reporting, including building a program BI dashboard§          §Providing data driven advice to all program stakeholders to facilitate decision making§          §Collaborating with the delivery teams to mobilise projects to achieve commitments defined in business cases§          §Facilitating the development of the Integrated Transformation Program Roadmap§          §You will develop cost control protocols for the program, including forecasting, cost simulations, variance analysis and cost reporting for the program§          §Driving efficiency and innovation in the development of program planning and control processes and protocols§        §        §What are we looking for?§        §          §Significant Business Analysis experience across large scale strategic digital or transformation programs.§          §We are looking for someone with a proven track record of translating highly technical and detailed data into user-friendly reports to include interpretation and recommendations based on the data. §          §Excellent commercial acumen and the ability to think strategically and identify and mitigate risks to the program as well as opportunities§          §Strong conceptual, financial, analytical, interpretive and problem-solving skills.§          §Collaborates effectively with other teams across the organisation, demonstrating understanding around what motivates and challenges colleagues in different areas.§        §        §What can we offer you?§        §          §A competitive base salary plus superannuation§          §Professional career development and training§          §Generous discounts on home, contents and car insurance, plus free roadside assistance§          §Member benefits and opportunity to join a very active Social Club§          §In-house Health and Wellness programs and Platinum WorkSafe Certification§        §        §We are looking for enthusiastic, forward thinking individuals who will thrive in a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration and innovation.§        §Please note:§ §We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as RAC reserves the right to close this vacancy without notice§.§        §Please contact: Andy Jennings - andy.jennings@rac.com.au for more information or if you would like a detailed position description.§        §About RAC§        §For more than 115 years, RAC has been giving back to WA. As a membership organisation, we’re able to reinvest our profits to serve more than one million members and the wider WA community.§        §As an Equal Opportunity Employer, RAC values inclusivity and promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome contributions from all people. We encourage people of all abilities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, diverse cultures and backgrounds, LGBTIQ+ identities, and all age groups to apply.§        §RAC is committed to flexibility. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact §recruitment@rac.com.au§.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§RAC is progressing through an exciting transformation journey and we are building a program delivery team to guide RAC towards becoming a truly member centred organisation, with a coordinated roadmap of initiatives to transform our organisation and deliver even greater value to our members.§The program delivery team will be the core dedicated resources that will be accountable for driving the outcomes of the Transformation plan and will work across the organisation and with our members, to implement approved initiatives defined in the transformation plan.§We have an exciting Strategic Enterprise Business Analyst opportunity to join the program team, and we are looking for passionate, committed individuals with a growth mindset who want to contribute to shaping RAC’s future. One that fully leverages the competitive advantages of a truly member centred organisation to ensure we remain relevant, valued and successful well into the future.§What’s the role?§§Reporting to the Program Manager, you will perform feasibility studies and developing business cases, scoping and mobilising delivery projects and supporting the realisation of benefits across the program, as well as reviewing program risks. This is a three year maximum term contract with the potential for an extension.§You will contribute as a key member of the program team by:§§Engaging with senior business leaders to ensure alignment, integration and leveraging the benefits between the program initiatives and the strategic initiatives within Business Units§Developing and maintaining of program reporting, including building a program BI dashboard§Providing data driven advice to all program stakeholders to facilitate decision making§Collaborating with the delivery teams to mobilise projects to achieve commitments defined in business cases§Facilitating the development of the Integrated Transformation Program Roadmap§You will develop cost control protocols for the program, including forecasting, cost simulations, variance analysis and cost reporting for the program§Driving efficiency and innovation in the development of program planning and control processes and protocols§§What are we looking for?§§Significant Business Analysis experience across large scale strategic digital or transformation programs.§We are looking for someone with a proven track record of translating highly technical and detailed data into user-friendly reports to include interpretation and recommendations based on the data. §Excellent commercial acumen and the ability to think strategically and identify and mitigate risks to the program as well as opportunities§Strong conceptual, financial, analytical, interpretive and problem-solving skills.§Collaborates effectively with other teams across the organisation, demonstrating understanding around what motivates and challenges colleagues in different areas.§§What can we offer you?§§A competitive base salary plus superannuation§Professional career development and training§Generous discounts on home, contents and car insurance, plus free roadside assistance§Member benefits and opportunity to join a very active Social Club§In-house Health and Wellness programs and Platinum WorkSafe Certification§§We are looking for enthusiastic, forward thinking individuals who will thrive in a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration and innovation.§Please note:§ §We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as RAC reserves the right to close this vacancy without notice§.§Please contact: Andy Jennings - andy.jennings@rac.com.au for more information or if you would like a detailed position description.§About RAC§For more than 115 years, RAC has been giving back to WA. jobText: TXT/50646245.txt	§Regenerative Design Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regenerative Design Advisor§§Advertiser: §Mott MacDonald Australia and New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§Competitive salary and benefits package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §    §      §Regenerative Design Advisor §      §        §Mott MacDonald is a global management, engineering and development consultancy that offers a diverse range of opportunities for our people to work with World Expert Practitioners on both small and large scale projects.§With offices in more than 150 countries, our global reach means that we tap into our expertise and resources from across the world. It also means that you will be amazed at the career development opportunities on offer to you.§The role§This is a unique opportunity to support the Regenerative Design Lead to grow regenerative design as a consulting practice in Australia, the Asia Pacific region and globally. The ideal candidate is a holistic systems thinker who has had exposure in applying regenerative principles to large scale projects and has both conducted and applied research. The role requires a background in either a design field such as architecture, urban design, placemaking or in ecological systems thinking with familiarity with biophilic design, biomimicry principles or indigenous design and design for country approaches. The role requires a creative, out of the box thinker who can help develop systems and processes to implement regenerative and biophilic design on a range of projects within infrastructure and buildings. The role includes the creation of visually compelling material that can translate ideas to a wide range of audiences, developing trainings, creating toolkits, conducting research, writing reports and white papers, and assisting with the implementation of regenerative design strategies on large scale infrastructure projects. The role includes being able to understand engineering and architecture drawings/masterplanning documents.§Reporting to Amanda Sturgeon, the role is Sydney based with Asia Pacific and global reach. The Regenerative Design Advisor role will encompass the above responsibilities in addition to connecting to the climate change and social outcomes practices within APNA.§What we want you to bring to the role§• Experience with implementing regenerative or biophilic design principles at the building, infrastructure or urban planning scale, (at least 5 years)§• A track record of using systems thinking to solve problems§• A demonstrated passion for Design for Country and ecological systems thinking§• Demonstrated research skills in regenerative thinking and/or biophilic design§• Exceptional communication skills§• Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite of programs and in-design§• A willingness to be innovative and explore new ideas that may seem impossible to others.§And it’s not just rhetoric when we say we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We take positive steps to create an inclusive culture because we know diversity makes us.§Like what you read? jobText: TXT/50633752.txt	§Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Planner§§Advertiser: §Martinus Rail§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§The Company§Martinus is a 100% Australian owned and operated rail construction company working on some of Australia's largest rail infrastructure projects. We are a company that focuses on finding people who are the right fit into our company culture as much having the right skills and experience. We encourage learning, experimentation and out of the box thinking, and we know that fun is a vital element of an engaged and productive workplace. We value the importance of balance between work and family life; and promote this philosophy throughout the company.§ §Do you thrive on driving a solution focused environment?§ §Are you committed to delivering outcomes that exceed expectations, every time?§ §Do you make things happen, get the job done, no matter what?§ §Job summary:§ §We are seeking a P6 Planner to manage the successful delivery of works on a number of rail projects. This role is flexible to work from 2 locations - Kirrawee or Frenchs Forrest within Sydney. This role will be working closely with the project manager and project leadership team to identify activities and their relationships, estimating duration's, and ensuring that task and sub-task schedules align with contractual requirements.§ §The role consists of:§ §Defining and developing work breakdown structure and packages§ §Inputting project activities§ §Determining activity durations and logic relationships.§ §TXT Task and Responsibilities:§ §Identifying and analysing critical path activities, their constraints and schedule variances that will put key milestone dates at risk and monitoring efforts to update schedules and taking corrective actions to keep projects on track.§ §Developing and managing the resource schedule to ensure appropriate coordination and scheduling of resources.§ §Submitting weekly and monthly progress reports to senior managers on major milestones. This includes a new status of schedule, S-Curves, 6 weeks look ahead report, changes and EVM report.§ §Identifying issues and risks of projects, their potential impacts and performed risk evaluation.§ §Rescheduling the project plan in terms of changes and delays.§ §Knowledge, skills and attributes:  § §Must have experience in a similar role working on rail or civil construction projects§ §Flexible and adaptable with ability to meet changing project demands§ §High computer literacy and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and P6§ §High Level of organisation and ability to meet deadlines§ §If you're keen to join Martinus, and are committed to making a difference, please send us your resume and a cover letter outlining why we can't do without you.§ §To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Please note agency submissions will not be accepted.§ §To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Please note agency submissions will not be accepted.§§§§

jobTitle: Qualified Experienced Psychologist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50589002.txt	§Qualified Experienced Psychologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Qualified Experienced Psychologist§§Advertiser: §McPhee Andrewartha§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Qualified experienced psychologist to join our professional consultancy located in our Melbourne or Adelaide Office.§ §MCA Group is seeking to expand our team by securing the expertise of two qualified experienced psychologists who embrace challenges and strive for excellence in the work they deliver, while maintaining their sound judgement and humour.  With corporate offices in both Melbourne and Adelaide we are looking to expand in both locations as our corporate business continues to thrive and grow.§ §The successful applicant will be joining a dynamic organisation with 40 years’ experience operating out of Melbourne and Adelaide, compromising 4 Directors and a team of talented professionals.  We are a boutique provider of organisational consultancy solutions that combine the best elements of individual wellbeing and organisational psychology.  We provide an extensive range of services to individual clients and to organisations in the public, not-for-profit, and private sectors.§ §A well-matched applicant will be a problem-solver, enjoy challenging and complex work, and value the loyalty and support of a close working, fun and cohesive team. We are seeking people with a desire to work in the organisational psychology field (which is our predominant focus in Melbourne), with an opportunity to provide psychological counselling to clients if you want to keep that area of your practice active (particularly in Adelaide where we have a greater clinical presence).§ §The successful applicants would be either Melbourne or Adelaide based. Our Melbourne professionals are currently working remotely due to COVID-19 restrictions, rather than from our Collins St office, whilst our Adelaide based professionals are working from our Parkside office.§ §To be considered for this role you will ideally possess:§ §-Full registration with AHPRA as a general, clinical, or organisational psychologist.§ §-Minimum of two years post registration experience in a counselling setting, preferably including brief interventions.§ §-Experience in providing organisational consulting services, especially those focussed on leadership, wellbeing, organisational culture and performance.§ §-Experience in adult psychometric assessments.§ §- High motivation, flexibility and proven ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.§ §-Excellent communication skills.§ §-A willingness and availability to travel intrastate and on occasion interstate.§ §Experience in organisational culture and change, leadership coaching and development programs, mediation, and alternate dispute resolution processes will also be highly regarded.§ §Applicants should also have the following:§ §-Current Australian Drivers Licence.§ §-Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency or eligibility to work in Australia.§ §-Current National Police clearance, including working with children and vulnerable persons.§ §MCA pride ourselves on our supportive and collaborative culture. We provide excellent training and mentoring and believe in a flexible approach to work. If you are seeking a part-time role we encourage you to apply indicating your availability and preferred hours of work.§ §To apply for this role please email a cover letter and CV to Alison Budden at §alison@mca-group.com.au§ by 2 October 2020.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a psychologist?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§§§
