jobText: TXT/50609019.txt	§Senior Commercial Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Commercial Analyst§§Advertiser: §Serco Asia Pacific§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Commercial Analyst §    §    §      §        §§        §About you:§        §You are a high performing, motivated and driven self-starter with high level analytical and problem-solving skills, and a collaborative and consultative approach. You have exemplary interpersonal skills with the ability to influence at all business levels.  You are highly confident in your ability to deliver positive and valuable solutions. You have interest in different infrastructure sectors and are curious and enthusiastic about finding the best solutions to operate major assets across Australia to deliver optimal outcomes for our clients and us. You are a respectful and professional person who demonstrates exceptional moral values in everything you do. §        §About the role:§        §You will develop best practice dynamic financial models and provide analytical support, insights and recommendations to the bid team and senior management including the Executive Management Team in quantitative aspects of the bid process. You will be involved in the project management of new and existing business opportunities including management of subcontracts, ensuring achievement of the project budget and provide support for other Business Development activities as required. This role offers a competitive salary and benefits package and will see you working across a broad range of infrastructure sectors and asset types. Having exposure to Serco’s local and global leadership teams will provide you with the opportunity to upskill, be involved in training and professional career opportunities.§        § §        §To be successful in this role you will have:§        §          §Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Commerce, Business or other relevant discipline§          §Qualified or part qualified Accountant to internationally recognised standards (Australian CA, CMA, CFA or CPA or equivalent)§          §Sound experience working in a Sales & Bids environment§          §Advanced financial modelling skills§          §Strong financial and quantitative analysis skills§          §High level accuracy and analytical skills§          §Exceptional problem-solving skills§          §Ability to work under pressure and with tight deadlines§          §Commercial operations, procurement and/ or budgeting experience§          §Able to travel with some frequency both nationally and internationally§          § §        §        §This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment as an essential selection component for this role.§        § §        § §        §About Us§        §Within our Group Corporate teams, we collaborate and support the operational arms of Serco’s Asia Pacific division. We problem solve and innovate across a range of disciplines including Corporate Affairs, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Sales and Bids.§        §At Serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people delivering essential services on behalf of governments and organisations around the world. We apply world's best practice, insights and technology across six key sectors: Citizen Services, Defence, Healthcare, Immigration, Justice and Transport. But no matter your role or where you’re based, we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. To learn more please visit www.serco.com/aspac§        §Join Us§        §If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the §'Apply Now'§ button.§        §Serco values of Trust, Care, Innovation and Pride underpin everything we do.  We are curious, creative and collaborative. Our people help in ways that matter. §        §We are committed to diversity and we encourage people from different backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse and people with disabilities to apply.§      §      §      §    §    §Trust | Care | Innovation | Pride§  §§§§About you:§You are a high performing, motivated and driven self-starter with high level analytical and problem-solving skills, and a collaborative and consultative approach. You will be involved in the project management of new and existing business opportunities including management of subcontracts, ensuring achievement of the project budget and provide support for other Business Development activities as required. This role offers a competitive salary and benefits package and will see you working across a broad range of infrastructure sectors and asset types. Having exposure to Serco’s local and global leadership teams will provide you with the opportunity to upskill, be involved in training and professional career opportunities.§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ §Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Commerce, Business or other relevant discipline§ §Qualified or part qualified Accountant to internationally recognised standards (Australian CA, CMA, CFA or CPA or equivalent)§ §Sound experience working in a Sales & Bids environment§ §Advanced financial modelling skills§ §Strong financial and quantitative analysis skills§ §High level accuracy and analytical skills§ §Exceptional problem-solving skills§ §Ability to work under pressure and with tight deadlines§ §Commercial operations, procurement and/ or budgeting experience§ §Able to travel with some frequency both nationally and internationally§ § § §This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment as an essential selection component for this role.§ § §About Us§Within our Group Corporate teams, we collaborate and support the operational arms of Serco’s Asia Pacific division. We problem solve and innovate across a range of disciplines including Corporate Affairs, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Sales and Bids.§At Serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people delivering essential services on behalf of governments and organisations around the world. We apply world's best practice, insights and technology across six key sectors: Citizen Services, Defence, Healthcare, Immigration, Justice and Transport. jobText: TXT/50607472.txt	§Chief of Staff§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief of Staff§§Advertiser: §Foxtel Management Pty Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Ryde & Macquarie Park§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§You will be  playing a key role as strategist, consultant and implementer.  Using you Management Consulting background to support our Executives at both a strategic and day to day operating level.  Streamlining, tracking and prioritising activities across the operations.  You will also be responsible for planning and driving top priority initiatives and programs under the respective Executive. Your role will encompass a broad range of activities, from highly strategic to tactical. §Your mission§§Assist in handling of day to day activities, coordinating team activity, and relationship management.§Coordinate the execution of strategic initiatives, tracking progress and keeping your Exec updated and abreast of deliverables§Participate in regular meetings with Exec, prepare board packs and papers, taking actions and progressing follow up activities.§Complete tasks as required that may include strategic research, analysis and problem solving, providing Senior Executive team members information for both strategic and operational activities§§Your capability§§Degree qualified in Business, Economics or related field.§Tenure in a Top Tier consulting firm§5+ years’ consulting and/or corporate experience in organizations undergoing business transformation. May include experience in: Project / Program Management, Business Development or business strategy as a Senior Analyst or Adviser.§Strong self-starter, able to meet deadlines and with exceptional organizational skills.§Proven ability to be versatile and action-oriented.§Demonstrated analytical skills along with highly tuned business acumen and strategic thinking§Highly tuned influencing, interpersonal and communication skills§Proven track record of effectively interacting with senior management§Ability to work strategically and collaboratively across teams and departments§Ability to anticipate issues and develop sound issue management mitigation strategies§Ability to interpret & present complex information in concise way§§Working for Foxtel§Foxtel’s purpose is to bring home Australia’s most valued entertainment experience.  Whether it’s a blockbuster sports match, a must-see reality episode, an election special, the newest hit movie or the most ambitious drama, Foxtel brings together the best of TV and on demand for our customers.§Working at Foxtel means being part of something different, better, special. We put our customers first, we own it, we’re authentic, we focus on changing the game, and we win together.§What’s in it for you?§We have a benefits program with something for everyone, but we’re in the entertainment business, so what would a Foxtel benefits program be without a free Foxtel subscription and discounted broadband!§Above all, we’re passionate about entertainment and, if you are too, you’ll love working with us.  So if you’re excited about this opportunity, please click ‘Apply now’.§§§§§

Artefact is growing and we are keen to get the right people on board to take this journey with us.§ §The right person for the job will connect with the six Artefact core values, which are at the heart of what we do, and how we do it.§ § §Think deeply, act bravely – We dare to find creative solutions that go against the flow.§ §Say what you mean, mean what you say – We communicate honestly, with heart, as soon as the need arises.§ §Work as a team, play as a team - We support each other to flourish…and have fun along the way!§ §We are all in this together – Our team is bigger than just us. We treat our clients and stakeholders with the same care and respect as we treat each other.§ §Always give your best, otherwise what's the point? – We do our best work as standard, down to every detail.§ §Bring life to work – We bring our individual passion and purpose to work so we stay true to who we are.§ §Job tasks and responsibilities§ §The position involves working effectively within small teams. These teams are responsible for the provision of Cultural Heritage Management services to a variety of clients and for completing projects on time and to budget.§ §As a heritage consultant you will, under direction, provide technical advice, assistance and heritage services.§ §Skills and experience§ §As well as connecting with the company values, the following skills and experience are important to your success in the role:§ § §Tertiary qualifications in heritage architecture, archaeology or heritage conservation§ §At least one years' experience in heritage consulting (built heritage or archaeology)§ §Exceptional writing skills§ §Strong understanding of project management techniques§ §Understanding of the applicable legislation§ §NSW drivers licence, or equivalent§ §Relevant fieldwork experience would be a bonus.§ §Job benefits and perks§ § §Professional development policy offering leave and an allowance§ §We prefer homegrown talent, so career paths are available as you build skills and experience.§ §Competitive salary package§ §Close to the CBD and all public transport options, working from a heritage wharf.§ §Applications close 7 October 2020. §Apply today or call Frankie Bryant (General Manager) on §0411 691 601§ for a confidential conversation.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

jobTitle: Business Manager Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50543052.txt	§Business Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Manager§§Advertiser: §Synergy Group Australia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Synergy Group is a high performing professional services firm that differentiates itself from the traditional choices, with an established reputation for excellence across various delivery streams. We are government specialists delivering a truly collaborative approach to navigate important challenges and provide practical solutions.§ §As a result of strong and continuing growth in our Program Delivery practice, we are looking for a driven Business Manager to support the Program Delivery Leadership Team. This diverse role will enable you to immerse yourself in the operational areas of the business that will support the continued growth whilst providing support in areas of business development, account management and resourcing to the team. We offer the opportunity to work with an outstanding team of committed professionals, in a culture that values and empowers the individual to realise success.§ §In this role, you will enable the team around you through your contribution to planning and coordination of the Program Delivery business as well as with your involvement and contribution in the Program Delivery Management Meetings. More specifically, you will:§ § §Optimise resource planning and information management processes to assist the Leadership Team with decision making and forward planning§ §Support the co-ordination of the Business Development activities of the Group including, but not limited to, business planning, panel and contract management, preparation of proposals and case studies and qualification meetings§ §Work closely with the Program Delivery Leadership Team to support the Account Management and Strategic Planning activities of the Group§ §Drive the marketing and communication activities of the Group in line with the Synergy Marketing Plan§ §Work closely with the Program Delivery Leadership Team to coordinate the resourcing and recruitment requirements for current and future engagements§ §Manage the implementation of Synergy wide initiatives in the Group§ §Working with other Business Managers in coordinating firm wide processes such as Tender Management§ §Complete ad hoc administration tasks as directed§ §The ideal candidate will demonstrate:§ § §A ‘can do’ positive attitude with an ability to build effective and collaborative working relationships§ §At least 3 years’ experience in a similar role within a consulting firm§ §An understanding and keen interest in Project Management and Change Management§ §Tertiary qualifications in a related field§ §High proficiency in Microsoft Office products§ §A high level of accuracy and attention to detail in your work§ §Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal§ §A strong customer service mindset§ §Strong planning and coordination skills§ §A willingness to learn and develop new skills§ §Your positive attitude, strong communication and relationship building skills will be advantageous in partnering with other Synergites in an authentic and personal way to ensure your success in this role.§ §We will offer you:§ § §An attractive remuneration package, including access to performance bonus schemes§ §A supportive environment that empowers you to thrive and gives you the autonomy and accountability to shape your own success§ §A personalised flexible employment agreement that reflects the way you want to work§ §Continued training and education opportunities to support you on an exciting career path§ §The opportunity to join a real team of likeminded people who will encourage your contributions and respect your perspectives.§ §In addition to a competitive remuneration package you will have the ability to access flexible working options, generous paid Parental Leave benefits, wellness programs, and social events that delight. Community spirit is strong among Synergites with many actively involved in local volunteer community groups.§ §We value diversity and inclusion and believe that no employment opportunity should be limited for any irrelevant reason. All employment decisions are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We respect and empower each individual and seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people.§ §If you are a person with a burning desire to be part of a dynamic team and value the opportunity to showcase your ability, then you should be talking to us. Please send your CV to §recruitment@synergygroup.net.au§. More information about Synergy is available at synergygroup.net.au and at our Synergy Group Australia page on LinkedIn.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a business manager?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

You could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We pride ourselves on recognising the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every single one of our employees.§ § §About the team§ We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Deloitte's Cloud Engineering is at the forefront of technology. In a world of accelerating change and technology innovation, we help clients identify areas that will make an impact on their business in order to drive focus on practical solutions that support the key business strategies. We then use cloud technologies to implement world-leading innovative solutions that drive exceptional business value.§ § §About the Role§ §        §          §Work hand in hand with client's project and program counterparts to implement Cloud/DevOps transformation and/or migrate enterprise workloads to the AWS cloud platform.§          §Assess the customer Cloud environment maturity, identify gaps and suggest improvements.§          §Create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, automation, security, implementation and operations.§          §Day-to-day lead the customer through the technical and organisational challenges of Cloud and DevOps transformation.§          §Responsible and accountable for Cloud migration and DevOps transformation projects success, adherence to timeline and budget.§          §Drive quality and productivity of local and regional delivery teams.§          §Address risk and issues through concrete action plans by working with the Deloitte and client engagement teams§        §        §Enough about us, let’s talk about you§ § You are strategic, resilient, engaging with people and a natural self-starter. You have a passion for solving complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join the Deloitte Cloud Engineering team.§ § Are you an industry visionary and technologist at heart with a passion for leading complex Cloud transformation programs? Are you able to guide and advise customers and teams on the technical and organizational challenges of Cloud journeys? Do you have strong soft skills with solid stakeholder and program management experience? Do you want to transform businesses, so they can benefit from next-generation IT automation and are able to operate and grow successfully in the cloud-first IT world?§ § Then you have an opportunity to join as a Cloud Engineering Manager/Senior Manager to work with highly skilled and engaged teams across the globe on Cloud transformation and AWS enablement strategies and migration opportunities. You will be working on a range of programs connecting program management, architecture, and delivery.§ § Some of the best opportunities with us are the opportunity to work on leading-edge technologies and platforms with likeminded and passionate engineering teams, knowledge-sharing and collaboration with colleagues from Deloitte's global technical communities, opportunities for continuous professional growth, competitive compensation depending on experience and skills, regular performance feedback and salary reviews.§ § § § §Required Industry Skills/Experience§ §        §          §Regarded as an expert in the Cloud Services space, where clients approach you directly for advice.§          §Regarded as an authoritative expert in one or more Cloud Services concepts & you can provide strategic consulting advice across two or more Cloud Services.§          §Sets the direction for all planned deliverables and communicates to client management.§          §Provides oversight and leadership in the design and development of a Cloud services architecture. Provides oversight in the development of a suitable enterprise architecture or overall solution architecture.§          §Provides team direction on system integration and leads configuration design decisions and best practise compliance controls: eg: §AWS CloudTrail, AWS Config, VPC Flow Logs, Centralised AWS IAM Authentication.§          §Provides direction and leadership in the development of design specifications to ensure quality deliverables.§          §Leads and provides direction in the management of infrastructure build and implementation activities.§          §Reviews overall engagement technical documentation for completeness and ensures it meets high quality standards.§          §Reviews application of tools and quality of the tool output to ensure client requirements are met.§          §Identifies, plans, and manages the use and application of complex system testing techniques.§          §Works with client to develop system acceptance criteria and plan; Manages all aspects of the testing process.§          §Integrates test results into work plan and ensures testing success.§          §Ensures cutover plan is achievable and supportable.§          §Provides team direction and leadership on Process Optimization through the use and implementation of Automation and orchestration§          §Provides team direction and leadership on cost savings initiatives, orchestration, automation and process enhancements§          §Demonstrates significant experience in and expert knowledge of prevailing Cloud services, frameworks, and technologies.§          §Demonstrates in-depth knowledge of complex Cloud service transformation.§          §Formal education or certification in Cloud Services §(AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner, AWS Certified SysOps Administrator - Associate, AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional, AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional) and/or an Architecture framework; Awareness of emerging technology and standards. Formal education in ITIL Fundamentals, service management and service operations. Technical training on prevailing Cloud services, frameworks, and technology;§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ § At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § §Next Steps§ § Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now!§ § §Applicants must hold either Permanent Residency or Citizenship to apply for this role§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Manager/Snr Manager - Cloud Engineering§ § §Why Deloitte?§ § From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word!§ § At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life. jobTitle: Manager - Cloud Advisory Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50658405.txt	§Manager - Cloud Advisory§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Cloud Advisory§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Manager - Cloud Advisory §      §        §§        §Manager - Cloud Advisory§ § §Why Deloitte§ § Our Brisbane Cloud Consulting practice is expanding, and we are looking for a Cloud Advisory Manager to join us on our journey. As a global leader in Technology Services, we provide end-to-end technology services from strategy, all the way to implementation. We are passionate about harnessing technology transformation to help our clients solve their most complex problems and navigate disruption.§ § From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word!§ § § At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life. You could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We pride ourselves on recognising the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every single one of our employees.§ § §The Opportunity - Cloud Advisory Manager§ § Are you able to guide and advise customers and teams on the technical and organisational challenges of their Cloud journeys? Do you have strong soft skills with solid stakeholder and program management experience?§ § As a Cloud Advisory Manager, you’ll have the opportunity to work with highly skilled and engaged teams across the globe to help solve our clients’ most complex problems, transforming their business through technology and cloud enablement strategies.§ § §What You’ll Do§ § § Working within our Cloud Advisory practice, you will be expected to learn, understand and apply Deloitte’s methodologies for delivering our core services:§ §        §          §Manage Projects - Delivering engagements in accordance with our Core Cloud and Infrastructure Advisory Services (Cloud and Infrastructure Strategy, Operating Model, Cloud Architecture, Business Case for Change, Solution Assessment)§          §Manage Clients - build and manage relationships, interact with key client stakeholders§          §Manage Scope & Budgets - Having accountability for the development and fulfillment of the engagement work plan - to time and budget§          §Lead people - manage, counsel, coach, mentor.§        §        §What You’ll Have§ § § Cloud advisory is a broad subject and no two engagements are the same. Typically, projects involve a combination of strategy, architecture skills, the ideal candidate will therefore have some combination of the following experience:§ § § IT Strategy§ §        §          §Possess knowledge of the use and impact of IT on clients’ business and industry in order to identify potential issues or business opportunities§          §Make recommendations on the use of technology enablers and industry points of view.§        §        §Operating Models§ §        §          §Apply experience and knowledge of Operating Model frameworks and how they relate to Cloud and Infrastructure Strategy§          §Understand the key roles necessary to operate and migrate cloud workloads§          §Understand the disruptive benefits that cloud can offer and how it can enable broader business transformation.§        §        §Cloud Migration & Architecture§ §        §          §Have experience of large-scale cloud migration-projects and the different models by which clients can move to the cloud and the inherent trade-offs between approaches§          §Apply knowledge of prevailing architecture services, hardware, standards, frameworks, and technology§          §Have experience and knowledge of Cloud and Infrastructure architectures§          §Clearly articulate the importance of architecture from a business perspective.§        §        §What We Offer§ § §        §          §Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best.§          §Rewards platform - your hard work won't go unnoticed at Deloitte.§          §Training and development - at Deloitte we believe in investing in our best assets, the people! You will have access to world class training and funding towards industry and other professional certifications.§          §Pathway to Partnership - receive support and mentoring to progress your career. You will have access to mentors and coaches who will help you pave a path for career progression.§        §        §Sound interesting?§ § §Next Steps§ § If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply online and one of our talent team will review your application accordingly.§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Manager - Cloud Advisory§ § §Why Deloitte§ § Our Brisbane Cloud Consulting practice is expanding, and we are looking for a Cloud Advisory Manager to join us on our journey. As a global leader in Technology Services, we provide end-to-end technology services from strategy, all the way to implementation. We are passionate about harnessing technology transformation to help our clients solve their most complex problems and navigate disruption.§ § From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word!§ § § At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life. You could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We pride ourselves on recognising the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every single one of our employees.§ § §The Opportunity - Cloud Advisory Manager§ § Are you able to guide and advise customers and teams on the technical and organisational challenges of their Cloud journeys? Do you have strong soft skills with solid stakeholder and program management experience?§ § As a Cloud Advisory Manager, you’ll have the opportunity to work with highly skilled and engaged teams across the globe to help solve our clients’ most complex problems, transforming their business through technology and cloud enablement strategies.§ § §What You’ll Do§ § § Working within our Cloud Advisory practice, you will be expected to learn, understand and apply Deloitte’s methodologies for delivering our core services:§ §Manage Projects - Delivering engagements in accordance with our Core Cloud and Infrastructure Advisory Services (Cloud and Infrastructure Strategy, Operating Model, Cloud Architecture, Business Case for Change, Solution Assessment)§Manage Clients - build and manage relationships, interact with key client stakeholders§Manage Scope & Budgets - Having accountability for the development and fulfillment of the engagement work plan - to time and budget§Lead people - manage, counsel, coach, mentor.§What You’ll Have§ § § Cloud advisory is a broad subject and no two engagements are the same. Typically, projects involve a combination of strategy, architecture skills, the ideal candidate will therefore have some combination of the following experience:§ § § IT Strategy§ §Possess knowledge of the use and impact of IT on clients’ business and industry in order to identify potential issues or business opportunities§Make recommendations on the use of technology enablers and industry points of view.§Operating Models§ §Apply experience and knowledge of Operating Model frameworks and how they relate to Cloud and Infrastructure Strategy§Understand the key roles necessary to operate and migrate cloud workloads§Understand the disruptive benefits that cloud can offer and how it can enable broader business transformation.§Cloud Migration & Architecture§ §Have experience of large-scale cloud migration-projects and the different models by which clients can move to the cloud and the inherent trade-offs between approaches§Apply knowledge of prevailing architecture services, hardware, standards, frameworks, and technology§Have experience and knowledge of Cloud and Infrastructure architectures§Clearly articulate the importance of architecture from a business perspective.§What We Offer§ § §Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best.§Rewards platform - your hard work won't go unnoticed at Deloitte.§Training and development - at Deloitte we believe in investing in our best assets, the people! You will have access to world class training and funding towards industry and other professional certifications.§Pathway to Partnership - receive support and mentoring to progress your career. You will have access to mentors and coaches who will help you pave a path for career progression.§Sound interesting?§ § §Next Steps§ § If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply online and one of our talent team will review your application accordingly.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50610502.txt	§Senior Customer Service and Activation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Customer Service and Activation Manager§§Advertiser: §Woolworths Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Customer Service and Activation Manager §      §        §        § §        § §        §          §Passion for Customer Experience §          §Shape the translation of the customer promise§          §Develop key initiatives to deliver customer promise  §        §        § §        §About the Role§ We have an amazing opportunity for someone to join us as a Senior Customer Service and Activation Manager. In this role you will shape the translation of the customer promise to the physical store environment. §        § §        §You will be responsible for developing and activating the 'Woolworths signature moments' and key in-store service initiatives which will deliver our customer service promise. To be effective in this role you will work with a diverse set of stakeholders and will partner very closely with the operations team, training and development team, as well as trainers on-the ground. You will need to be able to develop strategic plans and project manage their activation. §  § In addition, you will ideally have the following attributes:§        §          §Minimum of 5 years experience in Customer facing industries driving customer experience strategies based on customer insight§          §Customer-centric mentality§          §Highly collaborative §          §Strong prioritisation skills §          §Analytical & comfortable with numbers§          §Can-do attitude and result-orientation§  §        §        § §        §Joining the Group§        § §        §As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. §        § §        §We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI inclusion.§        §As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference. §        § §        §We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing. §        § §        §We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.§        § §        §We’d love to hear from You§        § §        §If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au. #LI #Work180§        § §        §Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§        § §        §  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ § § § § §Passion for Customer Experience § §Shape the translation of the customer promise§ §Develop key initiatives to deliver customer promise  § § § §About the Role§ We have an amazing opportunity for someone to join us as a Senior Customer Service and Activation Manager. In this role you will shape the translation of the customer promise to the physical store environment. § § § §You will be responsible for developing and activating the 'Woolworths signature moments' and key in-store service initiatives which will deliver our customer service promise. To be effective in this role you will work with a diverse set of stakeholders and will partner very closely with the operations team, training and development team, as well as trainers on-the ground. You will likely spend as much time in-stores as you will behind a desk - talking to and learning from, customers, operations SME's and trainers.§ § § §Key responsibilities include:§ §Co-design the translation of the customer promise to our physical stores environment§ §Own the activation of the initiatives which will deliver our customer service promise in-store(including key link to trainers and Ops spine)§ §Work closely with Customer Experience & Activation Manager  to identify opportunities, scope and build specific programs to address§ §Closely link with operations and customer transformation § §  §About You§ You are a motivated and pragmatic problem solver who is passionate about improving the customer experience.  To be successful in this role you will need to have some experience working closely in/or with retail operations teams. You will need to be able to develop strategic plans and project manage their activation. §  § In addition, you will ideally have the following attributes:§ §Minimum of 5 years experience in Customer facing industries driving customer experience strategies based on customer insight§ §Customer-centric mentality§ §Highly collaborative § §Strong prioritisation skills § §Analytical & comfortable with numbers§ §Can-do attitude and result-orientation§  § § § §Joining the Group§ § § §As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. § § § §We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI inclusion.§ §As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference. § § § §We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing. § § § §We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.§ § § §We’d love to hear from You§ § § §If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. jobTitle: Senior Consultant - Data engineering Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50677323.txt	§Senior Consultant - Data engineering§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant - Data engineering§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§NA§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Consultant - Data engineering §      §        § §        §          §Salary packaging - to suit your personal and financial circumstances§          §Technology discounts - from Apple, HP, Lenovo, to Windows§          §Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best§        §        §Do you want to work for one of the fastest growing data teams in Australia? Do you want to work on multiple data platforms and provide new solution offerings by leveraging cloud and big data technologies?§ § §About the team§ § Big data, information and analytics. Three words that spark apprehension in most businesses. But our team of experts are constantly curious and excited about combining our wonderful array of technological expertise to transform data into our clients’ most valuable assets, making their work smarter. Our data consultants are supported with resources, training and tools they need to excel at their work, but also the freedom and power to create their own paths forward to make a difference.§ § As a Senior Consultant - Big Data, you will work closely with the team and stakeholders to build and deliver a Cloud based vision for a next generation Big Data analytics platform. You will have a focus on data quality, data security and deliver the systems that process huge volumes of data.§ § §What will you typical day look like?§ § You will play a pivotal role in - Designing and producing high performing and stable applications to perform complex processing of massive volumes of data in a new cloud based architecture; Building real-time data processing applications which are integrated with business systems to enable value from analytic models to drive rapid decision making; Designing data structures (including data storage, data ingestion, analytics layers, data output/input files) on a variety of technological solutions (e.g. RDBMS, Big Data, columnar, NoSQL or graph databases); Contributing to system architecture design for a data platform (including cloud-based structures both on and off premises, data warehouse components and data lakes) focusing mainly on Azure/similar technologies; Support data strategy or technology strategy definition programs, including technology stack definition and target operating model requirements§ § §Enough about us, let’s talk about you:§ § You are someone with:§ §        §          §Experience in building and implementing big data solutions using industry best practice tools, technologies and methods§          §Use of ‘traditional’ data analytics tools and techniques (e.g. MSSQL, Oracle, MySQL) and ETL software (e.g. SSIS, Informatica, CloverETL)§          §Working in large scale cloud data solutions using platforms using Azure as a mandatory requirement§          §Experience in scripting or programming (e.g. Python, Java, Scala, C#)§          §Excellent verbal and written communication skills to adapt to technical and non-technical audiences.§          §Educated to degree level (or have equivalent experience)§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ § At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § §Next Steps§ § Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Do you want to work on multiple data platforms and provide new solution offerings by leveraging cloud and big data technologies?§ § §About the team§ § Big data, information and analytics. jobTitle: Acoustic Analyst Submariner Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50664667.txt	§Acoustic Analyst Submariner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Acoustic Analyst Submariner§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Southern Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$95,000 - $99,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Acoustic Analyst Submariner §      §        §§        §Your role: §        §In this unique role, you’ll operate, supervise and manage all passive and active sonars and acoustic sensors on board submarines. You’ll undergo extensive training to learn how to detect, track and classify noise sources in the ocean, passing the critical information that you gather on to Command. This role is vital to protecting the submarine from being detected and helps keeps Australia’s maritime environment free from the threat of enemy attack.§        § §        §As an Acoustic Analyst Submariner, you’ll be operating some of the most advanced systems in the Navy—making tactical recommendations relating to the information and data that you receive.§        § §        §In addition to your core duties, you’ll also be involved in tasks that affect the operation of the submarine.  These may include being part of the submarine's medical emergency team, and carrying out seamanship duties. When the submarine is on the surface, you’ll take part in roles like control room watch-keeping, lookout, helmsman, first response team for incidents and assisting in small boat and aviation operations.  When the submarine is underwater, you’ll keep watch as a sonar operator and fulfil a range of other positions like navigator’s assistant, damage control and survival equipment sailor. All this provides great variety day-to-day.§        § §        §This role enables you to play a vital part in protecting your country as part of a Navy force that’s second to none. All while travelling the world with a tight-knit team that become your best mates.§        § §        §Life in the Navy: §        §A career in the Navy is a challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. You can expect to feel a unique sense of accomplishment and pride from serving and protecting our country and helping to keep our vast coastlines safe.§        § §        §Life in the Navy is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy varied lifestyles, rewarding careers, opportunities to travel, and excellent social and fitness facilities, free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§        § §        §Don’t worry, it’s not all life at sea—there’s more to the Navy than ships, submarines and helicopters.  Some days, you might be exploring exciting new countries with your fellow crewmates. Other days, you could be based locally not too far from home.§        § §        §Salary: §        §Be paid to train and learn the skills required to become a qualified Acoustic Analyst Submariner. Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of up to: $99,600 including service and uniform allowances, as well as a Maritime Allowance (if applicable).§        § §        §In addition to your salary, you will receive generous superannuation, housing subsidies and free medical and dental care.§        § §        §Apply Now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths. However, you may apply while still studying year 10.§        § §        §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Acoustic Analyst Submariner and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Navy.§        §https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/acoustic-analyst-submariner§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Your role: § §In this unique role, you’ll operate, supervise and manage all passive and active sonars and acoustic sensors on board submarines. You’ll undergo extensive training to learn how to detect, track and classify noise sources in the ocean, passing the critical information that you gather on to Command. This role is vital to protecting the submarine from being detected and helps keeps Australia’s maritime environment free from the threat of enemy attack.§ § § §As an Acoustic Analyst Submariner, you’ll be operating some of the most advanced systems in the Navy—making tactical recommendations relating to the information and data that you receive.§ § § §In addition to your core duties, you’ll also be involved in tasks that affect the operation of the submarine.  These may include being part of the submarine's medical emergency team, and carrying out seamanship duties. When the submarine is on the surface, you’ll take part in roles like control room watch-keeping, lookout, helmsman, first response team for incidents and assisting in small boat and aviation operations.  When the submarine is underwater, you’ll keep watch as a sonar operator and fulfil a range of other positions like navigator’s assistant, damage control and survival equipment sailor. All this provides great variety day-to-day.§ § § §This role enables you to play a vital part in protecting your country as part of a Navy force that’s second to none. All while travelling the world with a tight-knit team that become your best mates.§ § § §Life in the Navy: § §A career in the Navy is a challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. You can expect to feel a unique sense of accomplishment and pride from serving and protecting our country and helping to keep our vast coastlines safe.§ § § §Life in the Navy is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy varied lifestyles, rewarding careers, opportunities to travel, and excellent social and fitness facilities, free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§ § § §Don’t worry, it’s not all life at sea—there’s more to the Navy than ships, submarines and helicopters.  Some days, you might be exploring exciting new countries with your fellow crewmates. Other days, you could be based locally not too far from home.§ § § §Salary: § §Be paid to train and learn the skills required to become a qualified Acoustic Analyst Submariner. Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of up to: $99,600 including service and uniform allowances, as well as a Maritime Allowance (if applicable).§ § § §In addition to your salary, you will receive generous superannuation, housing subsidies and free medical and dental care.§ § § §Apply Now: § §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths. However, you may apply while still studying year 10.§ § § §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Acoustic Analyst Submariner and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§ §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Navy.§ §https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/acoustic-analyst-submariner§§§§

jobTitle: Governance & Risk Partner - HSE Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50592809.txt	§Governance & Risk Partner - HSE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Governance & Risk Partner - HSE§§Advertiser: §Arc Infrastructure Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Governance & Risk Partner - HSE §      §        §Arc Infrastructure manages and develops transport infrastructure assets that support growth and create jobs in WA. Rail is at the heart of our business, and the 5,500km rail network is the backbone of freight transport in Western Australia from the diverse Midwest across to the fascinating Goldfields and Yilgarn regions through to the stunning South West and Great Southern. We’re committed to working with industry, our customers, partners and communities to find new opportunities that will support and strengthen our rail network for the benefit of WA.§        §The Opportunity§ §        §We have a fantastic opportunity for a proactive and passionate person to join our dynamic Governance & Risk team in the role of Governance & Risk Partner – HSE. This role is an 18 month contract based out of our head office at Perth Airport and involves regular travel across our regional rail network.§        §As Governance & Risk Partner - HSE you will proactively and collaboratively work with our stakeholders to prevent harm to our people, contractors and the environment. Working closely with the Projects and Third Party teams this role has a large focus on HSE risk, compliance and assurance activities.  §        §You will lead by example and contribute to the advancement of a positive HSE culture including Safeworking practices, environmental awareness and improved HSE maturity.§        §The Role§        §The key activities include:§        §          §Supporting and advising Managers, Leads and Supervisors to ensure the safe delivery of operational project activities.§          §Provides HSE guidance and advice on Network Safeworking Rules to jobText: TXT/50602250.txt	§Environmental Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Environmental Officer§§Advertiser: §Ventia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Darwin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Environmental Officer §      §        §Ventia’s acquisition of Broadspectrum, completed in June 2020, brings together two highly complementary businesses, each with a proud heritage of providing essential infrastructure services in Australia and New Zealand. We are one of the largest suppliers of essential services in the region, and are proud to provide the expertise to keep infrastructure working for our communities. No one else does exactly what we do in the way we do it.§        §Following Broadspectrum’s acquisition by Ventia and future opportunities, we are excited to engage an Environmental Technical Officer to support our Defence Base services contract in Northern Territory.  We currently provide support across five Defence bases in the NT which includes four sites in Darwin and one in the Katherine area as well as a number of remote ranges.§        §The primary purpose of the role is to partner with business and contract leadership to ensure successful contact delivery, management and provide technical support for environmental services across the regions/zones of the Defence Base Services. This role would see you monitor, report  and provide advice on operational aspects of environmental program delivery. Our ideal candidate will have experience and exposure in putting together environmental strategies, policies and programs that promote sustainable improvement.  As well as identify, design and implement business improvement programs, deliver assurance programs and compliance activities.  §        §We recognise that people are our greatest asset and are committed to being an employer of choice.§        § §As result we seek to employ people who will succeed in this role and who will likely have:§        §          §Drive a culture of customer satisfaction through high quality program delivery§          §Ensure compliance with environmental legislation§          §Lead the implementation of environmental policies and best practices§          §Coordinate the development and implementation of environmental strategies that support sustainable Defence capability§          § Ensure timely implementation of key environmental programs, including, but not limited to: bushfire management, week management, feral animal and overabundant native species management, groundwater and surface water quality monitoring and land condition monitoring§          §Advise and provide technical support to contract and project managers on matters of environment and sustainability§          §Respond to unplanned environmental issues through short-term works, variations to existing programs or other appropriate means§          §Audit, analyze and report environmental performance to internal and external stakeholders and regulatory bodies§          §Develop and nurture relationships with key stakeholders including suppliers and subcontractors;§          §Provide estimating and scoping support for Defence Base Services Contract Change Proposals, survey and quote proposals, ad hoc works and business cases§          §Write environmental reports, assuming the lead responsibility within the service delivery for the region/zone.§        §        § §It is essential that the incumbent has the following:§        §          §Tertiary qualifications in the Environmental sciences or equivalent experience.§          §Experience in the Environmental or Defence portfolio’s highly regarded.§          §Excellent communication experience and effectiveness.§          §Experience in Project Management or Contract Management is favourable.§        §        § If you are already a seasoned and successful Environmental professional with a passion and energy for engaging people, their hearts and minds and commitment to operating safely and you’re ready for the next big step in your career, then this might be the role for you.§        § We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures.     §The Perth USAsia Centre is located at The University of Western Australia (UWA).  UWA is ranked amongst the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of portfolio of the Centre’s policy-oriented programs.  Reporting to the Research Director, you will play a key role in representing the Centre and engaging with key stakeholders based on the east diplomatic domains.§        §Ideally, you will have significant experience in developing and delivering international policy across government, and strong networks across the nation within all competency in Foreign Affairs or International Relations§          §Substantial experience in international policy development and/or research§          §Substantial experience in the policy sector, research-led reports and policy briefs§          §An understanding of not-for-profit organisations and exposure to think tank is desirable§        §        §Full details of the position's We celebrate inclusion and diversity and believe gender equity is fundamental to achieving our goal of being a top 50 university by 2050.§        §          §We have child friendly areas on campus, including childcare facilities. jobText: TXT/50251009.txt	§Expression of Interest: Senior Consultant | Leadership Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Expression of Interest: Senior Consultant | Leadership Development§§Advertiser: §Maximus International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Expression of Interest: Senior Consultant | Leadership Development §      §        §Who is Maximus?§        §Maximus is one of the top leadership consultancies specialising in transforming organisations from the inside out. We act with intent.§ §The Opportunity:§ §We are seeking an ambitious Senior Consultant who is looking to progress their career in leadership. Maximus designs solutions that connect with personal, people, strategy and customer leadership. In this role you have the opportunity to demonstrate creativity through innovative design and facilitation, to shift mindset and capability, and maximise impact within a broad range of clients.§ §Responsibilities include:§ § §Designing experiential solutions that shift mindsets, build capability, and creates value by addressing the needs of our clients and the leaders within § §Creating innovative supporting materials to enhance the learning experience (facilitator guides, slides, case studies, role plays, simulations, etc)§ §Engaging solution delivery, facilitation and coaching § §Contributing to the firm's growth through thought leadership§ §Requirements:§ § §Experience working within the leadership consultancy environment §ideally coming from either a boutique or mid size firm. The role would ideally suit a candidate with 2-5 years experience, looking to grow your career§ §A post-graduate qualification would be highly desirable but not essential if extensive, relevant business experience and a proven track record of success have been achieved§ §Enablement and embedding (culture formation, change navigation, talent and succession management)§ §Measurement (organisational performance; performance management; ROI methodology)§ §Excellent written and spoken communication skills including the ability to influence and have impact § §Outcomes obsessed, strong attention to detail and quality execution § §Strong client focus and stakeholder management skills§ §Resilient, adaptable and comfortable with ambiguity § §Core consulting skills: problem solving, visualisation of information - MS Office including PowerPoint and Word; project/intervention design; project management (time, cost and quality focus)§ §We have created a stimulating and unique working environment where the rewards, both professional and personal, are exemplary. This role would suit someone wanting the flexibility of a nimble and growing consultancy, one that is able to align your goals to their growth. § §For more information about §Maximus§ please visit our website at §www.maximus.com.au§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

strong communication skills (written and verbal) and can engage across the business and IT§ §Why choose NSW Land Registry Services§ §NSW Land Registry Services (NSW LRS) is internationally recognised as a leader in land administration.  We've earned this position by maintaining trusted and reliable processes and data to underpin the NSW economy whilst having the courage to transform and innovate.  NSW LRS collects, collates and integrates property information in NSW.  The property data built and maintained by NSW LRS are among NSW's most important commercial and historical information assets.§ §We'll contribute to your growth by:§ § §Providing ongoing training and personal development.§ §Expanding your project management skills and knowledge§ §Improving your skills in team communication, collaboration and stakeholder management across the conveyancing industry and government§ §Providing opportunity to execute high impact projects based on the strategic goals and opportunities of the company§ §The successful applicant will be required to undertake a Police and Finance check.§ §If you're passionate about this newly created role, please submit an application. All face critical sustainability challenges and our clients in these and many other areas rely on our ability to assist them operate more sustainably which has a positive impact on our planet.§        §ERM established a presence in Australia in 1994 and has since grown to offices located in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Brisbane, Perth, Newcastle and Canberra. Offices have been strategically located to service our key clients across a range of sectors. The breadth of our experience enables us to provide full life cycle services to our clients, both at the corporate level and facilities level providing insight into our client's organisations that few of our competitors can rival.§        §Our team includes professionals whose expertise is called on at a regional and global level, which provides the opportunity to bring international best practice methodologies and approaches to local clients through first-hand experience§        § §        §About the role§        § §        §ERM's Liability Portfolio Management & Remediation (LPMR) Service §        §Environmental liabilities are a part of almost every company's asset portfolio and balance sheet. Drive innovation within the technical community§          §Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment to build ERM's business, as well as to lead client and technical teams§          §Meet business financial targets, overall project budget and schedule, client satisfaction / expectations, and internal and contract requirements§          §Partner with Account Directors to actively develop commercial strategies to pursue and win new business opportunities that result in significant revenue growth with target clients aligned with ERM's global strategy:§              §Provide business value selling at the top levels of client organisations, raising the profile of ERM's capabilities within key client organisations, §              §Develop new client relationships and expand existing relationships§              §Maintain pulse on industry business cycles and prioritise sales efforts toward high-potential, top opportunities.§              §Utilising technical understanding to develop proposals, including written content, pricing, presentations, contracting.§            §          §        §        § §        §Benefits and perks§        § §        §Our Partnership Model Offers Unparalleled Opportunities For Leaders With Ambition, Vision And Proven Expertise§§This Partner-level opportunity would suit a Principal/Director/VP-level professional looking to further their career with an equity stake in an established, successful and stable global environmental firm. jobTitle: Senior Manager - Strategic Partnerships Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50600412.txt	§Senior Manager - Strategic Partnerships§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager - Strategic Partnerships§§Advertiser: §TransGrid§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§ §Unique and exciting opportunity working as part of a high performing team § §Intellectually stimulating and rewarding work!§ §Full time position based in Sydney - Ultimo§ § §Who we are§ §At TransGrid, our work improves the lives of millions – from lighting up sports fields, schools and homes, to powering the wheels of commerce and everything else in between. Now it’s your turn to make it happen.§ §TransGrid offers fulfilling careers for driven people who can help ensure that our business and the essential services we provide to consumers, the community and key stakeholders are continually improving. With us you will thrive in a collaborative environment where new ideas and knowledge sharing are encouraged, and where you’ll be supported through opportunities to develop and achieve your full potential.§ §This is an exciting time in the energy industry with the transition to renewable energy. Recent government policies outline plans to facilitate increasing transmission interconnection between states and development of renewable energy zones. § §The Opportunity§ § §This is a unique opportunity for an experienced professional to be part of a team supporting improved outcomes for TransGrid by advocating for policy and regulatory reform.  This role is a senior leader in the Policy team.  Policy has a significant impact on the financial and operating environment of TransGrid as well as the services it can offer.  Engagement in policy also impacts TransGrid’s reputation with stakeholders and consumers as an industry leader and contributes more broadly to its social licence to operate.§ §You will be an innovative thinker and have the versatility and eagerness to work in a transforming and changing environment.§ §As the Senior Manager – Strategic Partnerships you will:§ § §Develop and implement strategic and commercial partnerships with other organisations in the broader business community, energy sector, research sector and technology sector in order to further TransGrid’s strategy and policy agenda§ §Identify innovative ways for TransGrid to develop alignment with private sector organisations advocating for policy reform§ §Identify collaboration opportunities with interest groups and community organisations to support the advocacy positions of TransGrid§ §Develop and manage the implementation of an advocacy plan for working and collaborating with other organisations in the energy sector to deliver on TransGrid’s holistic blueprint for policy reform§ §Cultivate and maintain relationships with strategic partners§ §Manage the negotiation, development and implementation of all relevant partnership agreements and documentation§ §Develop, build and maintain strong working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders§ § §Skills & Experience§ § §What we expect from you: § § §Relevant tertiary qualifications, Bachelor’s degree minimum, Master’s degree desirable§ §Proven experience in managing and leveraging strategic partnerships and opportunities to achieve commercial outcomes§ §Demonstrated experience in the identification of strategic partnerships to implement corporate strategy§ §Strong networks within the business and research industries at senior levels§ §Ability to negotiate commercial partnerships with large commercial organisations§ §Demonstrated achievement in building strong corporate relationships with Australian and global organisations § § §Recognition & Reward§ §What you can expect from us:§ § §Structured leadership and development programs§ §Flexible work arrangements available§ §14 weeks Parental Leave (includes adoption)§ §2 weeks Other Parent Leave§ §Annual picnic day (additional day off)§ §Health and Wellbeing Programs§ §Salary sacrifice and novated leasing options § §Access to sports and social clubs § § §In return for your hard work we have numerous benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to private health insurance discount, motor vehicle lease plan, career development support, study assistance program and workplace flexibility.§ §Join us and make it happen for your career, and for the millions of Australians who rely on our services every day.§ §To view our Privacy Statement and how we handle personal and sensitive information click §here§.§ §Applications close on Friday, 18 September, 2020§ §Due to the current COVID-19 restrictions in place, the successful candidate may be required to commence their employment working from home. TransGrid actively promotes flexible working arrangements within our teams. We have strong team structures, culture and communication tools in place to ensure all employees remain actively connected to each other and the broader organisation.§ § §Our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, we will assess applications as they are received and interviewing may commence earlier than closing date.§ § §We do not accept agency introductions as TransGrid operates a direct sourcing model.§ §​​​​​​​§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50617035.txt	§Senior Enterprise Risk Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Enterprise Risk Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Sydney Water Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Enterprise Risk Business Partner §      §        § §        §          §Implementation of the Enterprise Risk Management Framework in the business and relevant enterprise improvement projects.§          §Coach and mentor staff and Managers on the importance of risk informed decision making§          §1 x Permanent Opportunity & 1 x 12 months with a view for extension.§          §Location, Parramatta.§        §        §At Sydney Water, we’re passionate about making a difference to the lives of our customers and communities.§ § §About us§ § We have a proud heritage and a progressive future, providing world class drinking water and beautiful waterways from the mountains to the sea. We see the world is changing so we are changing too. Our people and their jobs are as diverse as the communities we serve.§ § §About the role§ § Help us innovate to meet the challenges of our growing cities as our Senior Enterprise Risk Advisor . In this role, you will be engaging with internal stakeholders to enable them to apply risk management in decision making and planning.§ § You will also support key enterprise programs and ensure risk management is consistently applied and sustained through all stages of the program. This will involve coaching and mentoring staff and Managers on the importance of enterprise risk management. You will also be required to:§ §        §          §Engage with the business to develop and uplift enterprise risk management capability.§          §Develop enterprise risk profile§          §Integrate risk management into key business processes and monitor its implementation.§          §Ensure enterprise risk management is consistently applied in projects§          §Conduct risk workshops and provide risk support for enterprise change programs§        §        §About you§ § With your strong experience in understanding and implementation of enterprise risk management you will provide fit for purpose advice in management of public health, safety, environment, reputation, compliance, finance, customer and performance related risks for the business areas.
