For more information, you can contact § § We want your perspective and ideas to help us find better ways to delight our customers, so we encourage you to apply no matter your age, sex or culture. You can be part of a committed, highly skilled team who’ll appreciate what you bring to the table. You’ll set and achieve real goals and make decisions that matter, as together we help shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney.§ § As part of the application process, Sydney Water will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role. We will also use your personal information to establish a LiveHire talent profile in our Talent Community. We look at our Talent Community first when new opportunities come up when you apply for a role. Your personal information will be collected in accordance with LiveHire’s §Terms, §Privacy Policy§ and Sydney Water’s §Privacy Collection Statement - Job Application§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Implementation of the Enterprise Risk Management Framework in the business and relevant enterprise improvement projects.§Coach and mentor staff and Managers on the importance of risk informed decision making§1 x Permanent Opportunity & 1 x 12 months with a view for extension.§Location, Parramatta.§At Sydney Water, we’re passionate about making a difference to the lives of our customers and communities.§ § §About us§ § We have a proud heritage and a progressive future, providing world class drinking water and beautiful waterways from the mountains to the sea. We see the world is changing so we are changing too. Our people and their jobs are as diverse as the communities we serve.§ § §About the role§ § Help us innovate to meet the challenges of our growing cities as our Senior Enterprise Risk Advisor . In this role, you will be engaging with internal stakeholders to enable them to apply risk management in decision making and planning.§ § You will also support key enterprise programs and ensure risk management is consistently applied and sustained through all stages of the program. This will involve coaching and mentoring staff and Managers on the importance of enterprise risk management. You will also be required to:§ §Engage with the business to develop and uplift enterprise risk management capability.§Develop enterprise risk profile§Integrate risk management into key business processes and monitor its implementation.§Ensure enterprise risk management is consistently applied in projects§Conduct risk workshops and provide risk support for enterprise change programs§About you§ § With your strong experience in understanding and implementation of enterprise risk management you will provide fit for purpose advice in management of public health, safety, environment, reputation, compliance, finance, customer and performance related risks for the business areas. You will also demonstrate:§ §Qualifications in risk, business improvement, management systems or similar experience, relevant to the role.§Working Knowledge in a similar role for a large organisation.§Recent, relevant experience in implementation of a risk management framework in a large organisation.§Ability to influence and coach decision makers to adopt risk management practices by demonstrating how risk management helps protect and create value.§Ability to communicate, negotiate and influence at all levels§You must be an §Australian Citizen§ or §Permanent Resident§ at the time of submitting your application to be considered for this role. For more information, you can contact § § We want your perspective and ideas to help us find better ways to delight our customers, so we encourage you to apply no matter your age, sex or culture. You can be part of a committed, highly skilled team who’ll appreciate what you bring to the table. You’ll set and achieve real goals and make decisions that matter, as together we help shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney.§ § As part of the application process, Sydney Water will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role. We will also use your personal information to establish a LiveHire talent profile in our Talent Community. We look at our Talent Community first when new opportunities come up when you apply for a role. Your personal information will be collected in accordance with LiveHire’s §Terms, §Privacy Policy§ and Sydney Water’s §Privacy Collection Statement - Job Application§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Manager Energy Market Reform Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50600411.txt	§Manager Energy Market Reform§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Energy Market Reform§§Advertiser: §TransGrid§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§ §Unique and exciting opportunity working as part of a high performing team § §Intellectually stimulating and rewarding work!§ §Full time position based in Sydney - Ultimo§ § §Who we are§ §At TransGrid, our work improves the lives of millions – from lighting up sports fields, schools and homes, to powering the wheels of commerce and everything else in between. Now it’s your turn to make it happen.§ §TransGrid offers fulfilling careers for driven people who can help ensure that our business and the essential services we provide to consumers, the community and key stakeholders are continually improving. With us you will thrive in a collaborative environment where new ideas and knowledge sharing are encouraged, and where you’ll be supported through opportunities to develop and achieve your full potential.§ §This is an exciting time in the energy industry with the transition to renewable energy. Recent government policies outline plans to facilitate increasing transmission interconnection between states and development of renewable energy zones.§ §The Opportunity§ §This is a unique opportunity for an experienced professional to be part of a team supporting improved outcomes for TransGrid by advocating for policy and regulatory reform.  Regulation and policy has a significant impact on the financial and operating environment of TransGrid as well as the services it can offer now and into the future. Engagement in policy also impacts TransGrid’s reputation with stakeholders and consumers as an industry leader and contributes more broadly to its social licence to operate.§ §You will be an innovative thinker and have the versatility and eagerness to work in a transforming and changing environment.§ §As the Manager Energy Market Reform you will:§ § §Establish and inform policy that will best position the business during the period of change unprecedented since the establishment of the National Electricity Market (NEM)§ §Develop and manage the Reform Blueprint for TransGrid, which outlines the policy positions TransGrid will advocate for in order to deliver on its Corporate Strategy and growth objectives§ §Identify the policy, regulatory and market reform initiatives to support the execution of TransGrid’s Reform Blueprint§ §Lead the preparation of TransGrid’s submissions and review submissions prepared by industry associations on any regulatory, market or policy matters§ §Work closely with the broader Strategy, Innovation and Technology team as well as other TransGrid teams to ensure the reform initiatives are holistically developed§ §Influence the development of policies, law, rules, and regulatory decisions affecting regulated electricity and gas network businesses generally§ §Understand the evolving external environment and be the internal SME on these issues§ §Monitor and analyse the activities carried out by industry associations associated with the economic regulation of network businesses§ §Lead the preparation of TransGrid’s submissions and review submissions prepared by industry associations on any regulatory, market or policy matters§ §Represent TransGrid to external stakeholders on regulatory and/policy matters as required§ § §Skills & Experience§ §What we expect from you:§ § §Tertiary qualifications at degree level as an economist, or equivalent degree. Bachelors minimum, master’s degree preferred§ §Minimum 10 years’ experience working in a private sector organisation in the broader energy market§ §Extensive knowledge and understanding of the energy market dynamics and emerging issues§ §Must demonstrate strong technical, analytical, and written and oral communication skills§ §Extensive experience in negotiating and influencing stakeholders§ §Extensive experience in preparing policy and regulatory submissions§ § §Recognition & Reward§ §What you can expect from us:§ § §Structured leadership and development programs§ §Flexible work arrangements available§ §14 weeks Parental Leave (includes adoption)§ §2 weeks Other Parent Leave§ §Annual picnic day (additional day off)§ §Health and Wellbeing Programs§ §Salary sacrifice and novated leasing options § §Access to sports and social clubs§ § §In return for your hard work we have numerous benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to private health insurance discount, motor vehicle lease plan, career development support, study assistance program and workplace flexibility.§ §Join us and make it happen for your career, and for the millions of Australians who rely on our services every day.§ §To view our Privacy Statement and how we handle personal and sensitive information click §here§.§ §Applications close on Friday, 18 September, 2020§ §Due to the current COVID-19 restrictions in place, the successful candidate may be required to commence their employment working from home. TransGrid actively promotes flexible working arrangements within our teams. We have strong team structures, culture and communication tools in place to ensure all employees remain actively connected to each other and the broader organisation.§ § §Our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, we will assess applications as they are received and interviewing may commence earlier than closing date.§ §We do not accept agency introductions as TransGrid operates a direct sourcing model.§ § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Policy Officer Secretariat Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50554983.txt	§Policy Officer Secretariat§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy Officer Secretariat§§Advertiser: §Aboriginal Housing Victoria§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Policy Officer Secretariat – Aboriginal Housing Victoria§ § §Employer: Aboriginal Housing Victoria§ §Work Type/s: full time, 12 month contract§ §Location: Based in Melbourne (North Fitzroy)§ §Applications close: 25 September 2020§ §Aboriginal Housing Victoria (AHV) is an Aboriginal community organisation responsible for managing over 1,500 rental properties for Aboriginal and /or Torres Strait Islander people living in Victoria. AHV’s vision is to ensure that Aboriginal Victorians secure appropriate, affordable housing as a pathway to better lives and stronger communities.§ §In addition to being the largest Aboriginal Registered Housing Agency in Australia, AHV is the lead agency for Victoria’s Aboriginal housing and homelessness policy, §Mana-na worn-tyeen maar-takoort§. As the housing policy lead in the Aboriginal community, AHV has dual roles to hold the Government to account in securing the resources and reforms to implement the policy, while we support sector development to empower Victoria’s Aboriginal community to determine its chosen housing future.§ §Reporting to the Director of Strategy and Performance the Policy Officer is responsible for undertaking a range of secretariat and policy functions to support the goals of AHV.  The Policy Officer is expected to research, analyse and evaluate a wide range of information, options and other data to develop policy positions, secretariat papers and proposals.§ §The Policy Officer will:§ § §Undertake secretariat support functions for the Executive Management Group and the Board and its subcommittees, including coordination of a range of business plan and other reports and briefing papers.§ §Provide information and advice to the executive group on statutory and other matters that may impact on AHVs operations and responsibilities.§ §Maintain registers of actions and/or decisions of the Executive Management Group, the CEO and the Board and its subcommittees.§ §Undertake research and analysis (including the identification of best practice) in respect of specified areas for policy and program development.§ §Provide high quality and timely written materials including correspondence, briefings and presentations and/or project briefs.§ §Build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders across the sector and with like agencies to develop and refine policy positions, protocols and program design.§ §We are looking for someone who will bring a client centred focus to the role and with the following key attributes and skills (KSC):§ § §Awareness and appreciation of Aboriginal societies and cultures and an understanding of the issues affecting Aboriginal people in contemporary Australia and the diversity of circumstances of Aboriginal people.§ §Experience in Minute taking, meeting coordination, collation of secretariat papers and accurate records and document management.§ §Experience in developing a diverse range of corporate and operational policies, program procedures and manuals by undertaking the various aspects of the policy making process; such as research, development, consultation, drafting, implementation and review.§ §High level interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to work collaboratively within and across teams to ensure the completion of common goals.§ §Demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information both in writing and verbally, together with the ability to communicate complex concepts to a broad audience.§ §Demonstrated analytical, problem solving and negotiation skills, particularly when working with a diverse range of stakeholders.§ §Knowledge of the roles of Local, State and Federal Governments and the community housing sector.§ §Highly organised with the ability to work on multiple tasks, manage competing priorities and work under pressure to meet deadlines.§ §A relevant tertiary qualification is preferred.§ §This position will be based in our North Fitzroy office when COVID-19 restrictions allow us, but will be working from home until further notice.§ §National Police records check and a Working with Children Check are required for this position.§ §To apply, please submit a resume and cover letter addressing the key selection criteria in the attached position description by COB 25 September 2020. A copy of the Position Description can be found on our website http://ahvic.org.au/§ §Applications should be sent to §jobs@ahvic.org.au§ using the subject line: Corporate Services Officer§ §Please direct enquiries about the position to Louise Carey on §0491 732 321§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Associate Director - Environment Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50604999.txt	§Associate Director - Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Director - Environment§§Advertiser: §Ricardo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Ricardo is a global sustainability consultancy and our ambition is to create a world fit for the future. We help our clients solve some of the world’s most complex environmental challenges and provide governments, public agencies and businesses with leading analysis, advice and data.§ §Operating across the world, we work in partnership with our customers to help transform the way they work, empowering business leaders with award winning consultancy advice. With unrivalled sector insight and a reputation for producing innovative solutions, we offer a stimulating and rewarding environment in which to work.§ §The opportunity§ § §We have an opportunity for a highly experienced Associate Director to lead and direct a wide range of exciting and innovative Environmental Advisory & Approvals and Environmental Science projects. This is an opportunity for you be at the forefront of establishing an international brand in the Australian market, whilst leveraging an globally respected business. Drawing upon Ricardo’s focus on innovation you will be involved with a broad range of projects focused on Renewable Energy, Waste to Energy, Environmental Infrastructure, Infrastructure Sustainability and Environmental Sustainability, working across both the public and private sector.§ §You will work closely with an established management team in Australia, and will also have support to draw upon from the wider international business. You will lead and manage a small team of consultants across Victoria and will be responsible for growing the Environmental Advisory & Approvals and Environmental Science business areas. You will utilise your strong commercial and business development skills to further grow and enhance the team and you will be rewarded for bringing your network of clients and local experience.§ §On a day-to-day basis you will be responsible for leading, directing and managing a team and will actively contribute to strategy and business development. You will often be acting as the technical lead on complex consultancy projects and proposals and will need to have the necessary skills, experience and aptitude to lead from the front and collaborate with a wide range of experts across the company and in partner organisations. § §We are looking for a unique individual who has strong capabilities and proven experience in operational development, technical expertise and business development in the Environmental Advisory & Approvals and Environmental Science sectors. You will have a proven track record, strong market credentials and great customer and commercial skills. You will also have experience of leading teams and will be passionate about developing and mentoring junior team members.§ §Skills and experience§ §You should have the following skills and experience:§ § §Extensive consultancy experience in Environmental Advisory & Approvals and Environmental Science.§ §Strong commercial and business development skills, coupled with a track record of identifying and securing new consultancy work, as well as supporting and leading complex proposals and consultancy projects.§ §Strong communication skills, and experience of collaborating with diverse stakeholders/audiences and facilitating agreement between conflicting parties.§ §Possess a good network of contacts across Victoria at a management and/or operational level and ideally be recognized as an industry leader within your chosen technical area.§ §You will have an established client base of national clients, with a specific focus on Victoria§ §An interest in supporting international projects.§ §An ability to build relationships both internally and externally.§ §Be an effective and proactive business leader, capable of supporting and developing peers.§ §Flexible approach, including a willingness and ability to work on a wide range of topics.§ §We operate in an interesting and innovative environment, offering you the opportunity to make your mark in an expanding international company. You will have support from the wider business in developing a personal development plan for your career to develop into a wide range of future opportunities. We have excellent training and development opportunities and you will have the opportunity to work in new and emerging markets.   § §This is an exciting and rewarding place to work, with the opportunity to make a difference. What sets us apart is our People. You will work with an exceptional team of talented, dedicated and supportive individuals. You will have a fantastic opportunity to develop your career with us through our broad range of projects, mentoring opportunities and a personalised approach to your learning and development.§ §Our People are important to us and we take pride in our wellbeing programmes and policies that support individuals including flexible working, carers policy, mental health first aiders and readily available support through our extensive Employee Assistance programme.§ §Ricardo Energy & Environment has an ambitious diversity, equality and inclusion approach.§ §Once you have submitted your application a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch. Please be aware that the timing can vary dependent on the volume of applications that we receive for each role and in some cases, we may start to review applications prior to the closing date.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50567951.txt	§Senior Actuary, Workers compensation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Actuary, Workers compensation§§Advertiser: §Taylor Fry§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Actuary, Workers compensation §      §        §Taylor Fry are seeking a qualified Senior Actuary with workers compensation experience for a newly created role in our Injury Schemes team.§        §The opportunity§        §Taylor Fry’s Injury Schemes practice is growing, and we are committed to investing in this growth. Our Injury Schemes team has identified a need for a general insurance Senior Actuary with accident compensation experience, preferably in workers compensation.§        §Our ideal hire is highly motivated: you see opportunity, love to innovate and you’re eager to support future business growth. This role will require you to leverage and develop your strong network to drive business development and client engagement. You’ll also scope and lead projects, and assist with the management and development of junior team members. In return for your commitment, we can offer you a flexible and collegiate environment where your contribution is valued. With bonuses based on firm profits rather than individual targets, you’ll have the freedom to make your own mark, with your career development trajectory supported and nurtured by your colleagues.§        §Our Injury Schemes practice offers client-focused solutions to governments and self-insurers across Australia and New Zealand. We cater to a range of demands, from conventional liability valuations to full-service offerings, with a focus on advanced analytics. As a senior member of the Injury Schemes team, you can expect to support projects such as scheme design and reform analysis, claims triage, claim pathways analysis, valuations, pricing and portfolio monitoring, and other services that give schemes and large self-insurers insights into scheme dynamics.§        §About us§        §We help business and government leaders see a clear way forward.§        §Taylor Fry’s actuarial and analytics consultants support our clients in making strategic decisions to enhance the financial health of their organisations, and benefit communities, people and society.§        §We are creative problem solvers – from physicists and engineers to mathematicians and computer scientists. This variety strengthens our advice to meet the needs of our clients and their customers.§        §Our innovations have led to changes in government policy in Australia and New Zealand, and continue to break new ground, particularly in the social sector. Qantas liked our approaches in analytics so much, it bought a 51 per cent stake in our business in 2015.§        §About our culture§        §Our firm was established so that staff would be encouraged and rewarded for being collaborative. We nurture our employees’ interests and support their growth and development. We’re known for doing great work, for our innovation and our thought leadership. Our people particularly love immersing themselves in the technical detail, which they can explore beyond day-to-day client projects by rotating in and out of research roles in our own research and development arm, TF labs.§        §We take an active interest in our people and their careers, and promote work practices that support wellbeing, mental wellness and work/life balance. The range of benefits we offer include flexible work hours, remote working, paid parental leave, bonuses based on profit share, as well as sporty and more relaxed social activities to suit your style.§        §Skills and experience§        §We are seeking candidates who have a minimum of 12 years’ experience gained in a consultancy or corporate environment, where the role required the cultivation and engagement of a strong network.  Candidates will be Actuarial Fellows.§        §As Taylor Fry is a consultancy, it is imperative that candidates are strong communicators who have good interpersonal skills and are confident liaising with clients and identifying new opportunities.§        §How to apply§        §Please apply by 8 October, and to the attention of Angela Wakenshaw, People & Culture Manager.§        §All applicants must have the right to work in Australia.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Taylor Fry are seeking a qualified Senior Actuary with workers compensation experience for a newly created role in our Injury Schemes team.§  §The opportunity§  §Taylor Fry’s Injury Schemes practice is growing, and we are committed to investing in this growth. You’ll also scope and lead projects, and assist with the management and development of junior team members. In return for your commitment, we can offer you a flexible and collegiate environment where your contribution is valued. With bonuses based on firm profits rather than individual targets, you’ll have the freedom to make your own mark, with your career development trajectory supported and nurtured by your colleagues.§  §Our Injury Schemes practice offers client-focused solutions to governments and self-insurers across Australia and New Zealand. We cater to a range of demands, from conventional liability valuations to full-service offerings, with a focus on advanced analytics. As a senior member of the Injury Schemes team, you can expect to support projects such as scheme design and reform analysis, claims triage, claim pathways analysis, valuations, pricing and portfolio monitoring, and other services that give schemes and large self-insurers insights into scheme dynamics.§  §About us§  §We help business and government leaders see a clear way forward.§  §Taylor Fry’s actuarial and analytics consultants support our clients in making strategic decisions to enhance the financial health of their organisations, and benefit communities, people and society.§  §We are creative problem solvers – from physicists and engineers to mathematicians and computer scientists. This variety strengthens our advice to meet the needs of our clients and their customers.§  §Our innovations have led to changes in government policy in Australia and New Zealand, and continue to break new ground, particularly in the social sector. Qantas liked our approaches in analytics so much, it bought a 51 per cent stake in our business in 2015.§  §About our culture§  §Our firm was established so that staff would be encouraged and rewarded for being collaborative. We nurture our employees’ interests and support their growth and development. We’re known for doing great work, for our innovation and our thought leadership. Our people particularly love immersing themselves in the technical detail, which they can explore beyond day-to-day client projects by rotating in and out of research roles in our own research and development arm, TF labs.§  §We take an active interest in our people and their careers, and promote work practices that support wellbeing, mental wellness and work/life balance. The range of benefits we offer include flexible work hours, remote working, paid parental leave, bonuses based on profit share, as well as sporty and more relaxed social activities to suit your style.§  §Skills and experience§  §We are seeking candidates who have a minimum of 12 years’ experience gained in a consultancy or corporate environment, where the role required the cultivation and engagement of a strong network.  Candidates will be Actuarial Fellows.§  §As Taylor Fry is a consultancy, it is imperative that candidates are strong communicators who have good interpersonal skills and are confident liaising with clients and identifying new opportunities.§  §How to apply§  §Please apply by 8 October, and to the attention of Angela Wakenshaw, People & Culture Manager.§  §All applicants must have the right to work in Australia.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50562514.txt	§Manager, Marketing Effectiveness§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager, Marketing Effectiveness§§Advertiser: §The Nielsen Company (Australia) Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$85,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§About This Job§ §The Nielsen Marketing Effectiveness team improve clients’ return on marketing investment from planning to delivery. We deploy cutting edge techniques that ultimately provide the best understanding of how the§modern consumer interacts with media content. Our work ranges from complex market mix modeling and advanced analytic consulting to measuring the effectiveness of TV and digital advertising, right through to solutions that provide longitudinal analysis on consumer behaviors and attitudes in relation to products and media.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Responsible for establishing and managing strong client relationships to drive client retention as well as business expansion.§ §Develop and lead client teams through designing, executing and presenting analytic studies to meet clients’ research objectives on the fast-moving digital landscape§ §Deliver insights and recommendations on industry-leading Multi-Touch Attribution, Marketing Mix and Lift analytics§ §Penetrate and establish enduring client relationships with senior decision-makers at clients by demonstrating on-going value by driving client outcomes§ §Ensure pro-active insights and action-oriented solutions are delivered to the team by being an expert with an ability to explain methodology behind key analytics to clients§ §Partner with clients to provide the best marketing plan based on the results of analysis and optimizations§ §Develop decks to report results & provide advice, and present to the client§ §Develop recommendations based on the insights derived from the analysis§ §Collaborate with other Nielsen teams to provide holistic support to clients. §  § §A Little Bit About you§ §Turn complexity into simplicity and show clients how to spend their marketing dollars. We’re looking for a manager-level analyst to work with our Marketing Mix Modelling solution in Sydney.§You are a consultative, client-facing individual with some experience managing complex projects. Ideally, you have a bit of experience working with analytic consulting and specifically marketing mix modeling, or a similar field. You’ll be able to communicate complexity in a simple way.§ § §Requirements§ § §Bachelor degree required (economics or statistics preferred), the advanced degree also preferred§ §Minimum 4 years of marketing research, econometric analysis or analytics experience. § §Ideally, some experience working with or selling analytical techniques, such as regression modeling, attribution modeling or other forms of measuring Return on Marketing Investment (ROMI) or a related / comparable field.§ §Enjoy being hands-on with data and analysis§ §Enthusiasm for applying statistical analysis to address business issues§ §Comfortable working with large data sets§ §Well-organized and detail-oriented, capable of handling several projects at a time while meeting deadlines§ §Strong communication and presentation skills§ §Strong technical market research skills§ §Strong project management skills§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50538552.txt	§Manager - Actuarial Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Actuarial Consulting§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Manager - Actuarial Consulting §      §        §About Deloitte§ § §Flexibility, opportunity and incredible experiences are the rewards for your time at Deloitte. You will be trained in core technical skills, but also to be able to think creatively and innovatively. We will work to give you projects with a wide range of professionals across Deloitte, to enable you to learn first-hand how actuarial skillsets can be combined with other competencies to create a leading solution to a problem.§ § Like many financial services’ roles, a significant portion of what actuaries currently do today may not exist in 5-10 years’ time, and our focus on innovation and creative thinking will prepare you and your career to be part of that next-generation of the actuary.§ § §Next Steps§ § If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that aligns with your experience and career goals, we want to hear from you. phone§        §      §      §      §    §    §If you would like to find out more about CNH Industrial, please visit us at:§ https://www.cnhindustrial.com/en-us/careers/ §    §  §§§§Is today the day you take a §step towards your new career? § §If you are looking for a challenging and an exciting role with the autonomy to make a difference, then make your next career move and take a step in the right direction with IVECO. § §Transforming itself both globally and locally, IVECO is offering a unique opportunity for a dynamic, driven and innovative Network Development Executive to §take our company into the §future as a leader §and integrated partner in sustainable transport solutions.§ §This key leadership role will redefine and build the network strategy for IVECO, while delivering sustainable and profitable growth, with a focus on increasing performance in targeted segments.§ §Based South East of Melbourne, you will lead an effective function to ensure the network is aligned to the greater business development strategies of IVECO, through setting clear objectives and guiding the segment towards the overall IVECO vision.§ §Responsibilities include:§ § §Define and implement a new distribution strategy, with the overall objective to maximize ROI while delivering growth and innovation§ §Improve dealer capability through implementing training strategies to enable dealers to express a high level of brand affinity, understand and deliver on-trend technical product development, and overall drive financial growth§ §Define the standard contracts of "franchise" and follow the evolution of the legislation§ §Manage the transaction of all the plans of investment/disinvestment in the acquisition/sale of third-party dealerships and of owned dealerships/branches to maximize the benefit for IVECO§ §Develop criteria and tools for dealer expansion, consolidation, termination, etc.§ §Define and implement dealer development projects encompassing Standards, Image  and Financial management, equity programs and the dealer advisory board§ §Interface with external dealer business consultants to strategize and contribute to specific dealer actions (consolidations, buyouts, etc.)§ §Requirements§:§ § §Tertiary business qualification is highly regarded§ §Proven leadership experience working in a B2B and / or dealer network environment§ §Network experience in the Commercial vehicle/Heavy Transport industry is preferred§ §Strong interpersonal, motivation and negotiating skills§ §Ability to represent the Company at board level§ §Advanced written and verbal communication skills§ §Why IVECO?§ §Joining IVECO and being part of CNH Industrial means working in a dynamic and multicultural environment, in a lean and flexible organization that is open to new opportunities in emerging markets, with a strong focus on research and innovation aimed at achieving excellence at all levels.§ §Benefits§ § §Supportive working environment with ongoing training and career progression opportunities § §Onsite parking and subsidised café§ §As part of your package you will be offered competitive remuneration, bonus structure, company vehicle, laptop and phone§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Remote Sensing Analysts Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50550431.txt	§Remote Sensing Analysts§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Remote Sensing Analysts§§Advertiser: §Astron Environmental Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Remote Sensing Analysts §      §        §About Us§        § §        §Astron Environmental Services is one of Australia's longest established environmental consultancies with a history of operations spanning over 30 years. Astron is an inclusive and innovative company that places high value on its employees. The company aligns around the collective values of mutual respect, operating safely and delivering high quality innovative services for our clients.§        §Our Earth Observation team is high-performing, innovative and quality focused. We are made up of remote sensing and GIS specialists, professional statisticians and environmental scientists, that work with a diverse range of clients from the resource industry to local government, across Australia and internationally. Our success is based on working closely with our clients to find solutions that assist them to monitor, understand and best manage their natural resources.§        § §        §The Role§        § §        §We have 2 exciting opportunities for experienced remote sensing analysts to join our professional team! In this role you will have freedom to innovate, extend your knowledge and generate new scientific solutions to complicated projects. You will get to work with the latest hardware, the best commercial data and a diverse team of specialized and experienced scientists.§        §Our remote sensing analysts use geospatial programming deployed on local and cloud-based high performance computing environments to analyse huge volumes of spatial data. Other exciting features of this role include:§        §          §Developing and utilising Python scripts for geospatial analyses§          §Making technical contributions to remote sensing and geospatial projects§          §Working closely with other scientists and clients regarding technical information both verbally and through scientific writing§          §Working on large and complex projects as part of a successful team§          §Developing new innovative approaches to traditional problems.§        §        §To be considered for this role you will need to demonstrate your experience with geospatial programming and your remote sensing knowledge. This includes image processing, using image classification, change detection, terrain mapping, image enhancement / manipulation, machine learning and statistical analyses. §        § §        §Salary, Benefits & Perks§        § §        §Competitive Salary: $68,000 – $73,000 per annum§        §Fantastic Employee Benefits: We offer a huge range of benefits such as flexible work hours, time in lieu system, shared parking on a rostered basis,  influenza vaccinations and subsidised annual skin checks. §        §Friendly Team Culture: We are a culture focused company who enjoys many social events throughout the year!§        §Convenient Location: Our office is located in the heart of East Perth. It's surrounded by parks, restaurants, public transport, parking and great coffee!§        § §        § §        §Required Skills§        §        §          §A graduate degree or Higher in Environmental and / or Spatial Sciences§          §Minimum 1 year post graduate experience in environmental remote sensing§          §Demonstrated knowledge of spatial science§          §Comprehensive knowledge of remote sensing data (including UAV, Aerial and Satellite Imagery)§          §High level Python programming skills. Some exposure to Java and R programming is required.§          §Good understanding of computer science and data analysis.§          §Minimum 1 year consulting experience working on complex projects.§          §Ability to engage in critical thinking§        §        §        §Further, you must have strong written and verbal communication skills, be able to work effectively as part of a team and display a strong commitment to health, safety and the environment.§        §      §      §To apply for this position, please send a covering letter, current CV and salary expectations to §jobs@astron.com.au§. For further information contact Emma Cook on §(08) 9421 9600§. §Please note that:§• Applicants must have the right to work in Australia§• Due to the volume of candidates applying for Astron vacancies, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted§• The following naming guide must be used for all applications FIRSTNAME.LASTNAME.DOCUMENTTYPE for example Jessica.Smith.Resume§• Astron handles recruitment processes internally and this vacancy is not open to Recruitment Agencies §    §  §§§About Us§ § §Astron Environmental Services is one of Australia's longest established environmental consultancies with a history of operations spanning over 30 years. Astron is an inclusive and innovative company that places high value on its employees. The company aligns around the collective values of mutual respect, operating safely and delivering high quality innovative services for our clients.§ §Our Earth Observation team is high-performing, innovative and quality focused. We are made up of remote sensing and GIS specialists, professional statisticians and environmental scientists, that work with a diverse range of clients from the resource industry to local government, across Australia and internationally. Our success is based on working closely with our clients to find solutions that assist them to monitor, understand and best manage their natural resources.§ § §The Role§ § §We have 2 exciting opportunities for experienced remote sensing analysts to join our professional team! In this role you will have freedom to innovate, extend your knowledge and generate new scientific solutions to complicated projects. You will get to work with the latest hardware, the best commercial data and a diverse team of specialized and experienced scientists.§ §Our remote sensing analysts use geospatial programming deployed on local and cloud-based high performance computing environments to analyse huge volumes of spatial data. Other exciting features of this role include:§ §Developing and utilising Python scripts for geospatial analyses§Making technical contributions to remote sensing and geospatial projects§Working closely with other scientists and clients regarding technical information both verbally and through scientific writing§Working on large and complex projects as part of a successful team§Developing new innovative approaches to traditional problems.§ §To be considered for this role you will need to demonstrate your experience with geospatial programming and your remote sensing knowledge. This includes image processing, using image classification, change detection, terrain mapping, image enhancement / manipulation, machine learning and statistical analyses. § § §Salary, Benefits & Perks§ § §Competitive Salary: $68,000 – $73,000 per annum§ §Fantastic Employee Benefits: We offer a huge range of benefits such as flexible work hours, time in lieu system, shared parking on a rostered basis,  influenza vaccinations and subsidised annual skin checks. § §Friendly Team Culture: We are a culture focused company who enjoys many social events throughout the year!§ §Convenient Location: Our office is located in the heart of East Perth. It's surrounded by parks, restaurants, public transport, parking and great coffee!§ § § § §Required Skills§ §A graduate degree or Higher in Environmental and / or Spatial Sciences§Minimum 1 year post graduate experience in environmental remote sensing§Demonstrated knowledge of spatial science§Comprehensive knowledge of remote sensing data (including UAV, Aerial and Satellite Imagery)§High level Python programming skills. Some exposure to Java and R programming is required.§Good understanding of computer science and data analysis.§Minimum 1 year consulting experience working on complex projects.§Ability to engage in critical thinking§ §Further, you must have strong written and verbal communication skills, be able to work effectively as part of a team and display a strong commitment to health, safety and the environment.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50606464.txt	§Environmental Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Environmental Consultant§§Advertiser: §Mott MacDonald Australia and New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§Competitive salary and benefits package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §    §      §Environmental Consultant §      §        §Mott MacDonald is a dynamic and innovative management, engineering and development consultancy working on landmark projects worldwide. Wholly independent and employee owned, we have over 16,000 staff worldwide working in all sectors including transport, energy, buildings, water, environment and advisory. Our Vision is to be the world’s leading employee-owned consultancy, opening opportunities with connected thinking to create solutions that make a lasting difference for humanity and the environment.§We have an exciting opportunity for an environmental consultant to join our growing Sydney team. This position can be a part time or fulltime role. You will be joining a diverse team of consultants who are passionate about what they do, with a proven track record guiding our clients, and leading delivery of critical infrastructure projects.§You will be come apart of our multi-disciplinary environment and sustainability team, which covers all aspects of statutory approvals, strategic planning, environmental assessments, environmental management, carbon management, climate resilience, sustainable building and infrastructure design, and corporate sustainability reporting and strategy development.§We work as part of a vibrant and diverse office of engineering, technology and management specialists who work together on schemes which have social and environmental benefits. We also engage with local communities through our outreach work and have an active social scene which is inclusive to all our people.§Role Specific Duties: §• Provide specialist advice in relation to statutory planning, planning and environmental approvals, environmental management and impact assessments to facilitate project outcomes.§• Project manage approvals processes, including leading stakeholder engagement, coordination of specialist assessments, interfacing across project teams, and documentation.§• Deliver client services and project management excellence.§• Leverage existing client relationships and build new relationships in continued support of developing a more diverse and robust business.§• Mentor junior environment and sustainability team members to build capability in a team focused, positive environment.§• Lead and support the development of proposals and bid submissions.§About you:§• Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science, or similar.§• Relevant experience in statutory planning and environmental assessment.§• Broader experience in the transport sector, environmental management and stakeholder management would be viewed favourably.§• Familiarity with Commonwealth and NSW environmental legislation and their application to facilitate the delivery of infrastructure projects§• Experience working on TfNSW projects (including RMS)§We offer you all the benefits that come from working in a global consultancy, including a competitive salary, ongoing professional support, career development and a great opportunity to work on iconic projects. We are committed to fostering a culture that empowers our people, promotes teamwork and embraces sustainability.§There’s no time like the present to make a change.§      §      §      §      §        §      §    §    §  §§§Mott MacDonald is a dynamic and innovative management, engineering and development consultancy working on landmark projects worldwide. This position can be a part time or fulltime role. You will be joining a diverse team of consultants who are passionate about what they do, with a proven track record guiding our clients, and leading delivery of critical infrastructure projects.§You will be come apart of our multi-disciplinary environment and sustainability team, which covers all aspects of statutory approvals, strategic planning, environmental assessments, environmental management, carbon management, climate resilience, sustainable building and infrastructure design, and corporate sustainability reporting and strategy development.§We work as part of a vibrant and diverse office of engineering, technology and management specialists who work together on schemes which have social and environmental benefits. We also engage with local communities through our outreach work and have an active social scene which is inclusive to all our people.§Role Specific Duties: §• Provide specialist advice in relation to statutory planning, planning and environmental approvals, environmental management and impact assessments to facilitate project outcomes.§• Project manage approvals processes, including leading stakeholder engagement, coordination of specialist assessments, interfacing across project teams, and documentation.§• Deliver client services and project management excellence.§• Leverage existing client relationships and build new relationships in continued support of developing a more diverse and robust business.§• Mentor junior environment and sustainability team members to build capability in a team focused, positive environment.§• Lead and support the development of proposals and bid submissions.§About you:§• Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science, or similar.§• Relevant experience in statutory planning and environmental assessment.§• Broader experience in the transport sector, environmental management and stakeholder management would be viewed favourably.§• Familiarity with Commonwealth and NSW environmental legislation and their application to facilitate the delivery of infrastructure projects§• Experience working on TfNSW projects (including RMS)§We offer you all the benefits that come from working in a global consultancy, including a competitive salary, ongoing professional support, career development and a great opportunity to work on iconic projects. We are committed to fostering a culture that empowers our people, promotes teamwork and embraces sustainability.§There’s no time like the present to make a change.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50582664.txt	§Social and Environmental Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social and Environmental Manager§§Advertiser: §APG & Co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§The Social and Environmental Manager is responsible for developing and leading APG & Co's social and environmental sustainability beyond compliance and be an integral part in driving our sustainability goals throughout the organisation and achieving specifics targets for each of APG & Co's brands Sportscraft, SABA and JAG.§You will be reporting to Head of Factory & Fabric Strategy and will have one direct report supporting on global auditing.§ §APG & CO§A leader in the Australian fashion industry, APG & Co designs and manages Sportscraft, SABA and JAG. For over 50 years, APG & Co. has curated, grown and evolved these brands to be at the forefront of Australian fashion. We celebrate our history while allowing our brands to express themselves in contemporary, relevant and authentic ways.§We have an unwavering commitment to design and quality across all aspects of our business. This commitment, when coupled with our creativity and passion allows us to bring great brands to life in engaging and surprising ways.§APG & Co has over 1200 employees across Australia and New Zealand.§The working environment is dynamic, professional and passionate. The mission: Bringing Style to Life. APG & Co values working as a collective, thriving on change, and playing to win. We are built to last.§The Role§ §Input & execute the strategic vision and implement a roadmap for achieving APG Sustainable goals§ §Identify opportunities of positive impact: people, planet, talent§ §Take control of the development and implementation of environment strategies within the organization§ §Be responsible for the delivery and execution of our core values as documented in our Sustainability Statement§ §Risk Assessment: Identify areas of improvement and collaboratively build roadmap for the next steps of mid and long-term goals§ §Work with sourcing team to identify risks and opportunities within the supply chain around social impact and the environment§ §Review global Restricted Substance List (RSL) testing requirements to ensure minimums are to industry and legal standards§ §Ongoing research of key sustainability issues and practices, as well as benchmarking against industry best practice and trends§§You§ §Extensive experience working within the sustainability field, ideally gained within a Fashion or FMCG organisation§ §Great understanding of garment materials and finished goods production§ §Great understanding of best sustainability procurement practices§ §A strategic thinker and extremely organised§ §Passionate about sustainability and have experience in strategic development and execution§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Work well independently as well as being a great collaborator§ §Strong project management skills, a hands-on approach, good problem-solving skills§§Where do I sign?§This full-time role is based in our stunning head offices in Alexandria. We offer lots of flexibility to keep your work/life balance healthy, 50% discount on products, sample sales, paid parental leave, a fun, fast-paced working environment, and excellent opportunities for growth and development. Style your career in a new direction and apply now.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50538693.txt	§Business Algorithms - Senior Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Algorithms - Senior Consultant§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Algorithms - Senior Consultant §      §        §About Deloitte§ § §Flexibility, opportunity and incredible experiences are the rewards for your time at Deloitte. We champion and support our talented people in achieving their career goals and collectively celebrate success.§ § § Join a high performing culture of talented people, who are motivated and passionate about building and implementing information based solutions. We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte professionals who are supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, to create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of '..and different'.§ § From day one at our firm, you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we know that you perform other roles within your life - you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace flexibility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.§ § §About the Team§ § § We are a team of talented Actuaries, Data Scientists and Quants who love to use our unique blend of technical and commercial expertise. Coupling the power of data with our human-centred approach, we solve client problems with a deep appreciation of behavioural science. We provide clients with end-to-end quantitative solutions, from strategic advice, data management and modelling, to the final execution.§ § Working between our Business Algorithms and Actuarial team, you will have the opportunity to:§ §        §          §Be part of a multi-disciplinary analytics team to help a major insurance client to target customers who are most likely to leave and purchase cover elsewhere.§          §Work for a large insurer to assess the value for a potential acquisition of an insurance company.§          §Dive into solving complex client problems and work on a variety projects from different industries (i.e. Financial Services, Health-Pharma, Telco & Retail industries.§          §Hone your modelling skills, develop your approach to delivering projects, work within teams, and develop your client facing skills§        §        §About the role:§ § This role will provide deep statistical, mathematical and financial expertise to support the team’s core purpose of providing technical quantitative advice and analytics solutions to achieve the strategic business’ goals.§ § §About you§ § To be considered for this role, critical to your success will be your knowledge and experience in:§ §        §          §Strong experience working in quantitative modelling or advanced analytics role, requiring deep expertise of statistical / actuarial modelling and machine learning.§          §Experience using SQL and a good understanding of Python is mandatory. Other programming languages desirable, including R, SAS, Matlab, C/C++ and/or analytics platforms such as Alteryx, SageMaker or similar.§          §Relevant quantitative degree in actuarial studies, statistics, engineering, mathematics, econometrics or related field.§          §Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyse data, identify key issues, develop solutions and drive data-based decisions.§          §Strong problem-solving skills.§          §Effective communication skills (both written and verbal).§          §Results oriented, self−motivated and pro−active.§          §Ability to work effectively within a team environment.§          §Time management skills - prioritisation of work without supervision.§          §Adaptable and responsive to a continuously changing environment.§          §Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint§        §        §What we will provide you§ § You will be trained in core technical skills, but also to be able to think creatively and innovatively. We will work to give you projects with a wide range of professionals across Deloitte, to enable you to learn first-hand how quantitative skillsets can be combined with other competencies to create a leading solution to a problem.§ § We offer great study support packages for relevant qualifications along with a range of technical and non-technical training opportunities.§ § We will also provide you with one of the strongest project management training available in the actuarial market.§ § Like many financial services’ roles, a significant portion of what we currently do today may not exist in 5-10 years’ time, and our focus on innovation and creative thinking will prepare you and your career to be part of that next-generation of Actuaries, Data Scientists and Quants.§ § §Next Steps§ § If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that aligns with your experience and career goals, we want to hear from you. manipulation and integration skills using a range of cloud-based SQL and NoSQL database technologies§          §Strong experience with statistical and machine learning modelling techniques§ industralisation of analytical models including design and deployment using DevOps approach and toolsets (e.g. Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Ansible)§          §Experience leveraging either AWS, Azure or GCP platforms including their ML toolsets for building advanced analytical models§          §5 - 8 years relevant work experience with applying analytics or working with data in any industry§ jobText: TXT/50561293.txt	§Senior DEFENCE Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior DEFENCE Consultant§§Advertiser: §ArcBlue Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§About Us§ §ArcBlue is a specialist procurement consultancy with the mission to support our clients to deliver positive change through procurement. That means supporting them to achieve more efficiency, more insight, more social outcomes, more value, more clarity, more influence, more flexibility, more assurance, more savings, more visibility… and more!§  §We offer a broad range of consulting, contracting, training & analytics services to our clients that cover the end-to-end procurement lifecycle, and have clients in private sector and local, state, and federal government including Defence. As our business continues to grow in South Australia, we are now seeking a Senior Consultant to join our team.§  §We operate across Asia Pacific with offices in several locations in Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, and Singapore.§  §ArcBlue was started by passionate procurement people, motivated to support organisations in their journey towards best practice and positive outcomes.§  §We believe our clients want practical, hands-on advice from experienced professionals, not theory from academics, and we purposefully build our team with like-minded professionals who share this philosophy.§  §Want to find out more? Check out our website at www.arcblue.com.au§  §The Role§ §As Senior Defence Consultant you will play a key role in the and ongoing success and growth of our South Australian & Western Australian Region.§  §You will join a team of highly capable, like minded professionals delivering value to a range of Clients, within a range of Sectors across the region.§  §Your aim is to achieve excellence in client value, and you will be rewarded by ongoing adoption, growth and renewal of contracts. This opportunity attracts excellent remuneration with rewards for measurable growth.§  §Responsibilities§ §Your primary focus will be managing and supporting the development and delivery of DEFENCE projects and programs. As well as :§ §State Government Procurements and Projects§ §Infrastructure Procurements and Projects§ §Local Government Procurements and Projects§ §Private sector Procurements and Projects§ §Probity advice and audits§ §Spend Analysis Programs§ §Technology diagnostic and systems development§ §Procure-to-pay Systems and Practice Development Programs§ §Targeted Development Programs including:§ §Training and e-learning§ §Technology Solutions§ §Specialist Category Strategies and Solutions§ §Other Programs and opportunities as identified§ §Support Business Development in SA, WA and on a National level for Defence projects (working closely with the Executive Manager and other ArcBlue Consultants) for the: § §Defence Sector§ §Private Sector§ §Public Sector – including  Infrastructure§ § § §Delivery across a range of clients of ArcBlue Programs and Products including Procurement Capability Analysis, Accreditation Programs, Strategy and Documentation Development§ §Program and Product development and delivery support for a range of ArcBlue National and International Programs§ §Support for internal ArcBlue development projects and practices including areas such as: Business Systems, IT, Strategic Planning and Marketing§ §Delivery of ArcBlue Training Programs§ §About You§ §A tertiary qualification in a related discipline such as Business, Commerce, Procurement, Marketing or Supply Chain, or significant proven relevant experience will be required§ §Demonstrable Defence experience is required§ §An active AGSVA Defence Security Clearance will be required (NV1 minimum)§ §A Nationally recognized professional accreditation would be advantageous (e.g. CIPS, AAPCM, IACCM, PMP, PRINCE2)§ §You will be seeking out a new challenge, new perspectives, new relationships, and new experiences§ §You will have significant procurement and/or project management experience in working within a complex, corporate environment, and within the public or private sectors§ §You will be a team-oriented, engaging, and passionate person with a positive mindset§ §You will have the ability to concisely and effectively write reports and proposals combined with the ability to interpret and analyse data§ §You will be able to develop and grow relationships with clients, building trust and delivering on time§ §You will be a people-person with an encouraging, authentic personality who measures success alongside the success of their wider team§ §You will also be a natural fit for the core ArcBlue values:§ §Be Authentic | Work with Passion | Embrace Innovation |Take Accountability | Encourage Collaboration§  §The ArcBlue Team§ §Our team is widely spread across the Asia Pacific region, and we regularly stay in touch to share and collaborate on ideas, initiatives, and projects.§  §We hand-pick our experienced team to be the right fit for our values and our client’s needs. Our experienced procurement team support the delivery of major projects, ensuring effective project delivery while maintaining the highest level of governance. From the feasibility stage through to completion, the success of any major project relies on the selection, engagement, and performance of key contractors. We offer a highly competitive salary and benefits package.§  §Why join?§ §When you join ArcBlue, you will become part of an organisation that is pioneering the future of procurement.§  §Our teams are involved in some of the most innovative projects and programs, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the environment for generations to come.§  §Internally, we are constantly evolving and improving to provide a great employee experience. With our broad range of services, diverse client base and fun internal growth projects, every day is different at ArcBlue and you will be constantly growing and developing new skills.§  §We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility, and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity, and overall employee well-being.§  §Next Step§ §Please select Apply if you are interested! Or feel free to email §georgia.reeks@arcblue.com.au§ if you'd like more details on this opportunity.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a procurement role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Terrestrial Ecologist Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50600802.txt	§Terrestrial Ecologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Terrestrial Ecologist§§Advertiser: §S5 Environmental§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§ABOUT US:§ §S5 Environmental is a boutique environmental consultancy firm based in Brisbane and servicing the Development, Government and Infrastructure sectors.  S5 Environmental offers specialist expertise and services in the fields of terrestrial ecology, environmental compliance, contaminated land assessment and management, vegetation management, soils, water and bushfire assessments and management.  § §S5 Environmental is seeking a Terrestrial Ecologist to join our expanding Team.  For the right candidate, we have:§ § §An established and ever-expanding Client Base;§ §An awesome diversity in Projects;§ §A team of environmental professionals to support you;§ §A relaxed work environment offering flexibility and certainty;§ §Full or Part time options considered to suit your needs.§ §ABOUT THE ROLE:§ §We are seeking an experienced Terrestrial Ecologist with developed botanical skills who will employ a high level of attention to detail and technical expertise to each and every project deliverable.  The role involves considerable field work in and around Queensland's South East Corner, balanced with data management and reporting in the office. Remote travel would be very much the exception rather than the norm.§ §The Terrestrial Ecologist core responsibilities will include:§ § §Vegetation Surveys and Assessments;§ §Protected Plant Surveys;§ §Presence Absence Surveys;§ §Ecological Assessments (Flora and Fauna);§ §Vegetation and Rehabilitation Management Plans;§ §Bushfire Hazard Assessments;§ §Technical Report development; and§ §Client liaison and management.§ §ABOUT YOU:§ §We seek a Terrestrial Ecologist with developed skills in the following areas:§ § §Skills in plant identification (native, exotic and weed species) and vegetation assessment;§ §Regional Ecosystem identification and assessment;§ §High level of understanding of ecological compliance at the Local and State Government Levels;§ §Scientific and Technical report and letter writing;§ §Ability to utilize GIS mapping tools or the willingness to rapidly develop these skills; and§ §Advanced computer skills of standard office applications.§ §QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE§ §You will hold a Bachelor of Science Ecology or equivalent and will have a minimum of 2 years experience as a Terrestrial Ecologist, preferably in the Consultancy field.§ §APPLICATIONS:§ §Please forward a cover letter detailing your ability to meet the criteria above along with your CV to §office@s5consulting.com.au§.  Or click the Apply Now button.  Enquiries should also be sent via §office@s5consulting.com.au§ . § §For more information about S5 Environmental, check out our website www.s5consulting.com.au.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Enterprise Risk Manager Job in Wagga Wagga & Riverina - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50551687.txt	§Enterprise Risk Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Enterprise Risk Manager§§Advertiser: §Junee Shire Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wagga Wagga & Riverina§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§About Junee Shire Council§ §Join a close-knit local community at the heart of the Riverina!§ §Junee Shire Council is a dynamic and innovative Local Government organisation tackling significant issues at a social, economic and practical level on behalf of its residents.§ §Junee Shire Council is progressive and proactive. With approximately 70 employees, Junee Shire Council is proud to have an agile workforce dedicated to meeting the needs of the community.  All employees share a singular pride in their organisation and their community and are encouraged to work collaboratively with teams, with sufficient autonomy to grow professionally and in the workplace.§ §Junee Shire Council is an equal employment opportunity employer.§ §About the Opportunity§ §Junee Shire Council currently has a Risk Manager position available for an enthusiastic individual to provide support to the Executive team as a trusted advisor to the Executive for the development and implementation of Council’s Enterprise Risk Management Framework and to manage WHS requirements supported by policies and procedures to mitigate Council’s exposure to both strategic and operational risks.§ §The position presents an excellent opportunity to pursue a career in Local Government, WHS and Enterprise Risk.§ §The position of Risk Manager would ideally suit a person who has previous experience and qualifications in the WHS and enterprise risk management arena, who can interpret relevant Safety and Workers Compensation Legislation and can apply it with diplomacy. The ideal person will have excellent interpersonal and customer service skills, advanced computer literacy skills and will be motivated by continuous improvement.§ §Applicants must be either an Australian Citizen or have the right to work in Australia.§ §The ideal person will have excellent interpersonal and customer service skills, advanced computer literacy skills and will be motivated by continuous improvement.§ §About the Benefits§ §This is an exciting opportunity for a pragmatic, driven and strategic professional to enhance their career in a stable local council.§ §If you are looking for a change of lifestyle, a new adventure or the opportunity to grow your career in the Local Government sector, then this is the role for you. § §Experience life in one of the most supportive and family friendly rural communities in NSW – and get paid to do it!§ §For your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with a highly attractive salary package inclusive of super – negotiable with skills and experience.  § §Conditions§ §The position is graded in Council’s Salary System, with a salary package ranging from $79,000 to $96,000 per annum.§ §A complete medical fitness assessment will be required to be undertaken by the successful applicant.§ §APPLICATIONS:§ §Information packages are available on Council’s website at: www.junee.nsw.gov.au/council/career-opportunities, Council Offices at 29 Belmore Street, Junee or by emailing to §jsc@junee.nsw.gov.au§ §Details regarding the application procedure are included in the information pack. For further details, please contact Pamela Mace, Human Resources on §02 6924 8100§.§ §The recruitment process has commenced and will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. Applications should be emailed to The General Manager at §jsc@junee.nsw.gov.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§
