jobTitle: NatHERS ENERGY RATING CONSULTANT Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50532051.txt	§NatHERS ENERGY RATING CONSULTANT§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§NatHERS ENERGY RATING CONSULTANT§§Advertiser: §Hexicon Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$55,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§NatHERS ENERGY RATING CONSULTANT§Hexicon ESD Consulting provides clients with Practical Environmental Sustainable Design solutions. Established in 2019, Hexicon is rooted to help make strategic arrangements and optimised ESD solutions across Residential and Commercial Projects to deliver services that ensure projects meet Environmental Sustainable Development criteria. §Our aim is to provide "end to end" ESD solutions for our clients from design advice & design review, building modelling & verification and code compliance. Due to significant growth over the last 18 months, we now require an experienced Energy rating consultant to join our team in Western Suburbs - Melbourne. §Reporting directly to the Director, the Consultant will analyse, rate, report, model and document ESD projects in line with the Nationwide House Energy Rating Scheme (NatHERS) framework. This will include presentation, preparation, evaluation and reporting using your strong background in sustainable engineering. To carry out the duties of this role the successful candidate will use FirstRates5 software package.§The ideal person for this position is an individual who is NatHERS accredited or someone who has experience using the relevant sustainability software such as FirstRates5. Coming from an engineering background is not essential however the right candidate must have a comprehensive knowledge of local standards and codes and must have a passion for low energy building solutions and open to learning new things. §With a passion for energy sustainability, your enthusiasm to learn and your tenacity to grow will ensure you progress within this fast-growing organisation. As a creative ESD Consultant who is looking for a challenging permanent position with a boutique consultancy, you will play a critical role in the team structure and be rewarded generously for your confident, outcomes-driven approach.§A competitive salary is on offer along with varied responsibilities and superior growth. This is a rare opportunity in the company and is the perfect position for someone to continue to develop their skills and knowledge in an organisation with a strong vision and a long list of clients. §The Candidate:§As a successful candidate you will demonstrate:§A minimum of 2 years experience (or more) in NatHERS or ESD role§Confidence in liaising with design teams, construction teams and clients§Strong communication skills with excellent time management & attention to detail§Knowledge and experience with BESS, SMP, SDA, WSUD would be beneficial§A recognised qualification in engineering, architecture or similar qualification relevant to the building industry§Project management and people skills§Understanding of relevant standards and code including Section J and Green Star but not desired§Skills and experience in design and report writings§An aptitude for complex analysis and problem-solving§Please respond with a cover letter addressing the above criteria, along with a CV to §esd@hexicon.com.au§. Hexicon promotes a safe, friendly and supportive work environment.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50600413.txt	§Senior Economist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Economist§§Advertiser: §TransGrid§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§ §Unique and exciting opportunity working as part of a high performing team § §Intellectually stimulating and rewarding work!§ §Full time position based in Sydney - Ultimo§ § §Who we are§ §At TransGrid, our work improves the lives of millions – from lighting up sports fields, schools and homes, to powering the wheels of commerce and everything else in between. Now it’s your turn to make it happen.§ §TransGrid offers fulfilling careers for driven people who can help ensure that our business and the essential services we provide to consumers, the community and key stakeholders are continually improving. With us you will thrive in a collaborative environment where new ideas and knowledge sharing are encouraged, and where you’ll be supported through opportunities to develop and achieve your full potential.§ §This is an exciting time in the energy industry with the transition to renewable energy. Recent government policies outline plans to facilitate increasing transmission interconnection between states and development of renewable energy zones.§ §The Opportunity§ §This is a unique opportunity for an experienced professional to be part of a team supporting improved outcomes for TransGrid by advocating for policy and regulatory reform.  This role is a senior leader in the Policy team.  Policy has a significant impact on the financial and operating environment of TransGrid as well as the services it can offer. Engagement in policy also impacts TransGrid’s reputation with stakeholders and consumers as an industry leader and contributes more broadly to its social licence to operate.§ §You will be an innovative thinker and have the versatility and eagerness to work in a transforming and changing environment.§ §As the Senior Economist you will:§ § §Be the most senior internal SME in relation to the energy market and economics, providing advice, support and analysis to the senior leadership of TransGrid, the Executive team and Board.§ §Develop TransGrid’s economic policy and research capability through understanding and articulating the economic and market dynamics in the current and future energy system in order to support the development of Corporate Strategy, policy reform and advocacy plans.§ §Enhance and develop TransGrid’s external profile, its influence and impact through being a recognised ‘voice’ in the Australian energy market for TransGrid and providing economic analysis and direction to the Executive to enable TransGrid to become a thought leader in the energy market. § § §Skills & Experience§ §What we expect from you:§ § §An excellent understanding of contemporary debates in economic policy both in Australia and overseas in the energy sector§ §Recognised standing in the energy sector as a though leader in market dynamics and economics§ §Bachelor degree in economics mandatory, Masters’ degree desirable§ §Strong links with and industry§ §A proven track record of conceptualising, implementing and managing policy-oriented research and/or development projects§ §Exceptional communication skills in translating complex market dynamics and economics into business strategy and Executive and Board Papers in a commercial and strategic manner§ §A record of success of effective engagement with high-level opinion formers and decision makers§ §Strong commercial acumen§ § §Recognition & Reward§ §What you can expect from us:§ § §Structured leadership and development programs§ §Flexible work arrangements available§ §14 weeks Parental Leave (includes adoption)§ §2 weeks Other Parent Leave§ §Annual picnic day (additional day off)§ §Health and Wellbeing Programs§ §Salary sacrifice and novated leasing options § §Access to sports and social clubs§ § §In return for your hard work we have numerous benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to private health insurance discount, motor vehicle lease plan, career development support, study assistance program and workplace flexibility.§ §Join us and make it happen for your career, and for the millions of Australians who rely on our services every day.§ §To view our Privacy Statement and how we handle personal and sensitive information click §here§.§ §Applications close on Friday, 18 September, 2020§ §Due to the current COVID-19 restrictions in place, the successful candidate may be required to commence their employment working from home. TransGrid actively promotes flexible working arrangements within our teams. We have strong team structures, culture and communication tools in place to ensure all employees remain actively connected to each other and the broader organisation.§ § §Our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, we will assess applications as they are received and interviewing may commence earlier than closing date.§ §We do not accept agency introductions as TransGrid operates a direct sourcing model.§ § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We offer a broad range of professional services that combine to make a real difference to our clients and the communities in which we work.§        §We are truly global, and our 15,000 planners, designers, engineers and consultants around the world deliver innovative projects with creativity and passion.§        §As our Sydney Environment and Resources team continues to grow, this role has been designed to assist the team in managing a range of environmental planning and associated statutory approvals. Projects could range between Environmental Impact Statements and Review of Environmental Factors or Statement of Environmental Effects. This includes co-ordination, providing technical direction, reviewing other’s work and authorship.§        §About you§        §As a  successful candidate for this role you will be able to demonstrate:§        §          §Recognised relevant tertiary qualifications in Environmental Science, Environmental Planning, Environmental Engineering or similar;§          §Relevant industry experience in a consulting, private industry or a government environment (10+ years);§          §Experience in environmental planning, impact assessment and/or statutory approval processes;§          §Project management and business development experience would be highly regarded;§          §Membership of relevant professional institutions/professional peer bodies including certification/chartership where available or have significant credit towards eligibility for certification;§          §Ability to coordinate various projects within tight timelines and budgetary constraints;§          §Ability to see the ‘big picture’ and make changes in order to meet strategic needs;§          §Ability to make final decisions when consensus is not reached;§          §Experience in putting together tenders for projects covering different resources and locations, considering both the cost and benefit to Arup;§          §Understanding the client’s commercial aspirations and business needs in order to become involved in the decision-making process;§          §Ability to work well with people at all levels;§          §Track record of supporting, training and sharing expertise with junior staff;  §          §Excellent written communication and report writing skills;§        §        § §        §About the role§        §Working with the broader team and a number of clients’ projects, this role’s responsibilities include:§        §          §You will be accountable for significant and complex activities or projects. This will require you to be responsible for predicting and planning future project resources;§          §You will represent Arup at internal and external meetings;§          §You will take a longer-term strategic view of the business and contribute to the development plan of Arup;§          §You will be responsible for the performance and development of others. This would require you to provide guidance, training, motivation and direction to staff;§          §You will be responsible for executing responsibilities as outlined in Arup’s Quality Management System;§          §You may be involved in setting budgets; as such you would be responsible for negotiating with clients.§        §        §The people at Arup are driven to find a better way and to deliver better solutions for our clients.§        §“We welcome applications from a diverse group of people, including those who are seeking flexible working, have accessibility needs, want to bring their whole selves to work, and can enrich our workforce with cultural diversity.”§ §        §We offer a competitive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience to the right candidate including a global profit share scheme, excellent staff benefits and long-term career development opportunities.§        §If you are interested in helping us shape a better world, please click “Apply Now” to submit your online application.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ § §A career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world. This would require you to provide guidance, training, motivation and direction to staff;§ §You will be responsible for executing responsibilities as outlined in Arup’s Quality Management System;§ §You may be involved in setting budgets; as such you would be responsible for negotiating with clients.§ §The people at Arup are driven to find a better way and to deliver better solutions for our clients.§ §“We welcome applications from a diverse group of people, including those who are seeking flexible working, have accessibility needs, want to bring their whole selves to work, and can enrich our workforce with cultural diversity.”§ § §We offer a competitive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience to the right candidate including a global profit share scheme, excellent staff benefits and long-term career development opportunities.§ §If you are interested in helping us shape a better world, please click “Apply Now” to submit your online application.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in environment & planning law?§§§

jobTitle: Associate Director (Built Heritage) - Heritage Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50570952.txt	§Associate Director (Built Heritage) - Heritage§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Director (Built Heritage) - Heritage§§Advertiser: §Urbis Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§Be a key leader of a new Melbourne based Heritage offer working across a diverse range of Heritage-related projects & clients§Build on the market leading Urbis Heritage team already established in Sydney and Brisbane§Brand new architecturally designed office located in the heart of the CBD§Sophisticated, user-friendly agile working technology§§The Opportunity:§This new opportunity is part of Victoria’s premier planning team, focused on building our built heritage offering in Victoria as a priority, followed by archaeology. We are looking for an enthusiastic, commercial, proactive, effective and experienced heritage consultant or heritage architect to build our Melbourne heritage team.  §You will have the opportunity to be involved in providing heritage advice on city shaping projects across a diverse, high profile and ground-breaking range of projects, contributing to reports and providing advice to our clients. You will have excellent industry connections and be respected by the consent authorities and relevant stakeholders. You will be an effective communicator and negotiator with a clear head for providing reasonable heritage advice that strikes a sensible balance between the ambitions of all stakeholders.§The role will be supported by highly experienced and successful Melbourne Directors and a market leading established National Heritage team in Sydney and Brisbane. Our national heritage consultancy provides independent, strategic advice on all heritage aspects of properties and projects, from pre-design and approval, to construction. §You will:§Provide a range of heritage advice to the team and clients on a range of projects including heritage design advice.§Prepare or supervise Conservation Management Plans, Heritage Impact Statements, Conservation Schedules of Work, Interpretation Plans, Opportunities and Constraints, Archival Recordings and architectural conservation supervision.§Contribute heritage conservation knowledge, documentation and expertise to the wider team on projects as required.§Demonstrate expert level report writing, technical documentation, time management, commercial acumen and communication skills.§Ability to undertake projects, manage clients and other stakeholder relationships and work to specification and deadlines.§Develop proposals, tenders & submissions for potential projects.§About You:§A heritage professional with 5 + years in heritage advisory consulting, with a Masters in Heritage Conservation, Architecture, or similar relevant industry experience.§An understanding of and the ability to apply appropriate statutory heritage and planning legislation to heritage issues, particularly heritage overlays, the Heritage Act 2017 and the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999.§An understanding of The Australia ICOMOS Charter for Places of Cultural Significance, The Burra Charter, 2013 (Burra Charter). §Able to undertake heritage research utilising multiple sources and methodologies and present a preliminary assessment of findings. §Passionate about built heritage and the reasonable and appropriate management of change.§Who we are:§Urbis is a market-leading built environment consultancy that shapes the cities and communities of Australia for a better future. Drawing together a network of the brightest minds, Urbis consists of practice experts, working collaboratively to deliver fresh thinking and independent advice and guidance – all backed up by real, evidence-based solutions.§Urbis regularly hosts industry events and is a Corporate Patron of the 20th ICOMOS General Assembly and Scientific Symposium 2020 (GA2020). §Why Urbis?§Urbis is a firm that truly values its people and provides a broad range of benefits which include:§Ongoing training and professional learning & development opportunities§Health and wellbeing programs including access to an employee assistance program§Generous parental leave policy for both primary and secondary carers§Salary continuance insurance§Regular social activities§Opportunity to participate in community and charitable activities§To find out more about us visit our website at www.urbis.com.au/careers.§Urbis is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive, supports flexibility, and welcomes diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.§How to Apply?§If you are an enthusiastic candidate, with the desire to become part of a driven and highly professional team, click on “Apply for this job”. If you have any further queries, please contact §hrmelbourne@urbis.com.au§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our projects are nationally significant and include resources, infrastructure, renewable energy, and agricultural developments.  Our work includes project environmental approvals, construction and operational compliance, Government and other stakeholder consultation, and mine rehabilitation and closure.§ §We have a pipeline of work into 2021 and we are seeking a highly motivated mid-senior environmental consultant to assist with increasing demand for our services.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We are seeking a person with 6 to 10 years experience in major project approvals (mining, infrastructure, and renewable energy), onsite environmental management, and auditing.§ §This is an opportunity to join an emerging company and grow with it.  You will be encouraged to pursue your own interests and build relationships with your own clients.§ §As a senior person in the company, you will be offered an autonomous work environment and a high level of responsibility, which will assist your personal and professional growth.  It will also provide you with a real sense of achievement and satisfaction.§ §The location is flexible, but prefer Armidale NSW or Brisbane QLD.  There is also opportunity to work from home. § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §The benefits of joining a new expanding business include:§ §Growth - we offer autonomy and responsibility, which leads to accelerated personal and professional growth.§Shape your future - follow your interests, build your team and your expertise.§Flexibility – we use modern communication systems to allow our people to work from anywhere.§Rewards and recognition – we believe those who contribute to the success of the business should be rewarded accordingly.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §A degree in environmental science, environmental engineering, or urban and regional planning, along with 6 to 10 years of experience in major project approvals and onsite environmental management.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50551024.txt	§Senior Mechanical Engineer - Building Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Mechanical Engineer - Building Services§§Advertiser: §FGA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§THE OPPORTUNITY§ §FG Advisory is seeking a modern professional with experience as a Senior Engineer who is looking for their next challenge in a company where innovation is at the forefront of what we do. While working towards a common goal of addressing today’s energy and infrastructure challenges and helping to create a sustainable future for Australia, as the Senior Engineer, you will work alongside our growing team of Engineers to successfully deliver a large number of Engineering Design projects with high-profile clients across a variety of Industries. As the Senior Engineer, your role will require you to:§ § §Develop and oversee junior staff in the development of technical documentation (concept design, detailed design, tender documentation, tender evaluations, defects registers) that concisely communicates the design, client requirements, compliance requirements, and baseline information.§ §Develop and oversee junior staff in the development of engineering designs (calculations, drawings, other design inputs), ensuring that designs meet Client requirements, compliance (standards, legislation), and FG Advisory quality benchmarks. Conduct peer reviews of technical work and designs as required.§ §Lead completion of feasibility studies, schematic design, tender documentation, contract plan management and project administration for various design projects.§ §Develop and oversee junior staff in the development of tender packages and tender drawings for major upgrades by liaising with suppliers and sub-contractors throughout the tender process and evaluating tender responses.§ §Lead completion of cost estimation, financial analyses, operational modelling, and total lifecycle cost analyses for projects as the Project Lead.§ §Coordinate and lead facility site visits, audits, and customer meetings including presentation of work results, both internally and externally.§ §Develop high quality comprehensive reports, Notices of Advice, and other client correspondence for review.§ §Draw technical insights from operational information and site data, and articulate to clients with clarity and coherence§ §Drive collaborative, proactive relationships with stakeholders and deliver high quality client service and assist in the identification and qualification of new business opportunities§ §Maintain awareness and compliance with ISO 9001 QMS requirements, and to identify improvements to role and process related to (i) quality, (ii) customer satisfaction, (iii) risk, and (iv) continuous improvement.§ §Develop skills and capabilities aligned to FG Advisory’s Senior Engineer Success Profile§ §All other tasks required by FG Advisory as a Senior Engineer§ § § §WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR§ §The role of Senior Engineer is the perfect opportunity for someone who has extensive experience delivering major building services engineering solutions for high-profile clients in a consulting capacity. We are looking for someone with a natural passion for sustainability, a demonstrable work ethic and the ability to build and lead collaborative relationships with all external stakeholders, to progress the delivery of exceptional solutions for all clients. § §The successful candidate will have a strong reputation for critical thought, is effective at working with people at all levels of the business and can do so with a positive and inclusive attitude. To be effective in this role, you need to be organised and can effectively manage your time, including delegating tasks and activities to supporting Engineers.§ §The ideal candidate will hold a degree, dual degree or Master’s in Engineering, possess a Registered Building Practitioner’s certification in any Building Services Engineering discipline or equivalent and may also have completed, or on the journey to completing, their MBA.§ §These attributes, combined with a fervent desire for continuous growth, will underpin your successful career at FG Advisory.§ § § §READY FOR AN OPPORTUNITY LIKE NO OTHER?§ §Imagine a career where your innovation and collaboration can make a positive impact on the world around you. At FG Advisory, we are shaping a more sustainable future in Australia. Join us and you will become part of a successful, results-orientated team who are focused on reaching the pinnacle of excellence.§ §We look forward to receiving your application for this role.  Please e-mail your cover letter and CV to Chris at §chris.morgan@fgadvisory.com§ §All submissions must be formatted as PDF documents, with the following file name conventions:§Cover Letter: "Firstname Lastname - Cover Letter.PDF"§Résumé: "Firstname Lastname - CV.PDF"§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in mechanical engineering?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50613823.txt	§Town Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Town Planner§§Advertiser: §Canberra Town Planning§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ § §Town Planner§ § § §Canberra Town Planning§ § § §About Us§ §Canberra Town Planning (CTP) is a dynamic planning consultancy firm providing strategic advice, statutory planning and environmental approvals for projects in the ACT and regional NSW.  CTP services a range of private, government and institutional clients.  Client service is paramount to the success of our business.  § §About the role§ §CTP is currently seeking §Town Planners§ who will be responsible for helping to meet the needs of our clients. You will liaise with clients and project consultants in relation to planning projects, prepare written advice and attend meetings and consultation sessions as required.§ § § §Key responsibilities include:§ § §Delivery of Strategic Development and Planning Projects§ §Delivery of Development Applications§ §Delivery of Environmental Impact Assessments§ §Preparation of a range of Town Planning advice, research projects and reports§ §Working closely with a range of private, institutional and government clients     § § § §About you§ §CTP is looking for people who exemplify the Company’s values of service excellence, collaboration, commitment to the CTP team, and driving innovative solutions.  This ensures a workplace environment where we value each other, provide excellent service to our clients, and continually strive to deliver innovative solutions for our clients. § §You may have a background in real estate, law, architecture or another related professional field and are looking for a rewarding new career path where you can utilise and grow your skills and profile.§ §You will also:§ § §Have a town planning or related tertiary degree and / or relevant work experience (at least 3-5 years)§ §Have a working knowledge of development assessment and environmental planning legislation§ §Have excellent oral/written communication skills including the ability to write complex and/or technical reports in plain English§ §Well-developed assessment and analytical skills§ §Be a self motivated problem solver§ §Ability to effectively manage competing priorities§ §Have a positive attitude towards continuous learning§ §Be committed to meeting deadlines in a dynamic work environment§ §Ability to work autonomously on a range of tasks across multiple projects§ §Ability to deal with a broad range of clients and community representatives in a courteous and professional manner§ §Class C Drivers Licence§ § § §What’s on Offer§ §In addition to a competitive remuneration package combined with attractive benefits, employees have the opportunity for further training and career development as our organisation continues to grow.§ §At CTP, we recognise the importance of diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect.§ §Visit our careers page to learn more about CTP.§ §To apply§ §Please click on the "Apply" button below to apply. Applications close on§ Friday §30 October 2020.§ Please monitor your email regarding communication on progress of§ your application. For further information about this opportunity please email §recruitment@canberratownplanning.com.au§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a town planner?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Manager Data and Analytics Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50601754.txt	§Senior Manager Data and Analytics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager Data and Analytics§§Advertiser: §HorizonOne Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$130k - $180k p.a. package + bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§The Organisation§Our client is a leading consulting organisation in our region with national recognition for their achievements and continued rapid growth forecast.§This area of the firm helps executive decision making by turning their data into actionable insights. Their specialty is executive dashboard design. They find ways to present the key information needed for decision-making in a clear, concise, and easy-to-use format.§Sounds like a pretty standard consulting role. So why would you leave your role in a Big 4, mid-tier competitor or government agency to join these guys?§The firm is well established, fast growing and has been building their reputation to a point where they are starting to be regarded as tier 1 by both clients and competitors.§Simply put, these guys are on the up and have attracted some impressive talent along the way. They have a culture that fosters entrepreneurship, whilst still looking after their employees. §The Opportunity§The data practice has been growing sustainably. The Executive Director has been with the firm for 10+ years after leaving the leaving Big 4 and has filled the pipeline with interesting and challenging work.§You will be joining this 10 person team with a number of high performing consultants and senior consults who are delivering exceptional work. The team is missing a senior manager like you to come in, take ownership and drive engagements.§Why would you want to leave your current role to join this team?§This firm treats people as PEOPLE and understand that occasionally you will have commitments and responsibility outside of work. This is one of many reasons why they have a single digit turnover rate§You will have access to a competitive bonus scheme with no invisible barriers§You get to focus more on the delivery of quality work§You will have more flexibility to deliver what the client wants that a structured and cookie cutter approach§With the firm growing and exciting prospects, future career opportunities are there for you to perform and realise significant salary growth§The Role§In this role your focus will be to:§Lead and drive engagements focused on the design and delivery of executive dashboards, visualisation, reports, analytical outcomes and other data-driven solutions§Engage with clients to ensure that the projects actually meet client needs and expectations and deliver genuine value-add outcomes§Be part of the leadership and management of the data practice including contributing to business development, staff management, recruitment, staff development and knowledge management§Manage scope and time of multiple tasks without compromising quality§Your Background and Experience§Some key aspects for success in this role will be a curious nature and passion for using data, numbers and facts to tell stories that are insightful, credible and impactful.§You will bring a combination of the following to the team:§Experience at leading small project based teams in complex operating environments§Manager, Senior Manager or Executive level experience§Understanding the challenges of working with data in an APS context§A growth mindset with the ability to ‘lean in’ and challenge established thinking§Skilled in PowerBI, Tableau or QLIK§Hands on practical experience using data wrangling tools, languages and techniques including SQL, R, Python in similar environments§Salary / Rate§$130K - $180K package + Bonuses (negotiable commensurate with experience)§Permanent position§Access to a well-designed bonus scheme and a flexibility in hours worked§How to Apply§To apply online, please click on the appropriate link.§Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, about this or similar roles please contact Lucas Walker on §02 6108 4878§ quoting ref no. 11246.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Environmental Approvals Consultant Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50573400.txt	§Senior Environmental Approvals Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Environmental Approvals Consultant§§Advertiser: §Niche Environment and Heritage§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§The opportunity!§  §We are seeking an experienced Senior Environmental Approvals consultant to join our fast-paced NSW Environmental Approvals team in a full-time position. We are seeking someone with 7+ years’ experience with relevant State and Commonwealth legislation.§  §The experience we are looking for:§ § §You will have significant industry connections within the NSW linear infrastructure sector to lead the growth of our environmental approvals business.§ §Significant consulting experience from within the road, rail and or utilities sectors.§ §You will be well experienced in planning, project managing and writing a broad range of approvals documents, as well as being a steady hand to guide other team members in winning and delivering approvals project work.§ §We’re flexible on location:§  §Wollongong, Parramatta or discuss being work from home based with us (flexible work arrangements are currently in place with covid-19).§  §Experience and qualifications required: § § §A relevant Bachelor-level university degree in environmental science, environmental management, environmental planning, resource management, environmental engineering or another relevant discipline. § §Strong connections to the marketplace and ability to bring in work form your own industry connections.§ §Exceptional experience in NSW planning approvals pathways, specifically REFs and EMPs in the mining  and resource sector is essential. As is experience preparing; project proposals including budgets, environmental constraints assessments, statements of environmental effects (SEE), environmental impact assessments and development applications, including project EISs and modifications and monitoring and management plans. § §Significant knowledge of local, State and Commonwealth legislation relating to environmental management in NSW and other jurisdictions in Australia.§ §Provide environmental management advice, compliance, auditing and reporting ensuring all legislative obligations are met for projects.§ §To step into this role, you will also have these key requirements: § § § §Excellent communication skills, strong interpersonal and time management skills. § §Ability to work collaboratively to resolve approval related issues when met with unforeseen project scope changes. § §Leadership skills and a willingness to provide mentoring to junior team members. § §Excellent analytical, conceptual and assessment skills, together with strong professional experience.§ §Precise attention to detail and ability to produce professional quality deliverables on time and on budget.  § §Ensure the deliverables produced are of a high quality, accuracy and complete including a quality assurance review. § §A full current NSW driver’s licence.   § §NSW White Card (CIC), First Aid certificate and experience with using tablets, laptops, digital cameras, and Microsoft 0365 are desirable.  § §Great conditions and salary on offer:§ § §Anniversary awards scheme.§ §Generous employee referral program.§ §Professional learning and development. § §Employee Assistance Program. § §Annual employee retreat. § §Flexible working options.§ §Paid maternity policy.§ §Community engagement activities.§ §An attractive salary and allowances will be offered in line with your level of experience. § §You’ll be prepared to:§ § §Travel where the work is.§ §Collaborate closely with senior employees across disciplines and directors.§ §Mentor and support others to develop professionally.§ §Have fun while delivering complex, challenging and large projects.§ §About us:§  §Niche Environment and Heritage is a leading multidisciplinary consultancy specialising in ecology and biodiversity, heritage management, environmental management and approvals and environmental offsetting. Established in 2009, Niche has successfully delivered more than 2000 projects to clients across Australia. Our 50+strong team includes ecologists, botanists, archaeologists and environmental scientists. §  §Niche is a vibrant, flexible and well organised business that prides itself in caring for and supporting our staff. We have an excellent safety culture and trust our staff to make the right decisions to deliver projects from end to end.  Our diverse and cross-discipline capacity provides the opportunity to work on a multitude of interesting projects across eastern Australia.  §  §How to apply:§  §A detailed position description is available at https://niche-eh.com/careers/§  §If you are interested in this fantastic career opportunity, please submit your application including a resume and cover letter addressing the key requirements §via the apply §button by close of business 16th October 2020. Our recruitment process includes behavioural and medical testing. §  §All applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence.§ Niche is an Equal Opportunity Employer, where diversity is embraced, and we encourage qualified candidates of all differences to apply. You must have the right to work in Australia to be considered for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50570050.txt	§Senior Heritage Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Heritage Consultant§§Advertiser: §NGH Environmental§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wagga Wagga & Riverina§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§About NGH§ § § §We provide environmental services to private and public-sector clients. NGH has strong environmental, social and ethical standards. We provide sustainable knowledge-based solutions and advice for environmental management and impact assessment. NGH provides flexibility in the workplace and support for professional development.§ §A large portion of our work is in renewable energy and linear infrastructure assessments across eastern Australia. We are leaders in renewable energy impact assessment and environmental management. This is a challenging and exciting industry.§ §The heritage team contributes assessments as part the REF or EIS process as well as undertaking stand-alone heritage assessments for projects.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We have an exciting new position to join our friendly and vibrant team in Wagga Wagga NSW.  We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Senior Heritage Consultant, specialising in Aboriginal heritage to join our friendly and dynamic team. § §Wagga (pop 70,000) is the hub of the Riverina and the largest regional city in NSW. We live in an area that  has stunning landscapes from mountains to plains. It has a vibrant art scene, live theatre, and sassy shopping. Wagga has affordable housing, minimum commute and over 20 schools including a TAFE campus and Charles Sturt University. Wagga has easy access to Canberra, Sydney and Melbourne. NSW and Victorian Ski fields are a short drive. Wagga will capture your imagination and tempt you to call it home. § §This position requires a dedicated senior professional to join our team. You will show initiative and work independently. You will have access to Directors and senior managers for support and guidance. § § § §What's on offer§ § § §Manage your own projects and work autonomously§Work on renewable energy projects in diverse landscapes§Participation in a successful and growing business§Energetic and supportive team culture§Flexible work arrangements including flex time and work from home§Generous training budget§EAP Program§Ethical client base§ § § §Application Process§ § § §For your application to be considered it must include a tailored cover letter addressing the required key criteria (below) and a current and detailed CV.§ §Selection Criteria§ §Tertiary qualifications in Archaeology / Cultural Heritage to minimum Honours level or equivalent§At least 8 years' experience as an archaeologist or heritage consultant§Demonstrated experience in conducting heritage surveys, site recording and report preparation§Demonstrated experience in identification and recording of stone artefacts§Detailed knowledge and experience in the application of the NSW Government Heritage legislation§Demonstrated experience in consultation with Aboriginal stakeholders§High level writing, research and communication skills§Experience in Microsoft Office computer programs and industry specific programs including GIS, especially QGIS§A current Australian Driver's License (Manual license) and ability to drive for long distances§Being able and prepared to undertake field work and have the ability to work in remote locations§Knowledge of WHS obligations and responsibilities relevant to the role§ §Desirable criteria§ §Expertise in a specialist area such as:§Stone artefact recording and analysis§Historic archaeology§Historic heritage site recording and assessment§Excavation experience§First Aid Certificate§4WD training§ §You can either apply via SEEK or via email to §employment@nghconsulting.com.au§ §Applications close 5pm Monday 5 October 2020.§ §If you have any further questions relating to the position or would like a copy of the position description please contact Julie Earles, HR Coordinator via emailing her at §employment@nghconsulting.com.au§ §NGH is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. During recruitment, all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, and people of all ages.  § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Change and Training Consultant Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641831.txt	§Change and Training Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change and Training Consultant§§Advertiser: §ANZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§•    Help deliver and embed organisational change§•    Support the design & delivery of training programs§•    Apply your expertise in change management processes & tools§ §About The Role§Role Location: 839 Collins Street, Docklands VIC 3008§Role Type: 10 months fixed-term, Full-time § §As the Change & Training Consultant, you will manage the delivery and embedding of organisational change within ANZ. You will help enable benefits realization by building the case for change, executing a change strategy, enabling and assessing the change readiness of the organisation. You will manage, partner with, and help prepare stakeholders, and provide support across business areas and provide needed training. § §Your key accountabilities will include:§ §•    Overseeing and leading the change management effort, including research, implementation, and assessment from start to finish§•    Applying change management process and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative§•    Supporting the design, development, delivery and management of communications§•    Conducting impact analyses, assessing change readiness and identify key stakeholders§•    Providing input, document requirements, and supporting the design and delivery of training programs§•    Managing the communications and views internally§•    Ensuring project goals are met and executed by collaborating with numerous internal resources§•    Helping with and leading colleague engagement programmes in relation to internal change management§•    Identifying suitable communication strategies and building on these (reviewing the plans and delivering reports to the executive)§ §About You§To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following: § §•    Experience in change management (including experience in change communications and engagement)§•    Experience in establishing change within an organisation (concentrating on employee development and behavioural & cultural change through training) §•    In-depth understanding of how people go through a change and the change process §•    Ability to take a strategic, system-wide view as well as examine sufficient details to translate insights into meaningful delivery plans§•    Ability to deeply probe, understand, and breakdown complex and multi-faceted problems§•    Ability to synthesise multiple sources of information and leverage a broad network of connections to prioritise and execute plans§•    Ability to rally and mobilize informal groups of people around focused tasks & stories§•    Experience in Human-Centred Design, Systems Thinking, Data-driven decision making, Consulting, Project Management; and Learning & Development § §About ANZ§At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.§ §We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.§ §A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.§ §ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.§ §We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.§ §To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers.  § § § §#GB4.2§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Consultants - Transformational Program Management (TPM) Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50678144.txt	§Senior Consultants - Transformational Program Management (TPM)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultants - Transformational Program Management (TPM)§§Advertiser: §KPMG Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Enjoy collaborating with a wide range of clients from various industry sectors.§§Value a supportive team with a positive work environment focused on career progression and internal development.§§Immerse yourself in our inclusive, diverse and supportive culture§§KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.§The Transformational Program Management (TPM) team within KPMG is a key part of our capability picture and has been involved in some of Australia's largest and most complex reform and transformation programs. We know that realising organisational change and improvement requires more than transactional project management – it takes an ability to manage complexity and find clarity in linking strategic objectives to implementation activities and ensuring effective stakeholder engagement results in pragmatic decision making.    We know that creating this requires people who are results driven, understand project and program management principles, are prepared to think critically and who are committed to helping our clients navigate their way through to success.  §Being involved in helping organisations succeed in transformation is rewarding and offers excellent opportunities for people seeking to make their mark.   We are looking for Senior Consultants to join our growing team in Adelaide. §Your Opportunity §You will enjoy contributing as part of a team who are passionate about supporting clients to deliver outcomes and drive transformational change. You will:§§Report to and work closely with experienced Program Management practitioners to establish and maintain value-adding program governance processes and PMOs for our clients;§Gain exposure to all aspects of a program, through the full program lifecycle;§Receive on-the-job learning support and access to world class training and development to grown your transformation management capabilities; and§Have the ability to join transformation programs with our clients across a range of sectors and industries.§§Specifically, this position requires someone with a strong understanding of project and program management delivery functions & processes, including:§§Establishing and managing key project and program management documents and processes;§Developing and supporting project and program performance status reports;§Assisting with program communication and stakeholder engagement;§Preparing program communication documents;§Coordinating risks and issues registers;§Assisting in the maintenance of program financial management;§Preparing Agendas, taking Minutes, tracking actions; and§Conducting research.§§How you are Extraordinary?§If you are interested in supporting our TPM practice to deliver transformation, then this is a fantastic opportunity for you. You will be experienced in using Powerpoint, Word and spreadsheets for business purposes. A high level of organisation and time management will be a specialty of yours as you excel at staying on top of your workload.§You will have:§§Prior experience of supporting projects and project governance frameworks with demonstrated ability to develop reports, take minutes and track actions;§Consulting experience is highly desired §Experience working in an Agile delivery environment, using Agile methodology and approaches §Strong documentation, reporting and presentation skills;§Excellent interpersonal written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate with project stakeholders at all levels;§Versatility, flexibility, enthusiasm, a high level of self-motivation and initiative;§Attention to detail in drafting correspondence and other documentation.§§The KPMG Difference§Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.§We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.§Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:§Flexibility empowers wellbeing [link removed]§§Flexibility enables contribution to the community [link removed]§§Flexibility inspires technology & innovation [link removed]§§Flexibility supports family [link removed]§§Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!§ §§§§

jobTitle: Change Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50710018.txt	§Change Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Manager§§Advertiser: §Westpac Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Every day we serve millions of customers when they need it most. We want even more customers to experience this service, care and be helped in the moments that matter. To help achieve this and to build a simpler and stronger company, Westpac has transitioned to a Lines of Business (LOB) operating model. This new operating model requires changing structures, refreshing operating rhythms, and changing the way we work.§How will I help?§As a Change Manager, you will be a key member of the Portfolio and Pricing function and the Simplification and Collateral management squad, responsible for the Group’s core business lending products (term lending, lines of credit, overdraft facilities and Equipment and Invoice Finance).A truly collaborative role, will be responsible for embedding a compliant by design culture with the Business Bank through the identification and resolution of risk issues, as well as providing your expertise in the simplification of the Business Lending suite of products, systems, collateral and fees.§What’s in it for you?§We’re going through significant change and this is an opportunity to work closely with our new Business Lending Line of Business to lead the business through the next phase of transformation. You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for over 200 years. So, we’ll back you in the development of your career, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grow, backed by a fantastic team of people within a can-do, supportive structure.§What do I need?§We’d expect you have a good track record of Change Management experience within the banking and financial services sector, ideally with solid Business Lending product knowledge. You will present with excellent problem solving, organising, decisive thinking and strong verbal and written communication skills, paired with exceptional stakeholder management and influencing skills. You will have demonstrated experience in applying problem solving methodologies and developing business solutions. You’ll be a highly motivated, self-starter who is tertiary qualified with a degree in a finance, commerce or risk related discipline. §What is it like to work there?§We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.§How do I Apply?§Start here. Just click on the §APPLY§ button.§As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.§The health and wellbeing of our employees is our priority and we will ensure that physical distancing requirements are met in all our workplaces if required.§§§§§

jobTitle: Entry Level Intelligence Analyst Job in Sunshine Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50668254.txt	§Entry Level Intelligence Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Entry Level Intelligence Analyst§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Northern Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sunshine Coast§§Salary§§$85,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Entry Level Intelligence Analyst §      §        §§        §Your role:§        §A role as an Entry Level Intelligence Analyst (known in the Navy as Cryptologic Linguist) is exciting, challenging and immensely rewarding. You’ll use language and analytical skills to provide key information to the Command team. You’ll be supported by classified Government intelligence programs to analyse, interpret and translate foreign language material in real-time; both at sea and ashore. The intelligence that you provide has a direct impact on operations all around the world.§        § §        §Whilst all Intelligence Analysts receive formal language training they do not normally perform the role of an interpreter or other linguistics roles not associated with their primary intelligence role.§        § §        §Teamwork is an important part of the role. You’ll work in a close-knit team that really rely on each other. There are also many opportunities for career growth and travel; all while making a difference to the defence of Australia and her interests.§        § §        §The training Intelligence Analysts receive include, but are not limited to:§        § §        §- Learning a language other than English,§        §- Information technology processes, like typing and software manipulation,§        §- Analytical techniques and methodical problem-solving,§        §- Communications theory and networks,§        §- Methods for working with intelligence information,§        §- The ‘order of battle’ of foreign military forces,§        §- Procedures for safeguarding intelligence information.§        § §        §Prior experience isn’t needed. You’ll gain all the necessary skills and qualifications to become an Entry Level Intelligence Analyst as part of your training.§        § §        §Life in the Navy: §        §A career in the Navy is a challenging and highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. You can expect to feel a unique sense of accomplishment and pride from serving and protecting our country and helping to keep our vast coastlines safe.§        § §        §Life in the Navy is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy varied lifestyles, rewarding careers, opportunities to travel, and excellent social and fitness facilities, free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§        § §        §Don’t worry, it’s not all life at sea—there’s more to the Navy than ships, submarines and helicopters.§        §Some days, you might be exploring exciting new countries with your fellow crewmates. Other days, you could be stationed locally not too far from home.§        § §        §Salary: §        §Be paid to train and learn the skills required to become a qualified Cryptologic Linguist. Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of up to: $85,154 including service and uniform allowances, as well as a Maritime Allowance (if applicable).§        § §        §In addition to your salary, you will receive generous superannuation, housing subsidies and free medical and dental.§        § §        §Apply Now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths. An aptitude to learn a foreign language is essential (you’ll be tested before being accepted).§        § §        § §        §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become a Entry Level Data Analyst and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Navy.§        §https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/cryptologic-linguist§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Your role:§ §A role as an Entry Level Intelligence Analyst (known in the Navy as Cryptologic Linguist) is exciting, challenging and immensely rewarding. You’ll work in a close-knit team that really rely on each other. There are also many opportunities for career growth and travel; all while making a difference to the defence of Australia and her interests.§ § § §The training Intelligence Analysts receive include, but are not limited to:§ § § §- Learning a language other than English,§ §- Information technology processes, like typing and software manipulation,§ §- Analytical techniques and methodical problem-solving,§ §- Communications theory and networks,§ §- Methods for working with intelligence information,§ §- The ‘order of battle’ of foreign military forces,§ §- Procedures for safeguarding intelligence information.§ § § §Prior experience isn’t needed. Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of up to: $85,154 including service and uniform allowances, as well as a Maritime Allowance (if applicable).§ § § §In addition to your salary, you will receive generous superannuation, housing subsidies and free medical and dental.§ § § §Apply Now: § §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths. jobTitle: Project Analyst Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692058.txt	§Project Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Analyst§§Advertiser: §Macias Consulting Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$110k+Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Your New Company§A key industry player in WA, this large service provider is currently transforming the group for the next wave of anticipated growth and expansion.  Based in an impressive CBD office, at group level, you will join a high performing team of project and program professionals.  The company is at a critical inflection point, and investing in people, systems, processes, in order to future proof the company.  Be part of a transformation, more than just step change, and make a real impact on company performance.§Your New Role§As a project analyst, you will enjoy a varied role - supporting program and project managers, functional leaders (IT, Finance, HR, Sales, Marketing, Procurement, Etc) and operational heads (General Managers, Operations Managers, etc).  You will be a key conduit for business case development, reporting, risk assessment, and reviews.  Projects will vary from $1m to $100m in size, and programs can run weeks to years.  A truly broad based role, requiring great business acumen, and superior stakeholder engagement skills.§Your Experience§You have 3-5 years of high performing experience as a management consultant (or equivalent corporate experience) with a thorough understanding of best practice when it comes to projects.  You learn quickly, are able to follow process, and engage a broad range of executives.  You are an excellent communicator - whether on the phone, email, face to face, spreadsheets or even PowerPoint.  You can communicate clearly and effectively, with excellent listening skills.  You are natural problem solver and creative thinker.  MBA preferred, bachelor's degree from a reputable university with distinction average or better, essential.  §Your Application§For immediate consideration of this permanent position, please send your CV via this advertisement or at www.maciasconsulting.com.au.  Your enquiry will be held in strict confidence.  If writing a cover letter, you may address it to Eric Macias §(08 6141 3200§).  This role is approved, vacant due to internal promotion, and ready to be filled ASAP.  Work rights within Australia are essential, sponsorship is not available.  Equal opportunity employer with exceptional fringe benefits in addition to competitive remuneration.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50658720.txt	§Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §The University of Sydney§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Remuneration package $127K p.a inc. super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Analyst §      §About the opportunity §We are seeking an experienced §Business Analyst§ to join our Operational Excellence team. As the§ Business Analyst§ you will play a key role in supporting the implementation of an enriched and complex operating model providing analytical leadership, operational management and subject matter expertise. Your subject matter expertise will span across the management, operationalisation and effective design of metrics, dashboards, out of the box thinking, compliance and management control experience. § You will be expected to perform analysis of complex issues while focusing on business re-engineering, implementation and issue resolution. § §About you§ The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a §Business Analyst§ who can demonstrate: §        §          §extensive experience working through organisational change and acting as a champion of that change §          §highly developed analytical and problem-solving skills in order to inform and drive organisational, operational, financial and people related decision making§          §competency in communicating business activities and functions to all audiences §          §highly developed stakeholder management skills in collaborating with senior leadership, stakeholders and clients§          §experience working in a laboratory environment focusing on the compliance of the laboratory including work health and safety§          §strong project management skills and capability.§        §        § §About us§ § § As part of the Operations portfolio, COS is responsible for the strategic asset management of the University’s infrastructure assets and the delivery of customer centric, quality operational services for our internal clients (staff, researchers, academics and ultimately students). COS consists of five portfolios that collectively achieve this objective: · Technical Services Support (TSS), including MYLAB · Asset Management and Operations · Shared Services Centre · Service Excellence & Innovation, including enablement functions such as Metrics & Reporting, L&D, Strategy, Continuous Improvement, Contract Management, WHS, Planning & scheduling etc. · Health, Safety, Environment & Compliance, Assurance § The role of Operational Excellence is contributing to the COS strategic goals. The Business Analyst is part of the Operational Excellence team, reporting directly to the Head of Operational Excellence. Operational Excellence provides and enables the service and specialists to deliver efficient, compliant services. § Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across our campuses, we employ over 8,100 academic and non-academic staff who support over 73,000 students.§ We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us. §How to apply§ §For more information on the position and University, please view the position description available from the job’s listing on the University of Sydney careers website. §All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.§ Visit §sydney.edu.au/recruitment§ and search by the reference number §1031/0820F §to apply. §Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position § §Closing date: 11:30pm, Wednesday 14 October 2020§ §The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. jobTitle: Branch Manager - Business Transformation & City Transformation Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680907.txt	§Branch Manager - Business Transformation & City Transformation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Branch Manager - Business Transformation & City Transformation§§Advertiser: §Logan City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Southern Suburbs & Logan§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§City of Logan's ambition is to become an innovative dynamic city of the future. Recognised nationally, and eventually internationally, as an 'innovation powerhouse'. A city of creativity, collaboration, and leadership. An exemplar of sustainability and liveability. A city renowned for excellence in design, technology, entrepreneurship and community vibrancy.  § §However, the future we imagine and hope for our City won't just happen without the right executive leadership team supporting our Council political leaders.   § §We've already been fortunate to attract and retain wonderful leaders across our organisation.....but we now need two more leaders at the branch management level for our Business Transformation and City Transformation branches within the Innovation & City Transformation Directorate. § §The Innovation and City Transformation Directorate branches comprise programs that are now established as centres of excellence, working strategically alongside internal and external stakeholders, connecting across teams and boundaries, to help Council transform the organisation and our city.  §Our aim is to help empower our people to realise the potential - within Council and across the city - by finding new ways to solve problems and "§do things differently and §better§"(which is how we define 'innovation').  §Our focus is firmly on strategic collaboration, developing and maintaining strong internal and external network connections and effective/timely communication.  § §B§usiness Transformation Branch § § §Business Transformation drives performance management to help our decision-makers set the strategic direction for the city and council and collaborate across the organisation to transform the way we do business. Some of the key opportunities in this role are:  § § §Shaping Council's longer-term business transformation agenda  § §Implementing a world class asset management system for all Council assets  § §Guiding Council's corporate and digital innovation development  § §City Transformation Branch § § §We empower businesses, innovators and communities to imagine, collaborate and create our future city.    § §Some of the key opportunities in this role are:  § § §Establishing the soon to be launched coLab growth hub as Australia's leading government support innovation lab and incubator/accelerator program.  § §Developing the pipeline of programs to support innovation and entrepreneurship capability development across all sectors from students/youth, SMEs through to start-ups and scale-ups as well as major corporates§ §Shaping the evolution of the City of Logan's innovation ecosystem to support achievement of the City's economic, social and environmental objectives§ § § §We're seeking two outstanding leaders and managers who are passionate, confident and purposeful about leading and managing transformational change - for the city and for our organisation. The opportunity to play a leading role in shaping the direction of a major Australian city as well positioned as the City of Logan is - growing, diverse, centrally located and connected - often only comes along once in a career lifetime.   § §If you've got the demonstrated ability and preparedness to commit to shape the transformation of a city, and in turn a large modern local government organisation, to realise our bold ambition……well, then we'd love to hear from you.  § §So what are you waiting for….apply now before the role closes on Monday 19th October 2020.   § §Need a little more convincing or information after reviewing the position descriptions at the top of the page § HERE,§ please feel free to contact our recruitment partner Mark Phillips from Dean & Ling on 07 §3211 1018§. § §We’re social! - connect with us at #§lccjobs§ through §LinkedIn§, §Facebook§,§ §Instagram§ § §Head along to §Logan§ City Council Careers§ §to discover more about us§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
