jobTitle: Consultant Business Analyst Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50663012.txt	§Consultant Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consultant Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §Artio People§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Apis, part of Accenture, is helping government deliver more efficient and effective services for our citizens and communities. Together we offer government a stronger end to end service delivery partner. We do this through industry leading advisory and program reform / design capability, backed by end to end delivery capability in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology, and operations. We're seeking skills for the future; let's build it together!§    § Due to sustained growth, a permanent opportunity has become available for an experienced consultant who thrives when solving problems and designing solutions in complex environments. The successful applicant will contribute towards informing and influencing policy proposals, system improvements and technical enhancements in a federal government setting.§     § This position is ideal for an experienced §Consultant §who:§ § §is driven§ §willing to present their ideas § §innovative§ §forward thinking§ § §Working with us you will:§ § §be recognised and rewarded for outstanding work and your contributions to our business§ §work alongside leaders in social policy reform within whole of government transformation§ §be encouraged and supported to achieve balance between your personal and professional life§ §experience a culture that fosters individual potential and excellence§ §have the opportunity to work flexibly and be afforded generous leave choices§ §be able to take part in a variety of volunteering programmes, and support your local community§ § §To ensure your success within this role, your experience will include a blend of;§ § §strategic communication and process visualisation§ §co-facilitation of workshops with stakeholders from a variety of backgrounds and levels§ §a developing understanding of industry frameworks to define problems, develop strategies and provide solutions§ §a genuine interest in contributing to improvements in service delivery in a social policy setting§ §relevant tertiary qualifications and industry recognised certifications highly desirable§ § §A baseline clearance or ability to obtain one is an essential criterion of this role, therefore §applicants without Australian Citizenship cannot be considered.§   § §Please contact Kristen Paes via kristen.paes@apisgroup.com.au§ §for a confidential discussion.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Business Analyst Job in Gold Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653208.txt	§Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §JJ Ryan Consulting Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§About us:§  §JJ Ryan Consulting are an award-winning engineering consulting firm made up of a skilled and experienced team of engineers, designers and project managers.§  §We assist clients across Australia throughout the entire infrastructure life cycle by delivering a variety of services including strategic & commercial advice, engineering design, contract administration, asset management and software engineering.§  §We have offices in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Gold Coast and Perth.§  §About you:§  §The purpose of this role is to lead the Finance & Analytics team. The role will involve undertaking financial analysis and support and facilitate administrative functions. The role will suit a logical thinker that enjoys using data to help make decisions and improve business processes.§  §We are seeking an enthusiastic Business Analyst to be based in our Gold Coast office.§  §You will be responsible for:§ § §Analysing complex problems and processes in order to accurately understand business needs§ §Reviewing and analysing large and complex sets of data turning data into useable and insightful information§ §Reporting to the Operations team on performance and KPI’s that can drive business improvements§ §Evaluating business needs of customers§ §Effectively and accurately documenting business requirements and specifications§ §Identifying, evaluating and developing procedures§ §Defining reporting and alerting requirements§ §Analysing cost/benefits for projects§ §Liaising with stakeholders at all stages of the solution building process§ §Developing test plans and coordinating user testing and assessments§ §Participating and leading training sessions§ §Performing quality assurance on ongoing project solutions§ §Ensuring projects and solutions do not exceed budgetary restraints§ §Collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to understand regular and adhoc reporting and data analysis requirements§ §S§kills and Qualifications:§  §Our ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role, including:§ § §Studied or currently studying a Accounting, Business, Commerce, Economics, Finance and/or an Engineering related course§ §Understanding and experience in large scale engineering infrastructure would be an advantage§ §Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel with ability to use formulas to build financial models§ §Excellent writing skills with the ability to produce detailed reports and documentation§ §Sound computer skills and proficient in the use of Microsoft Office suite§ §Attention to detail and ability to plan, prioritise and organise work demands and deadlines§ §Current and valid driver’s license as travel may be required from time to time§ §Be able to work effectively with minimal supervision§ §Experience with software development or programming will be a considerable advantage.§  §What Next?§  §If you would thrive in a fast paced and rewarding environment with a company who takes pride in quality and offers endless opportunity for personal development, then we would love to hear from you today.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a business analyst (BA) role?§Which of the following data analytics tools are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Manager, Corporate Governance - ESG Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50711087.txt	§Manager, Corporate Governance - ESG§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager, Corporate Governance - ESG§§Advertiser: §B & K Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$150k - $165k p.a. + Superannuation + Bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Our client is a leading consulting and research business to corporate clients all over the world. With an impressive list of high profile clients, they provide strategic advice across Corporate Governance, ESG and shareholder engagement. Building on their success in Australia the business is now looking to welcome a new Manager consultant to the team.§You will be the main managing consultant in Corporate Governance and will have the freedom to run client engagements and build exciting solutions to further your service offerings. §Key Responsibilities§Provide insights and updates on governance-related and ESG matters on an ongoing basis, including assessment of best practices and emerging trends.§Analysis of the likely voting outcomes on board or shareholder proposals.§Recommendations that would enhance management presentations to shareholders, including advice on the most effective approach to engaging specific investors.§Consultation on any related matters, including presentations to the governance committee of the board (or to the full board) on any critical issues.§We are looking for individuals who have the drive and energy to engage with clients. To be successful in this role, it is expected that you will come from a background in either Investor Stewardship, Corporate Governance or ESG and have an understanding of shareholder engagement. This position will suit someone looking for variety in their day to day and who is excited by the prospect of dealing with multiple clients across varied industries. §This role will offer you more freedom and scope to learn what it takes to become a true consultant in this space. You will have freedom for thought leadership and be keen to talk at events and round tables. You will be supported by a very experienced Director and a business with vast resources and opportunities. The client base is of plenty and won't require cold calling or door knocking to work on engagements. §If this is a position that is of interest and you have a relevant background, please feel free to apply.§ § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Program Manager Job in Asia Pacific - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647106.txt	§Program Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Program Manager§§Advertiser: §Cardno§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Asia Pacific§, §PNG & Pacific Islands§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Solomon Islands Education Sector Support Program§  § §  §The Solomon Islands Education Sector Support Program (ESSP) provides the strategic direction and implementation arrangements for the New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade (MFAT) and the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) combined investment to support the Solomon Islands Government (SIG) to implement its Education Strategic Framework 2016–2030 (ESF), the National Education Action Plan §2016-2020§ (NEAP) and its successor.§  § §  §The Program adopts a modified version of a sector-wide approach, using mixed-modalities. It positions the Ministry of Education and Human Resources Development (MEHRD) as the central partner, adopts MEHRD’s ESF and NEAP as the guiding frameworks for all investment, promotes strengthened sector-wide donor coordination and provides the majority of Program funding through sector budget support. Funding is also available to support targeted capacity development and activities implemented by non-governmental organisations.§  § §  §ESSP is managed under Australia’s Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF) by Cardno.§  § §  §The role§  § §  §The Program Manager will be a part of the Program Management Team (PMT) who are responsible for supporting the development and undertake the day-to-day management, implementation, coordination and administration of the Solomon Islands ESSP.§  § §  §The Program Manager will support implementation of day-to-day activities, provide stakeholder partnership liaison and support, and contribute to the monitoring and reporting on the overall performance of the program and manage NGO grant arrangements.§  § §  §The Program Manager will support the ESSP Team Leader to administer operations and support the team of technical advisers working within the PMT and MEHRD.§  § §  §The adviser will also:§  § § § §Monitor and project manage the NGO Funding Arrangements from inception to closure and work with the SIRF Grants Unit, under the guidance of the ESSP Team Leader;§ §Maintain strong collaboration with MEHRD in the overall management of NGO contestable Fund and coordinating (i) the committee responsible for reviewing and selecting successful proposals, (ii) annual reflection sessions with implementing NGOs;§ §Work closely with the SIRF Finance team, to plan and allocate the program’s budget, monitor and forecast expenditure;§ §Monitor and maintain records and key contacts of relevant complementary DFAT/MFAT bilateral and regional programs and work of other organisational/programs and facilitate linkages to ensure cohesive achievement of project outputs and deliverables which will contribute to the Education sector;§ §Provide quality advice and support to ESSP Team Leader in relation to program planning and implementation, leadership support including the ability to prioritise and sequence multiple and sometimes competing program activities§ §Contribute collaboratively to the development and implementation of a monitoring, evaluation and learning (MEL) framework which is aligned to the expected outcomes of the ESSP§ §Support the ESSP Team Leader to ensure that Adviser ToRs, work plans and reporting are aligned to MEHRD and DFAT/MFAT priorities and expected outcomes§ §Support the ESSP Team Leader to ensure that performance management of Advisers adds value by focusing on the quality and sustainability of Adviser outputs and progress against ToRs, work plans and expected program outcomes§ §  §  §For further information, please copy paste this link to access the Terms of Reference detailing responsibilities and selection criteria: https://bit.ly/345iXZ3 §  § §  §About you§  § §  §Cardno encourages Solomon Islands nationals and nationals from other Pacific island countries to apply.§  § §  §You will be a motivated and proactive individual with the right combination of experience, talent, energy and a commitment to technical excellence. You will also have:§  § § § §Tertiary qualification in education, project management, business administration or similar.§ §Five or more years’ relevant experience as a manager, program coordinator or relevant position;§ §Experience in international development managing development programs in Solomon Islands and working with donors or civil society, or similar contexts (preferable the Pacific region);§ §Demonstrated experience in activity and financial planning, project management and reporting to fulfil donor and contractor requirements;§ §High level interpersonal, communication (verbal and written) and cross-cultural skills including the ability to contribute to program reporting and policy dialogue;§ §Ability to work effectively as part of a cross-cultural and multi-location team with a range of stakeholders;§ §Excellent time management, problem solving and organisation skills.§ §Desired experience and knowledgeAbility to converse in Pidgin English would be an advantage but not essential.§ § §  §For further information, please copy paste this link to access the Terms of Reference detailing responsibilities and selection criteria: https://bit.ly/345iXZ3§  § §  §Remuneration§  § §  §This position is classified under DFAT’s Aid Adviser Remuneration Framework (ARF) as Discipline C, Level 2 and will be offered at a level commensurate to the successful candidate’s experience relevant to the role.§  § §  §To access the ARF rates, please copy and paste the following link:https://www.dfat.gov.au/sites/default/files/adviser-remuneration-framework-2016.pdf§  § § §  §Location and travel requirements§  § §  §The position will be based in Honiara with regular provincial travel required.§  § §  §Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF)§  § §  §The Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF) is supported by the Australian Government and managed by Cardno. SIRF is an integrated facility that delivers both Technical Assistance (TA) and Deployee Support Services (DSS), in Solomon Islands.§  § §  §Why join Cardno?§  § §  §Cardno offers meaningful opportunities for each individual member of our team to grow, make an impact and leave a legacy for local communities, globally.§  § §  §By joining Cardno, you will be part of an environment where you can collaborate with leading experts from diverse backgrounds, access development programs to achieve your career goals, and be challenged to take a global outlook§  § §  §How to apply§  § §  §We welcome your interest in joining the Cardno team. Click the ‘apply’ button to submit your application online with the reference number CID/MN/SIRF/PME by§ Sunday 25th October. §Your application §must§ include the following:§  § § § §Your CV; and§ §Completed application form in lieu of a cover letter. Please copy paste this link to access the application form: https://bit.ly/337is1j§ § §  §If you are having any technical issues with submitting your application online, please email them directly to the SIRF recruitment team §recruitment@sirf.com.sb§  § §  §About Cardno§  § §  §We are a global provider of integrated professional services which enrich the physical and social environment for the communities in which we live and work. Our team of multidisciplinary specialists has more than 70 years’ experience in designing, developing and delivering sustainable projects and community advancement programs.§  § §  §Cardno is an equal opportunity employer.§  § §  §Cardno is committed to Safety and the Prevention of Sexual Abuse and Harassment (PSEAH), Child Protection and bribery prevention. We want to engage with the right people to deliver our client programs. As part of our approach you will be subjected to formal background screening, criminal record checks, employment verification, and periodic compliance checks. All Cardno staff receive safety, compliance and safeguards training and are responsible for contributing to a safer working culture.§§§§

Our prices, our produce, our specials– all determined by nature. It enriches everyone and everything. For over 40 years Harris Farm Markets has remained 100% family owned and operated.  §        §With over 25 + stores across Sydney NSW and Queensland and growing and home to over 2,200 wonderful employees all with a common purpose, to reconnect Aussies with the joy of food. It’s this purpose that sees us continue to bring the best that nature has to offer to our customers each day. From sustainable initiatives like Imperfect Picks, to showing love for local farmers and producers through products such as our Farmer Friendly Milk, we believe that all our actions can make a real, positive difference.  §        §  §        §The Role  §        §Initially we require part time hours (2-3 days per week) As an OKR Program Manager. You will be required to formulate & facilitate setting up an OKR program for the business and also oversee tracking and compliance phase.   §        § Key responsibilities will include;  §        §          §Having a strong track record in OKR software systems and program implementation and be fully conversant with Trello software. §          §Setting up the OKR program in Trello & collaborate with Senior team to formulate work streams for each OKR. §          §The timely set up, tracking & measurement of OKRs.  §          §liaising with members of the senior team to develop work streams and track and support progress.  §          §Developing realistic timelines with a follow up progress that works with the business.  §          §Supporting the team to achieve agreed initiatives. §          §Liaising with Direct Report & key leaders on progress and solutions to achieving key results. §          §Developing, track & measure realistic schedules for 90, 180 day and longer activities. §          §Implementation of system initiatives.  §          §Developing a support and resolution processes to drive the program. §        §        § §        §Skills Required  §        §          §Alignment with HFM values §          §Demonstrated expertise in OKR software programs and strong skills in Trello §          §Relevant tertiary qualifications  §          §Proven expertise in OKR program delivery  §          §Strong knowledge of OKR excellence & systems §          §Strong process disciplines with strong record of timely delivery and results §          §Attention to detail §          §An analytical mind and good mathematical ability §          §Outstanding communication skills (written and oral) & the ability to work across functions & teams  §        §        §      §      §      §    §  §§§About us  §At Harris Farm Markets, we don’t just respect nature, we’re driven by it. Our prices, our produce, our specials– all determined by nature. It enriches everyone and everything. For over 40 years Harris Farm Markets has remained 100% family owned and operated.  §With over 25 + stores across Sydney NSW and Queensland and growing and home to over 2,200 wonderful employees all with a common purpose, to reconnect Aussies with the joy of food. It’s this purpose that sees us continue to bring the best that nature has to offer to our customers each day. From sustainable initiatives like Imperfect Picks, to showing love for local farmers and producers through products such as our Farmer Friendly Milk, we believe that all our actions can make a real, positive difference.  §  §The Role  §Initially we require part time hours (2-3 days per week) As an OKR Program Manager. You will be required to formulate & facilitate setting up an OKR program for the business and also oversee tracking and compliance phase.   § Key responsibilities will include;  §Having a strong track record in OKR software systems and program implementation and be fully conversant with Trello software. §Setting up the OKR program in Trello & collaborate with Senior team to formulate work streams for each OKR. §The timely set up, tracking & measurement of OKRs.  §liaising with members of the senior team to develop work streams and track and support progress.  §Developing realistic timelines with a follow up progress that works with the business.  §Supporting the team to achieve agreed initiatives. §Liaising with Direct Report & key leaders on progress and solutions to achieving key results. §Developing, track & measure realistic schedules for 90, 180 day and longer activities. §Implementation of system initiatives.  §Developing a support and resolution processes to drive the program. § §Skills Required  §Alignment with HFM values §Demonstrated expertise in OKR software programs and strong skills in Trello §Relevant tertiary qualifications  §Proven expertise in OKR program delivery  §Strong knowledge of OKR excellence & systems §Strong process disciplines with strong record of timely delivery and results §Attention to detail §An analytical mind and good mathematical ability §Outstanding communication skills (written and oral) & the ability to work across functions & teams  §§§§§

Applications are accepted only through this website.§§§Tasks & responsibilities§§Learn about the client's business challenges and technologies to understand their business needs; interview company personnel§Evaluate existing organisational problems and identify opportunities for improvement§Plan and implement cost-effective solutions utilising current infrastructure and resources§Implement software and technologies to optimise operations of the business§Maintain a line of direct communication with clients to give them feedback and assist them to implement the improved strategies§Identify areas of inefficiencies at all levels and assist the client to develop strategic plans to tackle them taking into account to timelines and budgets§Carry out research and data collection to understand the client’s organisation§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50641423.txt	§Manager, Strategy and Operations§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager, Strategy and Operations§§Advertiser: §Kingston Human Capital§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Manager, Strategy and Operations §      §About the Opportunity§ Kingston Human Capital has been exclusively engaged by a leading International Advisory and Management organisation to assist in securing an experienced Manager within Strategy and Operations to join their team permanently.§ With their Global Head Office based in Brisbane, the role will report directly with the General Manager of Emerging Markets. § The newly created position will have responsibility for engaging with their clients across a range of Government and Health sector clients and will have responsibility for the development of tender responses. §        §          §Engage directly Government and Health clients on their most important and challenging issues §          §Extensive strategy/operations consulting experience in a Consulting firm§          §Well-developed problem solving and analytical skills, coupled with a continuous improvement mindset to improve efficiencies across a large complex business§          §Respond to and develop a professional and compelling bid and tenders across a broad range of clients needs§          §Strong market research capability and experience with research tools §        § §To be successful in this role, you must possess: §        §          §A minimum of 5 years strategy/operations consulting experience in a Consulting firm§          §A strategic and pragmatic thinker, restless with the status quo and confident to share ideas in a collaborative work environment §          §Superior interpersonal, presentation, verbal, and written communication skills§          §Experience in a fast-paced and growth environment desirable§          §Strong sense of team and passion to develop others as well as self§          §Tertiary qualification §        § If you are interested in this opportunity, please click §"APPLY"§ and attach your current resume for further consideration. Confidential enquiries should be directed to §Gerard Kerr General Manager, Executive Search and Selection §at §Kingston Human Capital§ on §0432 544 444§.§        §Thank you for your time and interest. §      §      §0432544444§ §    §  §§§About the Opportunity§ Kingston Human Capital has been exclusively engaged by a leading International Advisory and Management organisation to assist in securing an experienced Manager within Strategy and Operations to join their team permanently.§ With their Global Head Office based in Brisbane, the role will report directly with the General Manager of Emerging Markets. § The newly created position will have responsibility for engaging with their clients across a range of Government and Health sector clients and will have responsibility for the development of tender responses. § § §Engage directly Government and Health clients on their most important and challenging issues § §Extensive strategy/operations consulting experience in a Consulting firm§ §Well-developed problem solving and analytical skills, coupled with a continuous improvement mindset to improve efficiencies across a large complex business§ §Respond to and develop a professional and compelling bid and tenders across a broad range of clients needs§ §Strong market research capability and experience with research tools § § §To be successful in this role, you must possess: § § §A minimum of 5 years strategy/operations consulting experience in a Consulting firm§ §A strategic and pragmatic thinker, restless with the status quo and confident to share ideas in a collaborative work environment § §Superior interpersonal, presentation, verbal, and written communication skills§ §Experience in a fast-paced and growth environment desirable§ §Strong sense of team and passion to develop others as well as self§ §Tertiary qualification § § If you are interested in this opportunity, please click §"APPLY"§ and attach your current resume for further consideration. Confidential enquiries should be directed to §Gerard Kerr General Manager, Executive Search and Selection §at §Kingston Human Capital§ on §0432 544 444§.§ §Thank you for your time and interest. §§§§

jobTitle: Business Analyst (Sydney) Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50700214.txt	§Business Analyst (Sydney)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Analyst (Sydney)§§Advertiser: §Allens§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Analyst (Sydney) §      §      §      §        §Your Role§§We are looking for a Business Analyst with a few years of general commercial experience to join our Pricing and Practice Economics Team in Sydney.  This is a unique opportunity to work closely with our in-house pricing strategists on analysis and implementation of the firm's pricing strategy. §Our Team§§As a member of Pricing and Practice Economics Team, you will work in a collaborative environment assisting and supporting the Head of Pricing and Pricing Manager.  You'll work closely with many parts of the firm, consulting directly with partners and other stakeholders, and will be challenged, supported and guided as you continue to learn and develop during your career at Allens.  §        §Your day§§As a Business Analyst, you'll assist the team to develop pricing structures to deliver value to clients.  Your core responsibilities will include working with our Head of Pricing and Pricing Manager to:§        §          §Support bid / tender teams to develop pricing strategy in preparation and response to client RFPs, including appropriate negotiation support through the entire lifecycle from pursuit.§          §Assist lawyers to plan and respond to requests for estimates or proposals using pricing tools and financial models to assess profitability and owning the development of workable pricing solutions.§          §Design, implement and assist partners to manage and improve outcomes under alternative fee arrangements and other pricing arrangements.§          §Implement strategic initiatives to that drive improvements in efficiency with which work is performed, driving positive outcomes for clients and the firm.§          §Assist the Pricing Manager to support the Integrated Legal Solutions team in pricing of legal tech products and technology services.§          §Contribute to projects that arise from time to time, including the ongoing development of pricing infrastructure for the firm. §        §        §Your clients§§As a member of our Pricing and Practice Economics Team, you will partner with many parts of the firm, across various practice groups and departments.  Together with members of the Pricing team, you'll work closely with Partners, Commercial Managers, Legal Project Managers, Integrated Legal Solutions, Legal Product Lab and our Innovation Team to develop and deliver elements of the firm's strategic plan. §Your career trajectory§§Our Pricing and Practice Economics Team is looking for a Business Analyst who has the desire to learn and develop their career with us. We will support you on your journey and will give you access to our career framework when you join, providing a clear understanding of high performance at each career stage at Allens.§We also recognise that every employee's experience is different and at Allens, we know that successful and enjoyable careers come through your focus and commitment to being the best you can be, in an environment where you are supported and encouraged and have clarity on key processes and decisions. Our career deal is a key part in achieving this; our deal asks you to take the lead for your career, with us providing the coaching and support to help you meet your goals and aspirations. §What you'll bring§Skills/Experience§        §          §Highly proficient in the use of Excel with the ability to analyse data.§          §Financial modelling experience is desirable but not essential.§          §Experience in bid / tender process is desirable.§          §Strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to build relationships with people at all levels of an organisation.§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence and negotiate.§          §Strong presentation skills and proficient in PowerPoint.§          §Excellent time management skills with the ability co-ordinate multiple stakeholders in a fast paced environment.§        §        §Qualifications§        §          §Undergraduate qualification in Business / Commerce.§          §Ideally you will have commenced your post graduate studies in CA/CPA.§          §Certification in project management or change management would be valued.§        §        §Work pattern§§This is a permanent opportunity for a Business Analyst.  We will consider candidates looking for full or part-time flexible work arrangements.§About Allens§§Allens is a leading international law firm with a proud 200-year heritage of shaping the future for our clients, our people and the communities in which we work.§From playing a pioneering role in the development of legislation and regulatory frameworks in the Asia region, to acting on numerous 'firsts' across a range of industry and community issues, it is in our DNA to make a difference and help shape what our world looks like.§Through our alliance with Linklaters, we offer clients a global network of 40 offices in 28 locations. With Allens, you'll work at the cutting edge of the law on the most complex and innovative deals in the market. You'll work with lawyers and professionals at the top of their game who, like you, strive to get a little better every day. And you'll be supported to take your career wherever you want it to go.§What we'll offer§        §You will be an integral part of a high performing, national team and have an opportunity to work with genuine market leaders.§ §        §At Allens, we provide lifelong learning that develops you personally and professionally, and access to people and leaders who can help you become the best you can be. You'll be given ongoing opportunities to get involved and to take your career all the way.§ §        §You'll enjoy a range of other benefits including free gym membership, staff discounts with hundreds of suppliers and regular social and sporting activities. Allens also leads the profession in community investment, giving you the opportunity to make a difference through our work on reconciliation, the environment and other social justice issues as well as our workplace giving and volunteering programs.§        §Are you ready to begin?§        §We prefer to hear from you directly.§ §        §Please submit your resume via our on-line careers site addressed to Charlotte Frith, Senior National Resourcing Manager or contact Charlotte for a confidential discussion on + §61 3 9613 8983§.§ §        §If this isn't the position for you, please tell your friends or colleagues about it.§      §    §    §www.allens.com.au§  §§§Your Role§§We are looking for a Business Analyst with a few years of general commercial experience to join our Pricing and Practice Economics Team in Sydney.  This is a unique opportunity to work closely with our in-house pricing strategists on analysis and implementation of the firm's pricing strategy. §Our Team§§As a member of Pricing and Practice Economics Team, you will work in a collaborative environment assisting and supporting the Head of Pricing and Pricing Manager.  You'll work closely with many parts of the firm, consulting directly with partners and other stakeholders, and will be challenged, supported and guided as you continue to learn and develop during your career at Allens.  §Your day§§As a Business Analyst, you'll assist the team to develop pricing structures to deliver value to clients.  Your core responsibilities will include working with our Head of Pricing and Pricing Manager to:§§Support bid / tender teams to develop pricing strategy in preparation and response to client RFPs, including appropriate negotiation support through the entire lifecycle from pursuit.§Assist lawyers to plan and respond to requests for estimates or proposals using pricing tools and financial models to assess profitability and owning the development of workable pricing solutions.§Design, implement and assist partners to manage and improve outcomes under alternative fee arrangements and other pricing arrangements.§Implement strategic initiatives to that drive improvements in efficiency with which work is performed, driving positive outcomes for clients and the firm.§Assist the Pricing Manager to support the Integrated Legal Solutions team in pricing of legal tech products and technology services.§Contribute to projects that arise from time to time, including the ongoing development of pricing infrastructure for the firm. §§Your clients§§As a member of our Pricing and Practice Economics Team, you will partner with many parts of the firm, across various practice groups and departments.  Together with members of the Pricing team, you'll work closely with Partners, Commercial Managers, Legal Project Managers, Integrated Legal Solutions, Legal Product Lab and our Innovation Team to develop and deliver elements of the firm's strategic plan. §Your career trajectory§§Our Pricing and Practice Economics Team is looking for a Business Analyst who has the desire to learn and develop their career with us. We will support you on your journey and will give you access to our career framework when you join, providing a clear understanding of high performance at each career stage at Allens.§We also recognise that every employee's experience is different and at Allens, we know that successful and enjoyable careers come through your focus and commitment to being the best you can be, in an environment where you are supported and encouraged and have clarity on key processes and decisions. Our career deal is a key part in achieving this; our deal asks you to take the lead for your career, with us providing the coaching and support to help you meet your goals and aspirations. §What you'll bring§Skills/Experience§§Highly proficient in the use of Excel with the ability to analyse data.§Financial modelling experience is desirable but not essential.§Experience in bid / tender process is desirable.§Strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to build relationships with people at all levels of an organisation.§Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence and negotiate.§Strong presentation skills and proficient in PowerPoint.§Excellent time management skills with the ability co-ordinate multiple stakeholders in a fast paced environment.§§Qualifications§§Undergraduate qualification in Business / Commerce.§Ideally you will have commenced your post graduate studies in CA/CPA.§Certification in project management or change management would be valued.§§Work pattern§§This is a permanent opportunity for a Business Analyst.  We will consider candidates looking for full or part-time flexible work arrangements.§About Allens§§Allens is a leading international law firm with a proud 200-year heritage of shaping the future for our clients, our people and the communities in which we work.§From playing a pioneering role in the development of legislation and regulatory frameworks in the Asia region, to acting on numerous 'firsts' across a range of industry and community issues, it is in our DNA to make a difference and help shape what our world looks like.§Through our alliance with Linklaters, we offer clients a global network of 40 offices in 28 locations. With Allens, you'll work at the cutting edge of the law on the most complex and innovative deals in the market. You'll work with lawyers and professionals at the top of their game who, like you, strive to get a little better every day. And you'll be supported to take your career wherever you want it to go.§What we'll offer§You will be an integral part of a high performing, national team and have an opportunity to work with genuine market leaders.§ §At Allens, we provide lifelong learning that develops you personally and professionally, and access to people and leaders who can help you become the best you can be. You'll be given ongoing opportunities to get involved and to take your career all the way.§ §You'll enjoy a range of other benefits including free gym membership, staff discounts with hundreds of suppliers and regular social and sporting activities. Allens also leads the profession in community investment, giving you the opportunity to make a difference through our work on reconciliation, the environment and other social justice issues as well as our workplace giving and volunteering programs.§Are you ready to begin?§We prefer to hear from you directly.§ §Please submit your resume via our on-line careers site addressed to Charlotte Frith, Senior National Resourcing Manager or contact Charlotte for a confidential discussion on + §61 3 9613 8983§.§ §If this isn't the position for you, please tell your friends or colleagues about it.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50685045.txt	§Senior Manager Innovation & Design§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager Innovation & Design§§Advertiser: §Eagle HR Consulting Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Northern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Corporate Development§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Be part of a dynamic & Innovative leadership team.§Generous salary packaging§Newly created key position.§ §Our client, is a highly respected child-centred and family-focused community services organisation that works with and supports children and families. They are one of the most respected child welfare organisations and today have acquired a distinguished reputation for their record of leadership and innovation in the design and provision of integrated child welfare and integrated early childhood services.§ § § §About the role§ § § §Reporting directly to the COO, you will be responsible for implementing their growth and business development of innovative new services or processes. You will lead innovation through being creative and a visionary with the ability to see opportunities whilst having the business acumen to shepherd ideas from the visionary stage through to production.§ §  §You will also§;§ §Foster individual and collective creativity through creating processes and procedures for product ideation, prototyping and production that are underpinned by co-design.§Develop and deliver end to end, innovation and new concepts, service and channel design and written proposals to secure and renew funding.§Identify new opportunities for growth within existing service streams, in conjunction with Management.§Proactively manage tender, bid and proposal opportunities and timelines.§Build agency and partner relationships to support brand and marketing objectives.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §The successful candidate will have a proven track record in business innovation and service design and relationship management. You will have excellent organisational and time management skills, be a good communicator both verbal and written and possess highly developed business development skills and substantial leadership experience at an executive level. Also, you will have demonstrated conceptual thinking, ability to design and articulate service delivery models and develop new business opportunities. Your experience in developing digital and innovation strategies to create new products will be highly regarded for this key position.§ §A generous salary package will be offered commensurate with your experience and qualifications including salary packaging benefits, car allowance and other great employment benefits including, 2 ex-gratia Christmas leave days, flexible working hours, supported study leave and much more.  § §Please forward your confidential CV and application letter to: §linton@eaglehr.com.au§, or for an initial enquiry call Linton on 03-§9653 9468§. Only applications with a cover letter will be considered.§ §Applications close Friday 30th October.§ §E§agle HR Consulting P/L, level 27, 101 Collins St, Melbourne VIC 3000.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50710534.txt	§Multiple Opportunities: Specialist Planning Officers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Multiple Opportunities: Specialist Planning Officers§§Advertiser: §Department of Planning, Industry and Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§Remuneration starting from $129,360 + super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §      §      §Multiple Opportunities: Specialist Planning Officers §      §        §Are you passionate about creating great places and public spaces for the people and communities of NSW? We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Specialist Planning Officers! §§        §          §Exciting opportunity to shape the future places and communities of NSW and make a difference to where we live, visit and work§          §A range of temporary, permanent positions and talent pool opportunities available§          §Remuneration starting from $129,360 + super§          §All positions located in Sydney/ Parramatta (other locations are open to negotiation)  §        §        §About the roles§ §We need more bright, daring and creative minds to join our Place, Design and Public Spaces (PDPS) team, in a range of specialist planning officer positions.  §        §Our PDPS team designs, creates and improves places for people to live, work, learn, play and be healthy.§        §It's a truly exciting time to join the Department. We're backing the state's post-pandemic recovery with world-class reforms and initiatives to keep people in jobs, the economy moving and build a public space legacy for generations to come.§        §Here’s a taste of what you’ll be doing as a Specialist Planning officer: §        §          §Assessing and preparing complex planning assessments for a range of statutory functions including planning proposals, local environmental plans, rezoning reviews and site compatibility certificates.§          §Providing high quality and timely assessments on a range of complex planning issues.§          §Responding to a diverse range of complex policy, technical planning and operational matters.§          §Managing contentious and sensitive planning and assessment issues within tight timeframes.§          §Providing advice to local councils, community stakeholders and proponents.§        §        §To find out more about the position, you can view the role description §here§.§        §About you§Ideally, you will thrive in what is a fast-paced, dynamic and varied working environment. You will have the ability to prioritise team work loads and manage competing deadlines.§        §You will have demonstrated experience working through complex and often contentious negotiations with both local government and proponents.§        §We welcome applications from those who have excellent communication, problem solving, negotiation and stakeholder management skills.§        §To be considered you must have:§        §          §A degree in planning coupled with extensive experience.§          §Advanced knowledge and experience of the planning system and associated legislation§        §        § §        §About Us §Place, Design and Public Spaces is part of the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE). Together we create thriving environments, communities and economies, and we’re focused on creating a strong and liveable NSW. We have an amazing story to tell, and we want your story to be part of it. You’ll get all the support you need to feel valued and to perform at your best.§        §We are committed to equal employment opportunity and embrace diversity and inclusion within our workforce. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§        §We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with disability as we seek to shape a future for NSW that is truly reflective of our communities. We will provide support and reasonable adjustments in our recruitment process and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.§        § §        §How to apply§Applicants must address their suitability for the role by supplying an updated copy of their resume as well as a cover letter (no more than 1 – 2 pages) outlining your relevant skills and experience.§ §        §Applications Close:§ 11:55pm Sunday 25 October 2020§        §Should you require any further information about the role please contact Jess Walker, Talent Acquisition Specialist via §jess.walker@dpie.nsw.gov.au§  §        § §        §Good to know§A Recruitment Pool may be established for future roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from Planning and Environment Cluster and other NSW Public Sector agencies over an 18-month period.  §        § §        §Our commitment to diversity and flexibility:§The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and those with disability.§        §We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.§      §    §  §§§Are you passionate about creating great places and public spaces for the people and communities of NSW? We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Specialist Planning Officers! §§Exciting opportunity to shape the future places and communities of NSW and make a difference to where we live, visit and work§A range of temporary, permanent positions and talent pool opportunities available§Remuneration starting from $129,360 + super§All positions located in Sydney/ Parramatta (other locations are open to negotiation)  §§About the roles§ §We need more bright, daring and creative minds to join our Place, Design and Public Spaces (PDPS) team, in a range of specialist planning officer positions.  §Our PDPS team designs, creates and improves places for people to live, work, learn, play and be healthy.§It's a truly exciting time to join the Department. We're backing the state's post-pandemic recovery with world-class reforms and initiatives to keep people in jobs, the economy moving and build a public space legacy for generations to come.§§Here’s a taste of what you’ll be doing as a Specialist Planning officer: §§Assessing and preparing complex planning assessments for a range of statutory functions including planning proposals, local environmental plans, rezoning reviews and site compatibility certificates.§Providing high quality and timely assessments on a range of complex planning issues.§Responding to a diverse range of complex policy, technical planning and operational matters.§Managing contentious and sensitive planning and assessment issues within tight timeframes.§Providing advice to local councils, community stakeholders and proponents.§§To find out more about the position, you can view the role description §here§.§§About you§Ideally, you will thrive in what is a fast-paced, dynamic and varied working environment. You will have the ability to prioritise team work loads and manage competing deadlines.§You will have demonstrated experience working through complex and often contentious negotiations with both local government and proponents.§We welcome applications from those who have excellent communication, problem solving, negotiation and stakeholder management skills.§§To be considered you must have:§§A degree in planning coupled with extensive experience.§Advanced knowledge and experience of the planning system and associated legislation§§ §§About Us §Place, Design and Public Spaces is part of the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE). Together we create thriving environments, communities and economies, and we’re focused on creating a strong and liveable NSW. We have an amazing story to tell, and we want your story to be part of it. You’ll get all the support you need to feel valued and to perform at your best.§We are committed to equal employment opportunity and embrace diversity and inclusion within our workforce. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with disability as we seek to shape a future for NSW that is truly reflective of our communities. We will provide support and reasonable adjustments in our recruitment process and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.§ §How to apply§Applicants must address their suitability for the role by supplying an updated copy of their resume as well as a cover letter (no more than 1 – 2 pages) outlining your relevant skills and experience.§ §Applications Close:§ 11:55pm Sunday 25 October 2020§§Should you require any further information about the role please contact Jess Walker, Talent Acquisition Specialist via §jess.walker@dpie.nsw.gov.au§  § §§Good to know§A Recruitment Pool may be established for future roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from Planning and Environment Cluster and other NSW Public Sector agencies over an 18-month period.  § §§Our commitment to diversity and flexibility:§The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and those with disability.§§We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.§§§§

jobTitle: Lead Adviser - Transport Job in Asia Pacific - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50683316.txt	§Lead Adviser - Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Adviser - Transport§§Advertiser: §Cardno§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Asia Pacific§, §PNG & Pacific Islands§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§The role§ § § §The Lead Adviser – Transport coordinates and supports the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation, and sustainability of KIAT activities in the transport sector. The position applies outstanding technical knolwedge to complex transport policies and ensures the high quality performance of supported activities. The Lead Adviser will be innovatve and results-orientated and ensure that KIAT activities are managed in a way to achieve lasting effectiveness to improve Indonesia’s infrastructure sector.§ § § §This role also involves the following key activities:§ § § § §Identify strategic development priorities and opportunities for KIAT support in close collaboration with the KIAT Senior Management Team and GOI counterparts.§ §Establish effective working relationships with all relevant GOI§ §Develop new activities in the transport sector and lead the preparation of concept notes, design documents, terms of reference and budgets.§ §Provide technical assistance and capacity building support to GOI counterparts in line with KIAT’s mandate and agreed priorities.§ §Oversee the performance of individual sub-contractors and subcontractor firms to ensure that the quality of services is delivered and meets professional standards, and is delivered within the allocated time and budget.§ §Prepare briefing notes, policy papers, progress reports, communications materials and other adhoc reporting relating to KIAT’s activities in the transport portfolio.§ §Coordinate closely with KIAT’s Gender Equality, Social Inclusion and Civil Society Engagement (GESI-CSE) section to identify actions across KIAT’s transport activities that promote gender equality and social inclusion for vulnerable groups, including identifying opportunities where CSE can help enhance impact. Coordination will include support for the production, implementation, and resourcing of GESI-CSE Action Plans for activities.§ §Coordinate closely with KIAT’s Performance Unit in the implementation of KIAT’s Performance System, including leading participation in regular six-monthly cycles of setting progress markers against individual activity outcomes and reviewing progress towards their achievement.§ §Facilitate KIAT, Australian Embassy and sub-contractor meetings and interactions with the relevant GOI stakeholders.§ §Manage the performance of the staff reporting directly to the Lead Adviser.§ §Support coordination activities, information exchange and analysis with development cooperation partners and relevant GoI stakeholders.§ §Provide direct technical assistance and support to GOI counterparts as jointly agreed with the Deputy Director Transport Policy, Planning and Delivery.§ §Support the preparation, implementation, and monitoring of KIAT annual work plans.§ §Advise Senior Program Officer(s) and Program Manager for the preparation and implementation of procurement plans and contracting arrangements with sub-contractors and service providers.§ §Identify and assess risks to KIAT activities and relationships and develop and implement risk mitigation plans.§ §Ensure prudent management of KIATs finances and take appropriate measures to maximise value for money in procurement, minimise fiduciary risk and avoid fraud.§ §Participate in events, high level forums and dialogues with the relevant GoI counterparts, academia, development partners and other stakeholders as required.§ §Other agreed inputs as requested by the Deputy Director Transport Policy, Planning and Delivery.§ § § §Please copy paste this link to access the Terms of Reference detailing responsibilities and selection criteria: https://www.cardno.com/media/6439/tor-lead-adviser-transport-201005.pdf;§ § § § §About you§ § § §You will be a motivated and proactive §Lead Adviser §with the right combination of talent, energy and a commitment to technical excellence. You have:§ § § § §Tertiary qualifications preferably with a major in Civil Engineering/Transport Policy/Transport Planning/Transport Engineering or related field.§ §Minimum 15 years of experience in Transport Engineering, Transport Planning, and/or Infrastructure Financing, including in management positions and in areas relevant to the Indonesian context.§ §Demonstrated experience in the design and implementation of technical assistance and capacity building activities in the transport sector.§ §Experience in managing teams of consultants and sub-contractors.§ §Demonstrated ability to work in a team in a complex, and cross-cultural operating environment.§ §Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with key personnel in government and development partners.§ §Strong interpersonal skills and oral and written communication skills in English. Familiarity with Bahasa Indonesia is highly desirable.§ §Advanced skills with computer-based applications.§ §Experience with donor processes and procedures preferred.§ § § §Remuneration§ § § §Adviser Remuneration Framework (ARF) C4. Successful Indonesian nationals will be engaged under a local contract in Indonesia Rupiah and subject to Indonesian employment regulations and tax obligations.§ § § § §Why join KIAT?§ § § §The Australia Indonesia Infrastructure Partnership (Kemitraan Indonesia Australia untuk Infrastruktur - KIAT) offers meaningful opportunities for each individual member of our team to grow, make an impact and leave a legacy for local communities, globally.§ §  § §By joining KIAT, you will be part of an environment where you can collaborate with leading experts from diverse backgrounds, access development programs to achieve your career goals, and be challenged to take a global outlook.§ § § § §How to apply§ § § §Applicants must include a CV with 3 referees in their application:§ §  § §Closing Date§ § § §The position closes on §19 October 2020§ § § § §About Cardno§ §  § §We are a global provider of integrated professional services which enrich the physical and social environment for the communities in which we live and work. Our team of multidisciplinary specialists has more than 70 years’ experience in designing, developing and delivering sustainable projects and community advancement programs.§ §  § §Notice to recruitment agencies:§ Please note that Cardno does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or recruitment agencies.§ §  § §Cardno is committed to Safety and the Prevention of Sexual Abuse and Harassment (PSEAH), Child Protection and bribery prevention. We want to engage with the right people to deliver our client programs. As part of our approach you will be subjected to formal background screening, criminal record checks, employment verification, and periodic compliance checks. All Cardno staff receive safety, compliance and safeguards training and are responsible for contributing to a safer working culture.§§§§

jobTitle: Business Improvement Analyst Job in South West Coast VIC - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50624632.txt	§Business Improvement Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Improvement Analyst§§Advertiser: §genU§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§South West Coast VIC§§Salary§§Increase your take home pay with Salary Packaging§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §genU, formerly Karingal St Laurence is a progressive organisation that is committed to building inclusive communities and helping people realise their dreams. With over 3000 staff across 200 national locations, a strong history of committed leadership and values driving growth, we invite you to bring your professional skills and passion to our motivated team.§    §      §        §Business Improvement Analyst §        §Hey You!§          §genU is short for Generation You. Because whatever generation you belong to, whether you’re young, old, or somewhere in between, what unites us is the belief that neither disability nor ageing are disadvantages to be endured but challenges to be met boldly, achievements to be had and adventures in the making.§          §genU has been 60 years in the making. Bringing together the best of two trusted and respected organisations, Karingal and St Laurence, genU builds on this experience, adding a new ambition: to become the leader in what we do.§          §With over 3000 staff across 200 national locations, a strong history of committed leadership and values driving growth, we invite you to bring your professional skills and passion to our motivated team§          § §About the role§          §We are seeking a Business Improvement Analyst to help implement the genU business improvement strategy, identify business improvement projects and ingrain continuous improvement culture across the wider genU business. Working alongside the Business Improvement & Quality Group Manager, you will be delivering continuous improvement outcomes and training with a focus on client experience, safety, quality and cost.§          §Combining your technical knowledge and application of lean tools with an ability to impart this knowledge, influence, coach and train staff throughout the business. You will deliver business improvement projects and initiatives. §This role will be instrumental in supporting the Business Improvement & Quality Group Manager to:§          §            §Embed lean methodology across genU and build organisational capability in BI processes§            §Lead business improvement projects and strategic initiatives§            §Identification and realisation of improvements across the business§            §Coach, support and empower staff to develop a culture of continuous improvement across the genU business§            §Facilitate and provide specialist process improvement advice to business units via targeted workshops to identify and resolve specific issues that are critically impacting business outcomes and require resolution§            §Gather and document business requirements across various projects throughout the business§          § This is a full time role, based in Geelong.§About You§          §Now that you know a bit about us & the role – let us tell you why you will be the right person for it! jobTitle: Manager - Change Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50682898.txt	§Manager - Change§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Change§§Advertiser: §Deep Blue Company Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§ABOUT US§ §Deep Blue Company is a fast-growing business delivering innovative, digital and high volume solutions to the Australian retail property market. With a focus on connecting people, systems and data across the building inspection, pre-sale and conveyancing processes through to settlement, the Deep Blue Group of companies is changing the Australian retail property market. § §ABOUT THE TEAM§ §The Legal Services team is the engine room of Deep Blue Company. Providing scalable, quality conveyancing advice, support and services to buyers and sellers across the retail residential property market, the Legal Services Business Unit works across all Australian jurisdictions and includes a large team of operational specialists in our Philippines locations.  § §ABOUT THE ROLE§ §Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, you will be an integral member of the projects, operations and technology leadership teams. You will be exposed to a diverse delivery team and work with them to develop, implement and embed effective change management solutions.  Your primary accountabilities will include:§ § §Application of a structured change management methodology to deliver effective and efficient change for key strategic projects and initiatives§ §Partnering and collaborating with stakeholders to understand the need for change and plan and implement appropriate change strategy§ §Development and implementation of communications and training materials across various mediums partnering with the Learning team§ §Supporting, coaching and enabling change leadership and change advocacy through engagement activities across stakeholder groups§ §Facilitating change activities through to BAU - ensuring successful embedding§ §Utilising data and analytics to inform decisions and approaches§ §Identifying and managing change management risks and issues.§ §ABOUT YOU§ §You thrive in a fast paced and ever evolving environment.  You are know for your delivery of impactful and practical solutions that support high volumes of people, systems and process change.  You bring with you:§ § §Deep expertise in change management in an operational environment. § §Demonstrated experience as a change practitioner leading and implementing change§ §Strong stakeholder management skills§ §Strong technology skills§ §Passion for delivering an outstanding experience for employees and customers§ §Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think outside the box§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to engage and manage diverse stakeholder groups§ §Highly valued: Formal change management certification or accreditation§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have with change management?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Strategic Insights Consultant Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50658295.txt	§Strategic Insights Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Insights Consultant§§Advertiser: §RMIT Online§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$80,000 - $90,000 + 9.5% Super + Benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§Who is RMIT Online?§We provide world-class digital learning experiences leaning into the future of work. We are a passionate and nimble team dedicated to creating a 'community of lifelong learners, successfully navigating the world of work.'§  §Teaming up with industry thought leaders and experts, we strive to deliver the best in structured, flexible online education using the latest digital tools and technologies. And we have a bit of fun along the way.§  §Let’s talk about you§  §Analytical, resourceful, collaborative, creative, strong on communication, ability to balance multiple priorities – just a few ways your previous managers would describe you. You find comfort in ambiguity and rapidly changing environments – this is where you thrive.§  §With experience in a role that has required significant research, data analysis and reporting – ideally within management consulting or a fast-moving start-up, you’re someone who loves to roll up their sleeves. You’re a wizard at designing and building dashboards and reports, and this is complemented by your strong analytical and creative problem-solving ability.§  §Drawing on your strong commercial acumen, you think about growth from a commercial and customer experience perspective. You love complex and diverse data sets and have an innate ability to generate the 'so what' out of analysis and communicate this in a compelling way. You’re highly resourceful, can identify what data points are required and source them with ease.§  §Naturally, you have strong communication and interpersonal skills with proven ability working with diverse stakeholders. This is supported by your incredible ability to build relationships and always knowing the right questions to ask next.§  §You’ll need solid spreadsheet modelling skills and experience using relevant visualisation software such as Tableau and Power BI. Bonus points for a sense of humour, grace under pressure and a love of digital tech§  §Sounds great! Tell me about the role?§  §RMIT Online has experienced rapid growth since we were founded in 2016. As we navigate our next stage of growth and maturity we require increasingly sophisticated approaches to generating the insights required to make fundamental business decisions and measure our performance.§  §It is vital for RMIT Online to have someone great at business intelligence, benchmarking, and insight generation to support fundamental decisions that will support our future growth.§  §As an integral part of the Strategy team, you’ll be responsible for generating and reporting on sophisticated insights to internal partners across our business. This will involve working with internal stakeholders on problem definition, identifying and sourcing the range of data required to generate insights, cutting that data in interesting ways and clearly communicating new insights and ‘so whats’ in a clear and compelling manner. Defining repeatable processes for generating and reporting on insights, including through dashboards and reports, will be a big part of the role.§  §As a partner with key stakeholders across the business, you’ll provide insights that address a wide range of problems. These are likely to include competitor and exemplar research to inform enhancements to our student experience, data to inform our product roadmap, market intelligence to inform strategic growth decisions, and deep insights on target customers and partners.§  §Ambiguity is very common, so you’ll need to feel comfortable working at a rapid pace and being able to adapt to change quickly when things pivot.§  §What’s a week in the life of this role?§  §You’ll be meeting with leaders from our different teams to identify project priorities, conducting desktop research on exemplar online education institutions from across the globe, compiling data requests from external entities, wrangling some data and generating cool charts, reports and dashboards, iterating your work with the Strategy team, attending meetings and presentations with our partners across the business to communicate insights and make recommendations.§  §This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to continue building out their strategy toolkit, or who wants a career in business analysis or intelligence.§  §Ticking your boxes? Here's how to apply:§  §Send us your resume and §a brief cover letter§ telling us about:§ § §A time when you generated insights that were used to make fundamental business decisions that resulted in high performing outcomes?§ §What excites you about RMIT Online§ §Need more convincing?§  §This is a unique opportunity to build something really big, to disrupt an industry and do it with purpose, helping lifelong learners, and put your name on it.§What’s more, is you’ll be surrounded by a buzzing team of high achievers who are passionate and friendly. We pride ourselves on being a respectful, diverse and inclusive community of fun and intelligent people.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50711139.txt	§People Systems Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People Systems Analyst§§Advertiser: §Lion - Dairy & Drinks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced People Systems Analyst to join our People Systems team.§ § Based in Docklands, this role is to act as a key point of contact for SuccessFactors continuous improvement initiatives as well as a point of escalation for systems issues, troubleshooting issues and seeking out long term resolutions.§ § We are looking for a talented SuccessFactors & SAP guru, that also can engage stakeholders strategically, provide recommendations and thought leadership around best practice functionality and ensure its successfully implemented.§ § Key accountabilities of the role will include:§ §Implement roadmap of changes across SuccessFactors including testing and troubleshooting.§Discuss and plan a roadmap of change with key business stakeholders to ensure SuccessFactors is fully utilised to support business strategies.§Manage the implementation of improvement initiatives (e.g. configuration updates, testing, troubleshooting, feedback, and documentation).§Provide system change signoff through an agreed governance process for regular packaged changes as well as for break fixes.§Manage the SuccessFactors upgrade process along with ensuring configuration changes are made within the team.§Liaison with Platinum support teams - raising systems issues through to solution implementation and issue closed.§Manage BAU activities including template creation, launching forms, managing system permissions, email templates and notifications across the modules, and supporting and providing guidance with operations of SuccessFactors Learning.§Manage escalated helpdesk queries within agreed SLAs or as agreed with stakeholders if outside SLA.§Identify issue trends and lead a long-term resolution process with process/system owners.§Ensure accurate and complete documentation of processes is maintained.§An element of this role will be an in-depth understanding of SuccessFactors including performing system build, configuration, and maintenance.§ §To enable our people to work in ways that support their lifestyle, LionFlex drives agility and innovation to help us deliver on business goals. Our people have the freedom to choose where, when, or how they achieve and deliver outcomes, with the support of their leaders and peers.§ § We believe our people have it in them to achieve something outstanding. By challenging ourselves to make a difference, we make our experience at Lion Dairy & Drinks the best it can be.§ §§§§
