We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Planning Officers!  §§        §          §Exciting opportunity to be part of a team collaborating with councils, industry and community to create great places and public spaces  §          §A range of temporary, permanent positions and talent pool opportunities available§          §All positions located in Sydney§        §        §About the roles§Our Place, Design and Public Spaces (PDPS) team are looking for a range of planning officers to provide advice and support to key stakeholders within the business.§        §The PDPS team designs, creates and improves places for people to live, work, learn, play and be healthy.§        §It's a truly exciting time to join the Department. We're backing the state's post-pandemic recovery with world-class reforms and initiatives to keep people in jobs, the economy moving and build a public space legacy for generations to come.§        §Take a further look at our opportunities and the salaries we have available below§        §          §Planning Officers PO1A§ – Salary starting from $73,167 + super§          §Planning Officers PO1B§ – Salary starting from  $99,102 + super§        §        §Are you ready to seize the opportunity, make positive change and help us create better places and communities? §About you§To be successful in our roles, you will have a degree and/ or equivalent experience in planning. You will also have a general understanding of policies and practices related to the NSW planning system.§        §Above all you will bring fresh energy and ideas, you will be kind to yourself and others, and you will be skilled in communicating and building strong relationships with people.§        §You will also be a team player and a problem solver, proactive and cool-headed, focused on solutions, and ready to tackle the big issues with a sense of urgency and purpose.§About Us §Place, Design and Public Spaces is part of the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE). Together we create thriving environments, communities and economies, and we’re focused on creating a strong and liveable NSW. We have an amazing story to tell, and we want your story to be part of it. You’ll get all the support you need to feel valued and to perform at your best.§        §We are committed to equal employment opportunity and embrace diversity and inclusion within our workforce. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§        §We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with disability as we seek to shape a future for NSW that is truly reflective of our communities. We will provide support and reasonable adjustments in our recruitment process and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.§How to apply§Applicants must address their suitability for the role by supplying an updated copy of their resume as well as a cover letter (no more than 1 – 2 pages) outlining your relevant skills and experience.  §        §Please note;§ as part of the application process you will also be asked if you are interested in the PO1A or PO1B vacancies.§        §Applications Close:§ 11:55pm Sunday 25 October 2020§        §Should you require any further information about the role please contact Jess Walker, Talent Acquisition Specialist via §jess.walker@dpie.nsw.gov.au§  §§Good to know§A Recruitment Pool may be established for future roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from Planning and Environment Cluster and other NSW Public Sector agencies over an 18-month period.  §§Our commitment to diversity and flexibility:§The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and those with disability.§        §We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.§      §    §  §§§Are you passionate about creating great places and public spaces for the people and communities of NSW? We will provide support and reasonable adjustments in our recruitment process and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.§How to apply§Applicants must address their suitability for the role by supplying an updated copy of their resume as well as a cover letter (no more than 1 – 2 pages) outlining your relevant skills and experience.  §Please note;§ as part of the application process you will also be asked if you are interested in the PO1A or PO1B vacancies.§§Applications Close:§ 11:55pm Sunday 25 October 2020§Should you require any further information about the role please contact Jess Walker, Talent Acquisition Specialist via §jess.walker@dpie.nsw.gov.au§  §§Good to know§A Recruitment Pool may be established for future roles with similar focus capabilities. jobTitle: Strategy Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50621782.txt	§Strategy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategy Manager§§Advertiser: §Derwent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Company§Our client is Australia and New Zealand’s market leading pipeline renewal contractor employing over 550 employees with offices or depots in Sydney, Canberra, Charmhaven Melbourne, Bendigo, Brisbane, Caboolture, Townsville, Adelaide, Perth and Auckland. §Role§This role is primarily focused on their continued corporate development, growth and the implementation of its business strategy.§The Corporate Development Manager will assist in the execution of the strategic objectives of the Company including:§The identified actions from the Group’s 5 Year Strategic Plan. The Plan is an evolving and dynamic document updated on a six-monthly basis.§Providing support to other strategic projects which develop in the ordinary course of business.§Reacting to opportunities outside of the Strategic Plan as they arise.§As well as delivering outcomes, the role will involve collaboration with stakeholders from various business units and related third parties to provide comprehensive business and market related intelligence to assist with strategic planning and decision making.§The role will also be responsible for conducting comprehensive research, investigation and analysis of market and industry trends including the identification of new market and product opportunities as well as supporting of the major objectives noted above.§Candidate Experience§We are seeking candidates who have over 5 years’ experience in related industry (consultancy or corporate roles) focussed on corporate development, strategy, project management or corporate finance.§Ideally some experience in or exposure to a fast-growing medium to large, technically developed, service-oriented organisations would be well regarded.§You will have:§Strong analytical and project management experience.§Time management skills and the ability to set and negotiate priorities.§Exceptional problem-solving ability.§Strong research and analysis capability.§Ability to think logically and creatively.§Strong report writing and presentation skills.§The ability to conduct cost/benefit and related commercial analysis.§Business case development.§Modelling techniques and methods: §Capable of performing detailed financial analysis including advanced financial modelling, profitability analysis, return on investment, discounted cash flow analysis, monitoring business issues and impact to bottom line.§High level of IT proficiency, computer literacy, data management, MS Office Suite.§Analytical and agile thinker with an ability to develop logical and creative approaches to different scenarios.§Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.§Focused, determined, energetic, confident and receptive.§Able to work with ambiguity and across business unit structures in a “virtual” or project team environment.§Outcome driven and objective focussed.§Collaborative and team oriented.§Degree qualified in related discipline a must§ §Our Industrial Partner Helen Hall is leading this search, however given the volume of interest we are unable to field calls and enquiries on this role. If you match the experience we are looking for, please apply through this ad.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Associate Director - Operations Advisory (Mining) Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50678100.txt	§Associate Director - Operations Advisory (Mining)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Director - Operations Advisory (Mining)§§Advertiser: §KPMG Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Business improvement, strategy, innovation§§Mining sector focussed leadership role with national coverage§§Career advancement opportunities§§KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, and drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.§KPMG’s Operations Advisory group works with clients to identify opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their operations and to successfully execute against their objectives. The team draws on a combination of professional talented people, powerful KPMG methodologies, and global resources. As the practice continues to grow, we are looking for a high calibre Operational leader to join the Perth team on a permanent basis. The position will drive business development and lead client engagements in the mining sector principally in Perth, but also supporting opportunities nationally and globally.§Your Opportunity§This is an excellent opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry whilst undertaking significant projects that solve critical operational problems at some of the nation's most respected companies. Joining our team as an Associate Director you will support KPMG and its clients by:§§Developing compelling and differentiated value propositions in opportunity pursuits§Bringing relevant experience to the role. Highly valued experience would include operational leadership in the mining sector, experience in mine planning processes, problem solving, analysing complex data sets, developing and implementing performance metrics, innovation and evaluating and implementing new technologies such as autonomous haul systems§Leading engagements with clients to deliver high quality outcomes through deep analysis, framing potential solutions, articulating business benefits and diligent program management.§Partnering with clients to solve and implement solutions to address complex challenges across their business (both on site and in the corporate office).§Facilitating workshops and synthesising and presenting insights and recommendations enabled by strategic thinking, technical knowledge and exceptional communication skills.§Leading in the delivery of KPMG service offerings§Bringing passion and deep expertise that positions you as being an inspirational role model and leader within the Operations Advisory team.§Supporting a high-performance culture to consistently deliver quality outcomes for clients and great growth opportunities for junior colleagues.§Focusing on business development through maintaining strong relationships with clients during and post engagements and through building strong professional networks§Supporting the growth and development of more junior team members through technical training, skills coaching and mentoring.§§How are you Extraordinary?§At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.§To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include: §§Proven experience in leading operational teams, solving complex problems and identifying and implementing improvement opportunities within a mining environment.§Strong written and verbal communication particularly when communicating on an engagement to a wide range of stakeholders up to C-Level.§Ability to manage all aspects of a project and lead large teams (10+ resources) or streams of work as part of a larger engagement.§Possess confidence to lead and drive business development.§Experience in long to medium term mine planning and / or a mine engineering background would be valued highly as would experience in deploying and improving autonomous haulage systems.§§The KPMG Difference§At KPMG, we’re passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity. We believe that everyone’s unique experiences enable us to deliver meaningful benefits for our people, our clients and communities. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, ages, religions, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, LGBTIQ+ people, those with a disability, women and people with a cultural or linguistically diverse background.§We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life.§KPMG has a decade-long, proud commitment to Indigenous Australia, as demonstrated by the achievement of an Elevate level Reconciliation Action Plan. KPMG is a foundation member and Principal Partner of Pride in Diversity started in Australia by ACON and the Diversity Council of Australia, and is recognised in the Australian Workplace Equality Index(AWEI) which evaluates LGBTIQ+ inclusiveness in the workplace. KPMG Australia has been consistently recognised as an Employer of Choice in the Australian Government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) annual index.§Flexibility empowers wellbeing § [link removed]§Flexibility enables contribution to the community§ [link removed]§Flexibility inspires technology§ [link removed]§ & innovation§§Flexibility§ [link removed]§ supports family§§Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!§ §§§§

jobTitle: Senior Consultant - A&AI Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50690516.txt	§Senior Consultant - A&AI§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant - A&AI§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§NA§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Consultant - A&AI §      §        § §        §          §Implement cutting edge Analytics & AI technology in real world environments§          §Work with clients in Australia and APAC to transform analytics and cognitive capabilities§          §World-class learning and leadership programs§        §        §Do you want to work on the front-line of Analytics & AI? If you love working in diverse teams to solve complex business problems using data and analytics, we need you!§ § §About the team§ § Deloitte’s Analytics & AI practice is a diverse team comprised of experts across strategy, insight advisory, data engineering, data science and automation. We have a dedicated focus on solving business problems for our clients. Our services range from helping clients understand the potential of Analytics & AI through to designing and implementing solutions. We constantly evaluate new technologies, experiment with new techniques and create leading-edge data and analytics assets that can be used by our clients and practitioners to drive success with Analytics & AI.§ § You will be part of a close, collaborative team that identifies and builds solutions that are practical as well as visionary, and that make an impact that matters.§ § §What will your typical day look like?§ § As a Senior Consultant, you will typically be responsible for leading a workstream on a large client project. You will need a range of skills from interviewing client stakeholders, capturing business problem statements, leading workshops, designing and implementing technology, and presenting results to clients and your team. As you grow, you will take up more senior level responsibilities in architecture, design and coaching junior team members on delivery.§ § At Deloitte, we give our Analytics & AI consultants the resources, training, tools and expert support that they need to excel at their work, but also the freedom and power to create their own paths forward to make a difference.§ § You will be challenged to solve real-life business problems that haven’t been seen before in diverse industries like Financial Services, Banking and Insurance, Retail, Life Sciences & Healthcare and Consumer Products. You will rely on a variety of analytics techniques (e.g. data engineering, machine learning), programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Julia, SQL) and real-world delivery experience to meet these challenges head-on. You will continuously be supported by senior leaders across the practice on projects and throughout your career growth at Deloitte.§ § §Enough about us, let’s talk about you.§ § You are someone who:§ §        §          §At least 4 years’ experience data engineering, feature engineering and/or model development using advanced statistical and machine learning techniques§          §Excellent knowledge of statistical techniques like Linear and Non-linear Regression, Generalized Models, Clustering, forecasting methods, etc.§          §Demonstrable experience of one or more relevant programming languages e.g. Python, R, Julia§          §Experience of different project life cycles and delivery methodologies (waterfall, scrum, agile)§          §Experience with cloud services (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Platform)§          §Demonstrable experience working in a consulting environment or managing non-technical stakeholders§          §Bachelor or MS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar quantitative disciplines.§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § § §Next Steps§ § Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now!§ § If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Vish Wadhwani from the Talent Acquisition§ § §By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients and candidates with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally.§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Implement cutting edge Analytics & AI technology in real world environments§Work with clients in Australia and APAC to transform analytics and cognitive capabilities§World-class learning and leadership programs§Do you want to work on the front-line of Analytics & AI? We have a dedicated focus on solving business problems for our clients. Our services range from helping clients understand the potential of Analytics & AI through to designing and implementing solutions. We constantly evaluate new technologies, experiment with new techniques and create leading-edge data and analytics assets that can be used by our clients and practitioners to drive success with Analytics & AI.§ § You will be part of a close, collaborative team that identifies and builds solutions that are practical as well as visionary, and that make an impact that matters.§ § §What will your typical day look like?§ § As a Senior Consultant, you will typically be responsible for leading a workstream on a large client project. Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Senior Consultant – Asset Management § §Assetivity is a growing consulting and training organisation specialising in physical asset management, maintenance, and reliability, looking for a passionate and driven problem-solver!! § §We are looking to engage a keen, motivated individual who is looking to "make a difference" in developing and implementing improved Asset Management practices and processes at one of our clients in the Northern Territory.  Initially this will be a full-time contract position, located in Darwin.  There may be opportunity at the end of this contract to either extend the contract term, or transition to a full-time, permanent consulting position with Assetivity. § §This role will give you the opportunity to make a valued contribution to improving the working lives and operational success of this large and influential client. § §Apply today to be part of our awesome team! § §This full-time position, initially for a 6 month period, and with the potential to extend  will provide you with the opportunity to:  § § § §utilise your consulting and influencing skills § § § §apply your knowledge of good practice Asset Management and ISO 55000 § § § §work alongside talented and recognised Asset Management leaders § § § §influence, coach and train client staff § § § §make a valued contribution to the operational success of this large and influential client § § §Should you transition to a full-time permanent position with us, there would also be an opportunity for you to grow with us by: § § § §progressively assuming greater responsibility for client and assignment management § § § §helping us to find and win new work, and  § § § §refine and improve our consulting methodologies. § § §Your Qualifications and Experience  § §Successful candidates will need to be resident in Darwin and have:  § § § §more than five years’ experience in applying good practice Asset Management practices in an appropriate industry sector, such as facilities management, healthcare, government, mining or transport § § § §demonstrated ability to implement sustainable change §previous senior management experience § § § §Previous consulting experience § § §Duties of the role § §This contract role is a hands-on role involving: § § § §Developing Strategic Asset Management quality expectations § § § § §This role will be primarily located in Darwin but occasional travel to other locations within the Northern Territory will most likely be required. § § § §About Us  § It also means that you will be amazed at the career development opportunities on offer to you.§The role§This exciting role requires a creative and energetic individual to support our budding strategic leadership team in NSW who are focused on social outcomes, regenerative design and external client engagement. jobTitle: Graduate Analyst Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50604086.txt	§Graduate Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate Analyst§§Advertiser: §Novigi Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Who we are§At Novigi, data and interoperability are at the core of what we do. We believe that by leveraging the vast troves of data that they now have access to, and by ensuring that all their systems are interoperable, the modern organisation can dramatically improve their products and services offerings, and unlock tangible benefits in efficiency, risk management and innovation.§What You’ll Do§You will work as part of a team that is responsible for investigating and analysing business and technology systems and processes at a diverse range of organisations. As part of this team, you will:§Engage in an ongoing cycle of research and development, staying abreast of cutting edge developments in data and interoperability, and their applications at the enterprise level.§Produce clear and detailed notes and documentation, and communicate your findings to your colleagues.§Work directly with clients, and be involved in the creation of reports, technical documentation and other artefacts that will be delivered to these clients.§Implement technology solutions focused around data and interoperability.§Some specific examples of the types of work you may be involved in include:§Current state analysis, research and development for an enterprise technology strategy document.§The creation of a detailed technical report providing future state architectural recommendations to a client.§Data analysis, mapping, modelling and producing associated documentation.§Implementation of a machine learning model using appropriate technologies.§Creation of a spreadsheet calculation model.§Development of interactive business intelligence reports.§Who You’ll Work With§You will work as part of Novigi’s Analyst Squad and report to the Analyst Squad Lead. You will participate in the provision of both advisory and technical services to our clients in the financial services and aged care sectors.§Analysts will typically work closely with the Advisory Services team and the Technical Services team. The Advisory Services team provides consulting services to Novigi’s clients, and is instrumental in framing the problem statement with our clients, and specifying tailored technical solutions. The Technical Services team is responsible for the implementation and delivery of technology solutions, primarily in data and interoperability.§About You§Novigi is currently looking to recruit 2 graduate-level analysts, starting on a casual basis with an aim towards full-time employment.§The following disciplines are preferred but applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply:§Computer and information science, software engineering§Data science, statistics, actuarial science§Mathematics and Engineering (all disciplines)§Science (physics, chemistry)§Commerce (economics, finance)§You have a basic understanding of programming or are willing to learn. The following languages are preferred, but not required:§SQL (MSSQL, MySQL)§Python§R§You have an interest in data driven problem solving, including:§Problem identification and definition§Inductive reasoning§Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning§Data analysis§You have a strong understanding of technology. Knowledge in the following areas is a plus:§Database design§Cloud infrastructure§Solution architecture§APIs§Soft skills will also include:§Working independently as needed, but also as part of a team and helping others to solve problems.§Knowing when to ask for help, and when to try solving problems yourself.§Expressing complex technical concepts in business terms and in written form.§Committed to personal and professional development.§Having a professional attitude towards work.§Enjoy the process of solving challenging problems, acquiring new skills and methodologies to address them.§Able to work flexibly, working on multiple projects with changing priorities.§Work Arrangements§We’re looking for the graduate analysts to work 3 days a week, with flexible hours possible under a casual arrangement. Work location is also flexible, but preferred if able to work at the Novigi Melbourne office once COVID restrictions have been lifted.§Diverse candidates are encouraged!§ If you don’t meet every criteria in this list, but think you’d be great for the role, please don’t hesitate to apply.§Address applications to:§Raymond Lam, PhD§Senior Analyst and Analyst Squad Lead§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Economic & Social Advisory - Student Internship Program 2021 Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50607189.txt	§Economic & Social Advisory - Student Internship Program 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economic & Social Advisory - Student Internship Program 2021§§Advertiser: §Urbis Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§Urbis is a market-leading firm that shapes the cities and communities of Australia for a better future. Drawing together a network of the brightest minds, Urbis consists of practice experts, working collaboratively to deliver fresh thinking and independent advice and guidance. Working across the areas of planning, design, policy, heritage, valuations, transactions, economics and research, the expert team at Urbis connect their clients in the public and private sectors to a better outcome, every time.§§National Student Internship Program 2021§Our National Student Internship Program offers exclusive opportunities for the brightest students to gain invaluable experience and broad exposure to our business and related industries. As part of our program, you will learn from mentors, work with our clients, access our learning resources and have exposure to fantastic networking opportunities.§Our annual program will run from February to December 2021 and will enable you to graduate with the distinct advantage of industry experience over your peers. Our student roles offer flexibility in the form of 2-4 days per week, to complement your studies.§What about this opportunity?§Our Economics & Social Advisory team has an opening for a student in our Sydney office on a paid casual basis. We are looking for either a student with a public policy research background or a student with an economics background. You will have the opportunity to be involved in research, report generation and administration across both our public policy and economic advisory projects, utilising a range of relevant research tools, to assist in delivering consulting services to clients.§As a Research Assistant (Public Policy) or Assistant Research Analyst (Economics), you can expect to be involved in:§Supporting team members in research tasks, servicing client requirements, including data and report preparation.§Providing input into the compilation and presentation of evidence-based research to support economic & social impact assessment, cost-benefit analysis, and Input-Output modelling (only if Economics student)§Supporting the design, development and testing of surveys and research instruments (only if Public Policy student)§Undertaking straightforward analysis of qualitative and quantitative data.§About You§You will be an undergraduate or post-graduate student undertaking studies in a relevant public policy, social science or economics degree, who is passionate about city shaping, has great communication skills and an interest in working in a professional services / consulting environment. Successful candidates will have a strong academic record and possess a combination of the following technical skills and attributes:§Strong writing and conceptual capabilities, with the ability to develop well-reasoned and logical arguments;§Demonstrates developing skills in specific qualitative, quantitative, economic research and modelling techniques (Economic student only); and/or,§Demonstrates developing ability to undertake desktop research including literature reviews and to clearly analyse and synthesise findings (Public Policy student only); and,§Strong attention to detail and accuracy.§The Application Process§If you’re interest in joining our Student Internship Program, click on ‘Apply’ and submit your application. For your application to be considered, we require your CV, a copy of your most recent academic transcripts and a cover letter (one page maximum) addressing the following questions:§Why do you want to be a cityshaper at Urbis?§What has motivated you to pursue a career in your selected discipline?§Which Urbis project (past or present) would you like to be part of, and why?§ §Note: your chosen project should be relevant to the practice area/discipline you are applying for.§Our Economic & Social Advisory team are looking for candidates with either Public Policy or Economic skills, although also welcome applications from candidates with experience in both areas.§Applications close at 11:00pm on Sunday 11 October 2020. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted, with interviews expected to be in mid/late October 2020.§Urbis is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive, supports flexibility, and welcomes diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. To find out more about us visit our website at https://urbis.com.au/.§Eligibility§You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident and studying throughout the duration of the internship to be eligible for the program. Preference will be given to those in their final or second last year of their degree, but we encourage applications from those earlier in their degrees also.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50641948.txt	§Management Consultant - Financial Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Management Consultant - Financial Services§§Advertiser: §Blenheim Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Blenheim Partners is an international Executive Search and Board Advisory Firm. As a professional services company we are specialist advisors to many of the world's leading corporations. As a result of company growth and market investment we have an opportunity for a motivated and experienced Management Consultant to join our Financial Services Practice.§ § § §Reporting to the Managing Partner, the potential candidate will have a track record as a Management Consultant delivering transformation programmes to leading financial services organisations in Australia. This opportunity will appeal to those with a background as a Management Consultant in financial services with a previous track record as an executive in the Banking and Financial Services sector. As a business consultant you will be accustomed to delivering on-time and on-budget consulting projects and will have experience of developing strategy and implementing change agendas, creating value and maximising growth that delivers sustainable and tangible results in the complex sector of financial services.§ § § §It is anticipated the successful candidate will have over 5 years’ experience working in financial services or as a management/business consultant covering financial services with exposure and knowledge across the broad remit of banking that may include institutional, corporate banking, retail banking and wealth management. You will ideally have international banking/consulting experience and a demonstrable track record of developing client relationships that has converted to sustainable revenue generation.  § § § §The successful candidate will be results oriented, customer focused, delivering on-time and on-budget projects to deliver enhanced efficiencies to our clients and be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. You will be a problem solver, able to understand organisational structures with high intellect and ambiguity tolerance, possessing strategic and commercial acumen. You will have the ability to engage and partner with senior level decision makers and bring a commitment to excellence, belief in team values and esprit de corps.§ § § §Responsibilities include:§ § §Playing a representative role as a trusted advisor and partner within the banking and financial services sector;§ §Developing strong client relationships and ensuring presentation of business cases with strategic advice are of utmost quality and reassurance; § §Analysing and evaluating client objectives and Management structures to achieve optimal commercial outcomes;§ §Presenting alterative ideas to clients to stimulate review of current organisational decision making processes to enhance efficiency and transformational goals;§ §Developing project plans with key deliverables that aim to provide efficiencies and support to corporate and growth agendas of our clients;§ §Managing client deliverables and expectations, including drafting client proposals and overseeing the end to end execution of the engagement deliverables; and,§ §Preparing written reports relating to business development opportunities based on previous successful outcomes.§ § § §It is anticipated you will possess an appropriate tertiary qualification with a degree in business, economics, engineering, science or a related field. Postgraduate business qualification would be highly regarded.§ § § §For further information please email your enquiries to (§employment@blenheimpartners.com§).§§§§

jobTitle: Improvement Specialist Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50620780.txt	§Improvement Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Improvement Specialist§§Advertiser: §Co-operative Bulk Handling Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Improvement Specialist §      §        §Company description:§ §        §The CBH Group is Australia’s largest co-operative and a leader in the Australian grain industry, with operations which extend along the value chain and include grain storage, handling, transport, marketing and processing. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing a safe and rewarding working environment for our people, with a strong culture of developing and enhancing our employees’ capabilities. We invite you to become part of a dynamic, diverse organisation with a bright future.§        §Job description:§ §        §We currently have an exciting opportunity for a highly experienced, hands-on Improvement Specialist to join our Improvement team on a full-time permanent basis. §        § §        §Our Improvement Specialist will be driven and passionate to doing better and making an impact in a dynamic environment.§        § §        §This role will work collaboratively with key stakeholders across metro and regional locations, while applying data analysis and problem-solving skills to identify opportunities for improvements across our supply chain and lead initiatives to convert ideas into tangible results. In addition to building and improving management systems that will to ensure that the improvements are sustainable long-term.§        § §        § §        §Key responsibilities include§        §          §Coach individual department leaders in the application of business improvement methods and Lean Principles to solve business problems.§          §Engage with appropriate stakeholders to understand requirements and constraints and build understanding and commitment to optimised operating protocols.§          §Ensure operating systems enable optimal site turnaround time during harvest periods.§          §Identify process improvement across the supply chain and drive business performance through development, coordination and implementation of management systems that drive business performance.§          §Demonstrate a clear problem-solving methodology through the application of structured root cause analysis systems, analysing data or processes, performing gap analysis and making well-judged decisions to implement sustainable solutions through Continuous Improvement.§        §        § §        §Skills and experience§        §          §Minimum 3 years’ experience working with a lean manufacturing or supply chain optimisation or industrial process management with key responsibilities related to process improvement and efficiency.§          §Up to 8 years relevant experience with a high level of technical knowledge.§          §Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline is desirable.§          §Demonstrated ability to influence others, sometimes against pre-held views.§          §Critical thinker who can assess and solve complex problems.§          §Sound knowledge of operating and exposure to management operating systems.§          §Able to effectively plan and manage multiple priorities and activities in line with time and budget commitments.§          §Exceptional communication skills and the ability to create buy-in and engagement from diverse stakeholder groups.§          §Competent in financial and operating analysis and interpreting common financial and operations reports. §        §        § §        §The benefits of working for CBH§        §CBH supports diversity and encourages applications from people of all backgrounds to be a part of a friendly and inclusive work environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing a safe and rewarding working environment for our people, with a strong culture of developing and enhancing our employees’ capabilities. We invite you to become part of a dynamic, diverse organisation with a bright future.§  §Job description:§ §  §We currently have an exciting opportunity for a highly experienced, hands-on Improvement Specialist to join our Improvement team on a full-time permanent basis. §  § §  §Our Improvement Specialist will be driven and passionate to doing better and making an impact in a dynamic environment.§  § §  §This role will work collaboratively with key stakeholders across metro and regional locations, while applying data analysis and problem-solving skills to identify opportunities for improvements across our supply chain and lead initiatives to convert ideas into tangible results. In addition to building and improving management systems that will to ensure that the improvements are sustainable long-term.§  § §  § §  §Key responsibilities include§ § §Coach individual department leaders in the application of business improvement methods and Lean Principles to solve business problems.§ §Engage with appropriate stakeholders to understand requirements and constraints and build understanding and commitment to optimised operating protocols.§ §Ensure operating systems enable optimal site turnaround time during harvest periods.§ §Identify process improvement across the supply chain and drive business performance through development, coordination and implementation of management systems that drive business performance.§ §Demonstrate a clear problem-solving methodology through the application of structured root cause analysis systems, analysing data or processes, performing gap analysis and making well-judged decisions to implement sustainable solutions through Continuous Improvement.§ § §  §Skills and experience§ § §Minimum 3 years’ experience working with a lean manufacturing or supply chain optimisation or industrial process management with key responsibilities related to process improvement and efficiency.§ §Up to 8 years relevant experience with a high level of technical knowledge.§ §Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline is desirable.§ §Demonstrated ability to influence others, sometimes against pre-held views.§ §Critical thinker who can assess and solve complex problems.§ §Sound knowledge of operating and exposure to management operating systems.§ §Able to effectively plan and manage multiple priorities and activities in line with time and budget commitments.§ §Exceptional communication skills and the ability to create buy-in and engagement from diverse stakeholder groups.§ §Competent in financial and operating analysis and interpreting common financial and operations reports. § § §  §The benefits of working for CBH§  §CBH supports diversity and encourages applications from people of all backgrounds to be a part of a jobTitle: Employment Policy Officer Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50710806.txt	§Employment Policy Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Policy Officer§§Advertiser: §Defence SA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Employment Policy Officer §      §        §Opportunity§        §An exciting opportunity, until 30 June 2021, for an experienced policy professional to develop policy recommendations for workforce participation of former Australian Defence Force members in South Australia.§        §About Us§        §Veterans SA was established in 2008 to provide support to the veteran community. Veterans SA works closely with the Veterans’ Advisory Council to provide advice to the Premier on veterans’ matters.§        §Veterans SA provides services to promote veterans’ and their families well-being, collaborate with all ex-service organisations and provide a link for the veterans’ community directly to the highest levels of the South Australian Government.§        §Veterans SA is also responsible for promoting Australia’s wartime history and the significance of national events such as ANZAC Day, Remembrance Day and Vietnam Veterans Day.§        §Benefits§        §Veterans SA is a small and agile agency which provides employees with challenging and rewarding work and great opportunities for learning and development and flexibility.§        §Role Purpose/Context:§        §The Employment Policy Officer will work within the Veterans SA team. The Employment Policy Officer is accountable to the Director Veterans SA for the development of evidence-based policy recommendations relating to workforce participation of current and ex-serving Australian Defence Force (ADF) members and their partners.  The primary purpose of the role is to conduct a gap analysis relating to skills and mapping pathways for employment relative to the qualifications and experiences of transitioning ADF members against the State infrastructure and growth sector strategy plans for the next decade.§        § §Key Selection Criteria:§        §          §Demonstrated ability in providing strategic advice on complex issues.§          §Demonstrated ability to pro-actively identify and engage with the appropriate stakeholders.§          §Ability to drive strategic change initiatives and recognise likely implications upon key stakeholders.§          §Demonstrated planning and organisational skills.§          §Demonstrated ability to manage multiple, concurrent projects within deadlines.§          §Demonstrated ability to adapt and problem solve within a fast-paced, dynamic environment.§          §Well-developed interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills with exceptional ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, exercise independent judgement and apply sound problem solving and decision-making skills.§          §Demonstrated ability to utilise confidentiality, diplomacy, discretion and to work with astuteness in a politically sensitive environment.§          §Ability to work independently under very broad direction to develop and implement innovative solutions to complex issues, identify performance outcomes, plan activities and set priorities.§        §        §Our Commitment to Diversity§        §The South Australian Government is committed to building a flexible, diverse and inclusive culture, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTIQ, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups.§        §Special Conditions§        §This is a contract / term vacancy up to 30 June 2021. The incumbent is required to enter into an annual performance agreement. Work outside of normal hours will be required and the position may require interstate travel involving overnight absences. §        §Essential Qualifications§        §Nil (Extensive experience in stakeholder consultation and policy development is required)§        §Enquiries§        §Contact: Catherine Walsh, Veterans SA§Phone:   §0421 866 191§Email:    DefenceSA.Enquiries@defencesa.com§        §Application requirements§        §All applications must be submitted online via § www.defencesa.com/careers§.§        §If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume, together with a Covering Letter (no more than two pages) outlining your skills and experience giving consideration to the key selection criteria and the experience and skills listed in the role description. Applicants must include the contact information of at least two referees with one being your immediate supervisor/manager and a completed “Pre-Employment Declaration in the SA Public Sector” form.§        §Applications Close:§25 October 2020, 11:45 PM§        §Flexibility Statement§        §The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.§        §Application Instructions§        §All applications must be submitted online via http://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/, citing Reference Number: 401939§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Opportunity§ §An exciting opportunity, until 30 June 2021, for an experienced policy professional to develop policy recommendations for workforce participation of former Australian Defence Force members in South Australia.§ §About Us§ §Veterans SA was established in 2008 to provide support to the veteran community. The incumbent is required to enter into an annual performance agreement. Work outside of normal hours will be required and the position may require interstate travel involving overnight absences. § §Essential Qualifications§ §Nil (Extensive experience in stakeholder consultation and policy development is required)§ §Enquiries§ §Contact: Catherine Walsh, Veterans SA§Phone:   §0421 866 191§Email:    DefenceSA.Enquiries@defencesa.com§ §Application requirements§ §All applications must be submitted online via § www.defencesa.com/careers§.§ §If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume, together with a Covering Letter (no more than two pages) outlining your skills and experience giving consideration to the key selection criteria and the experience and skills listed in the role description. location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50701069.txt	§Carbon and Energy Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Carbon and Energy Consultant§§Advertiser: §Pangolin Associates Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Carbon and Energy Consultant§Pangolin Associates Pty Ltd§About the role:§The role will be primarily technical in nature with some client liaison such as meetings and external communication.§The work will mainly focus on assisting clients with carbon and energy accounting, management and strategy development. Ensuring compliance with relevant standards and protocols is also a key aspect. It will have a degree of autonomy but the ability to work as part of a team is just as important.§Essential skills:§Bachelor level degree or higher in an appropriate discipline§Exposure to carbon accounting principles and protocols§Strong background in quantitative analytics§Ability to learn new methodologies quickly, be flexible, adaptable and keen to work in this expanding sector §Strong attention to detail  §Proficient in Microsoft Excel and familiar with Apple operating systems§Excellent spoken and written English communication skills including the ability to be build rapport with our valued client base.§Strong presentation skills§Commercial experience in a similar field§Additional information:§The position is based at our Sydney CBD office within easy walking distance of Wynyard and Town Hall Stations. Remote working from home is also encouraged and facilitated.§The right candidate will enjoy a role with exposure to diverse range of clients and sustainability engagements.§Some travel from time to time may be required such as interstate and regional Australia.§A competitive salary package will be negotiated based on experience, with opportunities for career progression.§About Us:§Pangolin Associates is an energy and carbon management consultancy that works with organisations Australia-wide and globally to increase efficiencies and reduce environmental impacts.§Pangolin’s core services include; greenhouse gas (GHG) assessments and verifications; compliance with programs such as the National Greenhouse and Energy Reporting Scheme (NGERS), the Climate Active Carbon Neutral Standard and the Emissions Reduction Fund (ERF) as well as energy audits. Pangolin also provides carbon offsetting services via the supply of carbon credits.§Pangolin’s scientific and engineering team assists clients with several climate change leadership initiatives. This includes Science Based Targets (SBTs), 100% renewables, Climate Risk, LCAs and the construction of environmental and energy management systems.§Pangolin Associates is proud to be the first in its sector to become certified carbon neutral under the Australian Government's voluntary scheme and a founding member of B Corp in Australia. §Visit: www.pangolinassociates.com.§To apply§Apply in writing with a CV, together with a letter covering the key selection criteria before 30 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for authoring and reviewing technical documentation?§§§

jobText: TXT/50598077.txt	§Graduate Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate Analyst§§Advertiser: §Novigi Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wollongong, Illawarra & South Coast§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Who we are§At Novigi, data and interoperability are at the core of what we do. We believe that by leveraging the vast troves of data that they now have access to, and by ensuring that all their systems are interoperable, the modern organisation can dramatically improve their products and services offerings, and unlock tangible benefits in efficiency, risk management and innovation.§What You’ll Do§You will work as part of a team that is responsible for investigating and analysing business and technology systems and processes at a diverse range of organisations. As part of this team, you will:§Engage in an ongoing cycle of research and development, staying abreast of cutting edge developments in data and interoperability, and their applications at the enterprise level.§Produce clear and detailed notes and documentation, and communicate your findings to your colleagues.§Work directly with clients, and be involved in the creation of reports, technical documentation and other artefacts that will be delivered to these clients.§Implement technology solutions focused around data and interoperability.§Some specific examples of the types of work you may be involved in include:§Current state analysis, research and development for an enterprise technology strategy document.§The creation of a detailed technical report providing future state architectural recommendations to a client.§Data analysis, mapping, modelling and producing associated documentation.§Implementation of a machine learning model using appropriate technologies.§Creation of a spreadsheet calculation model.§Development of interactive business intelligence reports.§Who You’ll Work With§You will work as part of Novigi’s Analyst Squad and report to the Analyst Squad Lead. You will participate in the provision of both advisory and technical services to our clients in the financial services and aged care sectors.§Analysts will typically work closely with the Advisory Services team and the Technical Services team. The Advisory Services team provides consulting services to Novigi’s clients, and is instrumental in framing the problem statement with our clients, and specifying tailored technical solutions. The Technical Services team is responsible for the implementation and delivery of technology solutions, primarily in data and interoperability.§About You§Novigi is currently looking to recruit 2 graduate-level analysts, starting on a casual basis with an aim towards full-time employment.§The following disciplines are preferred but applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply:§Computer and information science, software engineering§Data science, statistics, actuarial science§Mathematics and Engineering (all disciplines)§Science (physics, chemistry)§Commerce (economics, finance)§You have a basic understanding of programming or are willing to learn. The following languages are preferred, but not required:§SQL (MSSQL, MySQL)§Python§R§You have an interest in data driven problem solving, including:§Problem identification and definition§Inductive reasoning§Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning§Data analysis§You have a strong understanding of technology. Knowledge in the following areas is a plus:§Database design§Cloud infrastructure§Solution architecture§APIs§Soft skills will also include:§Working independently as needed, but also as part of a team and helping others to solve problems.§Knowing when to ask for help, and when to try solving problems yourself.§Expressing complex technical concepts in business terms and in written form.§Committed to personal and professional development.§Having a professional attitude towards work.§Enjoy the process of solving challenging problems, acquiring new skills and methodologies to address them.§Able to work flexibly, working on multiple projects with changing priorities.§Work Arrangements§We’re looking for the graduate analysts to work 3 days a week, with flexible hours possible under a casual arrangement. Work location is also flexible, but preferred if able to work at the Novigi Wollongong office.§Diverse candidates are encouraged!§ If you don’t meet every criteria in this list, but think you’d be great for the role, please don’t hesitate to apply.§Address applications to:§Raymond Lam, PhD§Senior Analyst and Analyst Squad Lead§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

We are currently delivering some of Australia’s most exciting projects across the transport, building construction, defence, airports, mining, civil and social infrastructure sectors. jobText: TXT/50677049.txt	§Senior Manager Strategic Projects§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager Strategic Projects§§Advertiser: §Sydney Metro§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §Senior Manager Strategic Projects §    §      §        §.§        §About us§        § §        §Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.§        § §        §The Office of the Chief Executive provides strategic advice and support to the Chief Executive and Executive to enable the delivery of projects and the operation of Sydney Metro. Our team sets the Organisational governance and strategic framework to ensure we’re going in the right direction. We work closely with government agencies, local government, NSW Government Ministers and other stakeholders to ensure Sydney Metro connects seamlessly with NSW’s integrated, multi-modal transport network.§        § §        § §        §Primary purpose of the role§        § §        §The primary purpose of the role is to lead, develop and manage strategic projects that support the delivery of organisational strategies, corporate planning, policy, governance and performance management to drive the achievement strategic improvements and outcomes.  §        § §        § §        §Key accountabilities and responsibilities will see you:§        § §        §          §Leading, planning and managing a portfolio of strategic and business projects in the organisation to the highest standards of quality to achieve business outcomes, generate efficiencies and deliver benefits in the short and long term.§          §Leading and driving enterprise change in relation to organisational strategies, performance management, governance and business improvement which supports strategic decision making, effective relationships and organisational goals.§          §Driving the review, creation and management of corporate policies, standards and guidelines aligned to our strategic direction and corporate governance.§          §Building and managing collaborative relationships across the organisation, other government agencies and stakeholders, working collaboratively and providing leadership to achieve strategic enterprise outcomes supported by sound governance processes.§          §Providing expert advice and recommendations to senior leadership group across the organisation, to enable the identification, assessment and management of emerging risks and issues.§        §        § §        § §        §About you     §        §   §        §You will have proven strategic planning, policy and governance experience at a leadership level in Government or a complex organisation. Your experience will demonstrate your skills working across an Organisation to understand the business and build relationships of trust to deliver enterprise outcomes, managing risks in a highly accountable environment.§        § §        §You have gravitas, demonstrating highly advanced stakeholder management, negotiation and influencing expertise with a proven track record in successfully navigating through highly complex projects, solid understanding of the planning and execution of corporate strategy, organisational change and strengthening policy and governance across the organisation. You will foster opportunities for continuous improvement whilst maintaining commitment to high levels in planning and delivering strategic and governance related projects.§        § §        §This is an important leadership role with a rare opportunity to lead and deliver strategic projects to support the achievement of Sydney Metro’s strategic objectives. You will be joining Sydney Metro at a pivotal time as it delivers Australia’s biggest public transport project.§        § §        § §        §Want to know more?§        § §        §Please click §here§ to view a copy of the role description.§        § §        § §        §Salary and Benefits§        § §        §This is a Transport Senior Service Manager role offering an attractive remuneration package.§        § §        §For more information on Employee Benefits at Sydney Metro please click §here§.§        § §        § §        §Our Commitment to Diversity§        § §        §Great people come from all walks of life. At Transport for NSW, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve. We actively promote gender diversity in our workplaces, the employment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and the employment of people with a disability. We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call/text or email the contact person for this role.§        § §        §To register your interest please click the apply now button to submit your updated resume and complete the online application process by §11:59pm, Sunday 18th October§. For any enquiries, please email Goran Danilov at §GORAN.DANILOV@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU§.§        § §        §Find out more about Sydney Metro at §https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sydney-metro§.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§.§§About us§ §Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.§ §The Office of the Chief Executive provides strategic advice and support to the Chief Executive and Executive to enable the delivery of projects and the operation of Sydney Metro. Our team sets the Organisational governance and strategic framework to ensure we’re going in the right direction. We work closely with government agencies, local government, NSW Government Ministers and other stakeholders to ensure Sydney Metro connects seamlessly with NSW’s integrated, multi-modal transport network.§ § §Primary purpose of the role§ §The primary purpose of the role is to lead, develop and manage strategic projects that support the delivery of organisational strategies, corporate planning, policy, governance and performance management to drive the achievement strategic improvements and outcomes.  § § §Key accountabilities and responsibilities will see you:§ § §Leading, planning and managing a portfolio of strategic and business projects in the organisation to the highest standards of quality to achieve business outcomes, generate efficiencies and deliver benefits in the short and long term.§ §Leading and driving enterprise change in relation to organisational strategies, performance management, governance and business improvement which supports strategic decision making, effective relationships and organisational goals.§ §Driving the review, creation and management of corporate policies, standards and guidelines aligned to our strategic direction and corporate governance.§ §Building and managing collaborative relationships across the organisation, other government agencies and stakeholders, working collaboratively and providing leadership to achieve strategic enterprise outcomes supported by sound governance processes.§ §Providing expert advice and recommendations to senior leadership group across the organisation, to enable the identification, assessment and management of emerging risks and issues.§ § § §About you     §   §You will have proven strategic planning, policy and governance experience at a leadership level in Government or a complex organisation. Your experience will demonstrate your skills working across an Organisation to understand the business and build relationships of trust to deliver enterprise outcomes, managing risks in a highly accountable environment.§ §You have gravitas, demonstrating highly advanced stakeholder management, negotiation and influencing expertise with a proven track record in successfully navigating through highly complex projects, solid understanding of the planning and execution of corporate strategy, organisational change and strengthening policy and governance across the organisation. You will foster opportunities for continuous improvement whilst maintaining commitment to high levels in planning and delivering strategic and governance related projects.§ §This is an important leadership role with a rare opportunity to lead and deliver strategic projects to support the achievement of Sydney Metro’s strategic objectives. You will be joining Sydney Metro at a pivotal time as it delivers Australia’s biggest public transport project.§ § §Want to know more?§ §Please click §here§ to view a copy of the role description.§ § §Salary and Benefits§ §This is a Transport Senior Service Manager role offering an attractive remuneration package.§ §For more information on Employee Benefits at Sydney Metro please click §here§.§ § §Our Commitment to Diversity§ §Great people come from all walks of life. At Transport for NSW, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve. We actively promote gender diversity in our workplaces, the employment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and the employment of people with a disability. We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call/text or email the contact person for this role.§ §To register your interest please click the apply now button to submit your updated resume and complete the online application process by §11:59pm, Sunday 18th October§. For any enquiries, please email Goran Danilov at §GORAN.DANILOV@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU§.§ §Find out more about Sydney Metro at §https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sydney-metro§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50604175.txt	§Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consultant§§Advertiser: §EGM Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§About ZED§ZED is a South Australian owned and operated management consulting firm that delivers on a wide range of expert advisory services including strategy, business improvement, organisational transformation, and data analytics. §With a team of 20 staff, they are growing and are looking to add to their team to focus on working within the private sector. At ZED, you’ll relish a culture that inspires a strong, supportive and high-performance team of high-powered doers.§ §Your day to day§In this role you will be responsible for supporting the team to solve our clients’ complex and challenging problems as well as work on exciting advisory projects across multiple industries.§You will work alongside the directors and actively contribute to project planning, analysis, concept development, report preparation and presentations to clients. § §What you will need to bring to the role§This is a unique opportunity to expand your skill base, work with industry specialists and enjoy the successes and benefits of being a valued member of a professional and highly regarded consultancy firm.
