jobTitle: Partner Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680800.txt	§Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Partner§§Advertiser: §Robert Half§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive remuneration package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Partner §      §        §Partner / Managing Director Risk & Compliance - Global Consulting Firm§        §Robert Half Executive Search has been exclusively retained by this multinational consulting firm to secure a highly commercial Senior Risk & Compliance leader to join their rapidly growing Financial Services practice.§        §A globally-renowned and highly successful firm, their Australian operations have achieved double-digit organic growth year-on-year over the past five years. Australia is very much viewed as the 'growth engine' for the wider Asia Pacific region and, as such, the global leadership team have consistently demonstrated a significant appetite to increase investment in the region. Our Clients ‘go to market initiatives’ will include Risk & controls uplift, Major programmes, Remediation, Governance & operating models, Regulatory change, Integrated GRCA, Culture and conduct, Technology uplift and improvement, Data management and Operational agility & resilience.§        §Within the Australian national practice, the firm has an impressive portfolio of Financial Services clients in most facets of the Financial Services sector including Banking and Capital Markets, Insurance, Wealth and Asset Management and has the ability to leverage its national operations to redeploy resources as required.§        §Leaders are unencumbered in winning engagements as the firm uniquely lives and breathes a team-focussed culture of collaboration in their approach to business development. The combination of solution offerings across FSI ensures that there are rarely any conflicts of interest with regard to client engagements.§        §With a corporatised bonus structure, the successful individual will be financially rewarded commensurate with a collegiate remuneration scheme, combining an aggregate assessment of personal, team and organisational performance.§        § §        §The Role§        §As the Managing Director for the Risk & Compliance solution for the FSI business, you will drive revenue growth and provide strategic and operational direction to a talented team who are committed to capturing further market share within the areas of governance, risk management and regulatory compliance. With an autonomous and independent working environment free from restrictions, employees of this firm enjoy the freedom to generate exciting and challenging pieces of work and focus on areas of particular interest. From an execution standpoint, the core focus of this role will be the provision of risk management advisory services.§        §A key priority for the role will be to grow revenues through extensive market-facing business development activities leveraging your current network of contacts within the financial services sector as well as diversifying the solutions offered as market opportunities present. Securing new clients and projects and subsequently taking a lead role in their successful, and timely delivery using world-class methodologies will ensure you consistently deliver an exceptional customer experience paving the way for repeat business.§        §With a proven strategic and operational business model, you will have a licence to build a high performing team, growing the practice to operate with the agility of a mid-sized entrepreneurial firm with the backing of a global listed parent.§        § §        §Your Profile§        §To succeed in this role you will ideally be a highly accomplished Partner or Senior Director within a Big 4 Consulting firm, a well-established mid-sized firm or a boutique risk consulting house. With a demonstrable track record of both sourcing work and delivering on risk advisory engagements across a range of financial services clients, you will be a subject matter expert in risk management, transformation and advisory matters. You will be a credible and professionally confident individual who has successfully built high-touch client relationships with senior management within the financial services sector.§        §A highly commercial consulting professional, you possess both gravitas and humility in equal measures. Seeking to accelerate your career within an entrepreneurial workplace, you thrive when working with high-performers and are excited by the opportunity to build upon an already successful team.§        §For a confidential conversation please contact Jennifer Andres or Lindsay Steinour via LinkedIn in the first instance.§        § §        §TO WORK IN AUSTRALIA YOU NEED TO BE IN POSSESSION OF A VALID AUSTRALIAN VISA WITH WORK RIGHTS.§      §      §      §    §    §www.roberthalf.com.au§    §IT'S TIME WE ALL WORK HAPPY.™§  §§§Partner / Managing Director Risk & Compliance - Global Consulting Firm§Robert Half Executive Search has been exclusively retained by this multinational consulting firm to secure a highly commercial Senior Risk & Compliance leader to join their rapidly growing Financial Services practice.§A globally-renowned and highly successful firm, their Australian operations have achieved double-digit organic growth year-on-year over the past five years. Australia is very much viewed as the 'growth engine' for the wider Asia Pacific region and, as such, the global leadership team have consistently demonstrated a significant appetite to increase investment in the region. Our Clients ‘go to market initiatives’ will include Risk & controls uplift, Major programmes, Remediation, Governance & operating models, Regulatory change, Integrated GRCA, Culture and conduct, Technology uplift and improvement, Data management and Operational agility & resilience.§Within the Australian national practice, the firm has an impressive portfolio of Financial Services clients in most facets of the Financial Services sector including Banking and Capital Markets, Insurance, Wealth and Asset Management and has the ability to leverage its national operations to redeploy resources as required.§Leaders are unencumbered in winning engagements as the firm uniquely lives and breathes a team-focussed culture of collaboration in their approach to business development. The combination of solution offerings across FSI ensures that there are rarely any conflicts of interest with regard to client engagements.§With a corporatised bonus structure, the successful individual will be financially rewarded commensurate with a collegiate remuneration scheme, combining an aggregate assessment of personal, team and organisational performance.§ §The Role§As the Managing Director for the Risk & Compliance solution for the FSI business, you will drive revenue growth and provide strategic and operational direction to a talented team who are committed to capturing further market share within the areas of governance, risk management and regulatory compliance. With an autonomous and independent working environment free from restrictions, employees of this firm enjoy the freedom to generate exciting and challenging pieces of work and focus on areas of particular interest. From an execution standpoint, the core focus of this role will be the provision of risk management advisory services.§A key priority for the role will be to grow revenues through extensive market-facing business development activities leveraging your current network of contacts within the financial services sector as well as diversifying the solutions offered as market opportunities present. Securing new clients and projects and subsequently taking a lead role in their successful, and timely delivery using world-class methodologies will ensure you consistently deliver an exceptional customer experience paving the way for repeat business.§With a proven strategic and operational business model, you will have a licence to build a high performing team, growing the practice to operate with the agility of a mid-sized entrepreneurial firm with the backing of a global listed parent.§ §Your Profile§To succeed in this role you will ideally be a highly accomplished Partner or Senior Director within a Big 4 Consulting firm, a well-established mid-sized firm or a boutique risk consulting house. With a demonstrable track record of both sourcing work and delivering on risk advisory engagements across a range of financial services clients, you will be a subject matter expert in risk management, transformation and advisory matters. You will be a credible and professionally confident individual who has successfully built high-touch client relationships with senior management within the financial services sector.§A highly commercial consulting professional, you possess both gravitas and humility in equal measures. Seeking to accelerate your career within an entrepreneurial workplace, you thrive when working with high-performers and are excited by the opportunity to build upon an already successful team.§For a confidential conversation please contact Jennifer Andres or Lindsay Steinour via LinkedIn in the first instance.§ §TO WORK IN AUSTRALIA YOU NEED TO BE IN POSSESSION OF A VALID AUSTRALIAN VISA WITH WORK RIGHTS.§§§§

jobTitle: Business Continuity Manager Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50652829.txt	§Business Continuity Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Continuity Manager§§Advertiser: §Life Without Barriers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Continuity Manager §      §        §§        §About the Organisation§        §Life Without Barriers is a leading social purpose, not for profit organisation of 7,000 employees working in more than 440 communities across Australia. We support children, young people and families, people with disability, older people and people with mental illness. We work with people who are homeless and refugees and asylum seekers.   §        §We want to employ people who reflect the diversity of our clients to ensure we can support each client's individual needs and wants. We encourage people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background and people with disability to apply.§        §About the role§        §The Business Continuity Manager is a newly created role to drive, deliver and execute a fit for purpose business continuity and business resiliency preparedness program. Reporting to the Manager Risk and Resilience, the key focus of this role is to deliver an integrated business continuity strategy, systems and tools and facilitate targeted testing and exercising programs to strengthen resiliency across the organisation.  This position is a permanent, full time position, location flexible.§        §Key Responsibilities§        §          §Develop, implement and maintain LWB’s business resilience program, policies and procedures.§          §Develop function-based business continuity plans, impact assessments, IT platform, systems, tools and templates to support managers to identify, maintain, update and validate business impact analysis.§          §Drive standardisation, consistency, quality and effectiveness of Business Continuity Management and controls.§          §Design business continuity scenario, testing and exercising programs.§          §Develop and evolve LWB’s approach and tools for business continuity management working proactively with the business.§          §Provide guidance, training and coaching for LWB managers and staff on all aspects of business continuity management.§          §Prepare routine reports on business continuity performance.§          §Oversee business continuity and resiliency management initiatives consistent with goals and objectives under the direction of the Manager Risk and Resilience.§        §        § §Skills & Experience§        §          §Tertiary level qualifications in business continuity management or relevant field.§          §Significant experience in a business continuity management, operational resilience, disaster recovery, crisis management, emergency management and risk management at an enterprise, strategic and operational level.§          §Demonstrated experience in implementing and monitoring a fit for purpose business continuity program across multiple service types and multi-site locations.§          §Demonstrated experience in managing competing priorities and delivering high quality outcomes within agreed timelines.§          §Experience in leading organisation wide change and managing relationships with stakeholders to achieve results.§          §The ability to influence and work collaboratively with a range of stakeholders including peers, employees, external organisations, funding bodies and government agencies.§          §Demonstrated written communication skills for the creation of reports, correspondence and other material.§          §Proficient ability in the use of Microsoft Office suite of programs.§        §        §Successful candidates will be required to clear probity checks including National Criminal History Record Check and Working with Children Check (where relevant to the role).§        §How to Apply§        §Include your resume and covering letter in one document, click ‘Apply’ and follow the prompts. For any enquiries including persons with disability that require adjustments, contact at §recruitment@lwb.org.au§.§        §We are dedicated to playing our part to reduce the spread of COVID-19 and bring continuity of care and support to our clients. With this in mind, if you are successful, we will discuss with you an alternative to a face to face interview. §        §Applications close at midnight AEST on Sunday 11th October 2020.§        §Life Without Barriers supports the Royal Commission into violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation of people with disability. We believe people with disability need to be heard and for these experiences to influence how support services like ours are delivered. View our statement here (https://bit.ly/2GzZGWA).§        § §      §      §      §    §    §www.lwb.org.au§  §§§§About the Organisation§Life Without Barriers is a leading social purpose, not for profit organisation of 7,000 employees working in more than 440 communities across Australia. jobTitle: Regional Manager Job in Northern QLD - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700092.txt	§Regional Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Manager§§Advertiser: §Wild Environmental Consultants§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northern QLD§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§About the Company:§  §Wild Environmental is a Townsville based, environmental consultancy committed to delivering a highly valuable experience for clients in Regional Queensland. As a result of delivering over 150 projects in four short years and our rapid growth, we are looking for a Regional Manager to drive the company forward. §  §Wild Environmental provides a diverse range of professional environmental services to the mining, aquaculture, construction, transport, agriculture, and tourism sectors.§  §The company offers a comprehensive suite of solutions across environmental approvals and compliance, ecological investigations, and land resource management, with a team of experts covering disciplines including ecology, water, soil, air, and marine sciences.§  §About the Role:§  §The role of the Regional Manager has responsibility for leading the day-to-day operations of Wild Environmental’s Regional Townsville office.§  §The Regional Manager will lead a team of multidisciplinary environmental professionals and administrative staff to oversee the expansion of Wild Environmental in North Queensland with a focus on business development, project delivery, and managing a team of professionals to deliver projects for the client, on time and on budget.§  §The role requires a solid technical background, with demonstrated extensive experience as an environmental professional at a management or executive level.§  §About You:§  §This position requires sound business instincts and acumen, including demonstrated experience in leading people and teams, financial decision making and analytics, business development strategy and know how, and operations management.§  §Your experience and reputation will naturally attract and retain clients. You will build strong relationships with clients and stakeholders at the same time as developing Wild’s brand in target markets.§  §Applicants should meet the following requirements:§ § §Tertiary qualification in environmental science, natural resource management, or another related field; § §At least 10 years of relevant experience in a similar role.§ §You will have demonstrated working knowledge of:§ § §Environmental legislation and approval requirements for development projects under Queensland and Commonwealth legislation;§ §Environmental and ecological investigations and surveys at small and large scales;§ §Environmental impact assessments; and § §Environmental scoping and due diligence for development projects. § §You should consider this role if you have the following experience:§ § §Leading a team of environmental professionals;§ §Building long term relationships with clients; § §Business development, writing proposals and work winning; § §Developing and working with a budget and accounts system; § §Regulatory or compliance background with demonstrated knowledge of the ways in which governments assess projects;§ §Led environmental impact assessments and utilize specialist knowledge to inform assessments;§ §Diverse industry exposure across one or more of the following sectors: mining, agriculture, transport, infrastructure, renewables, aquaculture;§ §Client and agency liaison. § §Should you have specific questions prior to applying, please email §info@wildenvironmental.com§. §Please do §not§ forward applications to that address.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Manager- Group Strategy Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639768.txt	§Senior Manager- Group Strategy§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager- Group Strategy§§Advertiser: §Credit Union Australia Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ §As the Senior Manager, Group Strategy you are a critical part of the Group Strategy & Innovation leadership team. In this role you will work with the Head of Group Strategy & Innovation, Senior Leadership, and Executive Committee in the development and execution of CUA's Strategy. You will be responsible for leading a diverse range of strategic projects across CUA, encompassing all elements of strategy and corporate development including growth and market entry, product development, marketing and distribution, process improvements and optimisation, and M&A.§You will play a critical role in the development of our annual corporate plan and 5-year transformation strategy, integrating complex sets of financial and strategic inputs into a cohesive plan, which can be synthesised into a compelling Executive and Board-level narrative. You will support the development and allocation of capital funding for initiatives to be taken through our transformation and delivery office, providing rigorous analysis to support your recommendations.§ § §Talent Factor…§A change agent, passionate about driving cultural and meaningful changes§Commercially astute, a structured problem solver passionate about evidenced based and data driven approach§Influential, engaging and capable of synthesising and communicating complex information and ideas clearly§An enterprise thinker, a collaborative thought leader and trusted business partner§A coach and leader, who sees the potential in others and helping your team to realise their full potential§Experienced working within agile environments and delivery methods§Essential Experience§Relevant Tertiary qualifications§Professionally qualified (MBA preferred) with practical experience in strategy formulation§Demonstrated experience from a Top Tier Management Consulting firm or in a Corporate Strategy role providing strategic advice at an Executive and Board level§Proven consulting toolkit with the ability to incorporate innovative approaches in solving complex problems§Experience in leading and coordinating cross-functional teams to deliver enterprise projects§Ability to facilitate discussions at senior executive level, with highly developed verbal and written communication skills§Highly developed decision making, negotiation, planning and organisational skills§Proven leadership capabilities in managing and developing a team of high-performing strategy practitioners§Why CUA?§ § At CUA, we aspire for our team members to be part of something special, where we are known as a Best Employer and a great community to be part of. We value our people to experience a place where: §Members are at the heart of everything we do§We are accountable for results and empowered to take action§We deliver outcomes and impact§We constructively challenge ourselves and others§We proactively work with others to innovate, adapt and grow§We are genuine and inclusive§§Questions?§ Please call James Hawley from our Talent Acquisition team on §07 3552 4112§.§§§§

jobTitle: Strategic Assistant  Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50661264.txt	§Strategic Assistant §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Assistant §§Advertiser: §Quality Compliance Systems (QCS)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Salary§§$150,000 - $200,000+§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§This Strategic Assistant role creates an exciting opportunity to work with the Company Founder of an established and fast growing, UK based software company, §Quality Compliance Systems (QCS).§ At QCS our purpose is 'Helping to create a fairer and more compassionate world’. We help Care Providers by giving them the policies, procedures, guidance and inspections tools they need to achieve ‘Outstanding’. Content is crafted by our team of subject specialists, updated dynamically and delivered directly to any device, saving precious time for busy Care Providers to spend on caring.§QCS Australia is primed for growth and therefore we seek a §Strategy Lead§ or§ Project Manager §or similarly experienced to work with our CEO as the §Strategic Assistant§. The role of the Strategic Assistant will focus on:§Idea Synthesis and Translation §- Understanding and interpreting CEO’s vision and plans, capturing ideas and pressure testing for efficacy. Organising and sequencing ideas and plans into clear, professional outputs for specific deliverables.§Capture and Organisation §- Understanding, recording and planning the CEO’s requirements, content development, decision making and communication for company deliverables. §People, Task and Project Management §- Develop, improve, and implement routines to capture and track CEO’s priorities, tasks, communications, and follow-ups with the support of the CEO’s Executive Assistant.§Skills and attributes of the Strategic Assistant:§Executive-presence§; poised with a positive and confident presence, able to represent the CEO’s interests. Capable of influencing colleagues and contacts at all levels while maintaining a high level of workplace discretion. § §Communicator§; precise and professional communicator capable of assimilating a range of information and act as ‘translator’, summarising the ideas of others into organised themes and thorough summaries.  § §Intuitive§; able to gauge what is needed to move the CEO’s work forward. Exercising good judgement when facing new opportunities, conflicting priorities, and difficult decisions. § §Organisation;§ with meticulous attention to detail, track, manage and prioritise multiple short, medium, and long-term projects in parallel, with nothing falling through the cracks. Capable of translating ideas into processes that drive execution, manage deliverables across parties, and ensure deadlines are met.  §Technically proficient;§ confident user of Microsoft tools, video conferencing, and file management platforms. § §Proactive;§ self-motivated, anticipating needs, opportunities and conflicts, making appropriate adjustments to ensure things run smoothly. § §Flexible and Adaptable;§ comfortable working in the midst of fluidity and ambiguity, able to read other people and situations. Tackles tasks with enthusiasm and adapts rapidly and calmly to changes in priorities, direction or information. §QCS is a values led organisation. We are proud of our QCS culture, a set of values that are shared by everyone in the company. These values are what got us to where we are, from a £30k a year business in the UK, into a business that supports thousands of Care providers. These are also the values that will help us achieve our long-term goal of helping 3 million people a day enjoy a better quality of life.   §We believe everything we do should revolve around these core values: § §Do the Right Thing  -  Make it Better -  Play for the Team -  Get it Done§If our values resonate with you then apply today to join our Team!§This is a permanent opportunity and will grow as the organisation grows but will remain as direct strategic support to the CEO.§Primary work location is the company office in Norwest with some opportunities to work from home. Start and finish times are flexible and QCS supports flexible and remote working with our Everyday Flex policy. The Strategic Assistant will be engaged in online meetings in other time zones, including the UK, which requires some flexibility in morning or evening routine.§We are keen to receive applications from project managers, strategic leads, the start-up experienced, the curious. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the build of an organisation and the sharing of technologies to make things better.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Senior ESG Analyst - ACSI Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692700.txt	§Senior ESG Analyst - ACSI§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior ESG Analyst - ACSI§§Advertiser: §Kaizen Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§ACSI is a major force in responsible investment in Australia. Established in 2001, they exist to provide a strong, collective voice on environmental, social and governance (ESG) investment issues on behalf of our members.§   §ACSI's members include 37 Australian and international asset owners and institutional investors. Collectively, own on average 10% of every ASX200 company. ACSI's members believe that ESG risks and opportunities have a material impact on investment outcomes over time. As fiduciary investors, they have a responsibility to exercise their ownership rights and act to enhance the long-term value of the savings entrusted to them.§   § Through ACSI, our members collaborate to achieve genuine, measurable and permanent improvements in the ESG practices and performance of the companies they invest in. ACSI staff undertake a year-round program of research, engagement, advocacy and voting advice.§   § Reporting to the Executive Manager, Governance and Engagement, this role is part of ACSI’s team who engage with boards and senior executives of Australia’s largest companies on key ESG investment issues. This work underpins ACSI’s long-term goal of achieving measurable improvements in the ESG practices of the companies our members invest in. §   § Ideally, we are looking for someone with strong communication and research skills and a keen interest in improving the governance and sustainability of listed companies. A strong interest in the impacts of environmental and social issues on corporate performance is a must.§ ACSI actively supports flexibility at work and this role can be located in either Sydney or Melbourne.§ If you are interested in learning more about this position, please contact Matt McGilton on §03 9095 7157§ or Simon Gvalda on §0431 634 291§ at Kaizen Recruitment or apply via the attached link.§ Kaizen Recruitment is the exclusive recruitment partner for this position and all applications will be reviewed and assessed directly by Kaizen Recruitment.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Program Capacity Building Adviser Job in Asia Pacific - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647230.txt	§Program Capacity Building Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Program Capacity Building Adviser§§Advertiser: §Cardno§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Asia Pacific§, §PNG & Pacific Islands§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Solomon Islands Education Sector Support Program§  § §  §The Solomon Islands Education Sector Support Program (ESSP) provides the strategic direction and implementation arrangements for the New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade (MFAT) and the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) combined investment to support the Solomon Islands Government (SIG) to implement its Education Strategic Framework 2016–2030 (ESF), the National Education Action Plan §2016-2020§ (NEAP) and its successor.§  § §  §The Program adopts a modified version of a sector-wide approach, using mixed-modalities. It positions the Ministry of Education and Human Resources Development (MEHRD) as the central partner, adopts MEHRD’s ESF and NEAP as the guiding frameworks for all investment, promotes strengthened sector-wide donor coordination and provides the majority of Program funding through sector budget support. Funding is also available to support targeted capacity development and activities implemented by non-governmental organisations.§  § §  §ESSP is managed under Australia’s Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF) by Cardno.§  § §  §The role§  § §  §The Program Capacity Building Adviser will be a part of the Program Management Team (PMT) who are responsible for the day-to-day management, implementation, coordination and administration of the Solomon Islands ESSP.§  §The Program Capacity Building Adviser will work with MEHRD to develop and design a Capacity Development Framework. The Capacity Development Framework will be pivotal in strengthening the organisational capacity and strategic support for MEHRD and framing the criteria for the Capacity Development Fund, which aims to provide ongoing long and short-term capacity development support.§  § §  §The adviser will also:§  § § § §Undertake a stocktake or scoping of existing performance review or capacity related approaches that are being used across MEHRD;§ §Draw on learnings from the understanding of MEHRD, it’s environment and state of play, to develop a Capacity Development Framework§ §As part of the Capacity Development Framework, develop a package of assistance including interactive tools, resources, facilitation notes and methods that can be applied within the Ministry and schools or Education Authorities at different levels.§ §Facilitate and support capacity building for MEHRD and partners (including NGOs and in-kind support recipients) that implement activities or programs in the Education sector.§ §Identify opportunities to integrate gender equality, child protection, disability and other social inclusion principles into the overall approach.§ § §  §For further information, please copy paste this link to access the Terms of Reference detailing responsibilities and selection criteria: https://bit.ly/30e1BIo §  § §  §About you§  § §  §Cardno encourages Solomon Islands nationals and nationals from other Pacific island countries to apply.§  § §  §You will be a motivated and proactive individual with the right combination of experience, talent, energy and a commitment to technical excellence.§  § §  §You will also have:§  § § § §Tertiary qualification in education, social sciences, international and/or community development, training or similar discipline.§ §10-15 years’ professional experience providing technical support working in in capacity building related to education or a similar field§ §Demonstrated experience in developing, delivering and facilitating capacity development tools/frameworks and strategies§ §Outstanding communication and facilitation skills and experience conveying complex information to stakeholders of varying levels of experience or ability§ §Excellent analytical and report writing skills, including the ability to write to DFAT/MFAT and MEHRD specifications.§ §Demonstrated commitment to gender equality and social inclusion.§ §Proven ability to analyse and manage risks and identify sustainable solutions in solving complex problems.§ § §  §Desired experience and Knowledge§  § § § §Experience working on international development programs in Solomon Islands or in the Melanesian/Pacific Islands context, demonstrating cross cultural skills.§ §Ability to converse in Pidgin English would be an advantage but not essential.§ § §  §Remuneration§  § §  §This position is classified under DFAT’s Aid Adviser Remuneration Framework (ARF) as Discipline C, Level 3 and will be offered at a level commensurate to the successful candidate’s experience relevant to the role.§  § §  §To access the ARF rates, please copy and paste the following link: https://www.dfat.gov.au/sites/default/files/adviser-remuneration-framework-2016.pdf§  § § §  §Location and travel requirements§  § §  §The position will be based in Honiara with regular provincial travel required.§  § §  §Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF)§  § §  §The Solomon Islands Resource Facility (SIRF) is supported by the Australian Government and managed by Cardno. SIRF is an integrated facility that delivers both Technical Assistance (TA) and Deployee Support Services (DSS), in Solomon Islands.§  § §  §Why join Cardno?§  § §  §Cardno offers meaningful opportunities for each individual member of our team to grow, make an impact and leave a legacy for local communities, globally.§  § §  §By joining Cardno, you will be part of an environment where you can collaborate with leading experts from diverse backgrounds, access development programs to achieve your career goals, and be challenged to take a global outlook§  § §  §How to apply§  § §  §We welcome your interest in joining the Cardno team. Click the ‘apply’ button to submit your application online with the reference number CID/MN/SIRF/PCA by§ Sunday 25th October. §Your application §must§ include the following:§  § § § §Your CV; and§ §Completed application form in lieu of a cover letter. Please copy paste this link to access the application form: https://bit.ly/30dhdf8§ § §  §If you are having any technical issues with submitting your application online, please email them directly to the SIRF recruitment team §recruitment@sirf.com.sb§  § §  §About Cardno§  § §  §We are a global provider of integrated professional services which enrich the physical and social environment for the communities in which we live and work. Our team of multidisciplinary specialists has more than 70 years’ experience in designing, developing and delivering sustainable projects and community advancement programs.§  § §  §Cardno is an equal opportunity employer. Cardno encourages women and Solomon Islands nationals to apply. §  § §  §Cardno is committed to Safety and the Prevention of Sexual Abuse and Harassment (PSEAH), Child Protection and bribery prevention. We want to engage with the right people to deliver our client programs. As part of our approach you will be subjected to formal background screening, criminal record checks, employment verification, and periodic compliance checks. All Cardno staff receive safety, compliance and safeguards training and are responsible for contributing to a safer working culture.§§§§

jobTitle: Associate Director - Financial Strategy & Performance Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50702061.txt	§Associate Director - Financial Strategy & Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Director - Financial Strategy & Performance§§Advertiser: §KPMG Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Work with our clients to enhance the capability of their finance functions§§Work with Finance leaders to build more efficient and effective Finance functions that provide more value to the business§§Collaborate with sector and technology experts to grow your knowledge and network§§KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.§KPMG’s Management Consulting division continues to experience growth and client demand and we’re seeking experienced and talented individuals for our Finance Strategy & Performance practice in Brisbane. The role calls for considerable experience of leading transformational change across finance functions locally and globally experience in finance systems and implementations, continuous improvement of finance business processes, and automation of finance activities would be ideal for this team. §At KPMG, we work with our clients to enhance the operation of their finance functions, their value to the business, and to position their finance teams for lasting success.§§Your Opportunity §§You’ll play a key role in the development of our client relationships in Brisbane and in embedding a culture that supports the development of our exceptional people. Your role will see you:§§Focus on business development through maintaining strong relationships with clients during and post engagements and through building strong professional networks§Developing compelling and differentiated value propositions in opportunity pursuits§Work in collaboration with colleagues across the Finance Strategy and Performance team nationally and our broader service lines to leverage expertise and enhancing finance team performance §Overseeing and delivering complex client engagements, acting as a key contact with senior stakeholders§Bring passion and deep expertise that positions you as an inspirational role model and leader§Supporting a high performance culture to consistently deliver quality outcomes for clients and great development opportunities for junior colleagues §§How are you Extraordinary?§§At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include: §§Relevant tertiary qualification(s)§An MBA or advanced degree is advantageous§Experience in Finance Transformation across any industry that is likely to cover: §§Developing cost and financial models§Enterprise Performance Management Solutions§Digital Finance, robotics and process automation§Finance Operating Models§Shared Services and Outsourcing§Finance Talent Development §§Experience in consulting or in a professional services firm is essential §Highly developed communication and presentation skills§Ability to prepare business development material, including proposals, case studies and other sector specific material§The ability to engage, lead and inspire your team to achieve personal success and great results for the business§A highly collaborative approach and the confidence and impact to influence diverse senior stakeholders in a complex, matrix organisation structure§§The KPMG Difference§§Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.§We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.§Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:§Flexibility empowers wellbeing § [link removed]§Flexibility enables contribution to the community§ [link removed]§Flexibility inspires technology§ [link removed]§ & innovation§§Flexibility§ [link removed]§ supports family§§Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!§Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.§ § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50680883.txt	§Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Partner§§Advertiser: §Robert Half§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive remuneration package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Partner §      §        §Partner / Managing Director Risk & Compliance - Global Consulting Firm§        §Robert Half Executive Search has been exclusively retained by this multinational consulting firm to secure a highly commercial Senior Risk & Compliance leader to join their rapidly growing Financial Services practice.§        §A globally-renowned and highly successful firm, their Australian operations have achieved double-digit organic growth year-on-year over the past five years. Australia is very much viewed as the 'growth engine' for the wider Asia Pacific region and, as such, the global leadership team have consistently demonstrated a significant appetite to increase investment in the region. Our Clients ‘go to market initiatives’ will include Risk & controls uplift, Major programmes, Remediation, Governance & operating models, Regulatory change, Integrated GRCA, Culture and conduct, Technology uplift and improvement, Data management and Operational agility & resilience.§        §Within the Australian national practice, the firm has an impressive portfolio of Financial Services clients in most facets of the Financial Services sector including Banking and Capital Markets, Insurance, Wealth and Asset Management and has the ability to leverage its national operations to redeploy resources as required.§        §Leaders are unencumbered in winning engagements as the firm uniquely lives and breathes a team-focussed culture of collaboration in their approach to business development. The combination of solution offerings across FSI ensures that there are rarely any conflicts of interest with regard to client engagements.§        §With a corporatised bonus structure, the successful individual will be financially rewarded commensurate with a collegiate remuneration scheme, combining an aggregate assessment of personal, team and organisational performance.§        § §        §The Role§        §As the Managing Director for the Risk & Compliance solution for the FSI business, you will drive revenue growth and provide strategic and operational direction to a talented team who are committed to capturing further market share within the areas of governance, risk management and regulatory compliance. With an autonomous and independent working environment free from restrictions, employees of this firm enjoy the freedom to generate exciting and challenging pieces of work and focus on areas of particular interest. From an execution standpoint, the core focus of this role will be the provision of risk management advisory services.§        §A key priority for the role will be to grow revenues through extensive market-facing business development activities leveraging your current network of contacts within the financial services sector as well as diversifying the solutions offered as market opportunities present. Securing new clients and projects and subsequently taking a lead role in their successful, and timely delivery using world-class methodologies will ensure you consistently deliver an exceptional customer experience paving the way for repeat business.§        §With a proven strategic and operational business model, you will have a licence to build a high performing team, growing the practice to operate with the agility of a mid-sized entrepreneurial firm with the backing of a global listed parent.§        § §        §Your Profile§        §To succeed in this role you will ideally be a highly accomplished Partner or Senior Director within a Big 4 Consulting firm, a well-established mid-sized firm or a boutique risk consulting house. With a demonstrable track record of both sourcing work and delivering on risk advisory engagements across a range of financial services clients, you will be a subject matter expert in risk management, transformation and advisory matters. You will be a credible and professionally confident individual who has successfully built high-touch client relationships with senior management within the financial services sector.§        §A highly commercial consulting professional, you possess both gravitas and humility in equal measures. Seeking to accelerate your career within an entrepreneurial workplace, you thrive when working with high-performers and are excited by the opportunity to build upon an already successful team.§        §For a confidential conversation please contact Jennifer Andres or Lindsay Steinour via LinkedIn in the first instance.§        § §        §TO WORK IN AUSTRALIA YOU NEED TO BE IN POSSESSION OF A VALID AUSTRALIAN VISA WITH WORK RIGHTS.§      §      §      §    §    §www.roberthalf.com.au§    §IT'S TIME WE ALL WORK HAPPY.™§  §§§Partner / Managing Director Risk & Compliance - Global Consulting Firm§Robert Half Executive Search has been exclusively retained by this multinational consulting firm to secure a highly commercial Senior Risk & Compliance leader to join their rapidly growing Financial Services practice.§A globally-renowned and highly successful firm, their Australian operations have achieved double-digit organic growth year-on-year over the past five years. Australia is very much viewed as the 'growth engine' for the wider Asia Pacific region and, as such, the global leadership team have consistently demonstrated a significant appetite to increase investment in the region. Our Clients ‘go to market initiatives’ will include Risk & controls uplift, Major programmes, Remediation, Governance & operating models, Regulatory change, Integrated GRCA, Culture and conduct, Technology uplift and improvement, Data management and Operational agility & resilience.§Within the Australian national practice, the firm has an impressive portfolio of Financial Services clients in most facets of the Financial Services sector including Banking and Capital Markets, Insurance, Wealth and Asset Management and has the ability to leverage its national operations to redeploy resources as required.§Leaders are unencumbered in winning engagements as the firm uniquely lives and breathes a team-focussed culture of collaboration in their approach to business development. The combination of solution offerings across FSI ensures that there are rarely any conflicts of interest with regard to client engagements.§With a corporatised bonus structure, the successful individual will be financially rewarded commensurate with a collegiate remuneration scheme, combining an aggregate assessment of personal, team and organisational performance.§ §The Role§As the Managing Director for the Risk & Compliance solution for the FSI business, you will drive revenue growth and provide strategic and operational direction to a talented team who are committed to capturing further market share within the areas of governance, risk management and regulatory compliance. With an autonomous and independent working environment free from restrictions, employees of this firm enjoy the freedom to generate exciting and challenging pieces of work and focus on areas of particular interest. From an execution standpoint, the core focus of this role will be the provision of risk management advisory services.§A key priority for the role will be to grow revenues through extensive market-facing business development activities leveraging your current network of contacts within the financial services sector as well as diversifying the solutions offered as market opportunities present. Securing new clients and projects and subsequently taking a lead role in their successful, and timely delivery using world-class methodologies will ensure you consistently deliver an exceptional customer experience paving the way for repeat business.§With a proven strategic and operational business model, you will have a licence to build a high performing team, growing the practice to operate with the agility of a mid-sized entrepreneurial firm with the backing of a global listed parent.§ §Your Profile§To succeed in this role you will ideally be a highly accomplished Partner or Senior Director within a Big 4 Consulting firm, a well-established mid-sized firm or a boutique risk consulting house. With a demonstrable track record of both sourcing work and delivering on risk advisory engagements across a range of financial services clients, you will be a subject matter expert in risk management, transformation and advisory matters. You will be a credible and professionally confident individual who has successfully built high-touch client relationships with senior management within the financial services sector.§A highly commercial consulting professional, you possess both gravitas and humility in equal measures. Seeking to accelerate your career within an entrepreneurial workplace, you thrive when working with high-performers and are excited by the opportunity to build upon an already successful team.§For a confidential conversation please contact Jennifer Andres or Lindsay Steinour via LinkedIn in the first instance.§ §TO WORK IN AUSTRALIA YOU NEED TO BE IN POSSESSION OF A VALID AUSTRALIAN VISA WITH WORK RIGHTS.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50645036.txt	§Portfolio Management Office (PMO) - Business Improvement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Management Office (PMO) - Business Improvement§§Advertiser: §Sydney Water Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Portfolio Management Office (PMO) - Business Improvement §      §        §Portfolio Management Office (PMO) - Business Improvement§ §        §          §The Manager PMO has overall responsibility to lead the governance activities within the Business Improvement portfolio.§          §Play a part in helping Sydney Water deliver its Business Plan and Strategy through collaboration with sponsors and key partners within the business.§          §Senior role that requires the breadth and depth of knowledge in project, program and portfolio governance.§        §        §Location, Parramatta§ § At Sydney Water, we’re passionate about making a difference to the lives of our customers and communities.§ § §About us§ § We have a proud heritage and a progressive future, providing world class drinking water and beautiful waterways from the mountains to the sea. We see the world is changing so we are changing too. Our people and their jobs are as diverse as the communities we serve.§ § §About the role§ § Help us innovate to meet the challenges of our growing cities as a Manager, Portfolio Management Office. The Manager, Portfolio Management Office will deliver effective governance to monitor and manage business improvement projects and programs across Sydney Water. They ensure that the appropriate governance and methodologies are followed within the projects and programs of the portfolio. A key objective of this role is to drive effective decision making within the Business Improvement portfolio and support the Enterprise Portfolio Management Office.§ § Key accountabilities include but are not limited to:§ §        §          §Contribute to the development of the medium to long term business plan to deliver on Sydney Water’s vision and strategy.§          §Oversee the day to day management and execution of governance within the Business Improvement portfolio (reporting processes and governance).§          §Ensure effective integration with the Program Managers and Business Leads to identify, evaluate and resolve portfolio level interdependencies, risks, issues and opportunities.§          §Develop portfolio level ‘Executive ready” reports and insights focused on strategic issues, risks, constraints, financial exposure and achievement of benefits in alignment with the Enterprise Portfolio Management team.§          §Oversee and review the tracking and management of the Business Improvement portfolio budget, actuals and forecast (costs and benefits).§          §Manage the identification and management of the portfolio level risks and issues ensuring integration with the Sydney Water risk management processes and portfolio insights.§          §Enable purpose and empower the team by driving / enacting direction that balances the requirements to service the customer, develop a constructive culture and demonstrate commercial focus.§        §        §About you§ § You have significant experience and depth of knowledge in project, program and portfolio governance including:§ §        §          §Degree in Business or Administration.§          §Minimum of 5 years’ + experience managing a Portfolio Management Office within complex environments.§          §Program and project management certifications in Prince2 or Managing Successful Programs.§          §Detailed understanding and experience of managing portfolio budgets§          §Significant experience in providing Executive reporting and insights.§          §Strong stakeholder management and experience in interacting with program sponsors, directors and managers.§        §        §Closing date: Monday 12th October 2020§ § Please see the position description for the roles full accountabilities.§ § You must be an §Australian Citizen§ or §Permanent Resident§ at the time of submitting your application to be considered for this role. For more information, you can contact § § We want your perspective and ideas to help us find better ways to delight our customers, so we encourage you to apply no matter your age, sex or culture. You can be part of a committed, highly skilled team who’ll appreciate what you bring to the table. You’ll set and achieve real goals and make decisions that matter, as together we help shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney.§ § As part of the application process, Sydney Water will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role. We will also use your personal information to establish a LiveHire talent profile in our Talent Community. We look at our Talent Community first when new opportunities come up when you apply for a role. jobTitle: Strategic Programs Director Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50681121.txt	§Strategic Programs Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Programs Director§§Advertiser: §News Corp Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Reporting to the Director, New Newsco, this role will be responsible for the coordination and successful delivery of business and financial outcomes through News Corp’s strategic transformation program. This will be achieved through an outstanding program and change management capability and fit for purpose programs governance structure.§Partnering with the Finance Directors, the Program workstream leaders and the Tech PMO, this role is also responsible for prioritisation of programs and escalation of key decisions to the Executive using a stage-gate and milestone tracking process.§ §What’s the role?§Establish and lead a core team with solid capability across; program execution, change management, program risk management, business architecture, and business process re-engineering§Ensure an appropriate program management framework, methodologies and tools are in place, incorporating Charters, stage gates, integrated roadmaps, cumulative change impacts, communication plans, risk management, cost and benefits management and interdependencies management§Manage roadmap schedule to execute the portfolio of initiatives to achieve the best outcomes for the business§Act as a liaison between the New Newsco Steerco and the program managers and business sponsors and assist program managers in the resolution of program related issues / problems§Support new scopings of work for new initiatives and convert to programs / initiatives. Taking them from design to implementation§Establish fit for purpose robust governance structure and operating rhythm to enable; timely and accurate information flow, progressive updates to Executive, timely decisions making, effective engagement and utilisation of Executive and senior leaders’ time§Facilitate informed decision making by the Executive, by providing fact based recommendations§Ensure interdependencies and portfolio risk are identified and managed / or escalated to the Executive for resolution where there are multiple programs or functions impacted§Provide a transparent / independent view of progress identifying conflicts and interdependencies to support communications and change management§Monitor and influence costs to be spent in line with budget and approved business cases§ §Who you are?§Solid experienced in strategic management and leadership across company functions directing substantial resources over long time frames§Experience in a media organisation§Strong commercial acumen - develop solutions based on an understanding of the business environment and objectives§Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems§Knows the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement§Strategic Mindset: Sees ahead to future possibilities and translates them into breakthrough strategies§Anticipates and balances the needs of multiple stakeholders§What’s in it for you?§Make a difference as part of Australia’s most influential media organisation§Opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward§Variety of work where no two days are the same§Collaborative environment§Who are we?§The nation's most influential media organisation, and the largest publisher across print and digital, News Corp Australia reaches an unduplicated audience of 16 million Australians every month. As well as our famous news and sport brands, we lead the way in fashion, food, health, real estate and parenting.§What’s next?§Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Facilitator Coach Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50675754.txt	§Facilitator Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilitator Coach§§Advertiser: §Automattic§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§*** Please apply directly on our website - https://grnh.se/e3da7eba1us ***§  §Automattic, is the company behind WordPress.com, Tumblr, Jetpack, WooCommerce, and WordPress VIP is looking for a thoughtful and experienced facilitator who also has 1-on-1 coaching skills to help us execute on the first line of our creed, “I will never stop learning.”§  §As our second Facilitator Coach, supporting employees across Asia-Pacific (APAC) and Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) time zones, you will facilitate individual and group sessions that teach general management best practices along with Automattic-specific strategies for success. One of our Learning and Development goals at Automattic is to develop more internal coaching and facilitation capacity among our Leads, and the group sessions that you facilitate will be one of the primary methods by which we do that.§  §You will be the eyes and ears of Learning and Development. Through both the group sessions you facilitate and 1-on-1 coaching sessions that may accompany them, you will help us distill the common challenges Automatticians experience across the company, and design new interventions to address them. You will report to our Chief Implementer of Learning and Development and work closely with him in every aspect of the role, helping to scale the Learning and Development organization.§  §About you§  §You are a seasoned group facilitator who also has 1-on-1 coaching experience. You have been a manager yourself in the past and ideally have experience leading product teams. You’re adept at building rapport and hold the view that people learn best when they come to the answers themselves. You have worked with other coaches in the past and can meaningfully contribute to improving the way we run our coaching program overall. Experience leading communities of practice (Masterminds, cohort-based learning, peer support groups, etc.) is a plus.§  §RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:§ § §Facilitating various group sessions that focus on unique Automattic needs like having difficult conversations, giving and receiving feedback, new lead onboarding, leading through uncertainty, etc.§ §Distilling learnings on our largest organizational challenges from your interactions with Automatticians.§ §Sourcing or publishing relevant leadership content for Automatticians.§ §Working with our Learning and Development Manager to improve the effectiveness of our coaching program.§ §Developing training modules to address additional leadership needs in conjunction with the rest of the Learning and Development Team.§ §REQUIREMENTS:§ § §4+ years of experience facilitating group sessions.§ §1-on-1 coaching experience.§ §Experience managing your own teams.§ §Exceptional written communication skills.§ §Highly organized, self-​motivated and able to work with significant autonomy.§ §A passion and personal interest in learning and optimization.§ §Availability to support Automatticians in APAC and EMEA time zones.§ §Experience working with distributed organizations is a plus but not required.§ §ABOUT AUTOMATTIC§  §We are the people behind WordPress.com, WooCommerce, Jetpack, Tumblr, and more. We believe in making the web a better place.§  §We’re a distributed company with more than 1200 Automatticians in 75+ countries speaking 90+ different languages. Our common goal is to democratize publishing so that anyone with a story can tell it, regardless of income, gender, politics, language, or where they live in the world.§  §We believe in Open Source and the vast majority of our work is available under the GPL.§  §DIVERSITY & INCLUSION AT AUTOMATTIC§  §We’re improving diversity in the tech industry. At Automattic, we want people to love their work and show respect and empathy to all. We welcome differences and strive to increase participation from traditionally underrepresented groups. Our D&I committee involves Automatticians across the company and drives grassroots change. For example, this group has helped facilitate private online spaces for affiliated Automatticians to gather and helps run a monthly D&I People Lab series for further learning. Diversity and Inclusion is a priority at Automattic, though our dedication influences far more than just Automatticians: We make our products freely available and translate our products into and offer customer support in numerous languages. We require unconscious bias training for our hiring teams and ensure our products are accessible across different bandwidths and devices. Learn more about our dedication to diversity and inclusion and our Employee Resource Groups.§  §HOW TO APPLY§  §Does this sound interesting? If yes, fill out our application form on the apply now page. In your cover letter, let us know what you can contribute to the team. Proofread! Make sure you spell and capitalize WordPress and Automattic correctly. We are lucky to receive many applications for this position, so try to make your application stand out. These are the questions you can expect on the application page.§Responses should be robust and thorough as we review all of these:§ § §Describe how you’ve evaluated the success or failure of a group process that you’ve facilitated along with the next steps you took after the evaluation.§ §In your experience what are the most common challenges that leaders face, and how do you address them in your sessions?§ §Describe a process you’ve personally undertaken to learn something challenging and the outcome.§ §What’s a question you have for us?§ §Please apply here:  https://grnh.se/e3da7eba1us§§§§

jobTitle: Business Intelligence Analyst - Deloitte Managed Solutions Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50714635.txt	§Business Intelligence Analyst - Deloitte Managed Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Intelligence Analyst - Deloitte Managed Solutions§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Intelligence Analyst - Deloitte Managed Solutions §      §        §§        §About the team§ The financial services industry is facing significant headwinds responding to misconduct which has resulted in a loss of customer trust and reputational damage. Organisations have responded by setting up large scale remediation programs and at Deloitte we run our remediation programs through the Deloitte Managed Solutions (DMS) practice.§ § Our objective is to assist clients who have operational processing challenges: typically, the need to undertake a large-scale remediation project in short timescales, whilst maintaining high quality and at a cost-competitive price. We have extensive experience in designing, implementing and managing high quality, cost efficient remediation programmes and complaint handling operations of all sizes.§ § §What will your typical day look like?§        §          §Specialisation in developing lean Business Processes within organisations. Substantial experience working with senior stakeholders, client partners and third party suppliers to deliver highly effective time and cost saving initiatives in short timescales. ​§          §Management of Developer, BA and Solutions Architect resources§          §Rolling Continuous Improvement sessions ​§          §Identification of efficiency opportunities in Process/Policy/Procedure§          §Optimisation of existing legacy systems and processes ​§          §Cost reduction via automation of manual tasks ​§          §Modelling MI solutions - Migration of client data (Access, Spreadsheets etc) onto more robust systems ​§          §Monitor data analytics and metrics results§          §Create and maintain design documentation, process flow maps§          §Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies that aligns with program’s vision§          §Develop policies and procedures for collection and analysis of data§          §Supporting business transition and helping to establish change§        §        §Enough about us, let’s talk about you. You are someone with:§ §        §          §Bachelor Degree - likely STEM§          §Minimum 5 years’ experience in professional services, financial services or relevant industry§          §Experience in working with Scrum team and possess knowledge on Agile practices§          §Experience in Identifying issues, risks and benefits of existing and proposed solutions and outlining business impacts§          §Exposure to cost estimations, change impact assessment and risk assessment§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ § At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§About the role§The Policy and Research Manager is responsible for leading a diverse range of policy, advocacy, research, health promotion and project management activities, role also includes an honorary appointment to eviDent Foundation as Policy and Research Manager to facilitate research projects and engage with eviDent’s stakeholders and provide briefings and advice to the eviDent Board and Dental Practice Based Research Network Committee.§Key responsibilities§Reporting to the CEO, you will:§undertake research and evaluation activities including designing and conducting literature reviews, surveys, content analysis and user experience testing§identify and nurture funding opportunities and contribute to the development and writing of competitive grants and other funding applications as required§conduct environmental monitoring across media, politics, government and the sector more broadly to keep the organisation abreast of policy developments, trends and discussions such as legislative and regulatory developments§research and analyse a wide range of policy issues to inform briefing papers and provide advice to the CEO, Board and Committees§lead and contribute to the development of policy documents, including external submissions, briefing and position papers§represent ADAVB (on behalf of the CEO) in meetings with politicians, within government and sector networks, committees and working groups§manage key projects and partnerships, including the supervision of project staff, and adherence to timelines and budgets§develop and provide input into media releases, social media communications, email communications, campaigns on health promotion and advocacy issues.§About you:§You will have:§Tertiary level qualifications in public health, social science, research, health promotion or a related discipline§Excellent oral and written communication skills§Experience in providing advice on policy issues, including articulation of key issues to a range of stakeholders and presenting papers at Board and committee levels§Demonstrated ability to work in partnership with multiple stakeholders, work independently and as part of a team§Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy§Demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities and complete a high standard of work within deadlines§Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)§About us§The ADAVB is the peak body for dentists in Victoria, representing and supporting dentists throughout every stage of their career and advocating for improved oral health for all Victorians. §Why us?§Flexible and friendly team environment§Diverse and rewarding role§Close to public transport§Immediate start available§What’s on offer?§$90,000-100,000 salary + performance premium + superannuation guarantee§Full time, permanent§Diverse and hands-on role§Modern offices, close to South Yarra station.§How to apply§For a copy of the position description, or for a confidential discussion about the position, please contact Meaghan Quinn on §8825 4600§ or email meaghan.quinn@adavb.org [link removed] §Applications must address each selection criteria, with a covering letter telling us why you want to work for the ADAVB, and include your CV. Send to meaghan.quinn@adavb.org [link removed]§Closing date: §            9am 22 October 2020§Interview date:§         30 October 2020. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§§§§

This is a unique opportunity for a dynamic individual who is driven in working towards a sustainable future with a wide array of blue chip industrial clients.  § § § §Reporting to the Sustainability Strategist, the Sustainability Specialist will develop and implement sustainability programs and customised client strategies and initiatives. The purpose of this role is to provide technical and on the ground support to Sustainability, Sales and Business Development teams to develop and deliver Veolia’s sustainability programs and customised client solutions. § §    §Key Responsibilities:§  § §Develop and implement customised sustainability strategies to support Veolia’s clients in achieving their sustainability goals; e.g zero waste to landfill, diversion strategies§ §Develop and implement customer focused sustainability programs that support specific industry needs and deliver measurable outcomes for that industry§ §Advise Veolia’s clients on best practice waste management in order to deliver greater efficiency and sustainability outcomes§ §Lead the implementation of best practice waste solutions across Veolia’s national client base§ §Prepare and present waste management strategies, diversion strategies and reports § §Identify growth opportunities and contribute to the growth strategy by achieving business development targets within key industry segments § §Ensure Veolia is well-represented and positioned as a professional, high quality and innovative environmental solutions business with the highest levels of customer service§ § §    §About You: Qualifications§  § §Graduate degree in environmental science or alike § §A Valid Drivers Licence§ § § §    §To be considered for this role, you must have:§  § §3-5 years waste sustainability experience onsite § §Knowledge of key sustainability practices, waste legislation and frameworks and key industries§ §Industry experience - mining, oil, gas§ §Waste auditing experience § §Advanced skills in Word and Excel/Google Docs and Sheets§ §A drive and passion for waste, recycling, and sustainability§ §Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage, communicate with all stakeholders and write professional reports § §Excellent presentation skills with the ability to present to diverse range of stakeholders § § §    §About Veolia:§  §Veolia is the only global company to provide a full range of environmental services in the fields of water solutions, waste management solutions and energy solutions.§ §With the global expertise gained from serving the environment for more than 150 years, Veolia operates in more than 40 countries around the world, with well over a hundred sites and approximately 4000 employees in Australia.§ § § §If you feel you would be suited to this role please apply today!§ § § §At Veolia we value diversity, equality and inclusion, we are committed to providing working environments where everyone is included and treated fairly and with respect.
