jobTitle: Expression of Interest –Senior Con & Managers, Health, Ageing and Human Services Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697039.txt	§Expression of Interest –Senior Con & Managers, Health, Ageing and Human Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Expression of Interest –Senior Con & Managers, Health, Ageing and Human Services§§Advertiser: §KPMG Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§Fantastic opportunity to develop your credentials in Management Consulting§§Collaborate with sector and technical experts to grow your knowledge and network§§Immerse yourself in our inclusive, diverse and supportive culture§§KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.§The National Health, Ageing and Human Services (HAHS) team within KPMG is a highly experienced and motivated team that has been involved in some of Australia's largest and most complex reform programs advancing the health and wellbeing of all Australians. We work shoulder to shoulder with our clients to support them as they face into the challenges facing all aspects of health care including digital disruption, increased demand for service, financial constraints and the increasing expectations of an empowered consumer.§Your Opportunity §We are always on the lookout for exceptional candidates at the Senior Consultant and Manager level to join KPMG’s HAHS team.  You will work across a variety of projects so you must enjoy stepping outside your comfort zone. Your ongoing responsibilities as a part of the team will include:§Manager§§Managing §concurrent §projects & teams§ to conceptualise, scope and structure of health engagements, ability to synthesise and analyse findings – and presenting them in clear and compelling ways – prepare reports and presentations at various points in a project§§Being involved in dynamic projects across the Health portfolio, which could include; system and service strategy and planning, clinical redesign and development of new models of care, eHealth digital transformation, service performance improvement, evaluation, commissioning and systems transformation.§§Developing and fostering §Client Relationships§ - Working directly with clients and alongside a diverse range of professionals to understand client challenges and build trust through credibility and delivery of quality outputs.§Ongoing §Professional Development§ - Strong focus on professional development with ongoing training and mentoring in one of the world’s most respected and trusted professional services firms.§Coaching§ and §mentoring§ of junior staff to rapidly form high performing teams that can rise to the deliver results for our clients challenge.§§Senior Consultant§ §§Assisting clients with a broad range of interesting and dynamic projects across the Health, Ageing and Human Services portfolio, these include service system redesign projects, evaluation and program reviews; the development of quality and safety standards and outcome measurement frameworks, workforce and service planning, cost benefit analyses and social return on investment analyses.§Working as a §team member§ to produce successful client solutions through an ability to synthesise and analyse findings – and presenting them in clear and compelling ways – prepare reports and presentations at various points in a project.§Ongoing §Professional Development§ - Strong focus on professional development with ongoing training and mentoring in one of the world’s most respected and trusted professional services firms.§§ § How are you Extraordinary?  §At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.§To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience should include:§§Demonstrated experience across one or more of the following areas; health care delivery, management consulting, health system and service strategy and planning, clinical redesign, service performance improvement, evaluation, commissioning and/or system [link removed][LE1] [link removed]  transformation. You will need a strong interest in and commitment to continuing to develop your skills in these areas.§Stakeholder engagement and management skills including interviews, workshops, and presentations.§Experience in consulting or project management with a track record of successful delivery.§Highly developed communication and reporting skills, including strong analytical and research skills with a focus on healthcare data sets.§Excellent teamwork and a willingness to travel within Australia§Tertiary qualifications in one of the following: health profession, healthcare management, program management, data and information management, information technology and/or equivalent experience would be desirable.§§This is a unique opportunity where you will get role diversity and work life balance. Each day will present new challenges and provide you with an opportunity to take your career and personal development to the next level.§**Please note you must be an Australian citizen to be considered for these opportunities §§ The KPMG Difference§We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.§We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.§This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.§§§Flexibility empowers wellbeing  [link removed]§§Flexibility enables contribution to the community [link removed]§§Flexibility inspires technology [link removed]§ & innovation§§Flexibility [link removed]§ supports family§ §Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!§§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50594380.txt	§Senior Management Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Management Consultant§§Advertiser: §Digital Purpose§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Digital Purpose is looking for a dynamic, versatile and experienced §Senior Management Consultant§ to join our Sydney-based digital consultancy and assist with both our growth strategy, and operational management and delivery. §About us§We design and build human-centred digital solutions for the social impact sector. From toy sharing apps for kids with disabilities and refugee employment systems, through to medical eLearning platforms and Indigenous procurement programs – we bring enterprise-grade design and development skills to the social impact sector.§Over the past two years Digital Purpose has built a solid reputation as a trusted partner delivering innovative solutions that meet the customer needs. Our team has doubled in size and we are still growing. Our projects range from the development of MVP’s for start ups to large scale government projects and always have a social purpose.§The more unique, ambitious and challenging our client’s mission is, the more interested we are in partnering with them.This is an exciting opportunity to make a difference, and to work with great clients and a highly motivated and passionate team.§About the role§We are looking for a Senior Management Consultant to join our team and help us on two fronts: §Internally you will be helping us mature our business processes and achieve greater efficiencies in how we operate. You will work directly with the CEO to ensure our growth strategy balances social impact, financial sustainability and operational success. You will assist with identifying and solving gaps in our skill sets, processes and team cohesion.  § §Externally you will be working with our clients to understand their business challenges, identify the solutions (both technical and process oriented) that will help them achieve their business goals and oversee the implementation, rollout and support of solutions needed, working closely with our technical delivery team. §Digital Purpose has a highly diverse mix of clients, ranging from pre-revenue, one-person startups up to high-profile, Government backed social change initiatives. You will be dealing daily with small and large clients, small and large projects, as well as clients from the startup, traditional corporate, not-for-profit and Government sectors. §In addition, we are a small team but growing exponentially so you will need to have proven experience working with both ends of the spectrum internally. Ideally you will have experience transitioning a company from small to medium (and ideally to large) and be able to hit the ground running and help us through this transition.   §Key requirements§At least 10 years commercial experience as a Management Consultant or similar, §A Bachelor's degree (equivalent) or higher§A demonstrated passion for and exposure to the social impact sector (either commercial or notable volunteer experience) and making a positive difference in the world§Commercial experience working with clients ranging from small startups to large, traditional corporates, Government agencies and not-for-profit organisations.§No-nonsense and results-driven, you like to be measured by outcomes, not effort§Excited about technology and experienced using it to create cutting edge, innovative solutions that solve genuine needs§Demonstrated customer empathy, with an ability to identify customer needs quickly and help map out solutions that span technology, operational and business model needs. §Proven experience in (IT) project delivery, including management processes and frameworks§Business development experience, helping find, shape and secure opportunities and being able to quote them realistically offering transparency to our customers§Experience driving the implementation of process improvements and business strategy recommendations, reviewing outcomes and recommending improvements§Experience developing relevant documentation for all stages from proposal through to delivery and post-review of client-related initiatives§Commercial team management skills, having helped lead teams through significant structural change and growth §Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills to build and maintain relationships with our clients§Flexible with outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities§Work from home while Covid demands it but then you must be available to join the team in our Surry Hills based office on work days, once that’s sensible to do§Remuneration and the application process§At Digital Purpose, our ethos is we pay fair market rates for our staff as per the wider industry. As such you can expect a salary on par with what the industry is paying for Senior Management Consultants at small to medium sized enterprises, with the opportunity for this to increase over time as Digital Purpose grows. Exact salary will be dependent on your personal experience and we will discuss this with you at the interview stage. §Please apply with your resume and a cover letter that indicates how you meet the requirements listed above. These are the key criteria we are looking for so please speak directly to these points to have your best chance of being considered. Do however include any additional information beyond these key points that you  §Applications will close on October 17. To ensure a fair process, we will only begin reviewing and shortlisting candidates after October 10, so please be aware that we will not be in contact with you before this date. §This is a permanent, full time job, based in Sydney, Australia. §We are not interested in hearing from recruiters or agencies looking to place people. Please do not contact us if you are one of these.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§§§

jobTitle: Change Manager Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681778.txt	§Change Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Manager§§Advertiser: §Southern Migrant And Refugee Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Change Manager §      §        §Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Change Manager§        § Not for Profit, Dynamic Environment, Attractive pay, Salary Packaging, Free parking§        §Do you want to be a part of a fabulous team that has passion to make a difference in the lives of the new arrivals in the community?  Look no further, this job is for you.  You will be a part of a dynamic environment that will stir your enthusiasm and instigate your abilities with striking challenges.§        §About us§        §SMRC is a not for profit organisation that aims at empowering the diverse communities in the South East Region of Melbourne to ensure inclusion in a unified Australian Society. We work in partnership with our communities and other stakeholders to ensure that the new comers in the community are well supported to reach their maximum potential by developing and delivering progressive programs using a strengths based approach. §        §SMRC has a diverse work force that is committed to innovation and quality improvement.  Our wellness program supports staff to pursue their interests that enhance their health and wellbeing.§        §We believe in integrating our values of empowerment, respect, integrity, resilience, diversity and inclusion in whatever we do.§        §The Position§        §The Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) – Change Manager, will be managing the change required to enable the successful deployment and adoption of the new ERP system and the associated changes in business processes, structure, staff roles and responsibilities.  The incumbent is responsible for the overall leadership and direction of an integrated approach to stakeholder engagement, communications, training, and support structures needed to effectively drive adoption of the new system and processes.§        §The role will support the General Manager Group Shared Services and the ERP Project Manager to meet the strategic objectives of Southern Migrant and Refugee Centre.§        §The ERP – Change Manager responsibilities includes:§        §          §Transforming business operations across the organisation in areas of finance, HR, rostering and field services and client management practices§          §Communicates and guides staff to a changed platform of operating business activities, from managing timesheets and leave, to processing invoices, to recording activities and reporting.§          §Manages the transition of business activities with the vendors and enacts on these changes with the ELT, Management and Staff.§          §Changing business processes across the organisation and gets the buy in from all staff.§          §Handles and manages resistance from staff and management in the adoption of the new best practice processes.§          §Understands the implementation stages of a large ERP application and works with management and staff to transition activities across into the new platform and new ways of operation.§          §Own and support the implementation of a holistic training program including training needs analysis, prepare training materials and organises training and information sessions.§          §Organises regular communication mediums to various staff across the organisation.§          §Can gauge staff vulnerabilities and concerns and implements strategies§          §Reports to the Project Sponsor, ELT on activities, progress and strategies for staff boarding§          §Duties as directed by the ERP Project Manager for successfully implementing the new ERP solution.§        §        § §        §Qualifications§        §          §A qualification in Business Management or Change Management.§          §Extensive knowledge and experience of implementing change management activities in the deployment to staff of a fully integrated ERP solution.§        §        §          §Experience in adopting Best Practice solutions for staff for the new ERP application§          §Strong knowledge and experience of change management principles, methodologies, and tools, including ADKAR.§          §Demonstrated experience in working within a project team and implementing large scale systems.§          §Strong reporting skills for senior management and the BOARD§ a multicultural workplace§        §        §The Location§        §This position is based in Dandenong, a great place to work because it is the most diverse region in Australia.  You do not need to travel the world to taste food from a large range of countries.  Dandenong Market which is at the doorsteps of SMRC offers you food from across the world at a price that does not pinch your pocket.§ date 16th October 2020§        §      §      §      §    §  §§§Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Change Manager§ § Not for Profit, Dynamic Environment, Attractive pay, Salary Packaging, Free parking§ §Do you want to be a part of a fabulous team that has passion to make a difference in the lives of the new arrivals in the community?  Look no further, this job is for you.  You will be a part of a dynamic environment that will stir your enthusiasm and instigate your abilities with striking challenges.§ §About us§ §SMRC is a not for profit organisation that aims at empowering the diverse communities in the South East Region of Melbourne to ensure inclusion in a unified Australian Society. We work in partnership with our communities and other stakeholders to ensure that the new comers in the community are well supported to reach their maximum potential by developing and delivering progressive programs using a strengths based approach. § §SMRC has a diverse work force that is committed to innovation and quality improvement.  Our wellness program supports staff to pursue their interests that enhance their health and wellbeing.§ §We believe in integrating our values of empowerment, respect, integrity, resilience, diversity and inclusion in whatever we do.§ §The Position§ §The Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) – Change Manager, will be managing the change required to enable the successful deployment and adoption of the new ERP system and the associated changes in business processes, structure, staff roles and responsibilities.  The incumbent is responsible for the overall leadership and direction of an integrated approach to stakeholder engagement, communications, training, and support structures needed to effectively drive adoption of the new system and processes.§ §The role will support the General Manager Group Shared Services and the ERP Project Manager to meet the strategic objectives of Southern Migrant and Refugee Centre.§ §The ERP – Change Manager responsibilities includes:§ § §Transforming business operations across the organisation in areas of finance, HR, rostering and field services and client management practices§ §Communicates and guides staff to a changed platform of operating business activities, from managing timesheets and leave, to processing invoices, to recording activities and reporting.§ §Manages the transition of business activities with the vendors and enacts on these changes with the ELT, Management and Staff.§ §Changing business processes across the organisation and gets the buy in from all staff.§ §Handles and manages resistance from staff and management in the adoption of the new best practice processes.§ §Understands the implementation stages of a large ERP application and works with management and staff to transition activities across into the new platform and new ways of operation.§ §Own and support the implementation of a holistic training program including training needs analysis, prepare training materials and organises training and information sessions.§ §Organises regular communication mediums to various staff across the organisation.§ §Can gauge staff vulnerabilities and concerns and implements strategies§ §Reports to the Project Sponsor, ELT on activities, progress and strategies for staff boarding§ §Duties as directed by the ERP Project Manager for successfully implementing the new ERP solution.§ § § §Qualifications§ § §A qualification in Business Management or Change Management.§ §Extensive knowledge and experience of implementing change management activities in the deployment to staff of a fully integrated ERP solution.§ §Experience in adopting Best Practice solutions for staff for the new ERP application§ §Strong knowledge and experience of change management principles, methodologies, and tools, including ADKAR.§ §Demonstrated experience in working within a project team and implementing large scale systems.§ §Strong reporting skills for senior management and the BOARD§ §Well-developed Interpersonal skills§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §Knowledge of working in a not for profit organisation§ §Appreciation of working in a multicultural workplace§ §The Location§ §This position is based in Dandenong, a great place to work because it is the most diverse region in Australia.  You do not need to travel the world to taste food from a large range of countries.  Dandenong Market which is at the doorsteps of SMRC offers you food from across the world at a price that does not pinch your pocket.§ §Interested?§ §For more information please read the position description on https://smrc.org.au/employment-at-smrc/ § §Your application must include:§ § §A cover letter outlining why you are applying for this position§ §A resume with your skills, experience and qualifications§ §Applications should apply directly through SEEK only.  Closing date 16th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a change manager?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of the software development lifecycle?§Do you have experience working in the not-for-profit sector?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Strategic Implementation Manager Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50635285.txt	§Strategic Implementation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Implementation Manager§§Advertiser: §United Super Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Working closely with several teams across Cbus, you will be responsible for the merger and corporate tender activity for Cbus; taking the lead role to scope, coordinate, execute and deliver on the strategic opportunities that align to our strategy and requirements of mergers and acquisitions.§ §You will be responsible for, but not limited to:§ § §Manage, support and contribute to due diligence process§ §Provide strategic guidance on potential legal risks and consequences of joint arrangements and M&A activities§ §Liaise with external parties to ensure implementation of the work program§ §Coordinate corporate documents relating to joint arrangements, M&A§ §Develop templates and precedents as required§ § A self-starter, you are proactive and love working in a collaborative environment.  You pride yourself on your strong planning and organisational skills and well-developed relationship building and stakeholder management. A confident communicator you can liaise at all levels with Executives, senior managers and staff in a credible and comfortable style. Your thinking is flexible and creative with pragmatic commercial problem-solving capabilities.  You have a high level of integrity together with strong personal and business ethics, sound judgement and a commitment to transparency and accountability.§   § §Why Cbus?§ You can be part of an award-winning organisation that is genuinely committed to delivering workplace diversity, inclusion and flexible working arrangements as an enabler of our purpose - to act in the best interest of our members and maximise their retirement outcomes. §   § Like to know more about working with Cbus? Listen to some of our videos with members of the Cbus team on our website. You will also be able to download the full position description from website - www.cbussuper.com.au/about-us/careers.§   § §About Cbus § Cbus is one of Australia’s largest industry superannuation funds and the national industry fund for the construction, building, infrastructure and allied industries. Established in 1984, Cbus provides superannuation benefits to over 780,000 members, has assets over $50 billion, and accepts contributions from more than 139 000 employers.§ § § § Applications Close: §Friday 9th October§   § § Applicants must have current rights to work in Australia§   § §Agencies, please note: All Cbus vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team.  Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50710188.txt	§Development Assessment Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Development Assessment Officer§§Advertiser: §Transport for NSW§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Dubbo & Central NSW§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §Development Assessment Officer §    §      §        §Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions.§We are responsible for strategy, planning, policy, regulation, funding allocation and other non-service delivery functions for all modes of transport in NSW including road, rail, ferry, light rail, point to point, regional air, cycling and walking.§We focus on improving the customer experience and contract public and private operators to deliver customer-focused transport services on our behalf.§We also lead the procurement of transport infrastructure and oversee delivery through project delivery offices and industry delivery partners.§        §          §Opportunity to make a real impact, shaping the future of NSW, §          §Progressive organisation that supports flexible working §          §Influence positive road network and safety outcomes for the benefit of the people and communities in regional NSW.§          §Fixed term full time opportunity (up to 24 months) – located in Parkes§        §        § §        §About Us §        §Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.§        § §        §The Regional and Outer Metropolitan division engages with our customers and communities. We connect regional NSW with safe and tailored transport choices, and contribute to strong economic growth and sustainability across the state.§        § §        §The opportunity §        §We have an exciting opportunity for a Development Assessment Officer to join our Regional and Outer Metropolitan division in the West region. This position plays a key role in coordinating and preparing responses to planning authorities and private developers for land use planning and development proposals.§        § §        §The Development Assessment Officer fulfils a crucial role in the Regional Customer Services team and demonstrates a strong focus on ensuring Transport for NSW meets its statutory obligations under the requirements of the Environmental Planning and Assessment Act, the Roads Act and various State Environmental Planning Policies in responding to development applications, development proposals and land use plans by adhering to legislative timeframes.§        § §        §This is an opportunity to make a real impact for the future of NSW. You will play an important role in helping to facilitate development in a safe and efficient manner and aligned with the priorities for regional NSW as part of a truly game changing §Future Transport§ strategy which will bring together several modes and cutting edge technologies to deliver satisfaction and safety for our customers while supporting a rapidly growing economy.§        § §        §Please §click here§ for a copy of the position description.§        § §        §About You§        §We are looking for a savvy professional with superior analytical and communication skills who has relevant tertiary qualifications and/or experience in town planning, engineering, environmental science or other appropriate discipline.  Knowledge of relevant NSW Government planning legislation and the Roads Act 1993, with the ability to understand and apply will need to be demonstrated.  Experience in resolving transport management issues and knowledge of relevant policies and standards is required.§        § §        §Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. Don’t miss out on your chance to be part of an historic $52.1b infrastructure boom! Apply today to register your interest. Find out more about Transport for NSW at §https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us§. §        § §        §Our Commitment to Diversity§        §Great people come from all walks of life. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve. We actively promote gender diversity in our workplaces, the employment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and the employment of people with a disability. We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call/text or email the contact person for this role.§        § §        §Salary and Benefits§        §The salary for this position is RMS USS Grade 8 ($102,098 - $109,561) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.§        § §        §At Transport our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. These include flexible working arrangements (subject to the needs of the business), professional development opportunities, health and wellbeing programs, and a program that helps you stay connected with work before, during and after parental leave. If you are looking for an environment in which you can contribute to creating a legacy of achievement that will last for generations, then we’d like to meet you.§        § §        §How to apply§To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application process.§For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click §here§. §For any enquiries, please contact Suzie Pose on §0466 023 167§ and quote 6206. §Applications close: 11:59pm on Thursday, 22 October 2020. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions.§We are responsible for strategy, planning, policy, regulation, funding allocation and other non-service delivery functions for all modes of transport in NSW including road, rail, ferry, light rail, point to point, regional air, cycling and walking.§We focus on improving the customer experience and contract public and private operators to deliver customer-focused transport services on our behalf.§We also lead the procurement of transport infrastructure and oversee delivery through project delivery offices and industry delivery partners.§ §Opportunity to make a real impact, shaping the future of NSW, § §Progressive organisation that supports flexible working § §Influence positive road network and safety outcomes for the benefit of the people and communities in regional NSW.§ §Fixed term full time opportunity (up to 24 months) – located in Parkes§ § § § §About Us § §Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. We connect regional NSW with safe and tailored transport choices, and contribute to strong economic growth and sustainability across the state.§ § § §The opportunity § §We have an exciting opportunity for a Development Assessment Officer to join our Regional and Outer Metropolitan division in the West region. You will play an important role in helping to facilitate development in a safe and efficient manner and aligned with the priorities for regional NSW as part of a truly game changing §Future Transport§ strategy which will bring together several modes and cutting edge technologies to deliver satisfaction and safety for our customers while supporting a rapidly growing economy.§ § § §Please §click here§ for a copy of the position description.§ § § §About You§ §We are looking for a savvy professional with superior analytical and communication skills who has relevant tertiary qualifications and/or experience in town planning, engineering, environmental science or other appropriate discipline.  Knowledge of relevant NSW Government planning legislation and the Roads Act 1993, with the ability to understand and apply will need to be demonstrated.  Experience in resolving transport management issues and knowledge of relevant policies and standards is required.§ § § §Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call/text or email the contact person for this role.§ § § §Salary and Benefits§ §The salary for this position is RMS USS Grade 8 ($102,098 - $109,561) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.§ § § §At Transport our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. These include flexible working arrangements (subject to the needs of the business), professional development opportunities, health and wellbeing programs, and a program that helps you stay connected with work before, during and after parental leave. If you are looking for an environment in which you can contribute to creating a legacy of achievement that will last for generations, then we’d like to meet you.§ § § §How to apply§To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application process.§For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click §here§. §For any enquiries, please contact Suzie Pose on §0466 023 167§ and quote 6206. §Applications close: 11:59pm on Thursday, 22 October 2020. §§§§

jobTitle: Head of Consulting (HR & Workforce Development) Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681275.txt	§Head of Consulting (HR & Workforce Development)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Consulting (HR & Workforce Development)§§Advertiser: §Globe 24-7 Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§annual bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Globe 24-7 is in search of an experienced and passionate Head of Consulting (HR & Workforce Development) to join the global leadership team in their East Perth head office. The incumbent will be responsible for development, growth and lead delivery of the Globe 24-7 HR Consulting and Workforce -Development business. This individual will be responsible for developing innovative HR Consulting solutions for new and existing clients throughout the global Mining industry. This will be achieved by working alongside Globe’s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Technical Officer in the Consulting and Workforce Development team to build strong relationships with new and existing clients in the local and international Mining industry.§ §The Company§Globe 24-7 is an international consulting company in Human Resources, Recruitment and Workforce Development solutions focused in the mining industry worldwide and are currently enjoying rapid growth and expansion of its service offering. For more information about us and this role, please give us a call!§ §The Role§The Head of Consulting (HR & Workforce Development) will encompass a number of responsibilities across Client/Project Delivery and Solution Management, Business Development, Marketing and ensuring they create an inspiring and engaged environment through leadership capability and approach§Responsibilities will also include:§Contribute to the creation and delivery of consulting proposals to help build out the methodology, delivery plan, resource allocation, deliverables, timelines, and pricing.§Create and develop complex HR and Workforce Development solutions for clients§A strong focus on business development, supporting and servicing existing and new clients - proactively build strong relationships that identify and develop new business opportunities.§Deliver on revenue targets currently in place and have comfort in generating new business revenue for the function§Responsible for building strong strategic/long lasting relationships with our client base and supporting/guiding them through current and future planning needs.§Responsible for ensuring the company is aligned with latest practises, technology and market trends in the Mining sector.§Develop business development and revenue generation strategies§Working closely with the Business Development team to ensure global opportunities are identified and the business has a clear approach to build pipeline inline with business growth projections.§Manage the Consulting P&L margins and profitability§Responsible for development of the function’s operational delivery whilst managing the day to day operations for the company.§Be seen as the Global authority and the go to subject matter expert through proactive online marketing, networking events/opportunities, speaking at conferences where possible.§ §The Requirements§As a successful candidate, it is essential that you possess the following skills, experience, and competencies:§10-15 years Human Resources/Consulting and Workforce Development experience in global resources industry with strong understanding of the mining sector.§Extensive knowledge of HR Consulting / Workforce Development in mining and emerging economies§Experience in Business Development activities and desire to participate in BD activities; networking events, conferences, marketing via word of mouth/LinkedIn etc§Proven experience effectively acquiring new clients/business through business development and relationship building§Proven experience consulting on best practise Human Resources/Workforce Development and providing complex and innovative solutions to clientele§Flexible with a high capacity to work effectively as part of a team as well as independently§Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders§Understanding of HSE in a mining context§The ability to travel 1-2 times per year or when needed in relation to projects and workflow.§ §The Rewards§The position offers an exciting opportunity to join a Global HR Consulting business with a sole focus on the Mining sector. Globe 24-7 is currently going through significant growth with a view to continue to partner with Mining companies to support their short and long term goals related to HR, Workforce Development and Recruitment.§ §Contact Us§Please apply directly by submitting your resume, preferably as a Microsoft Word document.§For any further questions, please reach out to Hannah Duffy on §0413 601 891§ or §h.duffy@globe24-7.com§. Interview and shortlisting will commence immediately.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Safety§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Officer §      §        §          §Fixed term to 31 December 2021 opportunity available§          §Salary range $85,279 to $96,759 plus superannuation §          §Be at the centre of the Youth Justice policy and reform§        §        §About us§        §The Department of Justice and Community Safety is responsible for the supervision of children and young people in the criminal justice system.§        §The Youth Justice Directorate Team leads and coordinates the response for operational incidents arising in Youth Justice, facilitates effective system-wide communications including information requests and  provides assurance to the Youth Justice executive, Secretary and Minister for Youth Justice and reporting on compliance with legislative, regulatory and standards requirements.§        §About the role§        §As a Project officer, you will be working in a complex and dynamic environment, liaising with frontline operational staff to for the Youth Justice executive, departmental stakeholders and Minister.§        §You will also assist in coordinating responses to information requests across the Youth Justice system, including subpoenas, reviews, royal commissions and requests for information under a number of information sharing schemes and legislation.§        §To be successful in this role you will:§        § Plans§          §Support the delivery of a project to embed safe systems of work in Youth Justice custody, including by mapping areas of risk and proposing systems of work that will prevent and tools to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our candidates and staff.  No face to face contact is required and induction training will also be completed online for those who are successful in securing a position with us.§      §      §For further information, please contact Linda Murray, Manager, Youth Justice Directorate at §Linda.Murray@justice.vic.gov.au§ §    §    §  §§§ §Fixed term to 31 December 2021 opportunity available§ §Salary range $85,279 to $96,759 plus superannuation § §Be at the centre of the Youth Justice policy and reform§ §About us§ §The Department of Justice and Community Safety is responsible for the supervision of children and young people in the criminal justice system.§ §The Youth Justice Directorate Team leads and coordinates the response for operational incidents arising in Youth Justice, facilitates effective system-wide communications including information requests and  provides assurance to the Youth Justice executive, Secretary and Minister for Youth Justice and reporting on compliance with legislative, regulatory and standards requirements.§ §About the role§ §As a Project officer, you will be working in a complex and dynamic environment, liaising with frontline operational staff to obtain information about incidents and post-incident reviews, preparing quality and timely responses to information requests, preparing briefings, and supporting the operation of central contact point for the Youth Justice executive, departmental stakeholders and Minister.§ §You will also assist in coordinating responses to information requests across the Youth Justice system, including subpoenas, reviews, royal commissions and requests for information under a number of information sharing schemes and legislation.§ §To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Provide responsive advice on evolving operational issues and incidents across Youth Justice's custodial and community operations.§ §Support the establishment and operation of a central Emergency Control Centre for Youth Justice, including coordinating emergency management processes across Youth Justice and developing head office Business Continuity and State Emergency Management Plans§ §Support the delivery of a project to embed safe systems of work in Youth Justice custody, including by mapping areas of risk and proposing systems of work that will prevent and respond to occupational health and safety risk§ §For more information on the accountabilities and key selection criteria for the role, please refer to the attached position description.§ §Why work Our values shape and influence how we recruit, train and develop our staff and build relationships with stakeholders.§ §We will also provide you with professional development opportunities, an employee assistance program, access to job opportunities across the Victorian Government, salary packaging and much more.§ §Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply.§ §How to apply§ §Please click the Apply button at the bottom of this advertisement to be redirected to our Youth Justice TXT website to complete your online application. § §The successful candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include national police checks and misconduct screening.§ §Please note:§ When completing the online application form, you will be required to respond to specific questions pertaining to the position's Key Selection Criteria. jobTitle: Project Consultant | Implementation Excellence, Client Relationship Management Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50650101.txt	§Project Consultant | Implementation Excellence, Client Relationship Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Consultant | Implementation Excellence, Client Relationship Management§§Advertiser: §Maximus International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Consultant | Implementation Excellence, Client Relationship Management §      §        §Who is Maximus?§        §Maximus is a top leadership consultancy specialising in transforming organisations from the inside out. We partner with clients to understand and embed solutions that create a measurable and immediate impact on their bottom-line. With a proven track record in delivering results, our team of consultants have successfully worked with over 40,000 of Australia's leaders and delivered a broad range of transformative leadership solutions for nearly 20 years.§        §The Opportunity§        §We are seeking a full time Project Consultant/Analyst to join our Melbourne team who enjoys a fast pace, produces quality work and thrives on working in a team environment. jobText: TXT/50688125.txt	§Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Business SA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Corporate Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §Level 1, 136 Greenhill Road§ Unley SA 5061§ Phone §(08) 8300 0000§ business-sa.com §    §      §Facilitator §      §        §Strengthening Business Facilitator §        §Adelaide Hills/Mount Barker§        §Entrepreneurs' Programme§        §The Entrepreneurs' Programme is the Australian Government's flagship initiative for driving business growth and competitiveness. The Strengthening Business service from the Entrepreneurs' Programme is helping businesses recover from the effects of the 2019-20 bushfires. Business SA is one of seven Delivery Partners across Australia working in partnership with the Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources under a Federally funded contract.§        §We are a looking for an experienced business adviser with a strong network in the Adelaide Hills.§        §You will be working with businesses to develop a roadmap to navigate the challenges and opportunities they are facing as a result of the summer bushfires. You will work with businesses to develop strategies and goals to achieve in the immediate and medium term and to develop a longer term roadmap, building their capability. You will work with businesses strategically to identify opportunities to strengthen and transform the way they may operate in the future. §        §We are seeking a commercial and outcome-based business facilitator to join our existing team. We are looking for a customer centric, commercial and results oriented professional with a passion for innovation, emerging technologies, growth and entrepreneurship.§        §You will have exceptional relationship building skills and be responsible for business development, establishing strong regional networks and the ability to build a strong customer pipeline. You will have demonstrated experience in building, maintaining and managing a pipeline of customers. You will manage a portfolio of clients and will be responsive to clients by offering tailored advice, tools and solutions to improve their recover and growth outcomes.§        §You will work as part of the South Australian team to ensure client needs are met and engagements managed to achieve improved business outcomes.  You will be part of a national network of facilitators.§        §You will combine your industry experience with your ability and skills to create and embed capabilities, frameworks and methodologies to provide one to one or one to many services tailored to the needs of businesses.§        §We are looking for a facilitator who can bring fresh and contemporary thinking, intuition and judgement to rapidly deliver outcomes for customers.§        §To be successful it is essential you have the following skills, experience and expertise:§        §          §Senior level, typically 10 years, experience in business management, operational management or consulting.§ industry characteristics and challenges.§          §Excellent writing skills including the ability to communicate complex information to non-specialists in a clear and succinct way.§          §Proven ability to use well-defined, concise language in correspondence as well as including content appropriate for the purpose and audience when preparing written briefs and reports.§          §Ability to read, interpret and analyse financial and other information or data as required.§          §Demonstrated experience (or the ability to transfer relevant skills) to undertake and manage the delivery of services to businesses within a Government program, including an inherent requirement for computer literacy.§          §Advanced stakeholder, relationship, client management and engagement skills and experience.§          §Excellent communication, interpersonal, representation, influencing and negotiation skills.§          §Demonstrated experience in business development and actively building, maintaining and managing a pipeline of customers.§          §Strong business analysis and systems analysis skills and experience.§          §The ability and skills to manage projects that deliver outcomes for customers.§          §The ability and skills to create and embed capabilities, frameworks and methodologies in customers’ businesses.§          §Awareness of, respect for, and sensitivity to, the diversity of the Australian public to deliver fit for purpose advice and support.§          §Business related Tertiary qualification(s)§        §        §You will be joining our existing team of experienced facilitators delivering services across South Australia, reporting directly to the General Manager, Business Advisory. You will be looking after clients in the Adelaide Hills and Mount Barker and will have the ability to work autonomously from home. The role offers an excellent salary package with an additional motor vehicle allowance.§        §The position is available on a fixed term contract to 30 June 2022 based on Federal Government funding.§        §If you believe you have the skills, desire and commitment to delivering high quality professional advice, we are very keen to hear from you.  Business SA is §an equal opportunity employer with flexible working practices. All§ applicants will be considered for §employment§ without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.§        §For more information on the Strengthening Business Programme or for a copy of the Position Description please go to https://www.business-sa.com/careers. If you have any questions please email Jenny Briggs, Executive Director, Employer Solutions and Programs at §jennyb@business-sa.com§.  Please submit your letter of application, outlining your experience and your CV, detailing your relevant experience in a similar position, via the apply button by no later than close of business by Friday 23 October 2020.§      §    §  §§§Strengthening Business Facilitator § §Adelaide Hills/Mount Barker§ §Entrepreneurs' Programme§ §The Entrepreneurs' Programme is the Australian Government's flagship initiative for driving business growth and competitiveness. The Strengthening Business service from the Entrepreneurs' Programme is helping businesses recover from the effects of the 2019-20 bushfires. You will have demonstrated experience in building, maintaining and managing a pipeline of customers. following skills, experience and expertise:§ § §Senior level, typically 10 years, experience in business management, operational management or consulting.§ §Have a deep understanding of Australian SMEs including the factors influencing them and barriers to growth.§ §Have an in-depth understanding of, and empathy and respect for, local industry characteristics and challenges.§ §Excellent writing skills including the ability to communicate complex information to non-specialists in a clear and succinct way.§ §Proven ability to use well-defined, concise language in correspondence as well as including content appropriate for the purpose and audience when preparing written briefs and reports.§ §Ability to read, interpret and analyse financial and other information or data as required.§ §Demonstrated experience (or the ability to transfer relevant skills) to undertake and manage the delivery of services to businesses within a Government program, including an inherent requirement for computer literacy.§ §Advanced stakeholder, relationship, client management and engagement skills and experience.§ §Excellent communication, interpersonal, representation, influencing and negotiation skills.§ §Demonstrated experience in business development and actively building, maintaining and managing a pipeline of customers.§ §Strong business analysis and systems analysis skills and experience.§ §The ability and skills to manage projects that deliver outcomes for customers.§ §The ability and skills to create and embed capabilities, frameworks and methodologies in customers’ businesses.§ §Awareness of, respect for, and sensitivity to, the diversity of the Australian public to deliver fit for purpose advice and support.§ §Business related Tertiary qualification(s)§ §You will be joining our existing team of experienced facilitators delivering services across South Australia, reporting directly to the General Manager, Business Advisory. You will be looking after clients in the Adelaide Hills and Mount Barker and will have the ability to work autonomously from home. The role offers an excellent salary package with an additional motor vehicle allowance.§ §The position is available on a fixed term contract to 30 June 2022 based on Federal Government funding.§ §If you believe you have the skills, desire and commitment to delivering high quality professional advice, we are very keen to hear from you.  Business SA is §an equal opportunity employer with flexible working practices. All§ applicants will be considered for §employment§ without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.§ §For more information on the Strengthening Business Programme or for a copy of the Position Description please go to https://www.business-sa.com/careers. If you have any questions please email Jenny Briggs, Executive Director, Employer Solutions and Programs at §jennyb@business-sa.com§.  Please submit your letter of application, outlining your experience and your CV, detailing your relevant experience in a similar position, via the apply button by no later than close of business by Friday 23 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of business development experience do you have?§How many years of business management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Manager - Assets Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50710370.txt	§Senior Manager - Assets§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager - Assets§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Manager - Assets §      §        § §        §          §Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best§          §World-class learning and leadership programs§          §Salary packaging - to suit your personal and financial circumstances§          §Banking, finance and wellbeing program discounts§          §Experience a borderless career - international assignment or secondment opportunities§        §        §The Deloitte Consulting - Assets Team provides a dynamic environment where you will work on challenging projects, across a range of client organisations.§ § §About the team§ § Our global team is growing rapidly in response to market demands for critical infrastructure to support the rapid urbanisation of the world. Capital intensive sectors such as Transport, Social Infrastructure, Energy & Resources, Manufacturing and Telecommunications invest substantial sums each year in their capital projects and programmes. We give our clients confidence in the face of challenges such as today's need to deliver more with less through to understanding and managing the risks of large capital programmes. We are passionate about the opportunity for technology to transform the delivery and operation of capital assets and apply a digital lens to everything we do.§ § Our Australian team draws on hands-on industry expertise and extensive experience from some of the world's largest and most complex capital projects. The team enables clients to set up, build and operate major projects with greater confidence in the results. We bring our clients this confidence through our focussed offering that focus on driving improved performance across the end to end asset lifecycle through the application of digital technologies to capital project development, delivery and commissioning and into asset operations, management and maintenance, including improved management of the supporting enterprise.§ § §About the role§ §        §          §Engage directly with high profile clients on their most important and challenging business issues and addressing and solving their priority capital project problems§          §Work with a high performing team with a strong commitment to excellence in pursuit of helping our clients drive profitability and performance through their capital programmes§          §Draw on Deloitte’s unique capabilities in Design thinking, Digital, Data Analytics, Deloitte Access Economics and experience from our global consulting network.§          §Demonstrate an exceptional understanding of complex program management and the ability to manage multiple work streams in an agile manner and a diverse group of stakeholders through a sustainable change program.§          §Undertake extensive operations focused training and development (both structured and on the job) with the opportunity to experience borderless careers through international assignments and secondments§          §Provide team leadership mentoring and proven capabilities in people management§          §Work on some of the most challenging private and public sector capital programmes in the Region§          §A career in Assets means you will be working alongside Australia’s leaders solving the toughest problems - you never have a boring day.§        §        §About your Experience§ § In response to strong client demand for our services we are currently seeking an outstanding Consulting Senior Manager with extensive assets or capital projects advisory and transformation/change experience. To be apart of the National Leadership team where you will be able to grow and expand the current team.§ § To succeed in this role, you will have:§ §        §          §Extensive consulting experience in a Tier 1 Consulting firm, boutique strategy house, engineering advisory firm or government’.§          §Must have a strong infrastructure and capital projects development and delivery background§          §Experience in major transport projects is preferred however not essential§          §Experience in asset management is preferred however not essential§          §Proven experience in leading project teams, demonstrating exceptional business development, communications and client relationship skills§          §Highly developed analytical skills with a track record for solving complex business problems§          §Experience in the use of structured consulting approaches / frameworks is preferred§          §Highly effective communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to build strong relationships with a range of clients§          §Strong problem solving skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment§          §Curiosity to learn and proactivity to bring forward ideas§          §Strong sense of team and passion to develop others as well as self.§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § §Next Steps§ § Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now!§ § If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Annabel Hooton We’d love to hear from you.§ § §‘By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally.’§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best§World-class learning and leadership programs§Salary packaging - to suit your personal and financial circumstances§Banking, finance and wellbeing program discounts§Experience a borderless career - international assignment or secondment opportunities§The Deloitte Consulting - Assets Team provides a dynamic environment where you will work on challenging projects, across a range of client organisations.§ § §About the team§ § Our global team is growing rapidly in response to market demands for critical infrastructure to support the rapid urbanisation of the world. Capital intensive sectors such as Transport, Social Infrastructure, Energy & Resources, Manufacturing and Telecommunications invest substantial sums each year in their capital projects and programmes. We give our clients confidence in the face of challenges such as today's need to deliver more with less through to understanding and managing the risks of large capital programmes. We are passionate about the opportunity for technology to transform the delivery and operation of capital assets and apply a digital lens to everything we do.§ § Our Australian team draws on hands-on industry expertise and extensive experience from some of the world's largest and most complex capital projects. The team enables clients to set up, build and operate major projects with greater confidence in the results. We bring our clients this confidence through our focussed offering that focus on driving improved performance across the end to end asset lifecycle through the application of digital technologies to capital project development, delivery and commissioning and into asset operations, management and maintenance, including improved management of the supporting enterprise.§ § §About the role§ §Engage directly with high profile clients on their most important and challenging business issues and addressing and solving their priority capital project problems§Work with a high performing team with a strong commitment to excellence in pursuit of helping our clients drive profitability and performance through their capital programmes§Draw on Deloitte’s unique capabilities in Design thinking, Digital, Data Analytics, Deloitte Access Economics and experience from our global consulting network.§Demonstrate an exceptional understanding of complex program management and the ability to manage multiple work streams in an agile manner and a diverse group of stakeholders through a sustainable change program.§Undertake extensive operations focused training and development (both structured and on the job) with the opportunity to experience borderless careers through international assignments and secondments§Provide team leadership mentoring and proven capabilities in people management§Work on some of the most challenging private and public sector capital programmes in the Region§A career in Assets means you will be working alongside Australia’s leaders solving the toughest problems - you never have a boring day.§About your Experience§ § In response to strong client demand for our services we are currently seeking an outstanding Consulting Senior Manager with extensive assets or capital projects advisory and transformation/change experience. To be apart of the National Leadership team where you will be able to grow and expand the current team.§ § To succeed in this role, you will have:§ §Extensive consulting experience in a Tier 1 Consulting firm, boutique strategy house, engineering advisory firm or government’.§Must have a strong infrastructure and capital projects development and delivery background§Experience in major transport projects is preferred however not essential§Experience in asset management is preferred however not essential§Proven experience in leading project teams, demonstrating exceptional business development, communications and client relationship skills§Highly developed analytical skills with a track record for solving complex business problems§Experience in the use of structured consulting approaches / frameworks is preferred§Highly effective communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to build strong relationships with a range of clients§Strong problem solving skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment§Curiosity to learn and proactivity to bring forward ideas§Strong sense of team and passion to develop others as well as self.§Why Deloitte?§ At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. jobTitle: Quality Improvement Manager Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50675888.txt	§Quality Improvement Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Quality Improvement Manager§§Advertiser: §St Vincent de Paul Society§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$85000 - $94999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Quality Improvement Manager §      §The St Vincent de Paul Society Canberra/Goulburn has been serving the local community since 1924. We are a charity offering a ‘hand up’ to people in need, regardless of their creed, ethnic or social background, health, gender or political opinion. We do this by respecting peoples' dignity, sharing our hope and by encouraging people to take control of their own destiny. We work to shape a more just and compassionate society. We help people in a large geographic area surrounding the ACT - to Lake Cargelligo in the west, across the Snowy Mountains to Tumut, down to Eden, up to Batemans Bay and inland to Crookwell. The Society’s services are the result of the combined effort of our members, volunteers and employees.§        §All about our Position  §        §The Society attempts to help as many struggling and vulnerable people as possible. To do this, we are in the process of attaining accreditation to that we can expand our programs as needed and ensure we are meeting best practice.§        §We have an exciting opportunity to join our Corporate Services team as a Quality Improvement Manager. This role will be responsible for drafting, implementing, monitoring, evaluating and reviewing internal policies, procedures and processes, ensuring they provide compliant, appropriate and effective governance for the Society. You will develop and design quality control processes to ensure all of the Society's various services adhere to legal and safety standards, our Strategic Plan and our Vision, Mission and Values.§        §The successful applicant will need to be an excellent communicator and able to engage effectively with internal stakeholders to communicate and implement the quality and compliance measures required. Your outstanding relationship management skills will enable our projects, programs and services to run efficiently and thereby meet the Society's present and future needs.§        §At least 3 years' previous experience in a similar roll, including project management and business analysis is essential, as well as tertiary qualifications in business administration or a relevant field. You must also have a current driver's licence and high level computer skills.§        §This is a role for someone ready to hit the ground running! If you are outgoing, organised, with a high attention to detail and self motivated to complete what needs to be done in a timely manner....read on as you may be ready to take on the Vinnies challenge!§        §Please read the position description plus the information about working with us on our website - https://www.vinnies.org.au/page/Get_Involved/Join_our_staff/ACT/§        §If you need further assistance, please contact the Director's Secretariat – Sarah Clifton on §0409 821 720§.§        §Working Conditions  §        §You will be working under our Enterprise Agreement.§ Status: Full time § Hours per week: 38 § Remuneration: Minimum $88 609.72 pa but negotiable based on experience § Superannuation: 11% § Location: Yarralumla § Equipment: Mobile Phone and laptop computer §Other great reasons to join - Enjoy the rewards that come from working for a charity such as salary packaging which increases the tax-free portion of your wage, and therefore, your take home pay. We are a family friendly workplace and encourage flexible working arrangements. You will have access to development opportunities and variety of work to keep you interested. You will be working in a small but passionate team that makes a genuine difference for people in need in the Canberra region.§        §How to Apply  §        §Send us your curriculum vitae and a two (2) page letter that address the selection criteria via SEEK.§        §Applications will be reviewed as they come in, and interviews may be offered before the closing date.§        §Applications close:§ Sunday, 25 October 2020§      §      §      §    §  §§§The St Vincent de Paul Society Canberra/Goulburn has been serving the local community since 1924. We are a charity offering a ‘hand up’ to people in need, regardless of their creed, ethnic or social background, health, gender or political opinion. We do this by respecting peoples' dignity, sharing our hope and by encouraging people to take control of their own destiny. We work to shape a more just and compassionate society. We help people in a large geographic area surrounding the ACT - to Lake Cargelligo in the west, across the Snowy Mountains to Tumut, down to Eden, up to Batemans Bay and inland to Crookwell. The Society’s services are the result of the combined effort of our members, volunteers and employees.§ §All about our Position  § §The Society attempts to help as many struggling and vulnerable people as possible. To do this, we are in the process of attaining accreditation to that we can expand our programs as needed and ensure we are meeting best practice.§ §We have an exciting opportunity to join our Corporate Services team as a Quality Improvement Manager. This role will be responsible for drafting, implementing, monitoring, evaluating and reviewing internal policies, procedures and processes, ensuring they provide compliant, appropriate and effective governance for the Society. You will develop and design quality control processes to ensure all of the Society's various services adhere to legal and safety standards, our Strategic Plan and our Vision, Mission and Values.§ §The successful applicant will need to be an excellent communicator and able to engage effectively with internal stakeholders to communicate and implement the quality and compliance measures required. Your outstanding relationship management skills will enable our projects, programs and services to run efficiently and thereby meet the Society's present and future needs.§ §At least 3 years' previous experience in a similar roll, including project management and business analysis is essential, as well as tertiary qualifications in business administration or a relevant field. You must also have a current driver's licence and high level computer skills.§ §This is a role for someone ready to hit the ground running! If you are outgoing, organised, with a high attention to detail and self motivated to complete what needs to be done in a timely manner....read on as you may be ready to take on the Vinnies challenge!§ §Please read the position description plus the information about working with us on our website - https://www.vinnies.org.au/page/Get_Involved/Join_our_staff/ACT/§ §If you need further assistance, please contact the Director's Secretariat – Sarah Clifton on §0409 821 720§.§ §Working Conditions  § §You will be working under our Enterprise Agreement.§ Status: Full time § Hours per week: 38 § Remuneration: Minimum $88 609.72 pa but negotiable based on experience § Superannuation: 11% § Location: Yarralumla § Equipment: Mobile Phone and laptop computer §Other great reasons to join - Enjoy the rewards that come from working for a charity such as salary packaging which increases the tax-free portion of your wage, and therefore, your take home pay. We are a family friendly workplace and encourage flexible working arrangements. You will have access to development opportunities and variety of work to keep you interested. You will be working in a small but passionate team that makes a genuine difference for people in need in the Canberra region.§ §How to Apply  § §Send us your curriculum vitae and a two (2) page letter that address the selection criteria via SEEK.§ §Applications will be reviewed as they come in, and interviews may be offered before the closing date.§ §Applications close:§ Sunday, 25 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Three words that spark apprehension in most businesses. But our team of experts are constantly curious and excited about combining our wonderful array of technological expertise to transform data into our clients most valuable assets making their work smarter.§ § We primarily seek to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of organisations at all stages of the data transformation journey from designing the change required to delivering and managing that change and providing assurance around change initiatives.§ § As a Big Data Manager, you will be an integral part of one of the fastest growing teams in Australia and build best in class data frameworks.§ § §What will your typical day look like?§ § As a Manager in our Big Data team you will - Lead the development and delivery of data solutions for our clients with strong focus on building cloud based big data platforms;
