jobTitle: Assistant Research Analyst Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50570817.txt	§Assistant Research Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Research Analyst§§Advertiser: §BPA Analytics§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $54,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§About us§ §BPA Analytics are established social researchers who specialise in measuring and analysing §Organisational Culture§.§ §Based in Brisbane, BPA has an extensive client-base in the Health and Community Services Sector throughout Australia, New Zealand and growing in the UK.§ §BPA's office is located in the Brisbane CBD and benefits from a location supported by many public transport options.§ § § §About the position§ §This role is primarily focused on the providing analytical assistance and quality assurance support in:§ § §Survey preparation, data cleansing, analytical stress-testing, and report preparation;§ §Benchmarking Analysis §(comparative analysis between organisations and sectors);§ §Linguistic Analysis §(thematic analysis of narrative text);§ §Red Flags Analysis§ (thematic analysis of allegations of contentious or harmful behaviours);§ §Structural Mapping§ (mapping of organisational sub-cultures); and§ §Statistical Analysis§ (you already know what this means).§ §This position is available now for an experienced applicant who is ready to hit the ground running. Pay on commencement will start at $50,000 p.a. plus superannuation. § § § §About you§ §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §Qualifications relevant to the analysis of Organisational Culture (perhaps Organisational Psychology or Sociology);§ §Experience in the study/analysis of group norms, preferably in organisations;§ §Advanced skills in statistical and/or linguistic analysis;§ §Exceptional attention to detail; and§ §Above all, the ability to create insightful analysis in a commercial, deadline driven environment.§ § § §How to apply§ §Send us a copy of your CV along with your Academic Transcript. This will be how you make your first impression.§ §Enquiries may be directed to Joanne Hanmer via email at §Joanne.Hanmer@bpanz.com§.§ §You must be an Australian Citizen or Australian Permanent Resident to apply for this role.§ §NO AGENCIES PLEASE§ §The closing date for this application is Friday, 2nd October 2020.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Manager Customer & Business Services  Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50644323.txt	§Manager Customer & Business Services §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Customer & Business Services §§Advertiser: §SA Water§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§Attractive Salary and benefits offered§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§The Australian Water Quality Centre (AWQC), a business unit of SA Water, is committed to continually developing people, practices and technologies to professionally deliver highly valued laboratory services to the water industry across Australia and globally. World-renowned for its expertise in water and wastewater analytical services and professional advice, the AWQC’s dedicated team of water industry professionals is at the forefront of water quality science and the protection of public health.§An exciting opportunity now exists for an accomplished results-driven §Manager Customer & Business Services§ to lead AWQC Laboratory Services business support team, ensuring the effective management and improvement of AWQC’s customer services, quality management and business systems functions to deliver value and achieve exceptional customer satisfaction. Drive the development and improvement of AWQC’s business management and technology systems to meet the current and future needs of the business and to improve the customer experience.§This role requires extensive experience in leading and transforming customer service teams in a fast-paced commercial business environment. With a proven history of managing successful customer service teams and improving customer relationships, service delivery and performance, and business growth, you will prepare, equip and support teams to successfully adopt change in order to bring about innovation and improvements.§About your new opportunity§§Build and lead a high-performing team that works collaboratively and embraces change to improve outcomes for our customers and business§Provide valued customer services to meet all customer requirements and ensure a high level of customer satisfaction§Ensure provision of all customer facing services of service scheduling, sample logistics, advice, result notification, reporting, quoting and invoicing, including response to operational enquiries and incidents for customers§Seek and keep abreast of customer feedback and incorporate this into functional delivery plans§Anticipate and act on customer and business needs, ensuring Customer & Business Services provides solutions that add value to our customers and business§Lead the effective and efficient management and improvement of AWQC’s quality and business systems to add value to AWQC’s customers and overall business operations§Identify and pursue innovation, implement new technology and systems development to improve customer experience and streamline laboratory, field and customer services functions§Explore the current and future needs of all customers, identifying opportunities to grow business and translating this into strong revenue growth§Achieve financial budget, efficiency and productivity targets.§§What you need to be successful:§§Tertiary qualifications in business management/customer service/finance/accounting or science/engineering or related fields with at least five years’ experience in managing customer service teams in a commercial environment§Extensive experience in customer relationship management, ability to develop and promote tailored solutions to customer needs§Demonstrated capability and experience in developing positive highly performing teams§Experience in constructively leading teams through continuous improvement, driving customer value, jobTitle: Policy and Program Officer Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50668119.txt	§Policy and Program Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy and Program Officer§§Advertiser: §National Aboriginal Community Controlled§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Company Profile§  §The National Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Organisation (NACCHO) is the national peak body representing 143 Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Services (ACCHOs). ACCHOs deliver comprehensive primary health care to more than half of the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples nationally. As an act of self-determination, these ACCHOs attend to all matters affecting health and wellbeing spanning transformative community empowerment through to individual health treatments and continuity of care.§  §NACCHO’s work is focused on supporting the work of ACCHOs and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people overall through negotiating and advocating with Governments on health care policies and programs and systems reform.  These issues range in variety from chronic disease management, preventative health strategies, telehealth, listing of Medical Benefits Scheme (MBS) to the social determinants of health. §  §NACCHO partners with organisations including: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RACGP), Royal College of Physicians, the Pharmacy Guild of Australia and the Pharmaceutical Society of Australia greatly contributes to significantly to enhancing health care for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.§  §It is a very interesting and transformative time across the health sector currently not the least being the COVID-19 pandemic.  NACCHO co-chairs the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Advisory Committee on COVID-19 with the Commonwealth Department of Health and is also a member of the Committee developing a 10-year Primary Health Care Plan.§  §NACCHO is also host to the Coalition of Peaks Secretariat.    The Coalition of Peaks is a representative body of around 50 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander community controlled peak organisations and members. The Coalition of Peaks came together as an act of self-determination to be formal partners with Australian governments on Closing the Gap.  The Secretariat supports the work of the Coalition of Peaks; and has been established through a grant by the Commonwealth Government.§  § §  §About the role§  §The Policy and Program Officer will work on a range of policy areas including:§ § §Disability§ §Chronic Diseases§ §Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health workforce issues§ §Social determinants of health§ §NACCHO are contracted to deliver a number of new program areas that will help build the capacity of our member ACCHOs. These programs are in the policy areas of health and disability and the Policy and Program Officer will be responsible for the program management of these.  §  §The successful candidate will foster a network of Program Officers across all jurisdictional Affiliates whose focus will be promoting and supporting ACCHOs in the implementation of the program. The Policy and Program Officer will also be responsible for the development, implementation and evaluation of capacity building grants provided to ACCHOs and/or working with ACCHOs in the prioritisation of capacity building activities. §  § §  §Type of person NACCHO is seeking§  §It isn’t essential the person has experience in the health or disability sector, but they will have the skills to quickly gain the knowledge and the agility to work across issues in short time frame. If not having worked with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people they will have an understanding and awareness of their history, culture and health and other issues affecting them.§  §We are seeking a motivated individual with:§ § §demonstrated ability in problem solving in a complex and evolving environment.§ §demonstrated experience in stakeholder engagement, including ability to negotiate the implementation of policy outcomes.§ §excellent communication and writing skills including the ability to present complex and technical information in a simple and concise manner, and tailor written material to different audiences.§ §demonstrated ability to prioritise work and meet deadlines while producing high quality work.§ §demonstrated ability to work in a diverse team environment and achieve positive results where a holistic approach to policy development is required.§ §demonstrated ability to work and priortise in an ever- changing environment§ §understanding of the NDIS (desirable capability).§ § §  §Qualifications§ § §tertiary qualifications in policy or related field.§ § §  §Experience§  §demonstrated experience in policy development, program management, analysis review and implementation (NDIS specific would be a bonus).§  § §  §Clearances§  §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a Police Check and Working with Vulnerable People Clearance.§  § §  §Enquiries§  §Enquires regarding this position are to be submitted via email to §Jess.Styles@naccho.org.au§  § §  §How to apply§  §Applicants are required to submit a resume and a detailed cover letter demonstrating their suitability to the position.   Applications are to be submitted using the “Apply” function. §  § §  §Closing date§  §Friday 16 October 2020, 9.00am.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Economist Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50674206.txt	§Economist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economist§§Advertiser: §The World Bank§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Do you want to build a career that is truly worthwhile? Working at the World Bank Group provides a unique opportunity for you to help our clients solve their greatest development challenges. The World Bank Group is one of the largest sources of funding and knowledge for developing countries; a unique global partnership of five institutions dedicated to ending extreme poverty, increasing shared prosperity and promoting sustainable development. With 189 member countries and more than 120 offices worldwide, we work with public and private sector partners, investing in groundbreaking projects and using data, research, and technology to develop solutions to the most urgent global challenges. § §The World Bank Group (WBG) is seeking to recruit an Economist, to be stationed in Sydney, Australia and will be involved in a combination of macroeconomic monitoring, Development Policy Operations and analytical work.  § §This is a 4 year term appointment.§ §Note:§ Given local law, please note that applicants must have the ability to legally work in Australia to be considered.§ §The responsibilities will include:§ §* Lead the macroeconomic policy dialogue with Government authorities and development partners.§ §• Lead the preparation of Development Policy Operations (DPOs) and Advisory Services and Analytics (ASA).§• Lead the Bank’s engagement with the country on its overall policy reform program.§• Represent the Bank in its relationship with the IMF on the macroeconomic framework for the country as well as in the preparation of joint World Bank-IMF debt sustainability analyses.§• Lead within the country team a variety of country economist tasks such as the annual Country Policy and Institutional Assessment (CPIA) exercise, preparation of the Macro Poverty Outlook (MPO), regular macroeconomic monitoring, and contribute to Country Partnership Strategies.§• Work with the EFI Program Leader, participate in the dialogue with development partners.§ §The successful candidate is expected to meet the following selection criteria:§ §* Minimum of a Master’s degree in Economics with five years of relevant professional experience (A completed PhD is equivalent to 3 years of relevant professional experience).  §• Technical skills on macro-fiscal and growth issues and a proven track record in delivering high quality and technically sophisticated analytical work.§• Operational and policy dialogue skills, as evidenced by a proven track record in delivering high quality Development Policy Operations.§• Integrative skills in order to support the CMU in articulating its strategic thinking on economic growth and poverty reduction and to articulate a coherent policy dialogue with the authorities.§• Proven sense of initiative, results orientation, team work and leadership qualities, and ability to work effectively across sectors.§• Communication skills, including the ability to speak persuasively and to present ideas clearly and concisely with senior authorities.  § § §The closing date is§ 15 October 2020. § §Poverty has no borders, neither does excellence. We succeed because of our differences and we continuously search for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds from around the globe.§ §The complete Term of Reference can be found on The World Bank Careers website.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50678641.txt	§Executive Director Advisory and Transactions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Director Advisory and Transactions§§Advertiser: §Department of Planning, Industry and Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§Salary starting from $280k incl super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §      §      §Executive Director Advisory and Transactions §      §        §Key leadership role responsible for the delivery of high-profile property projects and programs, requiring project management, governance and assurance, financial management and team leadership. §        §Housing and Property§ (HAP), part of the §Department of Planning, Industry & Environment§ (DPIE), is looking for an Advisory and Transactions executive to take on this exciting opportunity.§        §          §Opportunity to lead a team a team of property professionals and technical experts, delivering a range of property projects and transactions.§          §Fulltime, ongoing (permanent) opportunity.§          §Parramatta base – the Department is promoting flexible work arrangements and would be open to other locations.§          §TRP starting from $280k including superannuation, commensurate with experience.§        §        §About the role§        §As the Executive Director, Advisory and Transactions you will lead a team that drives the delivery of high-profile property projects and programs that requires a combination of project management, governance and assurance, financial management and team leadership. The role provides leadership, expert strategic advice and facilitates executive decision making to significant commercial advisory and transactions (both acquisitions and divestments) across the State within §Property & Development NSW§ (PDNSW).§        §Your challenge will be to provide expert advice to achieve stakeholder support within the PDNSW leadership team and senior external stakeholders including government officials in other agencies and clusters to ensure complex and high profile projects are delivered within time, cost and quality parameters.  §        §For more information about this rare opportunity, §click here to view the role description§.§        §About you§        §You will be a high performing property executive who is seeking a new, challenging and highly strategic role where your ideas and energy will be fully supported in one of NSW’s most inclusive workplace cultures. Your ability to work with and engage stakeholders across all levels of seniority, combined with experience in high profile projects and programs, will set you up for success in this role. Previous experience managing projects from inception to delivery, possibly in a government environment, will hold your application in high regard.§        §We’re passionate about our team and work. You’ll be joining a team which nurtures talent and works to overcome barriers in order to achieve exciting project outcomes for our state. You will also be expected to create and drive integrated project teams and government departments that bring together a diversity of skills and experience.§        §To apply§, please submit an updated CV and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role.§        §For further information,§ please contact Matthew Dwyer via email to §matthew.dwyer@dpie.nsw.gov.au§        §Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020, at 11:55pm §        § §        §About Housing & Property §        §The Housing and Property Group, part of the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE), oversees the management of NSW Government assets, including the management of Crown land, the NSW Government’s social housing portfolio and oversight of strategic use and disposal of government owned land. The Group also includes the Aboriginal Housing Office, the Valuer General and the Land and Housing Corporation.§        § §        §The Group leverages public and private sector expertise to improve place-based outcomes, providing greater access and choice of housing through initiatives such as an end-to-end housing strategy, and improving outcomes for Aboriginal communities to maximise community benefit from government owned land and property.§        § §        §Who is the §Department of Planning, Industry & Environment§ [link removed]§?§   §        §The Department of Planning, Industry and Environment brings together specialists in urban and regional planning, natural resources, industry, environment, Aboriginal and social housing and regional NSW.  §        §We share a common goal to maximise the long-term wellbeing of NSW.  §        § §        §          §We do this by protecting and improving:  §          §prosperity  §          §environmental sustainability  §          §safety and security  §          §social inclusion and cohesion, and  §          §attractiveness as a place for recreation and relaxation  §        §        § §        §We bring together the economy, environment, work and play, industry and recreation. This helps to ensure economic growth and job security considers the environment and character of our neighbourhoods and communities.  §        § §        §Why work for Department of Planning, Industry and Environment?§  §        §Exciting career pathways and opportunities§  §        §We offer vibrant and exciting career paths for people from a wide range of backgrounds and skills. Once you join the NSW Government, you’ll be supported to develop your skills and expertise through ongoing training, and opportunities to move easily from role to role, and agency to agency across the entire NSW government.  §        § §        § §        §Our people: §  §        §Join DPIE and you’ll be joining a team of more than 8,000 passionate people spread across a diverse range of disciplines and functions including - urban planning, parks and wildlife, fisheries, agriculture and water. If you’re motivated and passionate about making a difference to the people of NSW, we invite you to become part of our story.  §        § §        §Wellbeing: §  §        §Providing a safe, supportive, ethical, diverse and inclusive workplace for our people is one of our priorities. We run a variety of programs and provide a range of supporting resources to ensure the wellbeing of all our people.  §        § §        §A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary roles of the same role or role type that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.§ §        § §        § §      §    §  §§§Key leadership role responsible for the delivery of high-profile property projects and programs, requiring project management, governance and assurance, financial management and team leadership. §Housing and Property§ (HAP), part of the §Department of Planning, Industry & Environment§ (DPIE), is looking for an Advisory and Transactions executive to take on this exciting opportunity.§§Opportunity to lead a team a team of property professionals and technical experts, delivering a range of property projects and transactions.§Fulltime, ongoing (permanent) opportunity.§Parramatta base – the Department is promoting flexible work arrangements and would be open to other locations.§TRP starting from $280k including superannuation, commensurate with experience.§§About the role§As the Executive Director, Advisory and Transactions you will lead a team that drives the delivery of high-profile property projects and programs that requires a combination of project management, governance and assurance, financial management and team leadership. The role provides leadership, expert strategic advice and facilitates executive decision making to significant commercial advisory and transactions (both acquisitions and divestments) across the State within §Property & Development NSW§ (PDNSW).§Your challenge will be to provide expert advice to achieve stakeholder support within the PDNSW leadership team and senior external stakeholders including government officials in other agencies and clusters to ensure complex and high profile projects are delivered within time, cost and quality parameters.  §For more information about this rare opportunity, §click here to view the role description§.§About you§You will be a high performing property executive who is seeking a new, challenging and highly strategic role where your ideas and energy will be fully supported in one of NSW’s most inclusive workplace cultures. Your ability to work with and engage stakeholders across all levels of seniority, combined with experience in high profile projects and programs, will set you up for success in this role. Previous experience managing projects from inception to delivery, possibly in a government environment, will hold your application in high regard.§We’re passionate about our team and work. You’ll be joining a team which nurtures talent and works to overcome barriers in order to achieve exciting project outcomes for our state. You will also be expected to create and drive integrated project teams and government departments that bring together a diversity of skills and experience.§To apply§, please submit an updated CV and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role.§For further information,§ please contact Matthew Dwyer via email to §matthew.dwyer@dpie.nsw.gov.au§§Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020, at 11:55pm §§ §§About Housing & Property §The Housing and Property Group, part of the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE), oversees the management of NSW Government assets, including the management of Crown land, the NSW Government’s social housing portfolio and oversight of strategic use and disposal of government owned land. The Group also includes the Aboriginal Housing Office, the Valuer General and the Land and Housing Corporation.§ §The Group leverages public and private sector expertise to improve place-based outcomes, providing greater access and choice of housing through initiatives such as an end-to-end housing strategy, and improving outcomes for Aboriginal communities to maximise community benefit from government owned land and property.§§ §§Who is the §Department of Planning, Industry & Environment§ [link removed]§?§   §The Department of Planning, Industry and Environment brings together specialists in urban and regional planning, natural resources, industry, environment, Aboriginal and social housing and regional NSW.  §We share a common goal to maximise the long-term wellbeing of NSW.  § §§We do this by protecting and improving:  §prosperity  §environmental sustainability  §safety and security  §social inclusion and cohesion, and  §attractiveness as a place for recreation and relaxation  §§ §We bring together the economy, environment, work and play, industry and recreation. jobText: TXT/50711766.txt	§Multiple Opportunities: Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Multiple Opportunities: Case Manager§§Advertiser: §Department of Planning, Industry and Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§Salary from $128,089  + super §§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §      §      §Multiple Opportunities: Case Manager §      §        §It's a truly exciting time to join the Department. As a Customer Strategist you will build the best response to market.§§Deliver on-time insight driven proposals that meet Agency & Client requirements§Partner with the broader Sales team and Brands team to provide expertise and guidance on brief responses and proposals from a creative, budget, yield and delivery perspective.§Engage with our sales business by constantly evolving and innovating our offerings.  §§ §Skills and experience§Proven experience in the media industry including cross platform media strategy development or cross platform sales§§Great at taking briefs, finding hooks and uncovering insights§A strong communicator you can clearing communicate complex strategies§You’re a team player with a professional and positive approach to your work§Excellent stakeholder management skills and exceptional attention to detail§§Why Are Media?§ §At Are Media Story54 you would be working in a dynamic fast paced environment within a team that has a supportive, fun and driven culture second to none.  Story54 has some of the most creative, strategic and analytical minds to learn from, to collaborate with and to leverage. §Join a values based organisation built on respecting all, inspiring creativity and collaboration with others. §Excellent Employee Benefits Package including; discounted gym & swimming pool rates at Park Street CBD; regular beauty perks; discounts at cafes, restaurants & retail stores; as well as access to Are Media's Learning & Development Offerings. §Are Media is committed to a diverse, respectful, collaborative & inclusive workplace. jobText: TXT/50676860.txt	§Value Operations Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Value Operations Specialists§§Advertiser: §sportsbet.com.au§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§The Company§Sportsbet's purpose is to bring excitement to life for its customers and we do this by overdelivering on excitement through serious fun, disrupting the status quo and living our values. From the moment you walk in the door you'll see that fun is at the heart of the way we work. We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer with over 7000 cool, clever and curious people around the world. We’re a global player, but in Melbourne, Sydney and Darwin we’re tight knit, with 800 of us bringing excitement to life every day.§Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools we offer that go over and above industry requirements. We care about our team members and customers and everyone at Sportsbet has a role to play in bringing our commitment to Responsible Gambling to life. Check out the tools and information we provide our customers to help manage their gambling on our dedicated site at §https://responsiblegambling.sportsbet.com.au/hc/en-us§ §The Team§The Propositions & Platform team are responsible for all generosity delivered to Sportsbet Customers. They innovate, develop, plan, communicate and execute all above and below the line value propositions, manage the generosity budget and oversee all core processes and systems associated with issuing generosity. §The role§The Value Operations Specialists will manage the generosity based operational and governance requirements of the Value Team;§Governance;§§Manage all governance relating to generosity within Sportsbet§Create, maintain and manage all core generosity processes, and ensure policies/process/documentation/training material is accurate, up to date and shared with relevant stakeholders.§Manage all periodic risk management controls relating to Value Governance§Manage incident report process – including project management and delivery of actions from incident reports.§Ensure all generosity systemx operate in line with key policies and process§§Operational Excellence§§Manage all onboarding, training and upskilling of teams/users on using generosity systems, processes and policies – including refreshers when system/processes/policies change§Manage Value Setup Process for above the line and below the line Promotions§Manage Remediation Process for Value§Manage Generosity system processes/workflows between Customer Engagement/Value/Ops excellence§Identify and implement key initiatives to improve value-based processes§§Stakeholder Engagement§§Key point of commercial contact for Generosity Systems trouble shooting.§Manage all internal communications for Value – Including Value Plans for relevant team, setup and promo system execution plans.§Manage the product relationship for generosity systems from commercial compliance perspective§§You§A strong commercially minded individual that has demonstrated experience in an Operations and/or Compliance role.§§Strong organizational and planning skills§Impeccable attention to detail§Strong commercial understanding§Strong internal and external stakeholder management skills§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Strong collaboration skills§Agility and ability to pivot in a fast-paced environment§§The Perks§We don’t expect you to do this for free, so along with your salary we will also provide you with:§§Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers §Tailored career development programs, and opportunities§25 days annual leave§Discounted Myki & gym memberships, free breakfast and loads of event, conference tickets and many more§§What’s next?§To make sure you are the best person for Sportsbet and Sportsbet is the best for you our interview process includes, online assessments, videos, behavioural and technical interviews. This ensures all types of experiences can be considered for all roles and provides you with ample time to ask any questions.§We encourage you to apply immediately as we will begin shortlisting within 1-2 weeks of advertising.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

No one else does exactly what we do in the way we do it.§        §Ventia are currently seeking to engage a Junior Commercial Analyst to join their team on a fixed term 12 month contract in Darwin, NT.  The primary purpose of the role is to specialise in Defence specific estimating and commercial support functions and provide a Regional commercial point of subject matter expertise in Defence contracts estimating and variations management, within the Defence Base Services environment. The role is required to take a proactive role in improving and maintaining Ventia's commercial support data systems, processes and procedures. This includes scoping support to Contract Change Proposals and governance overview of contract related proposals, survey and quote works and Defence Business Rules.§        § §The Commercial Analyst procedures etc.§          §Developing and improving commercial and financial benchmarking data.§          §Supporting the financial and commercial aspects of arrangements with suppliers and subcontractors.§          §Developing commercial knowledge of the Commercial Analyst (Operational Services).§        §        § §General Responsibilities§        §          §Providing first level and commercial peers in the National Commercial portfolio.§          §Interacting with management to improve existing estimating and commercial support business functions§        §        § §Key operational environment§          §Advanced spreadsheeting skills§          §Analytical capability§          §Excellent oral and written communication skills.§          §Tertiary qualifications in business, engineering, finance, accounting, commerce or similar are highly regarded§        §        §Special Conditions§As this role is on a Defence Base it's requirement the incumbent must be an Australian Citizen.§        §We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures. jobTitle: Researcher Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50628383.txt	§Researcher§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Researcher§§Advertiser: §Regional Australia Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$55,000 - $90000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§ §Researcher, VARIOUS LEVELS§About the Regional Australia Institute §The Regional Australia Institute (RAI) is an independent, not-for-profit think tank that is in transition as we look to the next decade and beyond.§We are delivering on our long-term strategy to link research, policy and activation. Our work uses practical, evidence based research to provide the thought leadership and knowledge that we need to enact change through meaningful engagement.§We are looking for Researchers to join our team, who are not only passionate about solving problems and busting myths but who understand the connection between research and impact. If you believe in the future of our regions and wish to work with Australia’s only think tank dedicated to regional issues, we would love to hear from you.§More information on the RAI is available at §www.regionalaustralia.org.au§Position Objectives §The successful applicant will have the ability to produce high quality policy documents including research reports, position papers, policy statements, fact sheets, submissions to government inquiries and consultations and other projects relevant to the work of the RAI.  The successful applicant will provide high level strategic advice to the Chief Economist and Chief Executive Officer on policy and advocacy matters.§Members of the Regional Australia Institute’s (RAI’s) research team:§§Deliver high profile research projects on issues important to regional Australia;§Lead innovative and creative analysis of literature, and use in-house and external data resources to address complex regional development questions; and§Work in partnership with the RAI Executive Management Team and other RAI staff to ensure that robust research methodologies are followed, and that reporting and communications are of the highest standard. §Main Responsibilities and Duties §As a Researcher at the RAI you will provide high level contributions to our program of research on regional issues and the intersection of research, policy and activation. Key responsibilities include working with other staff to:§Undertake background research on a range of regional policy issues;§Develop, deliver and manage research projects;§Deliver policy briefs and other documents;§Represent the RAI and participate in meetings and policy forums;§Mentor research assistants in career and project tasks;§Contribute to policy advice, briefings and support to the Executive; and§Other duties as requested.§Selection Criteria §This position is suitable for applicants with a range of levels of experience from recent graduates through to researchers with 3-8 years’ experience.  The selection criteria for appointment at any level of Researcher comprise:§Sound research skills – qualitative and quantitative§Experience in project management§High level database and spreadsheet skills§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Experience in project design and delivery.§Qualifications and Experience §Desirable:§       Postgraduate (Honours / Masters / PhD) qualifications in Economics, Demography, Social Science, Geography, Environmental Science or other relevant field§Mandatory:§     Tertiary qualifications in Demography, Economics, Social Science, Geography or another related field of study.§The position is suitable for applicants with a range of experience – from new graduates to people with 3-8 years’ work experience in a similar role.§Applications close Monday 5 October 2020§Shortlisted applicants will be invited to submit a full CV, with references, and respond to a challenge questions§The position is full time and there is potential for remote working can be based anywhere in regional Australia or Canberra.§Appointment term is 12 months, but a secondment or short-term appointment would also be considered.§Salary range is between $55,000 and $90,000pa depending on experience, plus superannuation.§To discuss this position further, please contact:§Dr Kim Houghton§Chief Economist§p. §02 6260 3733§ §e. §kim.houghton@regionalaustralia.org.au§Written applications, addressing the selection criteria and including a current CV and the contact details of two referees, should be emailed to §info@regionalaustralia.org.au§ by COB Monday 5th October 2020.   For further information contact §02 6260 3733§.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50720551.txt	§Strategy Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategy Consultant§§Advertiser: §Uniting NSW & ACT§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Excellent Salary Packaging Benefits available§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§About Uniting§We are one of the largest providers of residential aged care, retirement living, and social services in Australia. We are a professionally-run organisation that delivers high-quality services to vulnerable and disadvantaged people.§At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. We work to inspire people, enliven communities, and confront injustice. We are §bold, imaginative, respectful,§ and §compassionate§. Look us up on §www.uniting.org§§What we offer to you:§§Work on some of society’s most pressing issues§Get exposure to executive leadership§Be part of a purpose-driven culture§Join a high-quality strategy team with a strong positive coaching and development culture§§Role description: Strategy Consultant - Full-time permanent position! - Sydney CBD based.§In the midst of COVID-19 and the Royal Commission into Aged Care, Uniting is playing a leadership role in shaping society's response to one of our most pressing issues: the future of Aged Care.§Our scope is to develop strategies to respond to a shifting environment and implement a Transformation program.§In this role, you manage cross-functional working groups with stakeholders across the business. You lead the analysis of key strategic questions and help drive the implementation of multiple initiatives.§In particular, we value your stakeholder management skills to build consensus for action in our collaborative culture.§You will get exposure to all aspects of the organisation, including long-term strategy development and shorter-term operational improvement. The team is led by former MBB and reports to the Director of Finance & Strategy who is also ex-MBB.§Our office is in the CBD, and you would be working from home as well as 1-2 days/week in the office. Our remote-working infrastructure is excellent.§Ideal Consultant:§§2+ years experience at a leading management consulting firm§Bachelor’s degree in business management, economics, engineering, information technology or equivalent experience§Strong consulting toolkit - focus on problem-solving, structuring, analytical ability, and communication skills§Functional and operational understanding of strategy, planning analysis, corporate finance, and accounting§Performance evaluation and management, strategic planning, change management, financial analysis, budgeting, and planning§Ability to translate information and develop insights§Ability to simplify complex information and ideas§A demonstrated passion for social change and contributing to an organisation of influence for the most disadvantaged§Skilled at navigating a complex organisation, forging relationships, and managing through influence rather than direct authority as required.§§Even better:§§Postgraduate qualification in Business Administration§Complex organisation-wide change project experience.                                                                                                                                                  We certainly look forward to receiving your application for this fantastic Strategy Consultant contract role. Please apply ASAP as all applications will be assessed upon receipt.                                                                                                                                                                                                For a confidential discussion please call §Louise Massie at §0468 341 590§ or email §lmassie@uniting.org§                                                                                                                                                                                       §PD - Strategy Consultant.docx§                                                                                                                                                                                    §Employment with Uniting is subject to satisfactory background checks which may include a National Police Check and Reference Checks.§                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50719101.txt	§Manager - Transformational Program Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Transformational Program Management§§Advertiser: §KPMG Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Have a passion for management consulting and aspirations to run large scale transformation programs?§§Excited by the opportunity to join a world leading firm and support a wide range of clientele§§Time to immerse yourself in an inclusive, diverse and supportive culture§§KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.§The Transformational Program Management team within KPMG is a key part of our capability picture and has been involved in some of Australia's largest and most complex reform and transformation programs. We know that realising organisational change and improvement requires more than transactional project management – it takes an ability to manage complexity and find clarity in linking strategic objectives to implementation activities whilst ensuring effective stakeholder engagement results. If you have an understanding of project and program management principles coupled with a results driven, client focused approach to achieving outcomes this could be the ideal role for you.§Your Opportunity §As a KPMG Client Transformation Manager, you can count on managing diverse projects and interesting Client engagements from day one. You can also count on a team culture that’s high quality and high care when it comes to client delivery and your career development. You will:§§Have the ability to successfully deliver client-based transformation programs.§Support KPMG Program/ Project Management Office teams ensuring that program/ project planning, execution, dependencies and controls are properly integrated in large and complex transformation programs/ projects.§Be able to bring together powerful teams from across our firm with deep experience in People & Change, Customer Analytics & Design, Policy & Evaluation, Operating Models, Business Process, Digital Transformation, Technology Strategy & Enablement and Financial Management.§Provide leadership in building the capacity of our delivery teams, integrating capabilities from across the firm, to ensure client engagements deliver to the highest quality by implementing the right program and project management disciplines.§Be able to apply best practice methodologies to support large transformational projects using either traditional or agile deliveries based on your practical knowledge of leading methodologies such as Prince2/MSP and Scrum/SAFe.§§How are you Extraordinary? §At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.§To be considered for this opportunity, your passion for program/ project management and achieving great client outcomes will be backed by the following attributes and experience:§§Demonstrated experience in running projects within a transformation program of work (>$10 million), project delivery in a complex environment or managing agile delivery projects.§Previous consulting experience is highly beneficial but not essential.§Experience in delivering projects using either Prince2/MSP and Scrum/SAFe methodologies (or equivalent).§Demonstrated analytical skills with the ability to apply structured thinking and analysis techniques to complex and ambiguous problems.§A proven team leader with proven experience in managing teams.§Outstanding communication skills and the ability to build professional working relationships with ease.§Tertiary Qualifications§§The KPMG Difference§Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess, and we share and learn from each other.§We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.§ §Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:§Flexibility empowers wellbeing § [link removed]§Flexibility enables contribution to the community§ [link removed]§Flexibility inspires technology§ [link removed]§ & innovation§§Flexibility§ [link removed]§ supports family§§Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!§ § §§§§

Our unified purpose helps people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helps organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities.§  §We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.§Our Culture§At SEEK we really value our culture and the way we work together to get stuff done. §You will work alongside a group of hard-working, fun and caring people who will support you to have a successful and fulfilling career at SEEK.§Our dedication to fostering a work environment where people feel like they're making a difference every single day has helped us maintain a consistently high ranking in the annual Hewitt Best Employer Award. In other words, people like to come here – and we're proud of that!§So, what are we looking for?§ § § § §Extensive experience in strategy-related roles, with part of that time spent in a top tier management consulting firm§ §Highly developed conceptual reasoning capabilities, analytical and problem-solving skills with proven ability to break down and frame strategic problems§ §Passion for creative growth strategy and excellent business insight§ §Intellectually curious with a passion for solving human and economic interactions and ‘making sense’ of the world§ §Ownership and drive - delivering outcomes with and through cross functional, cross market teams§ §Collaborative and empathetic work style with a high degree of humility§ § § §The Perks and Benefits§At SEEK we offer:§ § §Opportunity to transition into the wider business - including Artificial Intelligence Platform Services, Product and Commercial teams§ §Employee Share Purchase Plan§ §Flexible leave offerings, including opportunities to purchase additional leave§ §Support of flexible working§ §Regular brown bag sessions covering a variety of topics§ §Empower sessions with industry leading guest speakers§ § § §Privacy policy§All personal information received by us from you or about you will be stored, used and disclosed by us in accordance with our privacy policy, a copy of which can be found at www.seek.com.au/privacy. If you have any questions in relation to how we may use and store your personal information, please contact us at usersupport@seek.com.au§Here at SEEK we pride ourselves on harbouring a flexible and inclusive working environment. Should you require any specific supports or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50718420.txt	§Environmental Waste Auditors - Casual§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Environmental Waste Auditors - Casual§§Advertiser: §Knowwaste Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Salary§§$25 per hour plus super§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§About Knowwaste Pty Ltd§ §Knowwaste is a waste and sustainability consultancy providing services including; litter assessments, waste auditing, waste monitoring and reporting, waste assessments, reconciliations, education initiatives and community consultations.§ §We provide our services to Local Government and the private sector nationally across Australia.§ § § §The Role§ §Knowwaste seeks a candidate with an Environmental / Sustainability / Geography type background or equivalent, who would like to build their skills and knowledge in waste and sustainability.  The role will suit someone looking for a graduate position or looking to start their career in the waste and litter reduction sector. § § § §The tasks will involve:§ § §working in small teams surveying, litter, waste and recycling bins§ §collecting samples for composition analysis§ §conducting composition analysis and sorting§ §general support to the auditing team§ §data entry of field results and surveys§ § §Skills and expectations§ §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §good communication skills§ §ability to work well within small teams§ §attention to detail§ §punctual and reliable§ §clear police record check§ §vaccinations, Hepatitis A & B and Tetanus§ §WHS (white) card§ §first aid training§ §car license§ §able to work early hours§ §working across Sydney§ §potential for interstate travel (travel expenses paid)§ § § §Casual positions are available. The role may suit someone with a flexible schedule such as, student or someone looking for a casual position.§ §Experience working in the waste industry would be preferred but is not essential.  The package will reflect experience and qualifications and will start on a casual basis, flexible working arrangements will be considered.§ §This is a good role for someone looking for experience in the waste, resource, litter reduction and environmental sector.§Please send resumes through the "Apply for this job" tab.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Strategy Manager Job in Melbourne - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
jobText: TXT/50719151.txt	§Strategy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategy Manager§§Advertiser: §SEEK Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§The Opportunity§Based in Melbourne and reporting to one of the Heads of Strategy, this is a pivotal role which will support SEEK’s AP&A (employment marketplace) business in defining and executing towards its long term vision and growth ambitions.§ § § §Day-to-day the role entails:§ § § § §Developing and applying analytic frameworks and principles to investigate business issues, identify solutions and manage the implementation of agreed actions§ §Creating situational awareness – strategic metrics, key results, competitive analysis, strategic intelligence§ §Communicating complex issues with simplicity and impact to all levels of the organisation, including senior leadership§ §Contributing to our shared understanding of our business, the wider industry landscape and trends, and how to play in this environment§ §Collaborating with Product and Commercial teams to solve critical information problems and define future product or commercial solutions§ § § §About SEEK§ §SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our unified purpose helps people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helps organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities.§  §We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.§ §Our Culture§At SEEK we really value our culture and the way we work together to get stuff done. §You will work alongside a group of hard-working, fun and caring people who will support you to have a successful and fulfilling career at SEEK.§Our dedication to fostering a work environment where people feel like they're making a difference every single day has helped us maintain a consistently high ranking in the annual Hewitt Best Employer Award. In other words, people like to come here – and we're proud of that!§ § §So, what are we looking for?§ § § § §Demonstrated experience in a top-tier global strategy consulting firm or MBA plus at least 18 months of experience in a top-tier global strategy consulting firm§ §Highly developed conceptual reasoning capabilities and problem-solving skills with proven ability to break down and frame strategic problems§ §Solid quantitative and qualitative analytical skills§ §A high level of comfort around ambiguity, with a mindset of test and learn§ §Drive and intellectual curiosity - delivering outcomes with and through cross functional, cross market teams§ §Collaborative and empathetic work style with a high degree of humility§ § § §The Perks and Benefits§At SEEK we offer:§ § §Opportunity to transition into the wider business - including Artificial Intelligence Platform Services, Product and Commercial teams§ §Employee Share Purchase Plan§ §Flexible leave offerings, including opportunities to purchase additional leave§ §Support of flexible working§ §Regular brown bag sessions covering a variety of topics§ §Empower sessions with industry leading guest speakers §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Manager - Global Business Services Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50720659.txt	§Manager - Global Business Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Global Business Services§§Advertiser: §Deloitte§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Manager - Global Business Services §      §        §Manager - Global Business Services§ §        §          §Salary packaging - to suit your personal and financial circumstances§          §Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best§          §Impact day - we roll up our sleeves to help non-profit organisations make a difference!§        §        §For more than two decades, organisations around the world have been using shared services and outsourcing to improve service delivery and reduce costs within defined parts of their businesses. Now, leading organisations have/ are taking the next step to a global business services (GBS) model.§ § §What will your typical day look like?§ As a manager in our Global Business Services (GBS) team, you will lead a team of Deloitte’s brightest minds to analyse clients’ needs and requirements improving the performance in their shared services and outsourcing function; develop a roadmap strategy; and implement initiatives to enhance business value whilst at the same time improving efficiency. You will be the ‘go to’ for internal and external contacts which see the growing leader to mature in a collaborative team environment.§ § §About the team§ Deloitte’s Global Business Services practice works closely with senior executives to understand their strategic vision and assess how GBS might align with their business strategy to drive results. We advise our clients from initial strategy development, through the implementation and launch of Global Business Services, to refinements of the GBS model over time to help unlock the next frontier of growth.§ §        §          §For mature companies with shared services and outsourcing, we work to bring order to existing contracts, practices, and processes. We help find the next opportunity for incremental value, managing exposure to global locations and service providers, and improving internal and external controls.§          §For businesses with limited experience, who may have a single function utilizing shared services or outsourcing, we help capitalize on progress made and leverage lessons learned to drive value across other areas of their global enterprise.§        §        §Enough about us, let’s talk about you.§ You are someone with:§ §        §          §7+ years’ experience working in Private industry or Public Sector in GBS/ SSC functions with 4+ years in professional services or consulting in driving improved customer outcomes;§          §Ability to build consensus and foster change in ambiguous settings with understating of enabling technologies;§          §Must have project experience within GBS, Shared Services, Outsourcing and/or Offshoring industry, or back-office functional optimisation with experience working with vendors and an understanding of the broader BPO landscape;§          §Ability to analyse and apply outsourcing trends as well as problem solving, creative analysis, critical thinking - skills demonstrated while solving for client’s/organization’s growth and business needs§          §End to end project cycle management with design through to implementation experience§        §        §Why Deloitte?§ At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § § §Next Steps§ Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.§ If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact the Talent Acquisition t­­­­eam. We’d love to hear from you!§ § §By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.§ § §Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request.§ § §The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Manager - Global Business Services§ §Salary packaging - to suit your personal and financial circumstances§Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best§Impact day - we roll up our sleeves to help non-profit organisations make a difference!§For more than two decades, organisations around the world have been using shared services and outsourcing to improve service delivery and reduce costs within defined parts of their businesses. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.§ § § §Next Steps§ Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.§ If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact the Talent Acquisition t­­­­eam. jobText: TXT/50716735.txt	§Graduate HSE Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate HSE Consultant§§Advertiser: §EDP Consultants PTY Ltd.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $59,999 plus super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§EDP is seeking talented and ambitious Graduates to join our growing Sydney operations. §EDP is a health, safety, property compliance and environmental consultancy founded over 25 years ago with offices in Australia, UK, Ireland and Singapore.  EDP’s Sydney operation has experienced significant growth and we now have opportunities for Graduates to join our motivated and dynamic team to develop a career as a Health, Safety and Environment Consultant. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of EDP who have recently been awarded the Client Choices Award for Best Environmental Firm (<$30 revenue) in 2020.§We require self-motivated, high calibre Graduates with an Environment, Science or Engineering degree to work in a team of consultants to provide quality consultancy to a large array of clients in a diverse range of projects.§Main Duties and Responsibilities§The successful candidate will be provided with on the job training in the following areas of work:§Asbestos and other hazardous materials monitoring;§Clearance inspections and reports;§Asbestos and other hazardous materials surveys and registers;§Sampling and analysis;§Project and client management; and§Preparing accurate high-quality reports.§Skills and Experience Required§§Essential Requirements§Qualifications / Training§Degree in Environment, Science or Engineering§Skills / Knowledge §MS office packages including Word, Excel, PowerPoint§Accuracy and attention to detail§Report Writing§Organisation skills§Personal Qualities §Self-motivated§Team Player§Other Job Requirements §Excellent communication skills§Ability to work within a dynamic environment with tight deadlines§Flexible and pro-active attitude to work§Full driving license§§Desirable Requirements§Qualifications/Training§Training in Asbestos or other Hazardous Materials§Experience§Relevant work experience or internship§Skills / Knowledge §People Management§Project Management§Commercial skills§Personal Qualities §Ability to develop good relationships with clients and representatives at all levels§Other Job Requirements §Access to your own vehicle for business purposes§Salary and Benefits§A competitive salary is offered commensurate with experience, along with a wider employment package; and§Approved overtime and travel and subsistence expenses are payable.§Other Information§This is an excellent opportunity with expectations of career progression. §The role is Sydney based with the chance to travel nationally to service projects.§On occasion, our work involves travelling and working at weekends and other unsocial hours as required from time to time.§A full driving license is essential.  As such, full flexibility in working and travel will be required from the successful applicants to enable us to service our clients.§Must have full working rights in Australia, permanent residency or full Australian citizenship.§To Apply§Please email a CV and covering email explaining your suitability for this position to §recruitment@edp-au.com§ quoting job ref HSEA006 in the subject line.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50718930.txt	§Risk Manager ( Managed services)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk Manager ( Managed services)§§Advertiser: §Ashurst Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Risk Manager ( Managed services) §      §      §      §      §      §        § §About Ashurst:§ § § §Ashurst is a leading global law firm with a history spanning almost 200 years, and clear strategy for our future growth. Our in-depth understanding of our clients and commitment to providing exceptional standards of service have seen us become a trusted adviser to local and global corporates, financial institutions and governments in all areas of commercial law. To find out more please visit www.ashurst.com§        §More information can be found in the § Job Description [link removed]§ attached to the role on our website.§        § §Department/Role Overview:§        §Ashurst’s newly created Risk Advisory practice operates as an independent advisory function, and an adjacent function to the firm’s legal practices. It benefits from the firm’s deep-rooted network and profound expertise within the already well-established financial regulatory practice. We pride ourselves on “thinking differently” and as part of our core values, we live and breathe collaboration between practices, both nationally and globally. In keeping with Ashurst's reputation for excellence the Risk Advisory practice will offer an alternative and pioneering risk consulting and managed service solutions for the firm’s client base.§        §Ashurst, Australia are looking to attract an outstanding candidate to join as an Executive. As an Executive, you will be an integral member of a team who will deliver non-financial risk managed service solutions into the financial services industry in Australia including, but not limited to, operational risk, regulatory risk, RegTech, risk transformation, compliance and conduct risk.§        §An Executive will be responsible for building client relationships, delivering managed service solutions as well as assisting in growth and development of the Risk Advisory and Managed Services practice in Australia.§        § §Essential skills and experience:§        §          § Building trusted client relationships with integrity by putting the client at the centre of service delivery by thinking differently and delivering innovative solutions to respond to client needs §          § Providing local and global market insight to support clients' strategic planning with activities such as impact analysis, contingency planning or risk identification and mitigation initiatives§          § Assisting clients to embed a proactive and dynamic risk management capability and mindset into corporate business practices, starting from the onset of strategic planning and extending through to implementation and ongoing services.§          §Ensuring all engagements are planned and delivered within budget and on time to the client’s need and to the highest standard§          § Being bold in the market, assisting inbuilding the brand to win business adjacent to the core offerings of the firm§        §        § §Essential skills and experience:§        §          §8+ years of relevant experience in a professional services firm or equivalent industry experience§          § Strong knowledge of all facets of non-financial risk management including operational risk, regulatory risk, compliance and conduct risk§          §The ability to independently manage multiple projects, project teams and stakeholders§          §Demonstrated ability to bring together diverse, multi-disciplinary teams to deliver superior outcomes§          §Demonstrated ability in running complex operations to high level of quality§          §Demonstrated ability in developing commercial frameworks, tender strategies and financial modelling§          §Strong commercial acumen, report writing and presentation skills§        §        §*LI§        §        § §People Management and Support§        §          § Independently lead project teams, delivering complete engagements including billing, work-in-progress, fee negotiation and risk management§          § Coach, develop and contribute to the learning, growth and development of direct reports in the practice’s risk advisory team§          § Mentors, coaches and influences others in the team§        §        §        § § What makes Ashurst a great place to work?§        § We offer you all the things you should expect from an international law firm: competitive remuneration with the flexibility to reward high performance, flexible working, complimentary gym memberships, corporate health plans and an industry§-§leading programme that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We are committed to delivering positive impacts to our communities through our Social Impact programme, with a strong emphasis on working with First Nations people through our pro bono practice. We aim to recruit, retain and promote the best people from the widest possible talent pools. We are committed to offering a safe and welcoming environment for all employees to ensure they are supported to work at their best. Beyond this, what sets Ashurst apart from others is our global strength, our drive to innovate and collaborate§,§ and our commitment to excellence. It is these values that make Ashurst a unique place to work.§        §        §      §      §Zahra Nowrouz-Tafreshi§zahra.nowrouz-tafreshi@ashurst.com§ §      §      §    §  §§§  §About Ashurst:§  §    §    §Ashurst is a leading global law firm with a history  spanning almost 200 years, and clear strategy for our future growth.  Our in-depth understanding of our clients and commitment to providing  exceptional standards of service have seen us become a trusted adviser  to local and global corporates, financial institutions and governments  in all areas of commercial law. It benefits from the firm’s deep-rooted network and  profound expertise within the already well-established financial  regulatory practice. We offer flexible working conditions and a supportive and innovative organisation. We're an easy drive or train journey from Melbourne and offer a great affordable living for those considering a lifestyle change.§Mitchell Shire Council provides its employees with the opportunity to maintain a healthy work / life balance whilst performing challenging yet rewarding work. Employees have access to a range of ongoing professional development and a range of employee benefits designed to align with our ‘One Mitchell’ Philosophy.§About the role§Reporting to the Director Development and Infrastructure, the Manager Environment and Sustainability will play an integral role in environment, sustainability and waste management strategy, advocacy, advice and support to our Executive and wider organisation. §This newly created opportunity will ensure Mitchell Shire is at the forefront of environmental management, waste and resource management and sustainable development strategies, positioning us as a local government leader in this space.§Managing a number of teams, you will provide expert environmental advice and leadership across the entire Council ensuring we maximise key opportunities for growth whilst managing key risks and liabilities.§There are two primary functions of the teams you manage; to support our environment and sustainability programs as well as; to deliver a sustainable waste management service.  Ultimately, the main aim of the role is to help us minimise our impact on our natural environment.§About you§You will be strategic, visionary and committed to help us achieve the targets outlined in our recently adopted Environment Policy.  §You will be an excellent leader, an active communicator, passionate about the environment and have a proven ability to work across multidisciplinary teams in diverse organisations.  Importantly, you will be committed to developing the teams you lead creating a great workplace culture.§Your leadership and effectiveness will be informed by a combination of technical qualifications, proven on the job experience and a commitment to continued professional development.§About Mitchell Shire §We offer a real opportunity to build on your expertise and make positive contributions to our organisation and community. (This is now mandatory for ALL employees joining Council to meet Child Safe Standards of our Organisation)§All applications must address the Key Selection Criteria in the position description.
